name: Pakutto Puritto (パクッとプリッと)
description:
User summary
パクッとプリッと (Pakutto Puritto) is a Japanese memory game where, in turn, you will have to find some animals' favourite food, while you take care of their poop.

An animal's beloved snack will become the topic, and you have to find it among the scattered face-down food cards. Turn up one card, and if that is its favourite food, you can take it and feed the animal. If it's not, sorry, put the card face down again.

As they have eaten, the animals will take a poop, and your place will become filled with poop cards. Find as much of the animals' favourite foods as you can and take care of the poop!

A game for children mainly, with bright attractive graphic design.

The second edition has only technical changes: a better rulebook, Furigana added the Kanji names on the cards, bigger cards and a bigger box, the game is now for 2-6 or more players, a game variant is included in the rules.

Publisher's summary
うんちに気をつけながら動物の大好物を順番に見つけていく記憶ゲームです。

裏向きでバラバラに並べられた食べものカードの中から、お題となっている動物の大好物を探します。1枚めくって、もしそれが大好物だったら動物に食べものをあげることができます。大好物ではなかったら、残念。裏向きに戻します。大好物を食べた動物はうんちをするので、場にどんどんうんちカードが増えていきます。うんちに気をつけながら、なるべくたくさんの動物の大好物を見つけましょう。
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Mini-Lotto
description: The farm is normally a very busy place, but today the farm is very still as the farm inhabitants have managed to hide themselves very well. The first player who manages to cover all the motifs on their template board with matching lotto cards in Mini-Lotto wins.

name: Monopoly: Pummeleinhorn
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from FC Schalke 04, a soccer club in Gelsenkirchen, Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: PORN: The Game!
description:
PORN: The Game! is an homage to the history and beauty of vintage smut; an era, before the internet, where seedy shops and dirty theaters were where the pervs got their kicks; VHS tapes, Glory holes, Donkey Shows and Orgies; when bushes were as beautiful as mustaches sexy.

The game contains Explicit - Original Art, in Vintage Grindhouse style, creating a casual and highly entertaining deck, which seems to have come directly from the Sexploitation-era of the 1970’s & 80’s.

LIKE OPERATING A PEEPSHOW BOOTH, THE RULES ARE EASY:

Players drink and swindle one another as they race to be the first to unload their cards.
Everyone starts with four, while the rest are set aside to draw from.

Take turns playing a card and follow the rules accordingly.
The first to get rid of all their cards wins.

Simple stuff (like putting on a condom*).

Metaphorically speaking


Sometimes several players win and, often, many players lose;
but in the end, EVERYONE gets screwed."

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Zoology
description:
A dual-layered worker placement game for 1-5 people where players compete to build the best zoo, earning victory points for diversity of animals, interesting enclosures and fulfilling objectives, all while completing Conservation projects.

Each player will play as a different Zoo with variable player powers and will gradually improve their starting zoo. Will you recruit the best Gap Year Students? Will you upgrade your staff to make them more efficient or will you attempt to help your Elephants reproduce?

—description from the designer

name: Glyph: Tinker Champion
description:
Glyph is a dice-building combat strategy game for 2-6 players. Players are tasked with forming a team of three champions and defeat their opponent. These Champions are broken up into three distinct classes--Strikers, Guardians, and Adherents--with each Champion having his or her own strengths, weaknesses, and unique abilities which you will use by harnessing the power of mystical glyphs. As the game progresses, your Champions will have the opportunity to acquire new items which will enhance their capabilities as well as perhaps give them even more skills to use to defeat your enemy.

Glyph: The Tinker further expands the options available to players for customizing their group of Champions with a the Tinker, a hero with the ability to create his own unique items for battle, and even pawn them off when the tribe needs some extra gold.

—user summary
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Chicago 1920
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation, Trading, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Lest We Forget
description:
Lest We Forget is a solitaire ground combat game for the 20th century and modern time. You lead a small group of no name soldiers to fight in a brief moment of a large battle. A game of LWF portraits what is happening within a single hex of many other wargames. The design goal of LWF is a quick and light wargame with high replay value which requires minimal setup time. The basic game features a typical land engagement. There are additional scenarios and army rules for historical periods to provide an enhanced immersion.

—description from the designer
categories: Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Murder at Devil Pines
description:
Murder at Devil Pines is 90's era federal agent vs. the supernatural inspired board game, with a twist! It comes from the mind of Zzarchov Kowolski (Pioneers of Mars, NeoClassical Geek Revival).

Players take a number of actions, ordering gear, managing their investigation, or collecting clues but only have a limited number of turns to do so. The Heat is on! There's a monster on the loose, the press is closing in, and your bureau chief is demanding answers.

When we first sat down to play the prototype of Murder at Devil Pines, we need we had something unique. It's a semi-cooperative game, where agents need to race around investigating who killed the local politician, how the sacrifice was made, and ultimately, stopping whichever monster has been let loose on this poor unsuspecting town.

Murder at Devil Pines is a unique cooperative social deduction game with a combination of engaging mechanics unlike anything you've ever seen. While working with your fellow agents to solve a murder may be nothing new, the introduction of a conspiracy card means that you have a chance to be part of the summoning of a monster. While investigating, if you figure that out, it is your solemn duty to aid the monster. Will the Fallen Angel call on you for redemption, or are you already a pawn of the Vampire? Each player has six turns, shown by the heat die, to figure this out.

Gameplay is straightforward. You take an action and then move, or move and then take an action. Actions consist of investigating, meaning picking up a green, red or blue skill die, rolling however many you've collected of that color, and then checking the reference card. "Calling it in" where you help or hinder your fellow agents by announcing how, who, or what, or making a raid on a cult compound, or monster lair.

Because of how easy setup is, and how quick gameplay is, this is the perfect game to share with friends. Its an excellent game to introduce non-board game players to. The rules are simple and clean. Action move, move action. You pick!

With the twist, there's nothing more satisfying than looking around at the other players at the board, watching their stunned faces as they realize you've pulled the wool over their eyes. "Josh, you mean, the monster was the Wendigo, and you just let it eat you so we wouldn't figure it out?" Self-Sacrifice!

Lastly, you can own your own crazy wall!

—description from the publisher

name: E-I-E-I-Go!
description: A game for children in which they roll dice and match them to animal tokens. A matching set of animals wins the game.

name: Dreeple Wars: The War Before the Meeple War
description:
Players assume the role of 1 of 8 dragons, each with a different special ability ready to consume the land before them. The game is played over a series of rounds that involve each player taking 1 action each round accounting for little or no downtime. The game can last up to 45 minutes with 4 players. Actions include:

Fly and Gather
Fly and Fight
Rest/Heal

Players are trying to Decimate the most lands and gather the most magical coins and Dragon gems before all the magical coins are gone or the land is completely decimated. Players roll dice for combat but can heavily influence their die results by discarding magical coins with special powers. If you decimate a land with a Dragon gem on it, you also take on the special ability of that Dragon making you more powerful. There is no player elimination and whomever has the most VP at the end of the game is declared the winner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Sprogspillet
description:
Sprogspillet (Danish for "the language game") is a trivia game about Danish words and the Danish language.

—user summary

name: The Dance
description:
The Dance is a two-player combinatorial strategy game on a plus-shaped board of 33 intersections connected by orthogonal lines and intermittent diagonal lines. Each player has five pieces, which begin on the spaces of two of the longest available parallel lines of intersections.

Each turn, a player moves one piece between two intersections along any connecting lines, or jumps over one adjacent piece belonging to either player to the empty intersection immediately beyond the jumped piece. If a jumped piece belongs to the opponent, the player then moves that piece to any other unoccupied intersection on the board.

Win by either getting one of your opponent's pieces in the very central intersection of the board while none of the opposing pieces occupy any of the immediately surrounding intersections, or by getting three (or more) of your opponents pieces in an unbroken line spanning the central intersection of the board.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement

name: Pillow Fight Card Game
description: Players simultaneously search for matching pairs of pillows, then throw those pillows at their opponents. When all the pillows are gone, the player with the fewest cards wins!

name: Oh My God, Stacy!
description:
What’s your damage?! Find your clique, grab your gear, and prepare for a night of high school drama to the max with this radical card game that has jocks, preppies, geeks, and punks square off in loving homage to high school movies from the '80s.

A fun party game for up to 12 players, Oh My God, Stacy! has students work with their clique to play cards throughout the school day attempting to prank their fellow classmates, collect and steal gear, forge alliances, and earn cool points. Morning announcements may change the rules of play each turn, so stay chill, and may the coolest kids win!

—description from the publisher

Includes 152 cards for play (action, gear, morning announcements, and more), and pizza slice tokens.

name: Go Lightning McQueen
description:
Simple Roll and Move game featuring characters from the movie Cars 3. Players use a spinner to move along a racetrack with obstacles like flat tires, oil slicks or suddenly running out of fuel.

—user summary

name: Solve the Mystery
description: This release is part of a 3-item set released in 2.5 inch round metal tins by University games. This game includes 30 second mysteries of "Solve the Mystery", "Solve the Mystery Gram", and "Solve the Brainteaser". Each includes 64 cards.

name: Horse Club: Über Stock und Stein
description:
Oh dear! The little foal Cookie has left the paddock alone. Curious, it has explored its surroundings and quite far away from the Lakeside court. You are the Horse Club friends Sofia, Hannah, Lisa and Sarah. Together, you're helping Cookie to find the way back to the horse farm. Hurry up so the foal reaches his stable before dark!

To guide Cookie home safely, you roll the symbols shown on the individual boxes of the board. If you roll the moon, a strip of the board is turned on the night side. If Cookie reaches its stable before it is dark (before all the stripes are upside down on the table) you have won the game together.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Don't Sweat It!
description:
Don't Sweat It! is the party game of mismatched moves! Go head-to-head in hilarious challenges featuring over one hundred classic dance moves and pop culture poses!

—description from the publisher

name: Teeter Totter Tower
description:
Players add pieces to the seesaw, changing the balance to try to get either the "3" or "1" lines at the bottom of the seesaw to line up. If they do, the player gains that many points. The first player to get 6 points wins.
—user summary

TEETER TOTTER TOWER is an exciting game of balance. Take turns placing paper pieces on the seesaw to make it tilt atop the tower.
If the seesaw falls off the tower, you’re out!
Paper pieces of different size and thickness are placed strategically on the seesaw to make it balance evenly, or tip it to the limit.
A fun and exciting challenge for players of all ages.
You’ll surely get hooked on the feeling of relief when the seesaw stops just short of falling.
—description from the publisher

name: Sparkler Pyrotechnists
description:
[Sparkler Pyrotechnists is] a paper balancing game to make a brilliant firework sparkler. Take turns to become a pyrotechnician and attach sparkler pieces to the ball of flame.
Keep making the sparkler grow until someone knocks it off and loses. Attach all the sparkler pieces without it dropping off, and you all win! This exciting game will keep your heart in your throat from start to finish.

—description from the publisher

name: Emoji Party
description:
Emoji Party is a fast-action party game for friends, families and drunken fools.

Spot matching emoji cards and win the race to grab the eggplant to replenish your deck.

Run out of cards and you’re out (for now). Get back in the game by grabbing the eggplant.

—description from the publisher

name: Alchemy Struggle (アルケミストラグル)
description:
アルケミストラグル (Alchemy Struggle) is a Japanese card game, similar to Goita. It can be played as a 2 or 3 player game, as a 4 player game in partnership.

Players try to develop their potions as alchemists, and the first player who clears out their hand will win.

To win the game, it is important to determine which color of potion is rare. Because each time you create a potion unique in the world, you can take your turn again. So the players will aim to make potions which require more complex composition.

Further more you should keep in mind that you have a fellow player. By playing cards from your hand onto your partners potions, you will get closer to winning.

However, be careful, your fellow may secretly keep 'philosopher’s stone' card, a wild card in their hand. The philosopher's stone acts like a joker and can complete any potion. Knowing this is in play adds a thrill to the game.

The game was originally published in 2013 by Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ) and revised and re-issued by Southern Cross Games (サザンクロスゲームズ) in 2016.
'user summary
publishers: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ), Southern Cross Games (サザンクロスゲームズ)

name: UNO: Ghostbusters
description:
Who ya gonna call?

UNO Ghostbusters edition card game is here just in time for the film's 35th anniversary! It's the classic card game you know, with an exciting Ghostbusters theme and special rule. Based on the beloved film, this UNO deck features cards with pictures of all your favorite Ghostbusters characters.

Traditional UNO gameplay features matching colors and numbers along with action cards like Skip, Reverse and Wild Draw 4 cards. This Ghostbusters UNO deck also features a special "Crossing the Streams" rule that could change the whole game! And when you're down to one card, don't forget to yell "UNO! "

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mistaken Identity
description:
Easy to learn and hilarious to play, Mistaken Identity is the alter ego guessing game. Players draw an identity seen by everyone but themselves and must guess who they are from a cast of unlikely characters ranging from a man-bunned yogi to a coffee-drinking goth. Wrong guesses bring on crazy behaviors, accents, and punishments that pile up fast. Find out which of your friends has the best detective skills, and which ones do a surprisingly good German accent. As a bonus, every game comes with six fake mustaches for added laughs.

—description from the designer

name: Wordtini
description:
Grab a glass and sip a Wordtini, the best way to mix up your game night or girls’ night. Draw a challenge card and roll the letter dice, then do your best to create words before your opponents. Get creative, because if your word completes the challenge you score big. Roll the dice from the martini shaker and laugh at where your mind lands. This game is a must-have for every home bar!

—description from the designer
categories: Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Chi é il più forte
description:
Chi é il più forte is a simple cooperative game based on memory. Six tiles with wolf are put on the board and also 37 tokens. They are 16 couples and 9 special. At your turn you have to turn a wheel. Some actions could happen. Turn 1,2 or 3 token. Turn a wolf tile. When you turn tokens you try to find couples. If all couples are turned before the 6 tiles of wolf you win. Else the wolf eat you and you loose.

—user summary

name: NFL Trade$ Card Game
description:
NFL Trade$ Card Game is a fast paced card game where the goal is to grab the best combination of top picks as they rush by. Score big by making combos of player positions, teams and division. Acquire the top pick before your opponent to build a higher scoring team. Gather the most points and become the ultimate Trade$ winner!

—description from the designer

name: one more dude
description:
Can't get enough? This deck lets you add another player to both dude and more dude.
—description from the publisher

Expands dude and more dude to allow a 7th player.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Zakat Imperii
description:
This is an easy card game for 20-30 minutes, where you need to skillfully use the army, the circumstances that have fallen, and inattention, or sloppy tactics of the enemy.

A game of the First World War, where players act on behalf of two military-political blocs: the Entente and the Central Powers. It lasts five game years and your goal will be to win in 3 of them, defeating the enemy troops.

The game has two decks. Each of 65 cards, where there is an army, aviation, navy and operations.

Each year it is measured with a card with events introducing new conditions and changing the combat plans of the players. And these 40 cards - 8 for each year. Thus it rises regularly. After all, each new batch you take a new five cards of playing years.
This is a very fast and exciting game, thanks to which you can not only have a good time, but also learn a lot. Indeed, almost every card is provided with reference text.

—user summary

name: The Colour of Money Electronic Board Game
description:
One of twelve Money Target Amount Cards is drawn at random. These cards range in amount from £49,000 to £80,000. When playing multiplayer, the player to reach this target amount in ten turns or fewer is the winner. When playing solitaire, reaching this target amount in ten turns is a victory.

There are twenty Colour Money Cards which represent the twenty cash machines from the British television game show. Each card represents a different payout ranging from £1,000 to £20,000 in £1,000 increments.

A turn begins by choosing a Colour Money Card and logging in the card’s number into the electronic Money Module. Every player puts one hand on the Money Module. It begins to count up from £1,000 in £1,000 increments. Any player who stops the module before it reaches its payout limit adds the amount when the device was stopped to one’s own score. Any player who waits too long receives nothing.

Even though the television series has one player playing against the house, this is a faithful adaption of the series.

—user summary

name: Don't Get Drunk
description:
WARNING: Don't Get Drunk is not for the weak hearted! Don't Get Drunk is the ultimate party game that's bound to make anyone who plays it laugh out loud and have a night full of fun. Don't Get Drunk is the party game you've been waiting for, with 4 separate types of cards in the game, mini games, unique spots, and short / long cuts you're definitely going to have a crazy fun night!

The 4 card types are Luck, Quiz, Dare, and Trial, these unique cards will test your wits, bravery, and skills. You may be dared to ding dong ditch your neighbor, dance for a minute, post something wild on social media, or you might have to face another team in a game of pong, flip cup, or kings cup. Make sure to build your team accordingly!

HOW TO WIN AND PLAY: Be the first person or team to make it from the bar spot to the home spot. Roll the dice and move that amount of spaces, pick the corresponding card and do what it says, or don't, but beware there will be punishments! Don't be afraid to sabotage your opponents to get ahead in the game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Frozen II: Magical Adventure
description:
A new misfortune has come to the kingdom of Arendelle: the seasons have mixed! Bright spring flowers grow along the snow-covered path and as soon as you come around the corner, yellow leaves begin to fly off trees. Unravel the mysteries of the seasons and return the right weather to Arendelle.

There are 16 tiles making up a common game board for all players. Each player takes on the role of a character from the Frozen universe and aims to collect all 4 season tiles. Each player's turn consists of:

Either moving to an adjacent tile or discarding a card and moving to any tile with that symbol on the board.
Flipping the tile they left behind so now it shows another effect.
Resolving the effect of the tile they have just landed on.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Memory, Pieces as Map, Point to Point Movement, Resource to Move, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: El juego de Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente
description:
Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente was the most important nature broadcaster in Spain, during the 60s to 80s and is considered the main responsible for the development of nature conservation in Spain.

The players guide their Félix figures and several animal tokens across the game board and answer multiple questions on the most relevant animal species in the Iberian ecosystems.

The board consists of a track with spaces associated to the different species. Players roll a die and move their animal tokens along the track and when they stop on particular places they get a question. If the player answers a question correctly he/she can move the Félix figure along a different track. The final aim of the game is to reach the refuge of other player with your own Félix figure.

This is a family game for nature lovers, and when buying it you colaborate with "Fundación Félix Rodriguez de la Fuente" for the development of its projects.

name: Pub Quiz
description: A card game containing 54 cards each with two multiple choice quiz questions. Play individually or in teams.20

name: Robin Hood: The Sheriffs Revenge
description:
Robin Hood: The Sheriffs Revenge turns Robin Hood: Hero of the People into an asymmetric 2 player battle for Nottingham.

One person plays as Robin Hood and his merry men while other plays as the Sheriff of Nottingham, each battling to complete their own objective. Robin Hood is trying to help the villagers of Nottingham by giving them money stolen from the rich and corrupt. The Sheriff is trying to increase the bounty on Robin's head to 1000 gold coins.

The game is played in rounds consisting of 5 phases.

The first phase is the Rob from the rich phase where the Robin player draws and selects resources from the loot deck.

The second phase is the action phase where the Robin player can use resources to take a number of actions including building Sherwood Forest and giving to the poor.

The third phase is the duel phase. Both players select a character to enter into battle and simultaneously reveal. If the Robin character can and beat the Sheriff character by equalling the villain's skill level, they earn a reward. If they can't they gain a penalty.

The fourth phase is the Sheriffs Revenge phase. The Sheriff player can then do a number of actions Including raising the bounty, arresting heroes and oppressing the poor.

The final phase is the event phase where the Sheriff player draws 2 event cards and chooses one to play.

The game ends when one player objectives are achieved or the last card of the event deck is drawn.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Novel-based

name: Psia kość!
description:
Bones, food bowls, socks and many other treasures can be discovered by you and your friends. Run through the labyrinth to find out which puppies will get rewards, and then shout out "A dog's life" when you find the puppy with his bone.

Be the first of your friends to guess the puppy or to shout "A dog's life" to get all the cards. Hunt together, but make sure you're the winner.

name: Bold Made: Athlete Expansion Pack
description:
Includes
- 20 beautifully illustrated cards of amazing women in sports
- 2 quick start cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Bread and Circuses
description:
A 3-card microgame for exactly 3 Roman Nobles out for themselves in a time of crisis.

The great empire is crumbling.

Players are nobles doing what nobles do best in a crisis - milking the plebeians for as much money as possible before fleeing to their country homes. Make more money by giving plebeians a scarcer resource.

Consists of 3 cards. A scoring method (pen and paper) is needed and should be provided by the players.


Released in the October 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Meteor Rocks Promo Card
description:
Psi Series Card #8

Text says:
Meteor Rocks may be placed on any Super, Extra Super, or Semi-Super Bunny in The Bunny Circle which loses all of its “special features” and becomes a regular bunny of the same color or classification.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Horton Hates A Who Promo Card
description:
Psi Series Card #9

Text says:
Horton Hates A Who may be given to any Player who must give an Opponent one of his Carrots every time that he says the word, “Who.” Horton Hates A Who is discarded if or when the player has given each of his Opponents one Carrot. The player may pay 10 Dolla to remove this card.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Bunny's Eleven Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Bunny's Eleven
Omega 01: Allows a player to steal the winnings from any opponent who is successful at either the Carrot Top Casino or Casino Royale (Orange Booster Deck). A roll of 7 or 11 doubles the winnings.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: The Djarnak Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

The Djarnak
Omega 02: May be placed between any two adjacent players and prevents each from using any aggressive cards (cards with a pink box) against each other.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: The Conch Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

The Conch
Omega 04: May be used once by a player to silence all opponents for two rounds of play. Only the player holding The Conch may speak (and therefore make deals or exchanges of any kind).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Dago Bunny Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Dago Bunny
Omega 09: May be used as a Green Bunny and stops all weapons directly targeting any Kinder Bunnies that a player has in The Bunny Circle.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Targeto
description:
In Targeto, players try to hit pawns for cups with your catapult. Preparation of each gameplay depends on the variant they choose players among 5 different fun proposition contained in the manual.

Among the variants we find:
Remembering the chips
Earning points
Making sounds
pets and collecting chips
Telling a fairy tale
Line arrangement
pawns fired

name: Deutschland: Das Quiz!
description:
There are 300 interesting quiz questions through the topics of pop culture, politics, science, sports, geography, everyday life and history of Germany.
Prove that you are a real Germany-expert!

This is how it's played:
Answer the questions and get points for the right answer.
The less help you need for the right answer, the more points you can get. When you get points you may move your character on the scoreboard. Whoever reaches the goal first, wins.

name: Camptown Racetrack
description:
A recreation of classic simple tabletop horse racing. Horses are numbered 1 through 6, and each have a corresponding space on the spinner that allows them to move a space that turn. First horse to cross the finish line wins.

—user summary

name: Story Chest
description:
Open the Story Chest and release the magic! Draw two cards and start a new story, while the others guess which card you are going to choose. Each card can take the story into a thousand different directions, from a witch's cauldron to an enchanted forest and back, so let your imagination take flight!

—description from the designer

name: Standing Stones
description:
The first game in a new series: Roll and Write Revolution!

Roll and write style game that uses Dominoes as the randomizer instead of dice. Each turn, players are blind bidding for cards which earn them bonus effects or goods then using the other half of the domino as a worker placement mechanism. Players will also be able to assign their Worker to another player's sheet to activate a resource conversion ability.

Thematically, the players are creating a Pictish village in the Scottish Iron Age. Their activities include farming, hunting, crafting, art, and piracy against the Roman Empire.

After 3 rounds of 7 turns each the game ends and the player who has earned the most Prestige for their village is the winner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types
publishers: Lagniappe Games, Roll and Write Revolution

name: The One With All The Cards
description:
A fan-made "Cards Against Humanity"-style game, based on the popular TV show 'Friends'. It can be played as a standalone game, or treated like an expansion deck for the original game. Played with the same rules as Cards Against Humanity.

The game is simple. Each round, one player asks a question from a Black Card, and everyone else answers with their funniest White Card.

Game includes 90 black cards and 144 white cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Paris
description:
Quiz game about Paris landmarks.

The board is a map of the city, with a track wandering through it. If a player is the first to land on one of the numbered spaces, he draws the card from the deck of 30 cards and reads out the information on the pink side of the card. Then he turns the card over to see what instructions he has to follow. This are fairly predictable; Miss a turn perhaps, roll the die and move backwards, and so on. The player then takes the card and keeps it in front of him where all the players can see it. The card will have a value ranging from 5 to 30, with the value being commensurate with the penalty value of the instruction on it. If a subsequent player lands on a numbered field that has already been taken, then he treats the space as a normal space without number.

When the numbered space 30 has been reached, that player has finished. The others play on. When all the players have reached the 30 space, the 'won' cards are added up and the winner is the one with the most points.

name: ファー!!っていうゲーム (A Game to Yell FORE!!)
description:
This is a freebie game from Toryo Hojo designed to bring golf to your tabletop.

Players play either a single hole or a series of holes, using handfuls of dice to make shots, with your number rolled indicating the flight of the ball. If playing the full game, players choose only a few clubs to bring to the links and must compete with only the dice recipes for those clubs. The tee and hazard locations move based on the holes.

This was distributed as part of the Spring 2021 Market Crash pack and players must provide their own playing pieces.

name: Slingshot to Mars
description:
Take part in a galactic adventure and mine valuable minerals on Mars and its moon Phobos. Slingshot to Mars is a combination of skill and tactical thinking.

Players launch their ship into orbit in a plastic circular track and spend action points to place a magnet to stop at a certain point. The track sits on top of the board in order to find the best mining spots and use your ship upgrades to gain advantages. The game ends when all the minerals have been collected, and the player with the highest total score wins.

name: Zombie Puppies: A Barktastic Strategic Battle Card Game
description:
An Ebola research lab in Luanda, Angola in the 1980s. Through unfortunate chained circumstances (a professor, a snail and a cat are said to have been involved), a deadly virus breaks out, infecting only cute puppy dogs and mutating them into zombies!

You can play this dynamic card game with 2-5 players, regardless of their language. Zombie Puppies can be learned in 5-10 minutes, requires strategic thinking, and gives you a whole new card game experience.

And this is how you play it: With Zombie Puppies you acquire a set of cards which consists of healing, action, and infection cards. Each round involves drawing new cards, infecting your opponent and protecting or healing yourself.

You can win either by keeping your own puppy alive despite being under constant attack or by being the first to get a hold of the healing serum - which is only possible with the right strategy!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Zombies

name: Wordwise!
description:
Players roll letter dice to get as many words as possible in one minute.

The first player to finish checking off a list of word categories in his/her scorepad wins.
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Race, Spelling

name: Portals Card Game
description:
The realm of Rolaria has been plunged into chaos by a war among Deities. The divine forces at play have created ruptures between dimensions & various locations within the realm. These portals hold the key to triumph over the other regions battling for control of Rolaria. As a player, you will assume the role of a Deity, commanding an army of Allies, strategically positioning them to secure access to these portals while simultaneously directing your Champions in the heat of battle. Prepare to unleash your divine power and lead your armies to glory in this epic fantasy-themed card game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck Construction, Events, Tug of War

name: Inspector
description:
The fabulous Purple Puma Diamond has been stolen, and there’s only one person who can catch the thief: THE INSPECTOR

In this game, each player takes a turn as The Inspector, while the other players play as the tricky thieves. The thieves switch and swap their cards around, each trying to get the diamond for themselves without revealing its location to the watchful Inspector.

Pit your wits against your friends and family in a game of bluffing and deduction!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Victory Points, Memory, Variable Player Powers

name: Morning Coffee Dungeon: Deep Sea Adventure
description:
Morning Coffee Dungeon is a dungeon crawling puzzle that can be completed with your morning cup of coffee. Limiting randomness to the treasure/loot drops, each delve into the dungeon is more a series of calculated decisions. Will you be able to complete the campaign with the most victory points?

Deep Sea Adventure: An underwater vessel has been discovered and you have been tasked with investigating. A stroke of bad luck has compromised your mission. Get what you can, treasures or creature samples, and escape before your air runs out!

Rules / How to Play

You may move your character to any spot. It may not move through walls or undefeated monsters.
If your character encounters a monster, resolve Battle in order.
You may leave the dungeon at any time. The total number of Victory Points (VP) earned is your score. If you lose all your health, you lose all your Victory Points.

Battle Rules (Complete in Order)

Calculate Damage: monster level - your level = damage to you, with a minimum of 0. Example: Monster Level 5 - Your Level 3 = 2 Damage to you.
Earn VP: if the monster is the same level or higher than your level, gain 1 VP.
Gain Level: if the monster is the same level or higher than your level, gain 1 Level.

—description from the designer

name: Baseball Dice Board Game
description:
Play a 9 inning game of baseball using two 6 sided dice. Usually played on a wooden wedge shaped board using marbles or pegs. Some boards are square or rectangular. All have a baseball diamond printed, burned, or engraved on them.

Dice rolls, using standard dice, for scoring are imprinted on the board. Wooden dowels or marbles are used to mark positions on the board.

name: Moustique attaque
description:
Each player plays a mosquito and receives three cards: one sting card and two miss cards.

Four holidaymaker cards (divided into four different families) are placed in the center of the table.

The active mosquito must place its three cards face down on three holidaymakers and the next mosquito must place the swatter on one of the active mosquito's cards.

If the swatter is on the sting card, the turn ends and it is up to the next player to play, otherwise, that player places the victim of their bite on their hunting board.

Either they pass--and thus validate the points scored--or they replay.

If the swatter falls on the sting card, the turn ends and the active mosquito loses all cards from their hunting board. In this case, the player who handles the swatter wins a hunting token (which will score a point at the end of the game).

Players continue taking turns until one has collected four cards from a family or the draw pile (card or hunting token) is exhausted.

Points are tallied to determine the winner.

name: Fletter Fuse
description:
Super-Charge your Word Building But avoid the Fletter Fuse bombs!

In Fletter Fuse, 2-6 players have to fuse Single, Double and Triple letters together to make words. Everyone plays at the same time, so you have to think fast and act faster than your opponents if you want to win. The aim of the game is to make the most points.

Players toss cards with letters into a joint pool. The first player to see a word of 5 letter or more, shouts the word out and collects the cards. Once the deck runs out, the cards are added up and the player with the most points wins.

name: Gold Hunting
description:
Outsmart your opponent in this gold gathering game using your superior guessing and disguising abilities.

During the beginning of the game, both players construct their 4 gold pylons in secret. There are a set number of gold nuggets (Pylons consisting of 3 pieces, 2 pieces and single pieces). After that the players guess the number of connected pieces on top of a pylon of their choice (i.e. the left most pylon consists of a 3-piece nugget, a single piece nugget and another 2-piece nugget on top). If they guessed the correct number they receive the nugget. If they are incorrect they discard that nugget.

After all nuggets are either taken or discarded the player with the most nuggets wins.

name: Tricky!: Fantasy Feud
description:
Tricky! is a chaotic, unpredictable trick-taking game that asks you to predict it anyway. The game is compatible for 2 to 5 players. Each player plays cards to win tricks against the others over multiple rounds.

Players score points by winning tricks (or turns), correctly betting how many tricks they will win per round, and successfully executing certain abilities. The game lasts, at a minimum, long enough for each player to be dealer. For longer games, each player may be dealer multiple times. After the final round, the player with the most accumulated points is the winner.

The game is composed of 46 game cards. These cards are divided into three suits: HUMAN, DWARF, and DARK ELF, and one wildcard. Each suit is made up of fifteen different cards, each card having a distinct value, indicated by both the number in the top left and bottom right corners of the card. A card’s value is akin to its strength or power. If two cards share the same suit, the card with a higher value will beat the card with a lower value, thus winning the trick (or turn).

Each round consists of a series of 7 turns for each player, called tricks. Every trick, each player will play one card from their hand face up into the middle. One player will lead (that is, play the first card of the trick), and the others will follow in clockwise order. Based on the cards played, one player will be said to win the trick.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Predictive Bid, Trick-taking

name: Run & Gun
description:
A frenetic 90’s action movies inspired Print And Play board game, with App enhancement, for 2 to 6 players.
A first person shooter tabletop app powered print & play game.

A game of Run & Gun unfolds in a series of rounds. The app keeps track of the number of rounds and informs you when the final round arrives.

Each round involves two phases: the Run and the Gun phase. Run takes place in real time and is assisted by the app: during that phase you will try to take the action that interests you the most for the second phase (and I say try because another player could take it first!). The second phase plays out in rounds, starting with the player that has the carrot card. The players resolve one by one the actions they have selected in the previous phase.

Players get points when they complete the 3 types of goals. On the other hand, they can lose points depending on the amount of damage they received during the game.

At the end of the final round, the player who earned the most points, wins.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Real-time
mechanics: Grid Movement, Real-Time, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Pop Under Pressure
description:
Think fast before the blast... But don't let the pressure get to you!

Players try to come up with a word in each of twelve categories with the first letter chosen by a spinner. While doing so a balloon is slowly inflating as a timer. When the balloon pops, players compare words and score a point for each valid word that none of the other players came up with.

name: Good Boy
description:
In the game Good Boy you move to the world of cheerful dogs. Here you will meet the most different breeds from around the world.

Your task is to collect toys and treats that will make dogs want to play with you. Beware, however, of devious cats that can spoil even the best fun.

The player who proves to be the dogs' best friend wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

W grze Good Boy przenosicie się do świata wesołych psiaków. Spotkacie tutaj najróżniejsze rasy z całego świata.

Wasze zadanie polega na zbieraniu zabawek i łakoci, dzięki którym psy będą chciały się z Wami bawić. Uważajcie jednak na przebiegłe koty, które mogą popsuć nawet najlepszą zabawę.

Gracz, który okaże się największym przyjacielem psiaków, wygrywa grę.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Hunt A Killer: Fine Art Foul Play
description:
A deductive reasoning mystery game that is great for players of any level! When the matriarch of a family of artists is found dead at the opening of her art exhibit, you must identify who within her circle is the killer. You must act fast though; her daughter has been accused of the crime and her trial is rapidly approaching!

In this all-in-one box you’ll take on the role of an experienced but out-of-practice private investigator and review clues to rule out suspects.

Rule out suspects based on their lack of means, motive, or opportunity. Review fingerprints, handwriting, lab reports, and deductive reason to progress the story to its thrilling conclusion.

Difficulty: 2/5

-description from publisher's website

name: Dino Draft
description:
Stegosaurus, triceratops, brachiosaurus and pterodactyls are out in force!

Aim of the game: Score the maximum number of points. Choose carefully as the cards are passed from player to player, as you can only pick one card each turn.

At the beginning of the game, the players receive 2 "mission" cards, colors and types of dinosaurs. For Every card in a player's hand with the same colour or dinosaur as their "mission" cards at the end of the game, the plaer scores 1 point.

The game is played over several "pick and pass" rounds: during these rounds, the players receive cards and each turn, each player chooses any one card to keep, before passing the remaining hand to the player on their left.

After the final round of "pick and pass", each player counts their points from the cards in front of them.

name: Schuldig!?: Explosive Mischung
description:
A renowned chemistry professor dies in an explosion in a laboratory. The question quickly arises: Was it really an accident? Markus Trakta, the public prosecutor, is convinced it was murder and has a suspect he wants to bring to justice. But he needs help - and turns to you.

The players take on the role of lawyers. In five exciting sections, evidence is sifted through, investigations are carried out and, above all, information is analyzed and evaluated as a team. Together, they decide who seems suspicious and why they should be brought to justice - or whether there are good reasons to prevent exactly that.

There are no dice rolls, pawns or playing cards, players will draw their conclusions through discussions and reasoning with one another.

name: The Emperor's New Clothes
description:
The Emperor's New Clothes is a flip & write game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Players draw patterns to puzzle together a pretty shirt abiding by the rules set by the Emperor. Each round 3 patterns will be revealed, and one of the players may reserve a pattern. All players then draw their chosen pattern adjacent to something they have already drawn. Some patterns needs to be grouped together orthogonally, others diagonally and some of them not together at all. You score points after 6 rounds and again after 12 rounds - so players are forced to think short term and long term, and most points wins. There is also a bonus for completed rows and diversity.

The game has several difficulty levels and spans from family game to thinky gamer filler.

About the fairy tale:
The Emperor's New Clothes portrays a vain emperor that only wants the finest clothes. Two guys swindle him into believing they can weave an exceptionally beautiful attire that only the smartest can see. In reality there are no clothes but reluctant to admit he isn't smart, he parades through town until a boy yells out: "but he isn't wearing any clothes!"

name: Spørgsmål fra Helvede!
description:
Questions from Hell!

A game about both getting to know each other, by answering more or less personal questions, and about teasing or trolling each other.

The active player (the Angel) select a question from the table, and writes down and read aloud a truthful answer to the question.

Then each other player (the Devils), select a question from their hand. The selected questions are shuffled and the Angel reads out the questions, answering with the previous written answer.

After all questions are read aloud, the Angels select the best/funniest/rudest/worst/etc. question, and the Devil submitting that question gets a point token.

The Angels submits one question to the middle of the table, and all used questions are replaced with new questions from the stack.

The next player clockwise becomes the new Angel, and play continues until one player has 5 point tokens.

—description from the rulebook (translated)
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Political

name: Карты конфликта: Ыдишын 1 (Cards of Conflict – Edition 1)
description:
Cards of Сonflict (1 Edition) is a very controversial, if not “scandalous” game. In it, participants will select the most successful answers to strange questions. Uncensored. Without political correctness. No brakes. Cards of Сonflict raises a wide variety of topics, often going far beyond the generally accepted norms of decency and etiquette. But if your company prefers black humor, banter over everything, and undisguised sarcasm, then this game is just what you need. Here you can plunge into the world of toilet jokes about orgies, people of non-standard sexual orientation, racism, and of course, laugh heartily at other charms of modern civilization.

Table of Contents Cards Board Game Content:

30 cards with questions
150 cards with answers
rules of the game


The game begins with the fact that each player receives 10 white cards. In the first round, 1 player is selected - "Card Bro" of this round. "Card bro" takes 1 black card from the deck (black cards lie in one deck with the inscription down) and read out the text loudly. Each of the participants (except for "Card bro") chooses one of his white cards that seems to him the most suitable.

White cards are transferred to Card Bro, which in turn reads each option separately. We recommend that you reread the black card completely before reading out a new white card. "Card bro" is chosen by the winner, in his opinion, the option. The player whose white card wins this round receives a black card as a “ball."

At the end of the round, each player draws a new white card from the deck, so that at the beginning of the next round everyone has 10 white cards. White cards used in this round can be put down the white deck so that after a while they will return to them again. In each subsequent round, a new Card Bro is selected so that each player receives this role in turn. You yourself can choose the principle of changing “bro”: clockwise / counterclockwise, by height, age, leg size, or another sign that is understandable to all participants.

There are black cards in the deck, labeled “take 2”. In this case, each player must choose 2 white cards to form a winning combination. It is important to read the white cards in the correct order. Therefore, the card, the text of which you want to read first, you always need to put under the second card and so transmit "bro."

If you wish, you can modify the rules, for example, play without a “Card Bro”. In this case, each player votes for the option that he liked and gets the most votes with the score.

name: The Shame of Life
description:
Every minute someone, somewhere is second guessing what they’re about to say. We’re all guilty of it: shaming ourselves into silence for fear of not fitting in.

It’s time we break our silence. It’s time we celebrate the little weirdos we are. It’s time we beat The Shame of Life.

Players take turns reading questions written on the cards while every one else tries to verbally give their best reply if they can think of one. Once everyone is satisfied with their response, the lead play chooses their favorite response to get the point for the round. This is a game that can last as long as your party does. First to win 5 rounds wins or who ever has the most points by the time you decide to stop playing, wins.

name: Star Realms: Rise of Empire – Infinite Replay Deck
description:
This expansion set allows you to play Rise of Empire WITHOUT using stickers. It also enables you to reset your Rise of Empire campaign over and over and play through as many times as you like!

This expansion set includes a total of 180 cards.


A fresh copy of the Rise of Empire 60-card Trade Deck. If you have played through Rise of Empire using the Sticker Sheets, you can set that original Trade Deck aside and replace it with this new one.
120 upgraded cards. This represents every possible ship and base upgrade that can be made in Rise of Empire! When you upgrade a card in the game, simply swap the non-upgraded card for the appropriate upgraded card from the Infinite Replay Kit.


Also included:


A rules sheet with instructions for use with the Infinite Replay Kit.
A Trade Federation checklist indicating which upgrades are available in each game.
A Star Empire checklist indicating which upgrades are available in each game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Legacy Game, Open Drafting

name: Mystery Island Pirates
description:
AHOY, ME HEARTIES! Yer setting off on a dangerous but rewarding adventure — navigate the perilous Mystery Islands in a race to win the treasure! The Pirates' Code of Conduct, ye ask? There is none! Savvy? Now batten down the hatches and anchors aweigh, mateys! MAY THE WORST PIRATE WIN!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Set-up

name: Zebra
description:
First game of the Button Shy Big Box series


Is a zebra black with white stripes? Or black with white stripes?

Players fit shapes within a grid, adding striped patterns which not only affect their score but also define where additional shapes may go. If a player can’t fit a shape, they must instead add circles which deduct points during scoring


Did you know that you can theoretically color in any map using at most 4 colors, no matter how complicated the borders are? Well you’re going to put the 4-color theory to the ultimate test. Try to fill in your player sheet with as few patterns as possible, all while being efficient in your polyomino placement.

Each turn, you’ll flip over a single card that has a polyomino shape on it. You’ll either draw it, pause, or pass.

When you draw a shape, you have to draw it next to a shape already on your sheet. You then fill it with 1 of 4 different striped patterns. The shape you draw can’t have the same pattern as any of the other shapes it touches. You want to use as few patterns as possible,since the first pattern is worth the most points and other patterns go down in value.

If you don’t want to draw the shape, you can pause. Fill in all of the empty spaces in an enclosed area with circles. This way, you can try and wait for the perfect piece to pop up. But be careful, circles are worth negative points at the end of the game, so use this power wisely.

If you can’t fit the shape AND you can’t pause, you have to pass. Fill in a single space on your sheet with a circle. Once you have fewer than 4 empty spaces together anywhere on your sheet, your game is over. Fill in all remaining spaces with circles.

At the end of the game, total up your points. These shapes are worth 4 points each, these ones are worth 2 points each, and these ones are worth 1 point each. These ones aren’t worth anything, but you’ll get a bonus 5 points if you don’t have ANY shapes with this pattern. Very efficient of you!

Zebra has players think differently about how polyominoes are placed, not just how tightly packed they are. It’s not just black and white! Zebra is quick, easy to teach, and gives you a player sheet you’d be proud to hang on your wall once you’re done playing. Thanks for watching!

name: Guess in 10: Marvel
description:
This is a guessing game based around marvel characters. It is similar to the game 20 questions that most kids have played growing up. The object is for teams to collect seven cards to win.

Game includes 52 Game Cards, 6 Clue Cards, 1 Card Holder and a handy box to store it all.

name: 太陽の子供たち (Children of the Sun)
description:
A powerful ghost called a yūrei attacks the very foundations of the dazzling city of Hamar. You are one of two Masters commanding the Children of the Sun, an organization of famous supernatural warriors with the power to handle the dangerous menace. When it comes to securing your legacy, however, you have some tough competition. Aim for greater achievements than the other Master and establish your reputation as the city’s most skilled ghost fighter!

In 太陽の子供たち ("Children of the Sun"), two players build a grid of cards around the ghost. When the siege is complete, each placed card determines the direction the ghost will move, and the previously occupied card is removed from the grid. If the player catches the ghost in a line of matching colored cards, they may acquire the removed card for their reserve or secretly check the cards making up the ghost's shield.

Once both players have played all their cards, they use any cards they "rescued" to attack the ghost. Players score points based on their ability to match the ghost's weaknesses over several rounds of attacks. The player who damages the ghost the most and receives the most points will win.

Solo rules are also available. When playing alone, the player manipulates two hands of cards to achieve the highest score possible.
mechanics: Deduction, Grid Movement, Programmed Movement, Tile Placement

name: Theme Park Mania
description:
Together all 2 - 4 players contribute to build the greatest theme park ever. During the first phase of the game all players build the layout of the park with paths and railroad tracks to earn cash.

With the cash earned, each player can buy rides and facilities to connect them to the theme park layout. You also need team members to build, operate and secure your rides and facilities.

When 4 rides are build, the park will open the gates for your guests. During the second phase of the game, you'll need to walk the board and visit all rides by playing move- and action cards.

The first player to clear their mini meeple queue will end the game directly. No further moves or turns allowed. Time to count each players victory points.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, City Building, Territory Building
mechanics: Command Cards, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Set-up

name: Recon Mission
description:
In this 2-player "search and write" game, you are a soldier conducting reconnaissance to map out your enemy's base. Gather intel one square at a time and use logic to complete the map before your enemy does. Power up your jammer at the right times to slow them down!

Recon Mission's gameplay is a cross between Battleship and Minesweeper, with a defensive element of jamming signals. At the start of the game, players draw six different structures on their own base map. Then they take turns calling out squares on the enemy map. The other player indicates whether this square is confirmed as part of a structure, a number from 0-8 indicating how many surrounding squares are part of a structure, or "jammed" (meaning they don't want you to know).

—description from the publisher

name: Kdovíkdo
description:
Kdovíkdo is a party game based on association, clues and speed.

Each round you draw one of the famous personalities and you try to give your opponents a hint using well-chosen clues.

Your goal is to guess and be guessed. But beware, you only have three chances to guess the best clues. Even you must have fast hands.

name: Moments
description:
In Moments, players will work together. Some players will be giving clues to describe their cards which will then be mixed with random cards from the deck. The other players will be working together to identify the chosen cards. If the players are able to identify all the cards correctly, the group will score a point for the round. Can your group get a perfect score? Moments features 120 beautiful cards which are compatible with Keepers (sold separately).

Moments features a selection of breathtaking photography from the natural world with scenic views, animals, insects, and abstract photography. All artwork in Moments has been hand selected from Byron Jorjorian’s portfolio of over 600,000 images of the natural world.

name: Disney/Pixar Cars: Launch ‘N' Race Game
description:
Launch your fast-driving friends from Radiator Springs on a fun and friendly race. Whoever finishes four laps first wins! But watch out! Too much speed can send them crashing through Tail Light Caverns—and on a wild ride back to the checkered flag!

—description from the publisher

name: Rumors of Gold
description:
It’s 1848 and all anyone can talk about are the rumors of gold being found in the Sacramento Valley. Now’s your chance to try to get a piece of the prize, so grab your tools and start digging!

Rumors of Gold is a solo roll & write game set in the California gold rush of 1848. The player aims to get rich by digging for the most valuable resources and panning for gold.

Each turn, the player rolls three dice and uses them to explore a new area. The dice values are also used to build up the value of key resources – copper, silver, and gems – which can maximize the output of each dig. In addition, the player acquires rumors of gold, which can yield valuable riches when exploring the right river areas.

The player uses the dice values, and modifiers gained through the game, to choose the best times and locations to collect resources. When the player can no longer explore a new area, they add up their gold and the value of their completed digs to get their final score.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Orchard Quartet
description:
★Synopsis★
One day, an announcement was made by the king:
Hire the most famous pastry chef in the country as the exclusive pastry chef for the royal family.
This is an unprecedented opportunity for you, who have just become independent as a craftsman.
You immediately begin to accept orders from nobles in order to spread your name in the desire-filled social world.
However, there are also rivals who dream of the same success...

★Game Overview★
This game involves players producing sweets (taking tiles) in turn and packing and shipping them according to orders from nobles.
The number on the order card becomes fame points.
In the end, the person who earns the most points wins.

★Tsurukame Puzzle★
This is a puzzle based on the Tsurukame calculation.
By combining tiles that satisfy the 4 conditions of the shape, type, and number of sweets on the order card,
you can intuitively solve the Tsurukame calculation by placing them on the board.
Read your opponent's intentions and complete your own sweets!

★Components★
Acrylic tiles x 76
Game board x 4
Shipping crystal x 20
Assistant chime x 4
Order cards x 20
Bonus tile cards x 8

-description from designer

name: Down the Chimney Dice & Card Game
description:
Players roll dice to collect Gift Cards worth different values; at the end of five rounds the player with the highest total value Gift Cards is the winner.

The game includes its own dice tower and specialty dice. Each of the dice has six different holiday symbols on them: gift, holly, candy cane, snowflake, star, and coal. Players are each dealt three Gift cards, which have different quantities of the symbols on them -- the more symbols, the higher the value. The active player drops the six dice down the tower, then tries to match the rolled symbols to the cards in their hand. If there is a match with a card, those dice are set aside and the remainder re-rolled. Also, the card that matched is set aside for later scoring. Each player may roll the dice up to three times on their turn. If a coal symbol is rolled, that die remains on the table, and if the player accumulates three coal symbols, their turn is over and they may not score any cards.

After the third roll, all other player may attempt to match the symbols on the set-aside dice to those on their Gift cards, and those Gift cards are kept by that player, so everyone is potentially accumulating points. If three coal symbols are rolled, no player scores any points that turn. If the active player rolls three of a kind of any symbol (except coal) they may decide to take an Action card, which must be played immediately. The Actions are 'Nice' (take an extra roll of all six dice), 'Naughty' (next player loses their next turn), and 'Gift Exchange' (the active player may swap one of their Gift cards with a higher-value Gift card of another player, or from the Gift card deck).

When the active player's turn ends, play passes clockwise to the next player. Once all players have had five turns (five rounds), the game ends and each player's collected Gift cards are totaled. The player with the highest total wins.

This game is a tie-in to the publisher's "Elf on a Shelf" system.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Matching, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Snowball Slide
description:
Snowball Slide is a game which is also a Christmas card. On the front of the card is a picture, while on the back the rules are laid out neatly. Inside each is a small piece of card with eight counters to cut out and use with the game. It’s a two player game which takes around five minutes to play.

The card shows ski slopes, down which snowballs can run. Half the funds go to Camp Stripe and half to Camp Spots, which are both at the bottom of the card. The slopes are interrupted by cogs, which can send snowballs down one of two slopes, depends which way they are tilted — or can be horizontal and stop the snowball! The aim of the game is to get as many snowballs as possible into your camp. One player is aiming for Camp Stripe, the other Camp Spots. Players take turns at rolling two dice, and then use the results to move cogs or release snowballs. The snowball rolls down the slopes until it gets to a horizontal cog — or until it arrives in one of the two camps!

This is published as an A5 greetings card and is played using cut out counters included in the envelope. All you (or the lucky people to whom you send the card) need to find is some scissors and two standard six-side dice. It is also available as a print-and-play.

-description from publisher

name: Squabblin Goblins: Reset Button
description:
A Reset Button expansion for Squabblin Goblins.


Shuffle one pile back into the deck, then replace with one face-up card from the deck.

name: If You Know You Know
description:
If You Know You Know! The new IYKYK party game from Spin Master Games is here to put you to the challenge: How well do you know your friends? Your coworkers? Your family? Your significant other? The questions are hilarious, and you are sure to die laughing at the adults-only NSFW card deck. But be careful- these are for adults 18 and up only- these questions get wild!

Getting started and playing this card game is super simple. A rotating judge asks the group a question about themselves from each of the three levels. Then, everyone chooses their answer. If you guess the judge's answer correct, you get a point. Whoever has the most points at the end wins! The funny questions span multiple topics, ranging from pop culture to food habits. Such as: Do I prefer my wings with a side of ranch or blue cheese? If I have to get somewhere, I’m using… Google maps, Apple maps, or Waze? My favorite Chris is… Evans, Hemsworth, Pratt, or Rock?

This adult game for 2-6 players is a fun time for couples games date night, relationship gifts, or just a casual Friday night of family board games. It's also perfect for relationship gifts, best friends game, or games for couples. Prepare for a night of laughs with this new board game based on the viral IYKYK internet trend.

name: Legends of Expedition: Lost Rubies of the Amazon
description:
The day has come. We embark on our journey to find the Lost Rubies of the Amazon. We will meet the perils and challenges that lie ahead with courage. Our story will be shared with the world. This will be our Legend of Expedition.

Live the adventure of an Expedition crew in a fast, dice rolling, solo game. Traverse the unknown in search for legendary locations and treasures. Roll dice to complete challenges and dangers along the way. Manage your supplies in order to survive the journey.

Big adventure in a small Mint Tin package.

—description from the designer

name: UNO: Disney Princess
description:
An UNO variation different from the other Disney Princess editions. The images on these cards are from multiple Disney princess movies all the way up to the year 2020.

In this variation, a new card with the Power of Friendship Rule. When this wild card is played, the player will choose a color from their hand and place it face down in front of them. Going clockwise, every other player must choose a color they THINK the active player placed down, face down. Once all players have done so, everyone reveals. Players who colors matched with the active player get to discard their card, while everyone else just places it back in their hand.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Das Kleinhorn vom Riesenwald
description:
In Das Kleinhorn vom Riesenwald, suitably played color cards let four giants rush through the forest to guard unicorns. There are an amazing number of them: little unicorns, no unicorns, piecemeal unicorns, and of course pig unicorns, slime unicorns and sunshine unicorns.

The giant of a played card color always moves through the forest. It runs to a unicorn of the type that can also be seen on the card that has just been played. The unicorn can be collected and guarded immediately. Usually another animal appears on the spot. If you also have a matching card in your hand, you can add that animal to your hoard, too. If you don't find a unicorn of the card you played in the forest, you can steal one from the other players.

When the day and the game end, whoever has the largest collection of small unicorns, no unicorns, piecemeal unicorns, and so on wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Mrówki: Kolejno odlicz!
description:
The game develops the ability to add and subtract.

Players try to find ants with the appropriate values ​​in the meadow. On his turn, the player reveals 3 tiles. Then checks if you can create the correct addition or subtraction operation from the values ​​on the tiles. To win, you need a good memory.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Math, Memory, Number

name: Who's Who at the Zoo?
description:
Game description from the publisher:

As speedy as a snail and as heavy as a bear — hmm, which is slower and which weighs more? As clever animal detectives who are always tracking down different animals, players in Schneckenschnell & bärenschwer have to answer questions like these and many others! At the three check stops, they receive valuable hints as to the animals' speed, size and weight. Whoever draws the right conclusions from the hints given can win the game. With this game, all players can broaden their animal knowledge in a fun way.

name: Canine Chaos: Celebrity Edition
description:
Join this a-list cast of canine celebrities for a fast and frantic CARD-SWAPPING GAME of canine craziness. Simple to pick up, difficult to put down. Perfect for 2+ people! 25 hilarious canine celebrity characters included, can you claim your way to victory by collecting the most sets? It's a barking good game! CONTENTS: 100 playing cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Kartenspiel – Sonderkarte 2008 – Gustav und Reiner, Helfer der Ratlosen
description:
This is a special card for Siedler von Catan Card Game distributed on special fairs usually by mr. Klaus Teuber itself.
The card name is "Gustav und Reiner, Helfer der Ratlosen" what means "Gustav and Reiner, helper of the clueless" and is a special thank for Dr. Reiner Düren and Peter Gustav Bartschat, creators of the Encyclopædia Catanica.
The card says "If you have at least 3 victory points less than your opponent, you can play another turn right now".
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Looney Bin
description: Compete to identify the zany mental ailments of your teammates -- without letting the other side "in" on your diagnosis. Fantastic game for parties, mixers, and long road trips.

name: Feed-Rex
description:
Welcome to Dino Park! You have been chosen to enter the T-Rex enclosure. Don't worry, he's sedated... Or maybe not? Run away from the lizard and lure it toward your opponents to avoid becoming its snack!

—description from the publisher

Goal of the game is to be the first to reach the park gate, while avoid the attention of the T-Rex.

Player turn has two phases:

A. Gather information

You can ask other players a yes/no/number question (eg. Have I a swiss pocket knife?/How many meat cards do I have?)

B. Dump the weight

You must choose between three actions:


Let's try this: play a card from your hand and resolve its effect
Take this: give another player a card from your hand and resolve its effects
Pull a "MacGyver": choose two cards and ask other player if you can combine them. If yes, discard them and resolve a Rock card action. Otherwise, shuffle your hand and end your turn.


If at the end of your turn the T-Rex is focused on you, you get devoured.
If at the end of your turn you have no cards in hand, you win, leaving the other players trapped inside the park.

The game also has a team mode, and a couple of game variants.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Memory, Party Game, Prehistoric

name: Harry Potter and The Goblet of Fire Quidditch Dice Game
description:
From the rules: Roll the dice and place them on the Quidditch Pitch to earn goals and catch the Golden Snitch, or to block your opponent from scoring. The first player to "catch" the Golden Snitch ends the match, and the player with the most Goal Points wins!

Components:
1 trunk (travel-size game case)
1 score board & die holder
1 Quaffle Die (Red 12-Sided)(*)
2 Bludger Dice (Black 12-Sided)(*)
1 Golden Snitch Die (Gold 6-Sided)
1 Keeper Die (Black 6-Sided)
4 Goal Dice (Blue 6-Sided)
2 Quaffle Score Markers (1 Blue, 1 Red)
2 Golden Snitch Score Markers (1 Blue, 1 Red)

(*) All 3 12-sided dice in this game are actually 12-sided D6's (meaning they are numbered from 1-6 twice).
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Travel

name: PeekPoker
description:
PeekPoker is a fast-paced and fun dice version of its cousin, Texas Hold’em Poker.

Players use 3 dice hidden inside their see-through cup and 3 community dice to make their combinations.

Think you’ve got a good hand? Make a bet and get the chance to snag your opponents’ chips. And beware of bluffers... they’ll fill you with doubt!

Make a bet and get the chance to snag your opponents’ chips.
categories: Dice, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Travel
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Reidemeister
description:
Forming arts with strings, Flashing your inspiration!

This game is a puzzle game with some strings. You use strings to form the pictures depicted by the cards. You need to be careful to match the lower and upper part of the strings where they cross each other.

It is the point of the game that there are three types of strings in this game. Red is one set consists of 2 circular strings, blue is a long string, and yellow is ne set consists of 2 circular strings crossing each other. You have to form the picture with a correct string(for example, the picture have only one string, you have to use a blue string). So, you need to be able to separate them from each other.

There are three rules, Normal Rule, Race Rule, and Kid's Rule. Race rule is for players who want a handicap. Kid's Rule is for playing with children.

MOVIE:https://youtu.be/Mf-GVJItLcc

name: Glückshaus
description:
Glückshaus is a simple 15th-16th century dicing game popular among mercenaries then and historical re-enactors now. A board shows the numbers from 2-12, excepting 4. Players take turns throwing two dice.
