On a 3,5,6,8,9,10,or 11, if the corresponding space holds a coin, they take it; if the space is empty, they place a coin. On a 7 ("the Wedding"), a coin is always placed on the board, forming a growing jackpot. A 2 ("the Pig") takes all the coins except the pile on 7; A 12 takes all the coins on the board. On a 4, nothing happens, or the player may have paid the house, as no 4-space appears on surviving boards.

name: Quiz Wiz
description:
From the Pamphlet:

QUIZ WIZ is the computerized question and answer game that challenges you with 1,001 questions on topics like movies, TV, sports, trivia, and much more! And it's easy to use. Choose a question from the quiz book, then enter an answer from the multiple choices provided. Electronic lights and sounds tell you how you scored. If you're right, you get the green light and "beep". If you're wrong, you get the red light and "buzz". See how many questions you can answer!

QUIZ WIZ includes the Quiz Wiz computer, a programmed cartridge and a quiz book of 1,001 questions - all stylishly packed in a convenient vinyl case. Requires one 9 volt battery or Coleco Battery Eliminator / AC Adapter (neither included). U.S. Patent #4,164,078 and Patent Pending.
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Sports, Trivia
publishers: Coleco Industries, Inc., Jumbo, Peter Pan Playthings

name: Het Aandelenspel
description: Learning to speculate with a game! "Het aandelenspel" simulates the trade on the Stock Exchange. Every player has to make a fortune by buying and selling 6 shares. The dice simulates the unexpected movements of the shares, but the players can also influence the price, buy information from a financial newspaper and trade "à la baisse". The players even have to pay transaction costs when trading shares. A tactical game with a portion of luck, like the real Stock Exchange.

name: Jukem Soccer
description:
Setup: Choose a player to be the dealer. The dealer shuffles the deck, then deals five cards face down to each player. The dealer places the remaining deck face down to form the draw pile. The discard pile: During the game, a discard pile will form next to the draw pile. Player cannot draw cards from the discard pile. The non-dealing player takes the first turn. Player then alternate turns.

On Your Turn: Place an offensive card (or combination of cards) from your hand face down in front of you, either to set up a shot or take one.

Setting up a shot: In order to play a SHOT card to try to score a goal, you must first play 3, 4, or 5 offensive cards to get close enough to do so. The number of setup plays you need is shown at the top of each SHOT card. The Cards that set up a SHOT are PASS cards, HEADER cards, and the FLOP card.

Taking a shot: Once you've made enough plays to take a certain goal shot, you may play that SHOT card on your next turn. Before playing the card, say "SHOT!" Then hold your SHOT card face down in the center of the playing area. If your opponent has a SAVE card, he/she holds it face down near your SHOT card. On the count of three, you and your opponent flip your cards face up, checking out the cards to see if your shot is blocked or not. If your goal shot is blocked, place your possession, the SHOT card and the SAVE card face down into the discard pile. Both player replenish their hands to five cards. This ends your turn. If you score a goal, place your possession beside you with the SHOT card face up on top, to remind you that you scored a goal, This also end your turn.

Ending a Half: When the draw pile runs out, keep taking turns to play as many of your cards as you can. If one player runs out of plays, the other player can keep making plays until no more plays are possible. Remember how many goal you scored in the first half. Then shuffle the entire deck and begin the second half, with the player who did not deal in the first half dealing. The second half plays and the ends the same as the first half.

How to win: When the second half ends, the player with the most goals wins. In case of a tie, play again. The player who score the first goal wins

name: Brax
description: Brax is a fairly simple abstract game that nonetheless can be played on several different levels. Each player takes seven pieces of red or white pieces and place them in the starting diamonds on either side of the board. The board is a mixture of red and white lines, with the two halves exactly mirroring each other. Players alternate moves, moving a piece one space on enemy lines or two spaces on friendly. Play ends when one player's pieces are all captured.
publishers: (Public Domain), Fratelli Fabbri Editori  (Fabbri Editore), L. P. Septímio

name: Pyramis
description:
Tiring of stone pyramids and all the work involved with them, Pharaoh the king of Egypt plans to build new pyramids out of gemstone cubes. How colorful, how novel – now you and the other players need to get the work done.

Each round in Pyramis is broken into two parts: the "mining" of gems and the building of pyramids. During the mining phase, players take turns drawing gems from the gembag, pulling 1-3 at a time. If they draw more than the specified amounts shown on that round's king card, then the player must give up that color of cubes along with extras as a penalty. Players can stop drawing gems at any time, and players score points based on the number of gems they draw in a round.

Players then build mini-pyramids of four gems, with more points being scored when the pyramids have fewer colors in them. You must use all of your gems each round, whether to complete pyramids started by others or to leave half-finished pyramids of your own.

After four rounds, the player with the most points wins.

name: Österreich: Finden Sie Winden
description:
A trivia game focusing on Austrian topography. Players draw cards describing towns, popular sights or landmarks, etc. and are then asked to pinpoint them on the game board which is a map of Austria. However, no place names are included on the map.

The map is divided into several zones of varying sizes. Players can try to gain more points by choosing a smaller (thus more concrete) zone, or play it safe, by only choosing a general area (larger zone) for the location in question.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, End Game Bonuses, Memory, Open Drafting

name: Munchkin Journal Pack 2
description: Munchkin Journal Pack 2 is a set of three 48-page pocket journals as well as a new card for use with Munchkin.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Criss Cross
description:
Opponents roll balls down one of two tracks on the plastic gameboard, depending on whether they are the 'offense' or 'defense' for that particular play. One track is straight; the other meanders in progressively diminishing arcs. There are catching depressions where the tracks intersect, each worth a different score if the meandering balls are knocked off the track by the defense. Two balls are launched down the meandering track; the defender is allotted four balls to prevent these from reaching their intended destination.

A default 15 points are awarded to the offense for each ball that successfully reaches the end of the meandering track. Points are scored by the defending player for each ball of the offense that FAILS to reach the end of its path, according to the amount on the depression that the ball rests in.

After each play opponents swap roles.

The first player to accumulate 300 points is the winner.

name: Alpha Animals
description:
Are you the master of animal kingdom or the bottom of the food chain? With Alpha Animals, Green Board Games’ first ever game, you will see just how much you know about the animal kingdom. Players race around a spiral board naming animals from specific groups (birds, fish, mammals, reptiles & amphibians, insects, spiders & crustaceans). However, along the way challenging multi choice question may have to answered or an animal action performed. Can you name an insect beginning with ‘A’? A reptile starting with ‘Z’? Which has more neck bones, a giraffe or a mouse? Join our Alpha Animals Adventure and find out! Learn and improve your animal knowledge with 2 different question levels as well as reading the animal facts in the rule book. Perfect for children and the whole family. This game is made from recycled materials. All questions and rules are in English, French and Spanish.

Players 2 - 6 players or teams,
Ages 8 - 108,
Contains 1 game board, 1 wooden die, 6 hand-carved wooden animal playing pieces, 2 packs of question cards, 1 rule booklet with animal facts,
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Typisch Frau, typisch Mann
description: Typisch Frau, typisch Mann is a party game that deals with the typical characteristics and relationships of women and men.

name: Scoop
description:
Game in Swedish Only

Scoop is a card game where you build tabloid headlines. The juicier the better. Can you match the minister and the nanny? The sect leader and the pornstar? You decide.

name: Pen the Pig
description: You spin an arrow and get to pick fence pieces which you use to enclose pig pens. If you enclose all your 4 pigs , you win. Ages 5 and up................fun game to play with your children.

name: Balderdash Junior
description: From the box: If you thought Balderdash inspired new heights of silliness among adults, wait until the kids get into the act! Balderdash Junior features an entirely new set of crazy-sounding but real words that will have kids laughing for hours. Players choose the best definition for such Balderdash words as "Ichiboo", "Towilly", and Mohoohoo" and get the chance to make up definitions of their own. It's all the fun of an American favorite... but this time, it's for the kids. Balderdash Junior, for 2 to 6 players.
categories: Bluffing, Children's Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil
publishers: Canada Games Company Lmt., The Games Gang, LTD

name: La Batalla del Ebro
description: Last large Republican offensive of the Spanish Civil War, July - August 1938. This is a company level game, about 850 meters to the hex with variable turn length. Game includes one 25 x 31 inch map, 200 counters.

name: Eins, Vier, Viele
description:
A game to help very young children (Ages 4 - 6) learn to count. Game develops counting and pattern recognition skills.

Each player takes on the role of a seal catching fish.

Role a die (value 1-3) and move around a track on the edge of the board (with a wooden seal figure) which depicts patterns found on fish in the middle of the board. After moving, a player must find/identify all the fish in the middle of the board with the pattern corresponding to the space on the track they have landed on. The players then collect a number of small wooden fish equal to the number of fish they have found. When all the wooden fish are collected the game ends and the player with the most fish wins.

The game also includes rules and extra equipment for a slightly more involved game (requiring just a touch more counting skills).

From the box:
"The little sea lions frolic about at the pool edge. They hunt, catch, count and share many little fish. The colorful game board converts counting into an exciting search game.

A game for 2-4 little sea lions ages 4 and up. Two simple game ideas for an exciting first approach to the numbers 1-10."
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Number
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sly Knight Seekers
description:
Oops! The robber escaped into the town! The knights start seeking clues from the people of the town. Fortunately, the knights have got a lot of information. But it’s not complete and the knights are not satisfied. Now they try to grab more clues from each other!

The players have cards in their hands as clues on the robbery. Then, the players sort their hand cards into an ascending order. Now, the turn player plays one card face-up to another player, seeking an answer. If that player has the same card at the end of their hand, they must give it to the turn player along with the played card. So, the players start to detect the other hand cards from seeking clues.

If you have 2 or 3 players, it’s a competition to win.
If you have 4 players, it’s a two partnership game to win.
If you have 5 players, one player is solo, and the other four are two partnerships.

name: Sheep Dog
description:
The big bad wolf is very hungry! He tries to sneak into the farm to get something to eat. However the sheepdog, the guard of the farm, always keeps his eyes on the big bad wolf to protect lambs in the farm. Then, on a dark night, everyone in the farm falls asleep. The big bad wolf is very very hungry; he just breaks into the farm to have a big meal!

In Sheep Dog, the responsibility of the sheepdog is to protect these lambs and help them escape from the farm. On the other hand, he also has to catch this big bad wolf!! Who is the winner? Let's play!

name: The Last Brave
description:
A group of heroes battle to the last — can you survive?

The Last Brave comes with two rule sets, one that's a team game with a focus on hidden identities and the other that's a battle royale with more focus on combat. In both games, the core rules are largely the same: You are a champion who must fight for your nation and defeat all of your opponents. Each champion has three attributes: a class, an element, and a type of arms, all imbued with incredible power. When one champion is attacked by another, the damage they take exposes the nature of their attributes, revealing the weakened champion's true form to the other players. However, once these attributes have been revealed, the champion who wields them can start to benefit from their abilities.

In order to win, you have to reveal the right card at the right time while not giving your opponents the opportunity to do the same. In the team match you also have to figure out who your allies are before the other teams do. Be the last one standing — or the only team still in the game — to win.

name: Photoloco
description:
Photoloco is a drawing game game with some basic similiarities to Pictionary but with alot more going on! Photoloco is a fast paced, incredibly fun game with some hilarious moments and lots of interaction!

Photoloco is a brand new game that is fast, fun and more often than not- hilarious. In Photoloco you've got 90 seconds to draw anything you want on a giant game photo to get your teamates to say as many of nine hidden words associated with that photo as you can. Hand gestures are greatly encouraged! While the results of your efforts as an artist might seem obvious to you, your teammates might not be so sure! It's been a while since a game has come along that plays so well with people of all age groups. Photoloco can entertain children (8 and up) and yet still become the life of a party with adult beverages.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Line Drawing, Team-Based Game
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), RSV Productions Inc., Tactic

name: Wyprawa do dżungli
description: Players embark on a journey into the jungle in the footsteps of the ancient civilization Maya. Players will earn points for their treasure trove. In each round, players have four cards with available maps. In his turn, a player puts on the table his personal map (the card) held in the hand. Then he flips the selected card treasure lying on the table. A player gets points when the colour and the shape of treasures. After four rounds who has the most points is the winner.

name: UNO: Disney Theme Park Edition
description:
From the box:

"Take a tour of some of the most popular attractions at Disneyland Resort and Walt Disney World Resort without leaving the comfort of your chair, in this special Collector's Edition of UNO, America's #1 Brand of Family Games. Appearing throughout the deck are 16 beloved Disney attractions and characters, sure to add fun and fantasy to every game. But look out for Maleficent on the Exclusive Card and Rule, available only on the Disney Theme Part Edition of UNO. Let the magic begin!"

The "Evil" card, with a picture of Maleficent, allows the player to take the top card of the discard pile, even on another player's turn. The card then acts as a WILD card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Groovy
description:
This is a game for two players or two teams.
Aim of the game is to get three marbles on the opposite side of the gameboard. The gameboard can be tilted in 8 different directions and contains a 5x5 maze with different tiles. On his turn a player first changes the orientation of a tile on the game board and then tells his opponent in which direction to tilt the board.
publishers: MB Jeux, MB Spellen, MB Spiele

name: Disorderly Conduct
description:
Disorderly Conduct is the game that seems primarily focused at law students. Comprising seven categories of traditional law topics, this trivia game has individual players or player-teams answering questions about Torts, Contracts, Property, Criminal Law, Evidence, Constitutional Law, and General Practice. The questions are quite involved, and require players to have more than a passing association with the law and legal procedure.

In a similar vein to Trivial Pursuit, players seek to answer questions in each of the six law categories before moving to the middle to answer the question in general practice to win the game. Unlike Trivial Pursuit, players make a decision from among four multiple-choice answers.

name: On lâche rien !
description:
On lâche rien! is an observation and reflexes game for all ages.

Players take it in turns to turn over a card to form three piles. These will represent the procession.

Depending on the layout of the cards, you may have to tap certain piles. If you succeed to be the first, you win the cards in the pile. The player who collects the most cards before the end of the game wins.

The game is accompanied by a booklet that provides keys to understanding police practices in France. It was written by two associations fighting for the freedom to demonstrate and denouncing police violence: ACAT-France (Action by Christians for the Abolition of Torture) and LDH (Ligue des droits de l'Homme).

name: Flipsiders: Checkered Flag
description:
This is a small game of auto racing: it folds into its own plastic case measuring 2.5" x 4" (6.5 cm x 10 cm). One side has a small snap open compartment holding 2 magnets in two different colors (4 total). The other side pulls out into a tri-fold board which unfolds to 6" x 3.5" (15 cm x 9 cm), remaining attached to the plastic case. The case itself also has built into it two spinners which are activated by a switch: pull the switch and let go and the spinners spin quite fast with a satisfying sound vaguely reminiscent of a car, I suppose.

Checkered Flag is one of the Milton Bradley "Flipsiders" games.

name: Cheat
description:
Cheat is a beer & pretzels bluffing game.

Players shake a container containing 2 dice behind a slider, then look at the numbers they rolled. You must roll (or say you rolled) a higher score than the previous player. Points are lost by successful (or unsuccessful) challenges.

Similar to Mia.

name: LEGO: Knight's Kingdom – Das Spiel
description: Announced for Nuremberg...
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Asesinato en el Orient Express
description:
A murder has happened on the Orient Express train. There are 12 characters, the suspects. One player moves the characters around a map of Europe, and he is the only one to know the identity of the killer.
Each of the other players leads a team of 3 detectives around Europe, accomplishing missions that give them clues about the killer's identity, while the killer tries to mislead them.
The detective teams must cooperate, but remembering that only one player will be the winner. If the killer has not been discovered after the set time limit (between 1 and 2 hours), he wins.
publishers: Factor Games, Nike and Cooper Española, S.A.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Red Alert
description:
Unique Federation Elite Talent (2 SP)
When you spend a [BATTLESTATIONS] Token, you may discard this card instead of returning the [BATTLESTATIONS] Token to the Action Token supply.

This resource is a participation prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "The Tholian Web."
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Pass The Pot
description:
A dynamic push-your-luck dice rolling game.

The gameplay is so simple:

STEP 1 - Roll it.

STEP 2 - Get as high as you can.

STEP 3 - Pass it.

Filled with 55 coins and custom dice, and a pot, players compete to win the pot, and be the first to accumulate 24 coins.

name: Meine ersten Spiele: Feuerwehr
description:
So far, it has been a quiet day at the fire department in Habatown. Suddenly, the big siren at the fire station roars to life. There's a fire in the city! Firefighters Max and Anton are ready in a flash, jumping into the bright red fire engine and racing off to fight the fire. With their siren wailing and equipped with hose, bucket and fire extinguisher, they know just what to do!

Who knows where the equipment can be found in the fire engine in Feuerwehr to quickly put out the fire?
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Hot Property!
description:
"Welcome to the glamor and glitter of movies! You are a producer; cast the stars, sign the directors...A hit could make millions! A dog could lose a fortune! It takes strategy, skill and nerves to stay on top of the movie business."

This game is cutely packaged in a round movie reel box.

name: Let's Make a Deal
description:
Each player starts with $500. The two decks of cards are shuffled separately and dealt face down onto their respective places on the game mat: the Package Cards are eight piles of four and a pile of three and all seven Door Cards are placed on seven separate spaces.

The game begins with an open auction for ownership of one of the Package Card stacks of four. The winner of the auction looks at another stack of four and haggles a purchase price with any of the other players. The buyer of the latest stack initiates the next deal and the game goes on until all eight stacks are gone.

Package cards may be redeemed for cash from the bank but the purchase price for the cards goes into the Jackpot on the game mat.

When all eight Package Card stacks are gone, the players total their earnings and, in turn, each player chooses a Door Card. The players start with the player with the most money and play in descending order cycling a second time if necessary. The player who chooses the Jackpot Card gets all the money in the Jackpot and the player who chooses the Mystery Package Card gets the remaining Package Card stack of three.

The player who has the most money at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Corriere della Sera
description: To get your newspaper ready for printing is the object of the newspaper editor. The players move on the board trying to acquire exclusive news to insert in just their newspaper. When they have completed the paper, they must get it to the newspaper stand for the distribution.

name: Verfühlt nochmal! Groß und Klein
description:
Publisher website: "Fiddlesticks! The mischievous gremlins have snuck into the children's room and hidden all the toys in their magic bags. In three different game ideas the children try to find by touch the figures inside the bag. Not as easy as it seems as each of the figures exists in three sizes! So it is easy for the fingertips to guess wrong. An exciting collection of educational games for 1-4 elves ages 4-99. The three varied tactile games ideas motor skills, concentration and memory are fostered."

Several objects are placed in a bag, objects are available in 3 different sizes, can you draw the right object in the right size out of the bag ?

name: Pulsar
description:
You are an astrophysicist. There is an Alien Life Form roaming about the galaxy and it can only be captured by creating a special serum composed of samples from each of the six planetary bodies. Your mission is to soar around the galaxy and collect samples from each of the six planets and bring them back home in order to convert them into concentrate to create the serum, which will ultimately draw ALF to you. Your respect and possible future missions rely on this, so you must succeed before the other scientists do! But beware, as there is a black hole that will mysteriously spiral your work into the vortex, and Space Hubs that will intercept your journey...for better or for worse!

In Pulsar, outer space is the limit. Playability is endless as 24 Galaxy cards (including Stars, Planets, and Space Hubs) are randomly laid out in 5 x 5 grid to create the board around the central Black Hole. Sample/Concentrate cards are stacked on their respective Planets, and Hub cards are divided and placed on the Space Hubs, triggered when a scientist must stop at one. Rockets soar around space in movement patterns designated by a Vector Die roll, building warp speed, and by manipulation if in another rocket’s path. The goal is to land on the Planets, initiating the serum-development process. Each scientist also has his/her own special forte, determined by the random dealing of Character cards at the start of each game.

Space can be an awfully big place! A team-play variant allows scientists to work together, combining their character powers and using the bump-and-go rocket system to propel each other around the galaxy.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: (Web published), Dice Hate Me Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Flip!
description: Flip! is an exciting new twist on classic Rummy; the cards are double-sided. Players will steal each other's cards to help them win by playing sets and runs. First player to get rid of all of their cards wins the round. "Flip!" cards cause players to have to flip over their entire hand, discovering new possibilities.

name: Pictionary Disney
description: Pictionary Disney is the all new way to play in the world of pictures. With all play game modes, the entire family will be engaged during every moment. Players draw, use charades or make sound effects to get opponents to use the slap hands (with suction cups) to grab the correct card the fastest and win the game. With more than 400 clues and three ways to communicate, the entire family will have hours of fun with their favorite Disney icons. Includes 200 picture cards, 4 slap hands, 2 Mickey-styled dry erase boards, 2 dry erase markers, 1 die, 1 wipe cloth and instructions.

name: Piñata party: JEM promo
description:
Gift promotion for the Piñata party.
Additional moving mechanism and scoring card to the base game.
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pattern Building

name: Very British Problems
description:
Would you know who said they'd meekly find another chair when they arrived at the office if they found a stranger sitting in theirs? Or who said they'd put headphones on and pretend to be asleep if the person next to them began chatting on a long flight? All will be revealed as you sit around drinking milky tea, awkwardly discussing your inner Britishness by playing Very British Problems!

—description from the publisher

You start on the starting line. One person reads the question on the card. All players are armed with a wipe clean board and a pad. You write your answer on the pad, they all get read out and you have to guess who said what. However many you get right is how many spaces you move. This is a straight forward party style game where moves race around a track by guessing who said what.

—user summary

name: Meltdown
description:
Pile it on until there’s a…Meltdown! Atop the tower you’ll place the squishy goop—roll it, smash it, just place it however you want. And then set the balancing platform on top of that! Take turns stacking cool, slippery cubes you have to stack on top…but be careful…between the goop and slippery platform, it’s always shifting! If there’s a MELTDOWN and any cubes fall, you have to take them, and that’s dangerous because the goal is to get RID of your cubes!

—description from the publisher

name: Enigma: Crime Scene
description:
Enigma: Crime Scene is a replayable crime investigation game that can be competitively, cooperatively or imposter mode.

Players attempt to pinpoint the criminal from 10 suspects using a variety of tools including newspapers, riddle cards, maps, fingerprint cards and more. The base games comes with 4 scenarios set in London, New York, Chicago, and Sicily. 3 cards (location, weapon, and fingerprints) are placed face down on the board.

The first person to combine the location, weapon and fingerprints clues and find the criminal, wins the game.

—description from publisher

name: The Office Trivia Game
description: Are you a true Dunderhead? Find out with 150 questions testing your Scranton smarts.

name: Minderheiten-Quartett: Soziale Kernschmelze
description:
An expansion for Minderheiten-Quartett, which adds 19 more minorities to the game, as well as 14 new action cards.

Game play is largely the same as Minderheiten-Quartett, with features of Quartett and Top Trumps. There are some new tactical options with the booster-cards, which can change the stats for some of the minorities in the game.

name: Keep Calm
description:
Keep Calm is a party game where players vie to take control of situations by suggesting the best course of action to their friends in sticky situations. What do you do if your prom date turns into a werewolf? Keep calm and accept your mortality? Keep calm and give up on finding love?

In addition, players can play Panic cards to mess with gameplay in various ways, from skipping a judge to discarding responses.

The first person to take control of 6 situations wins!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Hocus Pocus
description:
Players are young wizards who fight over magic gems.

At his/her turn, one plays Hocus cards, while every player can play Pocus cards.

• The 50 red Hocus cards are powerful 9 different spells allowing players to draw cards, take or steal gems, force an opponent to discard cards, look at the cards on the top of the pile…

• The 25 yellow Pocus cards can only be combined with a Hocus card already in play, modifying its effects in order to protect oneself against a evil spell, double the effect of any spell, remove all other Pocus cards in play… There're 8 different Pocus cards.

Every wizard has always 3 of his/her cards face up in front of him/her, so every player partially knows the hand of all the others.

At the end of his/her turn, a player can either draw 2 cards or take 1 gem from the magic cauldron. The game ends whenever the cauldron is empty, and the player with the most gems wins.

name: Bug Out
description:
The Speedy Scramble for Slugs and Bugs!

Bug Cards are scattered all over your table or even your living room floor! Players race to capture the bugs by covering each Bug Card with a matching Leaf Card--It's a wild scramble to find each bug! Be the first player to cover all of your matching Bug Cards and Bug Out!

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Redshirt
description:
The Redshirt cards are a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 2, "The Battle of Chin'toka," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, The Dominion War. Each is a Federation Crew Upgrade card and costs 4 Squadron Points.

There are 2 versions of the card, which have different photos but the same card text. One card depicts a living "redshirt" crew member, the other a deceased "redshirt" crew member. Each Month 2 organized Play Kit includes 12 cards, six of each version.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: The Arab Israeli Wars
description:
The Arab Israeli Wars is an 3rd party expansion for Axis & Allies and is a territorial strategy board game covering the 1967 and 1973 wars between Israel and its Arab neighbors. It is an Empires of History game, which utilizes a D10 variant of the Axis & Allies gaming system. The Arab Israeli Wars includes 2 game scenarios; one for the 1967 War and one for the 1973 War.
In the 1967 war, Israel must strike out quickly to wrestle the Sinai region away from Egypt and deal deadly blows against Syria and Jordan before the weight of the superior Arab numbers can fully be mobilized, and before Iraq joins in the war against them. Israel's ready reserves gives them an edge in calling up their armies and they have to leverage that for everything it is worth.

In the 1973 war, Israel begins play in control of the Sinai, Palestine, and the Golan Heights. The Arab powers must hit Israel hard and fast, trying to overrun Israel's border armies before Israel can mobilize its then-superior military might.

The Arab Israeli Wars is a fast paced game (some games can be concluded in as little as a hour) historically portraying these two middle east conflicts. Optional rules for land mines and the use of the nuclear weapons adds additional game play variety.

Contents:

17" x 22" four piece Cardstock Game Map (four 8.5"x11" sheets)
270 Plastic Playing Tokens.
270 Plastic Playing Tokens Stickers.
Game Rule Booklet.
1D10
Cardstock cut out Mines, Nukes, and National Markers


Expansion For:

Axis & Allies
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Chicago in a Box
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Chicago, Illinois. It has spaces such as Oak Street Beach, Art Institute of Chicago, Navy Pier, Lake Michigan, and The "El" . The tokens include a pretzel, heart, baseball mitt, sailboat, star, and tommy gun. Cards include local events and staples of life in Chicago.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Millionaire
description: A board game for up to seven players, the object of the game for one of the players to become a Millionaire. The journey of players around the board is subject to advantage and penalty squares and a pack of playing cards with similar subject matter. the game features a lovely board loaded with period illustrations. The game was produced by Wm. Sessions Ltd.of York, England sometime in the early 1940s.

name: Skill Ball Marble Game
description:
Use your skills to land the marbles in the holes and earn the most points. Comes with 12 marbles in 4 colors.

Place the metal tray on the floor or table top.
Each player chooses three of the same colored marbles.

Each player takes a turn at rolling their marbles into the tray.
You can only roll each marble once. If you miss the tray you can not roll again.
try to land the marbles in the holes with the highest point values.

If you knock loose one of the marbles already in the tray you lose that marble's point score. After all three marbles have been rolled add up your total score.
The person with the highest score is the winner!

ALTERNATE VERSION:
Each player rolls one marble at a time trying to knock out the other player's marble's.
After each player rolls their three marbles the player with the highest score is the WINNER!
publishers: Hasbro, Marx Toys, Pressman Toy Corp., Schylling, World Metal Stamping Co. INC.,

name: Остров Страха
description:
From publisher:

The Island of Fear
Can you survive until sunrise?

A plane carrying a group of tourists to the Maldives crashes in the Indian Ocean. On the first night after the crash, the survivors realize that there were werewolves on the plane with them. These fiends organized the whole crash so that they could hunt down some humans in the moonlight. There is only one way to survive until the rescue crew arrives – find out who the werewolves are and lynch them.

The Island of Fear is probably the most advanced version of the world-renowned Mafia game. First of all, in addition to the normal tourists and werewolves, there is a sexual predator, a clairvoyant, a nurse, a witch, an untouchable, a nightwalker, a half-blood werewolf and even a were-hamster. All sorts of nasty surprises can be expected from this colorful group of people. Second, the game contains a set of event cards that create specific events as the game progresses. Third, there are object cards that can both help or hinder the owner. Finally, the game comes with a DVD with mood-setting backgrounds and a timer for day-time voting. Also included are a chart and voting tokens to help manage the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting
publishers: Fantasy World, Inc., Hobby World, Igrology

name: Monopoly Junior: Peppa Pig
description:
Play with family Wutz and Peppa Pig. Move around the playground and buy places from Peppa's world! As soon as one player runs out of money, the others count their banknotes. The player with the most money wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move

name: US High Speed Rail
description:
Make deals, lay tracks, and build a national high speed rail system! When it's your turn to lay new track, you'll ask the other players for proposals and pick one to implement.

Cards represent different regions and industries in the U.S. You represent three of them. Two are public for the other players to see, the third, well, that's your hidden agenda! To win, you'll want to satisfy at least two of your three.

Rules are 1 page long. Game takes approximately 60 minutes for a 3-6 player game, and 30 minutes for two players. Game is downloadable as a print and play from the official website.

name: Der Goldene Kompass: Duell der Panzerbären
description: Kosmos 2P Game that recreates the epic battle between Ioric and Iofur - Great Battling Polar Bears from the Golden Compass. Players take control of a bear and fight them trying to inflict the most damage before the game ends.
categories: Animals, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Micro Play-Break: Kingdoms
description:
The dying King is a shrewd man with more gold than compassion. Unable to choose between his two offspring whom to name as his successor, the King devised a challenge, bequeathing to them small Kingdoms in the far corners of his vast territory.

Who will earn the right to the throne? Only the most clever will succeed either by building an impenetrable fortress or eliminating the competition.

Objective: The winner is the first to either have a knight outside the forest that cannot be captured or be the only player with a knight on the board outside the forest.

Play: On their turn, each player will place, move, or flip pieces on the game board. Player options come from the pieces not-currently-on-the-board, meaning greater options are available to those who have fewer pieces in play.

name: Old Town Robbery
description:
Old Town Robbery is a communication-based memory game for families with easy rules.

In the first part of the game, the robber wanders through the city, and the players construct a story based on the places he visits. In the second part, players take turns playing the sheriff who is trying to retrace the steps of the robber, visiting the same places as the robber has before. The story element helps players do just that, and they earn points by correctly guessing the next building.

name: Sansibar
description:
"The Adventurous Trading Game in the Indian Ocean

Sailors and merchants from all nations meet in Zanzibar to purchase valuable spices. Each trader sails his two merchant ships along the Zanzibar coastline and heads for the various transshipment points in the bays. The captains are sometimes hindered by pirates on their journeys. In the different bays, you must load at least four of the same type of trade goods and exchange them for cash. Whoever gets back to their homeland first with their fleet and who purchases and sells their goods the most cleverly is the winner."

~from the back of the box (via Google Translate)

Another game in the "Bestseller Autoren" series from Schmidt. Also published as "Molukki" by Reinhold Wittig's company "Edition Perlhuhn."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Throwing Stones
description:
Throwing Stones was released as both an RPG and a "board" game. The board game is a dice-based arena combat game between two contestants. It can result in some tense, close combats. There are many different dice and many combinations of dice available, so choosing your dice before the combat is an important part of the game.

Each contestant has four dice that define him. Four dice of the same type can be used, but that limits the player's abilities. The dice were collectible: there were quite a few different types made, some more powerful than others. All dice are six-sided and have special glyphs on them.

To fight, players each roll all four of their dice and count up symbols for initiative. Low initiative has to state his action first, then the higher initiative character can respond.

Attacks are resolved by announcing the type of attack attempted and throw the dice again. This time the player is looking for Strike and Special glyphs. The opponent declares his action and rolls and hopes to get defensive, counterstrike, and special glyphs. Players record damage, and continue until only one fighter is conscious.

Some of the glyphs include: Unarmed combat, various magic spells, knockdown, bypass armor, poison, luck (reroll some dice!), roll with the blow, strike again, counterstrike, disarm, berserk, centered, zealous, sword, stun, skill+, and many others. All are described in detail in the 96-page book. (Only about a quarter of the book is pertinent to the arena combat game; the rest is for the RPG.)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Phase Order

name: Giù dal Trono
description:
"...this must be end!" screamed Skram with his squeaky voice, amplified by the crude loudhailer.
"The King!! The King is a tyrant, and exploits us and our work, keeping all the gold for himself!" shouted the little goblin. "We will regain our freedom!"
"Hurrah for the revolution!" screamed the crowd.

"We will suppress the nobilty!"
"Hurrah for the revolution!"
"We will found a republic!"
"Hurrah for the revolution!"
"And the King will pay!"
"Hurrah for the revolution!"
"And we will kill him beating him with a mace!"

Silence.

Spronfz said: "Why a mace? Why not a sword?"
"Or maybe an axe", rectified Glurz.
"Or a bomb!" shouted Fnurk.

Skram sighed, as the meeting turned into a giant-sized goblin brawl.

Giù dal Trono is a game of bluff and intrigue, but in a "goblin-style": players play in secret teams, trying to guess the faction of other goblins, each time wants to kill the king with a different weapon, and during each turn a player will choose a room of a dungeon, asking the other players to forge weapons with him, in order to produce enough maces or axes to supply with arms the plotters.
During each turn, player will also play cards to unveil factions, or to hinder or rob the opponents, simulating the not-so-complex discussion system in goblin society.

A player can lead his team to victory killing the king, or try to win alone fulfilling the requirements of his secret objective.

name: Tark Mees Taskus 2
description:
Second game in the series with different themes including movies, music, novels etc.

There is letter in one side of the card and theme (bands, actors, TV-Series etc.) in another side of the card. Turn around top card and be the first to say something that matches the theme from one card starting the letter from another card and You get the card as a point. If nobody can´t say anything or there is a tie the card is kept for the next round.
If the deck runs out the player with the most points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: WeyKick Kubbolino
description:
This is the table-version of the popular yard game, Kubb. 2 player try to be the first to drop the knights of the opponent. They use a catapult to shoot a bowl.
When all knights are fallen, the king can be attacked. The first player that drops the king legally wins the game.

name: Finger-Flick Sports: Baseball
description: Play baseball by flicking a soft disk around a baseball diamond. The offensive player places the disk at home plate and flicks it into the field of play. Specific targets represent singles, doubles, triples, home runs, and outs; if the disk lands anywhere else, the defensive player can flick the disk at other targets to try to put the batter out.

name: 90 Minutes
description:
This is a simulation of a soccer game played on a 41 by 52 square board.
Possession and movement are controlled by dice (one d20, two d6) and cards. The cards come in 4 types: Direction cards (60), Action cards (60), Referee's Decision cards (30) and Situation cards (30) which are drawn under defined circumstances.
The rules cover situations such as kick off, own goal, corner kicks, throw ins, free kicks, penalties and scoring chances.
The winner is the one to score most goals in two 45 minute halves.

name: Shuffle: Trivial Pursuit
description: Ever played the classic Trivial Pursuit with help of your smartphone or tablet? Now you can! Shuffle Trivial Pursuit combines the classic gameplay with some new features. Play in 2 teams against the time and when you think about the answer to a question your time is decreasing. When your time is out, the game is over and the other team win! Or play without the app just with the card. Your handcards chose whats your next question and you can even steal won cards from your opponents. [User summary]

name: Luftschlösser
description:
from Branham translation:

Many thousand meters above the surface of the earth lives the people of the cloud platforms. These people build graceful floating platforms in the sky, and castles on the clouds. The builders of the most beautiful cloud castles gain great privilege and respect.

Often, however, their contests made very difficult by inclement weather. Strong rains and sudden storms take a heavy toll on lives and the castles themselves.

Object: Whoever manages to complete 3 cloud castles. (With 2-3 players, 4 cloud castles) wins the game.

name: Royal Masquerade
description:
This is a children's game where players move around the game board looking for clues about the royal guests. Be the first player to correctly guess the identity of the Mystery Host.

The play of the game involves wearing a ring which grants the the player special abilities to enchant other characters. The Mystery Host’s identity changes every game. There are two levels of play - one for literate children and a younger version for non-readers.

name: Pizza Pie Game
description:
This is a pizza card game where the players play cards into a pizza pan while attempting to match adjacent slices with similar ingredients.

Each player is dealt four cards and one "ugh" card. On their turns, players play cards into the pizza pie pan. Whenever the ingredients from three adjacent slices match, the player score a point in each category of ingredient shown on those three cards and for all cards stacked beneath those cards. There is also one ingredient -- indicated by the "ugh" card -- that each player is trying to avoid.

Because some slices have more than one ingredient, players may end up scoring in favored categories and "ugh" categories at the same time. A player wins if he is the first to score 8 slices for each of his favored ingredients. He loses if he scores 8 slices of the "ugh" ingredient.

name: Angry Birds: Star Wars – Jenga Hoth Battle Game
description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

Take turns bombarding an imperial hog in the frozen terrain of Hoth (from back of box.) "Roll, Launch, Win!"

This is a new edition to the Jenga & Angry Birds line. The game comes with a Luke Skywalker bird, 2 Snowtrooper pigs, a Snowspeeder launcher, 12 translucent plastic Jenga blocks, 2 dice, label sheet, and game guide. The object of the game is to launch birds and knock down pigs to score the most points. One player is the builder, and the other player is the launcher. You score 1000 points for each pig you knock completely off the structure. In addition, you score a bonus 1000 points if you have any birds left unlaunched after you knock all the pigs off. Take turns until you've played three rounds. If you scored the highest, you win!

The game is based on the Star Wars Angry Bird app. In addition, the game comes with a App code to unlock game content.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Monkey Beach
description: Join the quest and help the monkey pirates find their long-lost buried treasure. Feel for the hidden treasure shapes within the cloth island and guide them out through beach, waterfall or jungle openings. Quickly collect your treasures before the volcano erupts!

name: Disney Eye Found It!
description:
A card game using the same art of Dreamworks Eye Found It, but with different rules, goals, and mechanics. The card show detailed illustrations on one side and a single item on the other. Each player receives a hand of 5 cards, then a card is drawn to determine the single item all players are trying to locate in their hand. The first player to find the required item gets to discard the card with the item.
The winner is the first player to get rid of all of their cards.

name: Quizduell Mini
description:
The most popular quiz app in Germany can now be experienced as a board game! Now in a little box with 600 new questions. May be played with its bigger brother Quizduell: Das Spiel or as a stand-alone game.

Choose category and start the duel by drawing cards, reading questions and its 4 variants. Who chooses the correct answer during the 20 seconds earns a point after each qurestion and so on. After 6 laps the game ends and the player with the most points is the winner.

name: Dinner for One
description:
"Same procedure as last year, Miss Sophie?"
"Same procedure as every year, James!"

Well, not quite. Miss Sophie is once again celebrating her 90th birthday with her deceased friends, but in the party game Der 90. Geburtstag oder Dinner for One based on the cult sketch of the same name, the players take turns playing the role of the butler James and reenacting the scenes: Saying toasts to the birthday child, hitting the heels, and serving food and drink — including, of course, jumping over the tiger's head, along with an increasing physical handicap through cardboard bottles clamped in the crooks of the arm or between the thighs because the increasingly drunk state of James cannot be missing in this party game.

The scenes are revealed as cards in a random order. As the game progresses, more and more cards are added, but the round always starts with the first card, followed by the second, and so on, so you should memorize the "script" in the game or else you will collect penalty chips.

In the end, whoever has the fewest Schwips-Chips wins. "Skol!"

—description from the publisher

name: HUNT: The Deckbuilding Game
description:
From the creator of Tournament Fishing, HUNT: The Deckbuilding Game brings the wild back to your table for another fantastically designed game of memory, skill, and timing based on the core system of the first game.

This time around, you will be heading out alone in a solitaire adventure, facing off against a reigning champion Hunter named Gary. You each will have 13 days to HUNT and bring back as many animals as you can. Do you have what it takes to unseat the current World Champion?

HUNT is a solo card game that combines familiar elements of deckbuilding along with hand-management. It features multi-use cards that can be used in 3 different ways. The theme is integrated into the game in a very realistic way and hunters will appreciate that and non-hunters will learn a thing or two about the sport all while appreciating the cohesive mechanics.

Gary is controlled by an AI deck and presents a very consistent and challenging experience every game. There is an element of memory to the game but many ways for the player to make choices to limit that by the cards they buy and in the starting deck itself. Those already familiar with Tournament Fishing will enjoy the familiar mechanics and find something new and unique as well. For those that have not, HUNT is also a great starting point to see if you like the system.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: Allo... la France: Le Grand Jeu du Tėlėphone
description:
The aim of the game is to guess first, the phone number of an opponent.

Each player is given a hometown, a name and a profession, all these data provide a phone number specific to each. A phone card with a maximum of 10 units is given to each player.

The board represents the "l'Hexagone" (France) with mayor cities of France and connections between them.

In his turn player draws a event-card indicating the displacement value, whether or not the wiring between vile and authorization or not to call an opponent (... and a possible additional event). After moving in the direction of his choice, the player may (if authorized) to connect to a city hotline of competitor.

To join an opponent, you have to pay as many units as channels of communication between the two cities. When communication is established, the player asks his opponent more information (a name, profession etc. and the answer can be yes or no.
These will reveal clues leading to the knowledge of the phone number.
When a player thinks he knows the number, he joined the owner and ask him if he has such a number, if so, the player wins.

name: Coffee Shop
description:
In the game Coffee Shop, the players have opened coffee shops right next to each other in the financial district and are competing to serve the same market.

Players draft ingredient cards and then customer cards. Each round ends with a trading phase where players can trade money and ingredient cards with each other.

Each of the drafts also has an auction element. While the active player chooses which ingredient they want from a face-up pool, the other players may bid higher and take it in an open turnless auction.

The customer draft works similarly, but with decreasing prices as the coffee shops lower their prices to attract the customers.

The game ends once a player has reached 10 or more points of customers. Additional points can be earned by specializing in certain drinks, as well as cash on hand. The player with the most points wins.

—user summary

name: Footy!
description:
FOOTY! is a table-top simulation of the game of Australian Rules Football.

FOOTY! includes all the charts and tables needed to play the game, as well as a sample scoresheet. The game is being re-published by Hot Stove Games under license from Valgames, and will be initially available in electronic format.

Players roll the dice on the Play Chart to determine what type of play is happening on the field. Additional rolls are then necessary to test player skills, team strength, or other ratings in play. Goals and behinds are scored by rolling the dice against the chosen player's scoring ratings.

All seasons from 1993 to 2004 will be available for owners of the game to purchase. Additional seasons will be made available as data becomes available for them.

name: GOBi: Destination Desert
description:
Welcome to the desert! Before crossing the desert, camels are gathered in the oasis corrals to form caravans.

In the beginner game you have to lay out a caravan with at least four camels carrying the same load. The cards are played face down and named, but you can bluff. To take a pile you have to play a “Bet” card that shows the exact number of camels that are in the pile. If it is correct, you take the stack and can place into your personal Caravan, observing the maximum number of 5 camels in a caravan. When you own 3 of the same color you win the game!

The advanced game uses 9 Tactic cards, which you either play face down in the stack as a bluff or face up to use the special feature. These cards allow you to build elaborated strategies to gain camels, and gives a truly tactical dimension to the game.

From the back of the box:
Count the camels that pass and bet: the caravan loaded with treasures from the East is yours! This game of 55 cards mixes bluffing and memory. It's simple, fast and fun. Gobi Basic will appeal to the whole family, but it's Gobi Tactics that friends will love!

Contents:
35 Camel cards - carrying goods in 5 colors: white rice, green tea, blue jade, yellow gold, and red silk
11 Bet cards marked with a number: 3, 4, and 5 or +
9 Tactic cards: 4 spies, 3 brigands, 1 merchant and 1 sandstorm

name: Art Shark
description:
Art Shark by Birdcage Press:

You need to be tricky as you bid for artwork, trying to make a fortune. You switch real artworks for fakes, fooling others into believing which is which. Outbid the other players at auction for the real ones, and make them bid higher on the fakes...

... and while playing, learn about 64 real art masterpieces!

In this set, there are 64 art cards, 54 chance cards, 2 dice. Ages 7 to adult.

name: Junior Alpha Animals
description: Players start on the letter A space and roll a colored die to determine if they pick a card. If they don't pick a card, they have to name an animal starting with the letter A. They advance to B and repeat the process until either they roll the color yellow, can't name an animal or land on an alpha card box. An advanced version gives each of the six colors on the die a different question that the players must answer.
publishers: Great American Puzzle Factory, Green Board Game Co.

name: Alemannen-Skat
description:
In Alemannen-Skat, played with a 7 through ace from a standard deck of cards, the two players simultaneously each select a card from their hand, then reveal it; then they do that again. Next, the highest card "grabs" the second-highest card, and the lowest card "grabs" the second-lowest card. The players now place their winnings on one of three fields they have, color-coded like a traffic light:


green: the value of the cards on it are multiplied by +2
yellow: the value of the cards on it are multiplied by +1
red: the value of the cards on it are multiplied by -1


The cards and suits all have specific relative values, so every card can be ranked uniquely, and some card score more than others. Additionally, the positive discard fields have a limit of how many of the 32 cards in the deck they can receive.

Published in spielbox Number 4 of 2007.

name: Who Gets the Cheese?
description:
Feeling particularly confident in his speed one day, a mouse brought a challenge to his unlikely friend, a kitty. The mouse would attempt to capture as many pieces of the cheese placed throughout the house as he could without being caught. However, if the kitty manages to catch him, he'll have to give up one of his six shiny trinkets for the kitty to wear. Let the competition begin!

Game Play:
Play starts with the first player turning over the top card of his face-down Draw Pile and placing the card face up in the center of the table. This card starts the Play Pile for the game. The type of card that is played will determine the sequence of actions that takes place next. As soon as all 6 Kitty Pawns are awarded, the game ends. Each player then counts up his or her combined cards and Kitty Pawns. The player with the most combined cards and Kitty Pawns is the winner!

name: Camp Travel Edition
description:
From the publisher's website:
"The Award winning CAMP Travel Edition is very compact and mobile, with a unique wood design. Up to 4 multi-level players, and has fun "setback" and "move forward" features. All new outdoor trivia cards, with vibrant full color images, includes content highlighting all 50 states. Game includes: 50 question cards, 4 game pieces, 4 level cards, decoder, and spinner.

Camp is a game where both children & adults can play & learn fun facts about the great outdoors. The game is designed to grow with the player, starting at level one questions, which are primarily identification of animals. As the players increase in their knowledge about the outdoors, they grow into the higher level questions. A fun & educational game where parents & children can play against each other to get to Camp first. Game includes: 1 game board, 199 game cards(400 questions, and 99 fun facts), 1 decoder, 8 game characters, 1 die, 16 level cards, and 1 compass card."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Manga Party
description:
Manga Party comes with two copies of 26 cards (one with red back, one with beige) that each feature a scene drawn manga-style; it's up to the players to bring the party!

To set up the game, the 26 beige cards are laid face-up on the table. Three red-backed "mime" cards are shuffled with the 26 red-backed scene cards to form a deck.

On a turn, the active player draws the top card from the deck, then acts out a scene, complete with whatever thoughts, cries, declarations, etc. best fit the word bubble or thought bubble on the card. The other players race to identify which beige card matches the scene being acted out. Each player can choose only one card, and no card can be chosen more than once. If the correct card is chosen, the guesser scores the beige card and the actor keeps the red card; otherwise both scene cards are removed from the game and the actor takes the "Malus" card (whether from the table or another player).

If a player draws a Mime card, he discards it, draws the next card, and acts out the scene but without any dialogue or sounds.

The game ends when either two beige cards remain on the table or after the third Mime card has been resolved. Players scores one point per card collected, with the holder of the Malus card losing one point. The player with the most points wins.

name: Hipp hipp hurra!
description: Twelve chair tiles and twelve guest tiles are placed face-down on the table. On her turn, a player selects one chair tile and one guest tile. If they match, the player scores one point. Otherwise they are returned face-down to the table. When all of the guests are seated, the player who scored the most points wins.

name: Das Haus Anubis: Pfad der 7 Sünden
description:
House of Anubis: Path of Seven Sins

While the Anubis friends are searching for Nina, they are lost in a mysterious phantasy world.A An enchanted path meanders through this world, the path of seven sins. The Anubis frinds are following this path to eventually find Nina. But dangers lurk everywhere!
The players need to pass several tests in order to resist the sins.

name: 100 Astronauts
description: "100 Astronauts" is a multiplayer colony building card game set in the deep reaches of space on planet T2853. In the game, you play a highly respected commander that has been sent on a mission to colonize planet T2853. Other highly ranked commanders will try to stop you as your goals & intentions on planet T2853 cross paths. Each game takes around 20-30 minutes and is guaranteed to leave you wanting to play more and more.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Economic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Market, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Ownership, Trading

name: I.Q.: The Logic Puzzle Game – Train Your Brain! Give Your I.Q. Some Exercise
description:
In this pack are over 100 of the best brain-baffling, I.Q. testing, mind-stretching puzzles ever invented. They will amuse you, torment you, tease you and test you (and your friends). You can play I.Q. as a game with friends, in teams, or just browse for your own amusement. Every puzzle is rated for difficulty - the rating determines your score if you solve it. Answer before the timer runs out and you may get a bonus puzzle! Solve the extra brain-beater bonus puzzle and get more points!

—description from the publisher

name: Guess in 10: Countries of The World
description: Ask up to 10 questions to guess the country on the Game Card! Is it an island? Is this country in South America? Do people pay with euros in this country? Think hard, ask intelligent questions, use your clue cards wisely, and the be the first player to win 7 Game Cards!
publishers: GaGa Games, Grasper Global Private Ltd (Skillmatics), Lúdilo

name: Zenith
description:
Players take turns placing triangular-shaped pieces of their own color on the remaining empty spaces on the board, or else stacking one piece on top of three supporting pieces.

Pieces can only be stacked if one of the three supporting pieces is of that player's color.

The last player able to place a piece wins.

Includes 116 solid wood triangular playing pieces, and two double-sided game boards featuring differently shaped playing areas. The different playing boards are named, "Krakatoa", "Pike's Peak", "Twin Peaks", and "Mount Fuji".

name: Swip'Sheep
description: Each player receives 3 cards. The rest are put to one side. Each player secretly gives one of their cards to the player on their left, and another to the player on their right. When all the players have 3 cards in their hand again, the first player says: "Are there any wolves around this evening?". All the players with a "wolf" card in their hand place it down in front of them. Each "wolf" card equals one attack. Any player with more than one "wolf" card, can attack the same player or different players. Working clockwise, any players who have placed down a "wolf" card now have to attack another player! To attack, the player has to put the "wolf" card in front of another player. If the player being attacked does have a "dog" card, they defend themselves and turn the attack against the wolf, otherwise the wolf attacks, and steals a card from the player's hand at random. The thieves keep the stolen cards in their hand. The used "wolf" and "dog" cards are put to one side. When all of the wolf attacks are over, each player reveals the cards they still have in their hand. The players keep their "sheep" cards to one side. These will ear them points at the end of the game. All the "wolf" and "dog" cards are put back into the deck of remaining cards and a new round begins. When all the rounds have been played, each player counts the number of sheep on their cards.

name: Ufo Attacks
description:
Your story - your rules!

Area 51. Im Jahr 1956 wird die verlassene Basis plötzlich wiederbelebt. Zwischenfälle mit abgestürzten „Heißluftballons“, Gerüchte von Ufosichtungen und paranormale Phänomene häufen sich schlagartig in den folgenden Monaten in diesem Gebiet. Allerlei Spekulationen und wilde Gerüchte kursieren. Doch eigentlich ist eines allen irgendwie klar: Die Aliens sind gelandet. Nur wer sind sie, und wem kannst du trauen?

Area 51. In 1956 the abandoned base all of a sudden came back to life again. In the following months, more and more rumours arise of crashed hot-air balloons, ufo sightings and paranormal phenomenons. Speculations and wild reports circulate. But everyone agrees on one thing: The aliens have landed. But who are they, and whom can you trust? Make your own story and see for yourself what happens.

Ufo Attacks is a narrative card game in the Mini Story series by Noris Spiele. Cards determine their role, their relations to each other and their secret goals. A game last over five rounds, after which the winner(s) are identified as related to their goals.
mechanics: Hand Management, Role Playing, Storytelling, Trading

name: Trivial Pursuit: 1994/1995 Edition
description: This edition of the Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition Year in Review Series captures the highlights of the years 1994 and 1995, and it lets you play your favorite trivia game in a whole new format. The game consists of cards with 1500 questions, a color-coded die to decide categories, and six scoring tokens with enough wedges for six players or teams. The special book-style slip case makes it a perfect addition to your book or game shelf.

name: Maiwand
description:
Two player game on the battle of the same title, a well-known British defeat occurring during the Second Afghan War. Components: Four page rulebook, 11x17" map, one sheet of 3/4" counters and 2 player aid cards. As it is a desktop publishing game, the counters must be assembled before play.

Units are normally 100 men or 2-6 guns. Each hex is 150 yards and each game turn is 30 minutes.

Sequence of play is (1) Afghan reinforcements, (2) Afghans move, (3) British fire, (4) Afghans melee, (5) British move, (6) Afghans fire, (7) British melee. Fire combat is done by rolling to hit, with struck units being eliminated. Melee is done by odds ratio with the only outcomes being Attacker eliminated, Defender eliminated or an exchange.

If the Afghans can eliminate the British baggage train before 16 turns pass, they win. Any other result and they lose.

First published in 2005 by Kyber Pass Games it is republished by Whitedog games with new counters, a variant scenario and an historical article on the battle by Tom Cundiff.

2nd edition features:
* Two-Person or Solitaire Play
* Sixteen-Page Rules Manual
* Rules Include a New Variant Scenario
* An Original Historical Article on the Battle by Tom Cundiff
* 22 x 15 Hex Game Map in Full Color by Map Artist Richard Dengel
* Map Comes in Two Printer Format Options: Two Letter-Sized (8.5" x 11") Sheets and Four Letter-Sized Sheets with One-Half Inch Margins
* 130 Beautiful Playing Pieces by Counter Artist Tom Cundiff
* Map, Counters, Charts and Rules Available in PDF Format
publishers: Khyber Pass Games, White Dog Games

name: Zig Zag
description:
Each player has a set of 13 tiles - each tile is formed of 1 to 4 hexagons (5 single, 4 double, 3 triple and 1 quadruple piece).

The board has 8 areas, ranging in size from 3 hexes to 10 hexes large.

Player alternate turns by placing one of their pieces on the board. When you place the last piece necessary to fill in an area of the board, you get a number of points equal to the size of the filled area.

Play finishes when no tiles can be placed anymore. Player with the highest total wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Enclosure, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement
publishers: Alga, Estrela, John Sands Pty Ltd, MB Jeux, MB spel, MB Spellen, MB Spiele, MB spil (Danish), Milton Bradley, Regev Games

name: Hannibal
description:
Hannibal from Rusiecki is a strategic Roman game and is the first game where land combat occurs in same hex and uses fluid movement/combat system.Board mounted on foam core.

This game is played in turns of one year each. Starting in 218 B.C.,a time marker piece is moved down the Time Records one space after the completion of each FULL turn. The game ends in the 202 B.C. turn.

Components:
1 Map
42 Carthaginians red round counters + 2 red markers
42 Roman white round counters + 2 white markers
1 die
1 Box made of white bristol board

A second edition was published in 1972 and a third in 1973.

name: Terra Galactix
description:
From the publisher's web site :

They have landed
2 Games in one box

INVASION
Coming from a distant Universe, you are counting on getting hold of this little blue planet called « earth ». Prepare a group strategy to weaken earth's defenses in order to invade the planet by squadrons.

GALACTIC WAR
From time to time, some stars produce a coveted substance called : GALACTIX. Travel the constellations of our universe in search for this substance. Attack the other Flying Saucers and steal their cargo. From your Mother Ship, you control your two Saucers and watch over the universe.

Contents
15 Galactix - 4 Dice of 3 colors
1 BoardGame - 2 Game Rules
98 Original Cards
8 Saucers - 8 Stickers
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dish It Up!
description: Each player receives "guest checks" that indicate the four items (chef and three different type of food) a guest at their Good Eats Diner has ordered. Shuffle and place 40 meal tiles (8 cooks, 8 main dishes, 8 beverages, 8 side orders or desserts, 4 cranky customers, 2 Mikeys, and 2 Mitts) face down. On each turn, players can turn over two tiles for all to see. If any of the tiles match what is on one of their guest checks, then keep the tiles and place them on the check. If you match both tiles, the player may turn over two more. Once a menu on the check is completed, then the player receives a dollar tip. The game ends when a dollar figure of tips is obtained, which depends on the number of players in the game.

name: Due Secoli di Guerre
description:
In 1982 two Italian journalists and historians, Indro Montanelli and Mario Cervi, published a 10-volumes encyclopedia about the history of the modern wars: from American Revolution to latest conflicts (Korea and Vietnam). The name of the work has been Due Secoli di Guerre: “Two Centuries of Wars”

Emilio Ceretti, chief of the Editrice Giochi, asked to Alex Randolph to invent a boardgame inspired to the encyclopedia.

Being impossible to simulate battles in a period of time from gunpowder to jet fighters, the result is a sort of an abstract wargame which tries to contain some fixed elements of war: strength vs. mobility, random factor, and bluff.

The game components are:
-a board with an irregular tessellation
-60 grey pieces with 3 holes each
-120 flags, 30 for every color (red, green, yellow, blue)
-the “bluffing bell”

Every player gets 30 flags of his color, and places them on 15 grey pieces. A piece with 3 flags has strength 3 and can move one space. A piece with 2 flags has strength 2 and can move up to two spaces… and I think the readers can guess the features of a piece with one flag on it…

Every player enters his units in the map from one side, and tries to win being the first to reach the opposite side with one of his units.

The combat system is quite original, and uses the “bluffing bell”. This is a little device similar to an hand-bell, containing two little 6-sided dices. Shaking the device makes the dices roll, and pressing the device on the table causes the dices to be blocked on their result. After the pressing of the “bell”, the player who is using it can pull it up and see the result, without showing it to other players. The player can repeat the shaking a number of times equal to the number of his flags involved in the combat, until he is satisfied (or wants to feign to be satisfied) by the result: at this point he can declare a result (obviously he can declare a number different from the real one!)
The opponent can now accept the declared result, and then try to get and declare an higher number; elsewhere he can try to see the bluff…

Entering the central red square allows the player to aim an “artillery shot” to an enemy unit.

According to Alex Randolph’s ludography compiled by Philippe Evrard, “Due Secoli di Guerre” has been published only in Italy by Editrice Giochi, and there is no report about editions in other countries.

name: Trivial Detective
description:
From the back of the box:

Hey, listen up! If you like trivia games and you like detective games, then Trivial Detective is for you. The questions in this game are harder than the questions in most trivia games, but in this game you can travel around the board picking up clues to help you figure out the answers.

Many of the clues are also in the form of trivia questions, so the more trivia you know, the easier it will be for you to interpret the clues and win the game. You'll find clues at twelve locations around the board including the library, city hall, movie theater, sports arena, radio & TV station, art museum, museum of natural science, and the geographical & historical society.

Includes: 6 sided die, 6 pawns, game board, game cards, quiz booklet, checklist pad, and clue and answer booklet.

name: Drumlin
description:
Drumlin is an abstract strategy game that is set in the Ice Age. The background of the story is that a magical stone, the Drumlin, has thawed out from the glaciers. Upon touching the stone, elephants turn into dragons and this fills the animals with fear. Two rival elephantine tribes, each controlled by a player, decide to dump the stone onto their rival's territory and make it their concern instead.

The players are free to move their pieces around on the board, even into squares with their own pieces or opponent's. They take control of the Drumlin when their piece moves onto it. In a square with several pieces, the player with a majority of pieces takes control. The player in control can then pass the Drumlin to another square, depending on the formation of his or her pieces. The passing elephant then turns into a dragon, which cannot pass or catch the Drumlin.

The first player to pass the Drumlin onto his or her opponent's edge of the board wins the game.

name: Monopoly: Alaska
description: In yet another version of Monopoly, Alaska has players buying and trading property and natural assets of the 49th state.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Fish Card Game
description: This game uses a special 36 card deck composed of different types of fish. The dealer deals out either 6 or 5 cards to each player (depending on how many are playing). Remaining cards are fanned out in the center of the table to form a pond. Play is similar to Go Fish, but since there are fewer cards the game tends to end quickly.

name: La Libération de Paris
description:
La Libération de Paris is a solitaire wargame on the liberation of Paris in August 1944. The players control the resistance (FFI), the French second armored division and the US 4th infantry division. The system controls the German units.

Published in Casus Belli #82.

name: Globalny konflikt
description: Risk clone with a solid, pretty board and cardboard tokens for armies. The board's changed a bit and the rules for conflict resolution are original.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Dr. Seuss Super Stretchy A-B-C Game
description:
The twisty-turny game of super stretchy alphabet fun!

Get ready to twist, turn and s-t-r-e-t-c-h! Can you put your hand on the letter E—while placing your foot on the letter K—AND still put your ear on the letter Q? You’ve got to be super-stretchy to meet the challenge!

In this silly game of physical challenges and alphabet fun, kids spin the Thing 1 and Thing 2 Tornado Tube to deal out letter-to-body-part challenges. Then it’s time to get down on the colorful, oversized Dr. Seuss alphabet mat and stretch and turn and twist to put your body and brain to the test!

Game Components:
•Oversized Super Stretchy Game Mat
•Game Board and Thing 1 and
Thing 2 Tornado Tube
•34 Letter tiles
•4 Toy boxes
•15 Word cards

name: Underworld Battle
description:
