Set in the Chaotic universe and packed with 25 miniatures and 3D components, Underworld Battle has the players taking the role of OverWorld heroes fighting monsters as they advancing through the UnderWorld City Battle Arena. The game ends in a climatic battle against Chaor, the Underworld's ruler.

Player order is randomized at the start of each turn by shaking Chaor's Staff of Chaos, which contains four different coloured balls that correspond to the player's miniatures. Players have three action points per turn to move or attack in any combination. After all the players move, the denizens of the Underworld City act, and may attack the players.

Players gain points for collecting treasure, battle gear and defeating monsters, with the one to defeat Chaor receiving a substantial bonus. The player with the most points after Chaor is defeated is the winner.

This is a rebadged and re-implemented version of Waddington Games Dark World fantasy game.

name: Skee Ball
description:
An action game for 1 or more players.
Let the ball to roll out of the slot and into the shooter. Then aim and pull back and shooter and release it. The ball will shoot up to the target area at the top of the game enter one of the holes and roll down into the proper scoring column.The positions of the balls in these columns indicates the score.
Repeat until all balls are played.
When the turns are completed add the first number showing above the balls in each column beginning at the left and adding all six of the columns.

name: Chasse aux Marsupilamis!
description:
Game play in Chasse aux Marsupilamis! resembles that of Pounce / Spitz paß auf! in that one player tries to capture one or more animals while everyone else yanks his animal off the table to keep it safe. The animal in question this game is Franquin's marsupilami – the spotted leopardy dog with the incredibly lengthy tail. Each player has his own marsupilami, with the tail being a piece of string.

On a turn, the active player rolls three dice – white, black and yellow – and depending on the roll of the white die, players consult the black or yellow die (or possibly still the white) to see what they have to do. In some cases the active player tries to slam a cage on the marsupilamis, taking a food token from the owner of each animal he captures; in other cases the goal is the same, but the active player must pay everyone he doesn't capture. Sometimes the active player can fake a capture, taking food from anyone who feverishly yanks his marsupilami out of range.

Players start the game with a number of food tokens, and the game ends as soon as one (or more) players has 15 tokens or 0 tokens. In either case, the player with the most tokens wins!
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor

name: QBQ
description:
Players in QBQ start with four cubes of their color in one corner of the game board, and to win they must move across the board, which is a 6x6 grid, to create in the opposite corner a square of four cubes, a cube of eight cubes, or a square of nine cubes. All other pieces owned by that player must be out of play. On a turn, a player takes one of three possible actions:


Moving a cube already on the board to a space orthogonally adjacent to the pieces it was taking previously (so the shape "oozes" across the board); you can choose to place the cube on top of another cube of your color.
Tilting a stack of cubes of your color to make them spill across the board. If you land on an opponent's stack that was shorter than your stack, then the opponent's pieces are removed from play.
Adding a cube from your stock to an existing stack of yours, whether on the lowest level or above.


Who will reach the other side first?

name: Zombie Shuffle
description:
Zombie Shuffle is a game for 2 to 4 players that lasts about 5 to 10 minutes by Blaise Sewell and Feels Right Design. Just like in any zombie story the object of the game is to survive the zombie apocalypse. Before you begin, you set up the Zombie Cards in this nifty "Z" shape and pick your Survivor Card to represent you in the game.

Everyone is dealt 5 cards that are a random set of weapons, some of which offer a utility function, but ALL of them can be used to Attack Zombies and other Survivors.
Zombie Shuffle cycles between a Night Phase, where you must defeat incoming zombies, and a Day Phase that offers the opportunity to prepare for the next zombie attack. The game begins when the first zombie in the "Z" is flipped. Survivors must Attack the zombie with ANY 2 through 10 card corresponding with that zombie's suit.

The winner keeps the Zombie card to track their number of kills. If a player does not lay down a card corresponding with that zombie's suit then they are considered Attacked and either lose equipped armor or become a zombie!Before the next zombie card is flipped, Survivors can use the Zombie Cure, Equip Armor (which protects from Attacks), Steal another Survivor's Weapons/Supplies or may instead decide to Attack another Survivor.

Just like Attacking a Zombie, the Attack Card must correspond with the Survivor you're Attacking. If a Survivor is a Zombie and loses one of these battles then they are Dead for the remainder of the game. The other Survivor gets to keep their card, again to track their number of kills, and scavenge the dead player's cards.

The Day Phase ends when everyone has had a chance to play a Utility or Attack Card and everyone has drawn enough cards to have 5 cards in their hand again.

The winner is the Survivor with the most kills at the end of the game. This has been a quick rundown of the game play and there are a few more awesome quirks to Zombie Shuffle not listed above. (For example, each Survivor has a unique Melee Weapon that can give them a Power-Up when equipped.

name: Mister Mailman
description:
The mail must go through!
On foot, by bike or by taxi, travel the neighbourhood streets to be the first mail to deliver all your letters!

Roll the dice then play your cards! Use them the best way possible to deliver as many letters as you can on your turn!
Beware of locked doors and angry dogs! Grab a taxi (that's not cheating)! Go, Mailman!
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dragons' Eggs
description:
In Dragons' Eggs, players use their treasure cards to bid on egg cards, and whoever has the most eggs at the end of the game wins.

In more detail, each player starts with a hand of eleven numbered treasure cards and one ability card; the deck of egg cards is shuffled, then one card revealed. Each player plays one or two treasure cards from hand in turn, revealing one of the cards if they played two. Each player in turn draws an ability card, then plays or discards one ability card. They reveal and resolve these ability cards simultaneously, then see who wins the round and claims the egg card.

A player can pass on bidding in a round by discarding one of the egg cards they've previously collected.

name: Shopping Queen: Das Kartenspiel
description:
Trends sometimes change faster than you can move!

Which colors are recommended by Guido the trendsetter? What's the new rallying cry? In Shopping Queen: Das Kartenspiel, you're trying as quickly as possible to compile a matching five-piece outfit. But be careful! Taking unwanted fashion advice from other players can make you look pretty stupid...

name: UNO: Monster High
description:
The original game of UNO gets a spook-tastic Monster High twist!


Classic UNO rules apply, and the addition of a special rule and 4 extra cards gives players a chance to experience all new game changing moments!



When you play a Beast Ghoul Friends Card, you get to choose a color and then discard up to three frightful cards from your hand. Plus, pick another player who gets to discard one card of that color, too!



Fans of the series will recognize their favorite Monster High characters and scenes featured on the cards they play.



And do not forget to yell UNO when you only have one card left!



Includes 112 cards and instructions.


—description from the publisher

name: Die Schule der magischen Tiere: Licht aus!
description:
After the book series of the same name (Volume 3: Licht aus!).

Four magical animals are searching their friends, the children, in a school-building. But the school janitor guarding the school-corridor with his flashlight should not see the animals, otherwise he catches them.
Are the animals able to find their friends before the school janitor reaches the end of the floor?

It is a cooperative dicegame with tactical elements.

Rules:

First: Turn one of the eventcards, which are all side by side backside up on one side of the board, around and do as it says (some times its helpful for the players, sometimes for the janitor). Then lay it, again backside up, down on the other side of the plan.
(You have to draw during the game all the cards on one side of the board first, before starting again on the other side of the board.)
Second: Role the white dice. And then decide, if you want to role the blue dice also (in some exceptions you have to role the blue dice).
Dice results: colour: move the matching animal(s).
white: joker: move an animal of your choice
flashlight: one flashlight: the janitor moves
two flashlights (only possible withe
both dices): nothing will happen

If the janitor reaches a field on which an animal stands, it is caught. This animal can be freed (2 x same colour / joker or special eventcard).

As soon as a magical animal enters a doorway, you may look at the child behind it:
If child and animal are matching = with the next diced matching colour the animal moves onto the child/doorwaycard. If not = the animal will continue searching.

If all animals reaches their matching childs before the school janitor reaches the end of the floor, the players win the game.

—description from the designer

name: Rat Queens: To the Slaughter
description:
Forge friendships and find your family as you take on the role of the rat queens in Rat Queens: To the Slaughter. Choose from four rat queens, each with asymmetric and unique playstyles, in order to save Palisade from total destruction. Power up your queen with new abilities and friendship as you take on hordes of monsters. Each queen comes packed with upgradeable abilities you have to spend gold to learn, allowing you to customize your queen differently each game to fit what the party needs!

Players spend the first half of the game defeating monsters to earn rewards to upgrade their ability deck and stats in order to prepare for the Big Bad hiding in the wake. The more monsters you defeat, the more powerful you become and the more time you have before the Big Bad arrives, with that enemy being determined by which monsters escape. Combat is a simplified version of RPG-style combat with easy-to-learn dice checks for attacks and abilities.

From the first sip to the last drop. Sisters. Warriors. Queens. Friends to the very end.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Risiko!: Batman – La Caduta Di Gotham City
description:
RisiKo! The most loved strategy game in a special edition set in the DC world! As one of Gotham City's Super-Villains you will descend on the city to conquer it! Strategically strengthen your armies on the districts of the city under your control, attack the neighboring districts to expand your dominion. Try to reach your goal and defeat your opponents to remain the only ones left on the board and win!

In this game we find ourselves playing the opponents of the superhero. The title includes up to a maximum of four players, who can however choose from the most iconic villains of Gotham City: Bane, Joker, Catwoman, Mr. Freeze, The Riddler and Harley Quinn.

This is a first new element compared to the classic version of RisiKo! In fact, each villain will have a Criminal Plan to carry out, developed in different missions (such as taking control of specific territories or making certain results with the dice). Achieving a certain number of objectives will activate the character's special powers, giving the player various advantages during the rest of the game.

Clearly while the villains compete for the districts of Gotham City (following the traditional RisiKo! dice-rolling mechanic!) Our hero is not standing idle. When five 1's are rolled during a turn, Batman goes into action, clearing one or more territories on the board and wreaking havoc in the fight for control of the metropolis. Especially in the initial stages it will not be easy to watch, but it will always be a great emotion to swoop into our opponents. It will be less pleasant when it's our turn to face the Dark Knight, but that's part of the challenge too.

In addition to conquering all of Gotham, you can take home the game by completing one of three objectives, common to all participants. However, every time a criminal empire is definitively defeated, the player who accomplished the feat can choose to eliminate one of the conditions.


RisiKo! Il Gioco di strategia più amato in una edizione speciale ambientata nel mondo DC! Nei panni di uno dei Supercriminali di Gotham City scenderete in città per conquistarla! Rinforzate strategicamente le vostre armate sui distretti della città sotto il vostro controllo, attaccate i distretti confinanti per ampliare il vostro dominio. Cercate di raggiungere il vostro obiettivo e sconfiggete i vostri avversari per restare gli unici rimasti sulla plancia e vincere!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: My First Monopoly Game
description:
My First Monopoly Game offers fun teaching tools for families. It features a double-sided game board with 2 levels of play.

Each level uses its own set of Monopoly money and cards, as well as rules. based on the classic Monopoly rules. Players still want to have the most money at the end of the game to win.

name: Egg Slam!
description:
Egg Slam! is a color-mixing game in which players race to call out the colors of eggs laid by the rainbow birds.

The deck consists of cards that birds in red, yellow, or blue with a background color that doesn't match the bird as well as egg cards that feature a rainbow either in the center or on the background. Place three cards face up in separate piles, then split the deck equally among players.

Players take turns flipping a card from their deck onto a pile. When an egg card lands on a pile, you need to yell out the color you get when you combine the colors of the birds (or backgrounds) on the other two piles depending upon whether the rainbow is on the egg itself or on the background. Whoever calls out the correct color first wins the egg card, and once the decks are exhausted, whoever has collected the most eggs wins.

name: Suited
description:
This brilliantly clever card game features all four suits; clubs, hearts, diamonds and spades, but each one appears in four different colours and multiple times on each card. It's all about judging the probability that the next player will be able to fulfill a challenge you lay down for them, based on the suits and colours that appear on their cards. On your turn, you play TWO cards. The first has to meet the criteria of a challenge set for you by the previous player. The second sets the challenge for the next player. You'll want to force them to use their most powerful cards early in the game, but make sure you hang on to your own powerful cards and use them at the right time. Hold onto game-changing cards for too long and you could inadvertently blow everything! This outstanding game will confound your expectations and keep you on your toes!

—description from the publisher

name: Hink Pink
description:
For two minutes at a time, based on the clues given on each card, a team tries to find an appropriate rhyming pair of words with the proper number of syllables each (1, 2, or 3).

After the two minutes are up, the team receives points based on the number of syllables (1, 2, or 3) for each card. First team to 50 points wins!

Sample cards:
I have a Hink Pink for...
a French pancake for a gorilla or chimp
"Ape Crepe"

I have a Hinky Pinky for...
a fine rain or mist that sounds like fat frying in a pan
"Drizzle Sizzle"

I have a Hinkity Pinkity for...
a large, Australian jumping marsupial that is late
"Overdue Kangaroo"

name: Denkste!?
description: Think!? A tri-fold board with a long track has players rolling dice to move and stack pieces to the finish.

name: KISS on Tour Game
description:
The contents of the box are as follows:
1 Game Board
10 City Cards
15 Kiss Cards
5 Record Cards
5 Fan Cards
2 Dice
4 Player Pieces

The board is laid out as a large star, and players move their pawns out from the "record store" space, as they follow the band on "tour".

name: Heros Deï
description:
Heros Deï is a Collectible Card Game based on different mythologies. However unlike other CCG's, in Heros Deï no card is rare. Once a mythology pack is bought, no other card from this mythology will come out. Booster contents (ordinary cards that can be multiple in a competition deck) are known when buying.

As to this date (July 2005), 3 civilizations have come out:
- The Celts
- The Greeks
- The Vikings

Interactions between heroes, gods, monsters and objects are especially faithful to the original mythology, since this original game has received assistance from Britain's cultural department.

name: Zing!
description:
From the TLI Games website:

"Let the stories begin…..Zing! gives you a delicious set of words (with three difficulty levels). With those and a few of your own, you develop a sentence. You’ll score points for every Zing! word you use. Players take turns adding to your sentence until you have a story!

Can’t write? You’ll be surprised… Zing! brings you in and gets you creating, writing and laughing in a flash! Discover new ways of thinking.

And when the stories have been told (after a few twists and turns) the player with the most points wins!"

name: Monopoly: My Fantasy Drivers
description:
The world’s best selling board game and NASCAR’s top drivers team up and put you in charge. For the first time ever YOU decide the layout of the MONOPOLY® game board. With 30 removable and reusable driver labels to choose from, like Matt Kenseth, Jeff Gordon and Kurt Busch, there are over ONE BILLION possible driver lineups! Who gets Boardwalk? Which driver will you put on Park Place? It’s decision time and you get to choose!

Includes 30 removable and reusable driver labels and six custom tokens: headset, RV, war wagon, gasman, racecar and the checkered flag.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Basketball Bones
description:
Game clock winding down, tie game, road team brings the ball up the court with the home crowd shrieking "DEE-FENSE, DEE-FENSE!" as the visitors try to get the rock in the hands of their top scorer for a possible game-winning shot. But pro basketball is a player's game, and sometimes the play that the coach designs doesn't work, so here comes a 20-foot jumper from the least likely shooter on the court as the clock is about to reach triple zeroes. The shot is true, tickling the net as the home crowd groans!

Is this a scene from any given night in the pro game? Absolutely – and it's also a scene that can happen with the same frequency when you play Basketball Bones, PT Games' new tabletop simulation of pro basketball using four dice ("bones") and player cards for a remarkably compact, efficient game engine in which very few charts are consulted and almost every possession is resolved by the dice and cards. Rebounding beasts, three point specialists, needle-threading passers and ham-handed, foul-prone defenders are all here, ready to perform for you on your tabletop as if it was made of hardwood. From the league's MVP to the 12th man on the worst team in the league, Basketball Bones rates every pro player in shooting percentage, field goal attempt frequency, rebounding, passing and more. The Rare Play charts introduce intangibles such as momentum swings, injuries, boneheaded decisions, and more!

name: Town of Salem's The Savior of Salem
description:
The Savior of Salem is a simple, easy to learn, multiplayer RPG dungeon crawling card game in the Town of Salem world, similar to Munchkin.

Summary

Players draw a starting hand of cards to build up a mob. Cards give bonuses or mess with other players.
Each turn you try to fight monsters, that give rewards if defeated.
The first player to get 20 mobsters wins.

There are 185 cards total with 90 House Cards, 25 Identity Cards, and 70 Chests Cards.

How to Play

Starting the game with 3 to 6 players, each player draws their starting hand. These cards will allow you to grow your mobs strength, give yourself bonuses, and mess with the other players in the game.

Every turn, a player searches a house. If there is a Monster in that house, the player must fight it. With each Monster you defeat, you rescue towns members who join your Mob. You also get rewards. This can include Equipment for your Mob (like a Garlic Stained Blouses), Identities (like the Vigilante), and Action Cards(like a Bag of Gold).

Sometimes, you will stumble upon a Monster you cannot beat. You can ask the other players for help, in exchange for a reward.

Other players can also make Monsters you could defeat much harder or add more Monsters to the fight.

Some monsters are Legendary such as Pestilence, Horseman of the Apocalypse. These legendary monsters have unique mechanics. If you defeat a Horseman, you get their legendary item. If you cannot, you are cursed.

Players grow their Mob until they have 20 Mob Members. Whoever gets to 20 Mob Members first, wins the game and is the Hero of Salem!

Whether your goal is to backstab, lie, cheat or make friends on your way to victory, Town of Salem – The Savior of Salem makes it all possible.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Сибирь. Начало. (Siberia: The Beginning)
description:
Siberia. The Beginning is a game for 2-4 players who are interested in being in the role of the conqueror of Siberia in the 18th century. Explore new territories with your squad, find treasures, build churches and forts, establish settlements and fight enemies! Become a real ruler of the Siberian land!

Taking turns exposing from the starting field and mastering the tiles of the map of the lands of Siberia, the players move their meeples along it so that their location on the map objects meets the requirements of various tasks. At the end of each turn, the player must try to complete one or more tasks of his choice.
Each completed mission earns the player victory points.

The winner of the game is the one who scores the most points at the end of the game - and proves his right to rule the Siberian land.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Map Addition, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Tile Placement

name: Three Blind Dice
description: From the box: Three Blind Dice combines the excitement of a sharp shooting dice game with the thrill of a high stakes card game. Out smart other players in an attempt to keep your dice. Out bluff the same players into losing their dice. However beware! One wrong bid and you lose a die, lose all five and the game is over.

name: Mouse Acrobat
description:
One of Haba's Mini-Spiels that come in a small tin (similar to an Altoids tin) and contain small wooden pieces.

The tin lid is placed on the ball (can be done in two ways - one making the game more challenging than the other). Place the mouse in the center of the lid. Each player gets 6 wedges of cheese. Players take turns pushing a cheese wedge onto the lid. It must be completely on the lid and no wedge can be placed on top of another. If you cause any wedges to fall off, you must take them. If the lid slips off the ball, you must take all the pieces that had been on the lid, reset the tin lid with mouse and then push a wedge on. Whoever is left without cheese first wins.

name: Destinations Secrètes
description: This game is about traveling the world by visiting some of the 80 interesting sites. Each player receives secret missions (destinations to reach) but has to find them by resolving enigmas. There may occur lucky or unhappy events, unplanned voyages... a passioned race across the whole world.

name: Poker Squares
description:
Summary: Place 25 cards sequentially in a 5-by-5 grid with an object to score the highest Poker combinations in each row and column.

Equipment:

a shuffled standard (French) 52-card deck
a pen and Poker Squares grid for each player


Rules: Each turn, a card is drawn from the deck and announced. Each player must then privately write the card rank and suit (e.g. “10C” for 10 of Clubs, “AH” for Ace of Hearts) in any empty cell of their 5-by-5 grid. Once written in the grid, cards may not be moved. After all players have written the card, the next turn begins. When player grids are full after 25 cards, grids are scored.

Scoring: The 5-card hand of each grid row and column is scored according to a point system.





Poker Squares Hand Scoring Systems


Poker Hand
American Points
English Points



Royal Flush
100
30



Straight Flush
75
30



Four of a Kind
50
16



Full House
25
10



Flush
20
5



Straight
15
12



Three of a Kind
10
6



Two Pair
5
2



One Pair
2
1



High Card
0
0




A player's total score is the sum of the hand scores for each of the 10 row and column hands.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Neues aus dem Wichtelwald
description:
This is an expansion to the game Der Herr Der Wichtel. It adds more Leprechauns and other creature types that can stand in for Leprechauns.

This Expansion also adds a lot of new events that takes the language barrier to a daunting level. The German on the original game was very manageable.

Expands:

Der Herr der Wichtel
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Canopéa
description:
Canopea is a cooperative game that cleverly combines dexterity, memory and strategical thinking. Within the same game, each player can adapt the difficulty according to their age, so the entire family can take part in the adventure. Board together your puck aircraft and fly towards 3D Tree Cities to recover birds in need of protection from poachers.

A game of Canopea consists of 5 trips to bring as many birds as possible to safety before they are captured by poachers. You begin each trip with a new mission that targets a species of bird to recover. You then must navigate between the 6 Tree Cities to find endangered birds.

When it is your turn, you have three chances to move the puck aircraft, hit a Tree City and make as many piled up Bird tokens fall from the city. Recover all tokens that match your mission but if you cannot find any, then poachers attack and can damage the aircraft or steal your birds. Whenever you want to, head back to Canopea to definitively bring all recovered birds to safety. Then, start a new trip with a new mission.

Throughout the game, the aircraft and the Tree Cities will move on the table and will not come back to their initial position. Distances between cities will grow, increasing the difficulty of moves and missions.

Canopea is an entirely intergenerational game and its varied mechanical elements allow all players to capitalise on their strengths: memory for the youngest, dexterity for teenagers, strategical thinking for adults. What is more, it is possible to adapt the difficulty to each adventurer within the same game: adults can increase the challenge by only using one or two moves per turn while younger children (from age 4) can simply move the Aircraft without the propeller.

name: Master of Music
description:
A traditional trivia game. You roll the dice and answer one of the 2.400 questions. You have to answer questions from all of the eight categories to win.

The Categories are:


Oldies But Goodies



80's



90's



Fresh (Hits after 2000)



Happy hour (Two artists are mentioned, you have to name the two both have published)



On-Stage (About the music industry in general)



Off-Stage (Gossip)



Song (A text line from a song is given, and you have tell what song it is.)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Damm / Egmont, NoDiceBoardGames Ltd., Nordisk Film

name: Monopoly: Firefly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Firefly.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sky Magic
description:
A powerful storm is brewing, so help the five enchanted friends get home before they run out of magic spells!

In Sky Magic, kids work as a team to navigate around storm clouds and avoid falling through the sky when the board shifts. Plan carefully, and use your magic wisely as the game continuously shifts! Kids learn strategy, co-operation, and communication.

—description from the publisher

name: Totally Awesome
description:
From the publisher:

Do you know which race car driver got his start as the national go-cart championship when he was eight? Or what chewy treat was originally called Blibber-Blubber? This game is full of the amazing accomplishments of athletes, scientists and even regular kids just like you! You'll even be called on to perform some fantastic feats yourself. Can you shimmy like a belly dancer? Hop on one foot? As you answer the questions, you'll race up a mountain. The unique magnetic game board gives this game its extreme edge. It's a confidence-building, fact-finding expedition! (The answers: Jeff Gordon and bubble gum!)

Contents:

4 magnetic playing pieces
20 plastic flags
Magnetic game board
110 fantastic feat cards, 110 totally awesome cards
Instructions
mechanics: Acting, Memory, Point to Point Movement

name: UNO: Superman Returns
description:
Based on the Superman Returns movie.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The Special Kryptonite Card. When the Kryptonite card is played each of the other players, in turn, must play a green or a wild card from their hand. The Kryptonite card may also be used as a wild card.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pile It
description:
from the website

Pile it™ Card Game
A high speed flipping & sorting game

Less than 4 minutes per game

On your mark, get set...
PILE it on! Players use quick eyes and nimble fingers in a revved-up race to see who can flip and sort their cards the fastest – by color, by number, and then by picture. Packed full of speed, concentration, and competition, Pile it is full throttle fun for the entire family!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pandemain: I'm going to stay in Nördlingen
description:
Get ingredients by rolling the dice and marking them on the board. After 20 turns check the recipes you have complete and record the score. Try to beat your score from game to game or play against others.

Free Print&Play.

It’s fun and easy to play, you just need a couple of dice to complete those delicious bread recipes that will give you the required score to reach victory.

—description from the designer

name: Vikings Risk: The Conquest of Europe
description:
LET THE VIKING AGE BEGIN! The continent of Europe has faced many battles in the past, but none as brutal as what is about to become a 250-year conquest. Ragnar Lothbrok, disenchanted with his chieftain's progress, decides to cross the oceans by boat and discover new, richer civilisations. Now it's your turn to engage in combat and seek to conquer this new world alongside him. Play as one of five fully customised Viking tribes, including uniquely influential Viking longship game pieces, as you try to invade and capture the nine regions of Europe. With special Cards of the Gods to help boost your forces or ruin your plans, and special Raid cards to capture strategic strongholds and gain new warriors, this edition of Risk is an epic battle for control of Europe... and its vast riches. See you in Valhalla!

—from publisher's website

name: Von Falkenstein
description:
A dreadful knight is pursuing innocent people! They must remember the best route to safety in order to escape the knight and defend the castle. To begin, the players decide which story they would like to play: "Ambush at Münzenberg Castle" or "Revenge of the Rockenberger Robber Barons". The rules of the game remain the same. However, there is a special rule that makes the game a little more difficult for the Rockenberg story.

Like Celtic, Von Falkenstein is a game set in the German region Wetterau, where Pegasus Spiele is located. It tells stories from two nearby cities, Münzenberg and Rockenberg.

—description from the publisher

name: Countaloupe
description:
Your goal in Countaloupe is to rid yourself of slice cards as quickly as possible, and whoever clears their plate first wins.

Each player starts with slices numbered 1-16. On a turn, you roll 3-5 dice (depending on your current top slice) and the chance die. After your roll, if any single die or the sum of any number of dice matches your top slice, you remove it; keep removing slices as long as the numbers add up. If, for example, you rolled 1, 2, 5 at the start of the game, you could remove the 1, 2 & 3 slices.

You now either end your turn or roll again. If you roll again and fail to remove a slice, you must place slice cards back on your deck as a penalty.

The chance die may give you the opportunity to swap decks with another player — or force you to swap with whoever has the largest deck! Alternatively, you might gain the Nope! token and use it to block a deck, whether to keep an opponent from removing cards from it or to protect your deck from being stolen.

Countalope can also be played as a multi-round game, with players scoring 1 point per card removed, with a game ending when someone has 16 points. Whoever reaches 100 points first wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Stardust
description:
Stardust is a card game for two or more players who are scriptwriters competing to make as many movies as possible.

To create a movie, a player has to put together a series of cards: a "Location," a "He," a "She," a "Plot," and a "The End." The last card of the set, however, can always be grabbed by an opponent using an attack card, if the player does not have a matching defense card. When a player's movie is complete, "flavor text" on each card forms a silly plotline.

The first player to complete three movies--or the player with the most movies when the cards run out--is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation

name: Judge Your Friends
description:
Find out what secrets your friends have been hiding in Judge Your Friends! Learn things about your friends you wish you hadn’t in this outrageous, fast-paced party game.
Each round, players take on the role of Judge and Defendant. One player is the Judge and reads a scenario card aloud to the group. The other players, or Defendants, enter their plea of whether they are guilty or not guilty of that scenario (The Defendant has taken a nap at work – you know you’re guilty!).
Then, one by one, the Judge gives their ruling while banging that golden gavel – yes, it’s a golden gavel. For every correct ruling, the Judge earns $100 in cold hard cash. Play continues for multiple rounds with players pleading guilty or not guilty, other players calling friends out for lying about their pleas, and Judges raking in the dough. At the end of the game, the player with the most cash is the winner.
Judge Your Friends is great for playing in person or on your next zoom game night with easy to learn game instructions and flexible content.

—description from the publisher

name: ZOKI
description: ZOKI is a unique set of 34 cards/tiles that can be used to play dozens of different games in the Zoki system. Most of these games are played by matching the four sides of the cards to adjacent cards, either to form a square or in domino-style fashion. These games can be played either solitaire or against opponents. Other games use the cards as part of mathematical logic games, where one must total the number of stripes on the cards. In addition, there are matching games, traditional card games with a twist, and much more.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Game System, Math, Memory, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Trick-taking
publishers: Eternity Games, Playroom Entertainment, ZOKI Games Division

name: Ronin: Duels
description:
Ronin is a customizable miniatures game of gigantic mechanized battle. In Ronin you design your own unique battle armor and equip it with heavy turbo rocket launchers, jump packs and assault cannons of your choice. Make tactical decisions on what energy-fluids to use and how to process them through your system in order to cool weapon systems or boost your movement circuits.

Design your Ronin from the 102 different parts of weaponry and equipment, and numerous different Ronin designs. All parts are interchangeable.

- 60 mm scale vouch for high detail and great presence on the tabletop.

- Fast and intense combat including missile weapons and close combat covering hit locations and critical hits.

- Features the unique MAG-HIT magnet indication system.

Expanded by:

Ronin: War

name: Wyrm Wars
description:
Wyrm Wars is a simple card game wherein players attempt to meld cards of like color. Melds score points geometrically proportionate to their number of cards. Several special-power cards as well as Dragons and Wyrms (which can remove a card from an opponent's meld and cancel a card as it is played, respectively) add variety and flavor.

From the back of the box:

In ages past, the Powers-that-be manifested themselves in spectacular conflict. Enter the war. Order the great Wyrms into battle. Build an empire. Spy on your opponents. Then dispatch a Dragon to devour your neighbor's precious little Unicorn. Smile. Eat pretzels. Drink (root?) beer. And, rain havoc down from above. Only five minutes to learn.

Contents:

90 full-color cards with fantasy themed art
rule sheet
publishers: Two Guys Making Card Games, Inc.

name: Travel
description:
Welcome world travelers!

You goal is to visit all the countries listed on your special passport and return home. The game consists of a board representing thirty-six countries, passports, passport stamps, travel tickets, country cards, pawns, dice, and money. There are four travel tickets: plane, boat, train, and car. Tickets are purchased randomly and then used to travel around the board. Each country has certain forms of travel going to different countries. Moves must be mapped out to make sure you get the best use out of your tickets. Money is obtained by rolling the dice. Each roll means something different, just don't roll a seven or you'll have to draw a country card and have to visit that country as well before you can win. For each country you visit you get a stamp for your passport. Once all your countries have been stamped, head home to win the game.

This is a unique but very fun game. Great for a light evening of games.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Fight the Power
description: A simple free dice game in which you have to choose between growing your faction of rebellious elves to the point where the can safely overthrow Santa or shrinking it to zero so that you can turn your opponents.

name: Think-It Link-It
description:
"The Game of Rhyme & Reason"

The object of the game is to guess paired rhyming words based on the clues given on each card. Each card gives four clues: 1) A syllable clue--for instance "Think Link" indicates two one-syllable words,Thinkit Linkitindicates two two-syllable words, etc. 2) A link clue--synonyms for each word in the answer are given, "Enormous Toupee" for "Big Wig" for instance. 3) A letter clue, which gives the first letter of each word in the answer. And 4) A phrase clue, "Covers a bald spot" for "Big Wig" for example. On a player's turn, another player chooses a card and reads the syllable and link clues aloud. If they guess the answer correctly, they score the points printed on the card (either 5 or 10--cards are double-sided with easier 5 point links printed in blue on one side and harder 10 point links printed in orange on the other.) For each additional clue given, one point is subtracted, with the player losing a point from their score if they fail to guess it after all four clues have been given. It is suggested in the rules that participants play to a score of 100.

This game was published in two editions: a pocket edition with 50 cards, and a deluxe edition with 500 cards. The pocket edition also includes a small pad of paper and a pencil for keeping score.

In 2005, a new deluxe edition was released with 1000 cards, and new pocket editions: Classic, Junior, Sports, Genius, Food & Cooking, and Science, Animals & Nature.

name: Dicey
description:
A dexterity game where players take turns stacking cards and dice.

Players take turns drawing a card. They then place dice on the card as to match the picture on the card. Finally the card is balanced on a communal stack in the middle of the table. Play continues to the next player.

When the stack collapses, the faulting player gains points from the sum of the top face of the dice touching the table. The game continues until one player earns 100 points, ending the game and making the player with the fewest points the winner.

Dicey comes with 22 dice and 13 cards.

name: Linear Progression
description:
Linear Progression is an abstract strategy game for 2 players, played on a standard chess board. Each player starts with a single piece that as it moves, takes control of the spaces through which it travels. Continue moving pieces until the last space is filled. The player controlling the most spaces wins. A Blocker variant is also possible which introduces special pieces through which no other piece can travel.

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: The Real Ghostbusters
description:
Ghosts have invaded Manhattan in New York and it’s the Ghostbusters’ job to liberate the city from these ugly creatures.

Each player takes the role as one of the four members in Ghostbusters, each with their strengths and weaknesses. The goal is to make as much money as possible.

Districts are assigned to players and they are to get to that location and attempt to clear that district of ghosts before they get a new district assigned.

There’s a wide range of inventory that can be purchased throughout the game and aid the players, everything from ghost traps and magical books to the copter Ecto II that can travel great distances in one turn and fly over traffic chaos on the streets.
categories: Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Negamco Pro Football
description: Charts and spinner based statistical replay of Pro football. New player ratings available each year. Included are 13 running plays and 8 passing plays.

name: Top Secret Adventures
description:
Based on the Highlights® Top Secret Adventures series, this game helps children expand their knowledge of world geography.

Each player is an agent on a top secret mission. Use the world map on the game board to help answer geography quiz cards and gather data cards as you go. Be the first to collect a correct set of data cards revealing the suspect, place and missing item to successfully complete your mission and win!
categories: Card Game, Educational, Spies/Secret Agents, Travel, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Sudoku: Das Würfelspiel
description: Sudoku: Das Würfelspiel is another in the Knizia series of Sudoku games, following "The Board Game" and "The Card Game". This time it's with dice and the Sudoku grid is made simpler with only six numbers to accommodate standard dice.

name: Caterpillar Race
description:
(From the box)

Create your own unique multi-colour caterpillar and race to victory in this exciting game.

Aim of the game: To be the first player to cross the finish line with your caterpillar.

1. Build your multi-colour 6 segment caterpillar.
2. Set up the finish line and decide the starting point of the race.
3. Take it in turns to roll the dice. Move your caterpillar segments (starting from the back) one in front of the other until the coloured segment at the front matches the colour on the dice. Place the head on the front segment.
4. If the colour on the die matches the colour of the front segment of your caterpillar, you miss a go. If this happens you can place a barrier in front of your opponent to slow them down.
5. Your opponent must now move around the barrier in order to reach the finish line.
6. The winning caterpillar is the one to cross the finish line first.

name: Zauberwäldchen
description:
(From the Box):

Oh dear! The magician Shaggy Beard has enchanted mushrooms, animals, and trees! Fortunately the apprentice Magnus Magneticus gives you a helping hand: Who will, with his assistance, be able to release them all from the spell?

name: Monopoly: Mannheim
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Mannheim, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ben 10 Omnitrix Duel for Power Game
description:
From the manufacturer:

Go head to head against your opponent as you try to collect the most alien cards and win. The Omnitrix tells you whether you want to have the lower or the higher card during each battle. Achieve that and you add both cards to your win pile. Special cards tie the battle up and bring another, more powerful battle on!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Quebec opoly
description:
This is a French Canadian version of Monopoly where all the properties have been replaced by popular places or events in Quebec.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: CHUGGA CHOO CHOO!
description: Chugga Choo Choo! is a fun way for kids to learn colors, coordination, and counting. After choosing a color station, players agree on the number of cargo balls each will attempt to load into their color of hopper car. Next, it's time to switch the lever to start the train moving. All aboard! Kids then use the loading chute to load the cargo balls as fast as they can into their hopper car. The quickest to fill their hopper with the cargo and switch the station lever wins the game and Chugga Choo Choo! will congratulate the winner with a happy tune! Requires 3 'AAA" batteries (not included).

name: Grisbi
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Grisbi is a very dynamic and entertaining game about encounters between cops and robbers. Each player's goal is to act quickly and – by matching the right pictures – collect all the location cards. Grisbi is not a turn-based game, so being swift is your best weapon. Try not to make any mistakes while matching pictures!

name: Jack le Pirate
description:
Similar to Blackjack

The goal of the game is to win as many gold pieces as possible. To win the gold pieces in play, You must reach 21 or get close but not to exceed.

The game consists of 54 cards and 10 pieces of gold. Each card has a value 2 to 10 and flag cards selectable value 1 or 11.

Each player gets 2 cards.
The goal is to reach or come as close as possible to 21, everyone will, each in turn, decide to stop or request an additional card, but must be careful not to exceed 21!
When all players have stopped, everyone turns over his cards and comparing results. The player with 21 or that the closest wins the gold coin. The player with over 21 lose one gold this round.

If 2 or more players have tied having 21 they each won a gold coin taken from the treasure, unless a player has two cards with only 21, he has a "Blackjack" and then won 2 pieces of gold.
If 2 or more player have tied having less than 21, nobody takes the gold but one more gold piece are taken into play for the next round.

The winner is the player who has won the most gold coins when the treasure is empty or there are no more cards in the deck.

name: Maha Yodha: Expansion Cards
description:
Maha Yodha was designed as a fun and quick 2 player game that also features tactical maneuvering and hand management. It's an epic battle-themed strategic card game based on ancient stories from Hindu Mythology.

In expansion cards, we have introduced weapon of mass destruction and artifacts. An artifact is a powerful force multiplier the is permanently deployed onto the battlefield.

A Weapon of Mass Destruction cards requires a specific Maha Yodha scroll cards. These are single use cards.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Prehistoric
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Feat on the Ground
description:
Feat On The Ground is a sequel to Ahead in the Clouds. If you recall, the industrialists gather and manage resources (Hydrogen, Oxygen, Water and Stone) in order to provide for their families and keep the city in the clouds afloat.

But now...

Empacta, the planet beneath the cloud city, is in bad shape - which is rough news for everyone. After an eternity of exploiting the Empacta's resources, it is dried up and the ecosystem is exhausted.

As an industrialist, you will use your resources to help re-shape the planet. By gathering and forming collections of assigned resources you will terraform Empacta back to its prime. After all, a city in the clouds is nothing without the planet below.

In Feat on the Ground, each player will take their turn by playing a card to the map, adding resources or removing them. Together you will be working on a defined area, but players will assume different roles once an area is completed. If a player completes the area on their turn, they will get credit and score points. If it’s completed on their opponent’s turn, they will stash resources to bring back with them. At the end of the game, players score points if they stashed the most of a resource type. In the end, the player that manages to do these the best is declared winner.

NOTE: Feat On The Ground requires 9 coins/cubes/tokens for tracking scores.

name: Would you rather..?: Filthy Edition
description: Would You Rather…? Filthy Edition is the game of crazy choices and demented dilemmas for adults! Your goal is to figure out which dilemma the other players would rather do. There are two ways to play: Classic Dilemmas give you two outrageous options to choose from, and Fill-in-the-Blank Dilemmas have missing words that you provide. Once the group has revealed their choice, turn over your previously selected Voting Token to see if you matched. With over 1000 dilemmas to choose, Would You Rather…? Filthy Edition is the game of obscene choices for adults.

name: Toire no Kayokosan
description:
User description:

トイレの香夜子さん(Toire no Kayokosan) which roughly translates into: "The restroom of Kayoko" / "The Toilet of Kayoko".
According to the English rules for the game the title of the game is called "The Restroom".


A horror game that takes place in a cursed village in a closed schoolhouse in a restroom. A group of different families are stuck in the restroom and have to escape from this vengeful ghost called Kayoko.
Each player will have 3 of the same colored play figures which represents a family to control. The players need to cooperate to escape the restroom, avoid the vengeful ghost Kayoko by rolling a die and moving to different toilet stalls and opening them by flipping cards either finding items or hiding in the toilet stalls to avoid danger. Be careful though you might encounter Kayoko or other vengeful ghosts on your search. If you find Kayoko the player needs to roll the die to escape from her which is represented by a meeple. If you roll any of the bloody marks on the die Kayoko will move that many spaces counterclockwise only around the restroom. If Kayoko lands where a play figure is that play figure is dead and sent to the depths of hell. The goal of the game is to find a key to open a door card and escape. Only one play figure needs to escape for all players to win. The players will lose if all play figures are dead or if the time hits 2AM. The time will start at 6PM each time a player reveals a Kayoko card the time will move by one hour.

Note: The rules are also written in English. There is a QR code to scan for English card descriptions for the game.

Publisher description:
---Story---
N県のはずれにある「奥彼岸(おくひがん)村」は、別名「たたり村」と呼ばれ恐れられている「心霊スポット」。
この村にある廃校のトイレには大怨霊『カヨコさん』がすみついているという・・・
物語は、怪談ツアーでこの地を訪れた家族一団がこのトイレに閉じ込められてしまうシーンから始まる。

name: ¡Pasa el marrón!
description:
PASS THE BUCK!
An elimination game
Don't get stuck with the drag in the office! Everybody is passing the mess and nobody wants to be the loser. Pass the buck, go and get a coffee to sneak away and try not to fall asleep while your colleagues pester you or you will get stuck with a new one!
Easy, fast-paced and extra funny card game. It can be played individually or in teams.

Each player has 3 cards.
There are 4 types of cards:

Bucks: you pass the mess putting this card in front of a player.
Pass the buck: moves the bucks card from one player to another.
Fall asleep: forces a player to lose a turn.
Coffee: protects from receiving bucks cards.


By turns, each player will use a card and take a new card from the deck.

When a player gets 3 bucks cards in front of him, he will be eliminated from the game.

The surviving player will be the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Rubik's Match
description:
Rubik’s Match is the ultimate quick-thinking, fast-action card game for brain teaser fans. Players race to build the pattern shown on the Challenge cards using their own set of Cubie Cards. The first player to complete the pattern wins the round!

—description from the publisher

name: Lista rätt!
description:
In this trivia game the players are asked to rank a "top 5" list out of 10 possible answers.

An innovative trivia game that's fun to play with your family and friends.

Lista rätt! is a trivia game with a game-changing idea. Each player is asked to write down a "top 5" list. One question could look something like "Rank the animals' weight" with the 10 possible answers being Elephant, Lion, Rhino, Rabbit, Fox, Coyote, Giraffe, Squirrel, Shark and Butterfly.
At the same time, you have to be a bit tactical hence a wrong answer deducts points from your tally.

name: Who Tooted?
description: Players sit around an electronic sound machine in the shape of a man, controlled by one of the players. One of the players secretly controls the machine, which makes sounds of passing gas. Players bet on who is controlling the machine, and the winner advances along a scoring track.

name: Kofferpacken extrem
description: You're going on a trip in Kofferpacken extrem, and you want to pack your suitcase with many things. Who can invent the most creative items with the letters given? And can you remember what everyone else has packed?

name: Legendy Polskie
description: A player is unveiling the lost legends of Polish. Collect the cards and travel around the game board (map Polish). Players can exchange parts of the legends of the others. The player who accumulates the most points wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pictionary Man Jr.
description: Pictionary Man Jr. features easy-to-hold pieces of chalk and sketch directly onto the smaller-sized purple figure. It is played in teams. Players are given a clue that they need to portray. They can draw on the man and props and then move both of them in order to act out the clues for their teammates to figure out the clue before time runs out. Whichever team gets the most points for correct guesses, wins.
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Junk
description:
Junk is a card and dice game for 2-4 players that takes 45-90 minutes to play: instead of building civilization like you might be used to in the genre, in Junk you are REbuilding using the junk from the world before.

The players are leaders of a tribe that has survived an apocalypse and scavenge the wasteland for junk. These junk cards are drawn, traded, or stolen from other players to combine into pre-collapse technologies. The first tribe to restore civilization by achieving all 5 of these: the wonders of Sanitation, Preservation, Constitution, Radio, and Power Generation, wins.

How will you choose to survive? By nurturing the wasteland ecology and harvesting its resources, founding a warrior culture to take what others have, restoring culture and quality of life, studying the science of what came before, or learning how it all fit together?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Magic Cat
description:
To win in Magic Cat, you need to complete potions and you need to do it quickly — sort of.

Each player starts the game with an empty potion bottle and a magic spell card, while all of the ingredients, other potion bottles, magic potion tiles and curse tiles are shuffled together face down, then placed in four stacks, with the top of tile of three stacks being turned face up.

One player starts as the first magician and says a spell of some kind starting with the word "Start" and ending with whatever she wants to say, e.g., "(werewolf howl)". The other players, in any order, try to say "First (werewolf howl)", "Second (werewolf howl)", etc., but they can't say something at the same time as another player; if they do, or if someone says that wrong thing, then the round ends and those magicians receive a curse token worth -1 point.

As magicians answer correctly, they throw their magic spell cards into the box in the center of the table. Once the round ends, in the order that they threw their cards in the box they claim one ingredient from a stack, revealing the next ingredient if they took a face-up tile. If someone reveals a curse tile, then she must take that, too.

When two stacks are empty or all of the curse tokens have been taken, the game ends. Players then score 3, 7 or 10 points for their completed potions (which take 3-5 ingredients), 1 point for each magic potion, and -1 for each curse (with an additional -4 points for whoever has the most). Whoever has the high score wins.

name: Juduku 4: Révélations Explosives
description:
Juduku Explosive Revelations contains 480 new cards to reveal your friends' and family's worst thoughts, as well as Sudden Death and Mime cards to spice up your evenings even more: that means more spicy answers and more hilarious situations.

This new opus of Juduku comprises 4 decks to renew the pleasure:

the quiet "Pépouze"
the terrible "Confessions"
the famous "Girl's Night"
the spicy "X Rated"


The rules remain similar, the players have to answer in only 8 seconds to questions like:

Name 3 dishes that you often cook but that Philippe Etchebest would spit in your face!
Name 3 ways to get a drink!
Name 3 things you prepare before a date!


—Description from the publisher.

name: How the Grinch Stole Christmas! Game
description:
From the box:
In this amusing game of memory and matching, players race around the board trying to rescue presents from the Grinch. The underside of each present has a toy on it; when players match a letter from the toy's name to their space on the board they collect that present. The player who rescues the most presents wins.

Ages 4 and up

Contents:
Game Board
20 3-Dimensional Presents
4 Playing Pieces
Spinner Card and Spinner
Complete Instructions

This is a silly kid's game, but it is fun to pack away in the Christmas box and play once a year. The little 3-d presents are irresistible!
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Construction & Corruption
description:
The less you work, the more you get paid!

In Construction & Corruption, the longer you keep your contracts, the more money you will receive. But be careful! Too much money and not enough work can carry the stink of corruption, which might bring about a federal investigation! But even worse than that, success carries the sting of jealousy, and other players may try to attack you well before the cops find out!

Bartering, trading and negotiation are central to the game. It’s a free-for-all. You may trade money, Investigation Cards, Contracts with their Corruption, ‘Keys to the City,’ the First Player Token, and promises, at any time. You may place a worker, make a promise, then break your promise and move your worker again. In the world of “Construction & Corruption,” promises are frequent, but never binding.

—description from the publisher

name: 4-Way Countdown!
description:
Players compete to achieve all numbers from 1 through 10 using 2 dice and simple math. Score is marked with wooden pegs that are flipped when a number is achieved.

Basically a four player version of Shut the Box. But it includes some variation. Players may not use the two dice as separate numbers to flip two pegs. Instead they use the two numbers with a basic math operand to create a single number to choose a peg.

Example: Dice roll 2 and 6 yields
2 + 6 = 8 6 – 2 = 4 6 ÷ 2 = 3
There are only 10 pegs so 6 x 2 = 12 is out.

From the box:
The ultimate challenge of your math skills by simply using numbers on the dice.

Re-implements:

Countdown!

name: Wrestle Around
description:
Another late sixties Ideal game released in a deep square box.

The game consists of a plastic circular arena with four handles evenly spaced around the circumference. There is a hole in the center of the arena which leads to a lower collecting area; this lower structure also serves to support the game and it must not leave the playing surface during gameplay.

Each player selects & holds 3 marbles of a particular color and grips a 'wrestling handle' with their other hand. Marbles are simultaneously entered into the arena. Players use the handles to manipulate the arena, trying to force opponents' marbles into the central hole while keeping their own marbles active.

The player owning the last remaining marble in the arena is the winner.

name: Scene It? TV  Deluxe Edition
description:
From the publisher:

TV trivia at its best!
With 50 years of TV packed into two DVDs, the Deluxe TV Edition of Scene It? is the quintessential television trivia game. From The Brady Bunch to Alias this game will keep players tuned in for hours and hours of TV entertainment.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Die monsterstarke Musikschule
description:
IMPORTANT:
To play this game you'll need the Ravensburger tiptoi-pencil - which is sold separately!

All monsters will participate in the major music competition of the country. But before they go on stage, each band has yet to prove themselves: Are they familiar with the instruments? Who sings the most beautiful songs? And who plays well on drums and xylophone? In the music school, the players learn the various aspects of music: From hearing-training through singing right up to instrument-knowledge.

Content:
Segmented board (single-sided, 2 parts connected via jigsaw / puzzle)
3 exercise cards (double sided)
5 player cards (representing the participating bands; double sided)
1 monster token ("Krokus", director of the music school)
1 plastic stand
1 rules

name: INDYCAR Unplugged
description:
Slingshot, draft and setback your opponents, upgrade your car, stay out of the marbles and try not to crash!

INDYCAR Unplugged is a racing board game for 2-6 players ages 6 & up that plays in 10-30 minutes.

During your turn, play cards to advance your car. Opponents may play Setback cards to reduce your movement. At the end of your turn, fill your hand back to 5 cards. Be the first driver to complete the final lap to win the game!

Featuring Indy drivers JR Hildebrand, Scott Dixon, Tony Kanaan, Dario Franchitti, Josef Newgarden, and Simon Pagenaud.

name: Speedy Graffiti
description: A wild and hectic letter battle to see who gets the last word. While the timer ticks away, players try to change or lengthen the word on the table by rearranging the letter cards and adding new ones. But when the bell rings, and time is up the player who made the last word wins. Everyone plays at once in this intense, new action word game.

name: Tien Zi Que: White Dragon
description:
White Dragon is an entertaining pocket MahJong for two. It uses unique selection of MahJong cards, and each card is added a color code (blue, green, red, white or black) for special scoring. With exceptional game play and color code, White Dragon brings you more fun and strategy than the traditional MahJong. All you need is 5 cards on hand and little or no MahJong knowledge to play. The first player collects 30 points wins the game.

Goal / Winning the Game:
After creating a Set, player chooses to keep one of the cards for end of the Round scoring. When one player completes five Sets, he calls MahJong and wins the Round immediately. He then uses the one card from each Set to calculate the score point. Player’s score points are accumulated after every winning round, and the player who accumulates 30 or more points wins the game.

Player: 2
Time: 24.7 Min
Age: Ages 8 and up

Components: 54 cards

Three Dragon Expansions: TZQ Red Dragon, TZQ White Dragon, and TZQ Green Dragon. Mix any two TZQ games for 3-4 player game, and mix any three TZQ games for 5-6 player game.

<!-- Hmmm.... this description is the exact same description as TZQ.... these might just be the same game with different components that are combinable for a larger game --!>

name: Yatzoo
description: A Yahtzee variant for children from ages 5 up. Numbers in the dice have been replaced with animals, and you try to roll as many same animals as possible. There are no straights and no bonuses for the upper part of the scoring sheet, so the rules have been simplified quite a bit.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Elefantissimo
description:
Theme: In this game, elephants balance from tree to tree!

The game takes place in the jungle, a square containing 36 tree cards. Each player controls two elephants of his color.

Every turn, the top card is revealed. The action described upon it will then be accomplished successively by all players. The 4 different actions are:
- take off a tree from the jungle
- move a tree
- move an elephant to a nearby tree
- make an elephant jump over the nearby tree

Once all action cards have been revealed, they are shuffled again to create a new pile.

With the trees disappearing, it becomes harder and harder for the elephants to stay in the jungle. Indeed the movements are compulsory.
If an elephant cannot complete the action, he falls from his tree (only one elephant per tree, heavy enough!) and is removed from the game.
The game stops when only one player has elephants left in the game and he is declared winner.
publishers: Cocktail Games, La Mèche Rebelle Editions

name: Interaction
description:
"The devious strategy game where each move generates a chain reaction."

The board is 9x9 with the corners clipped; the middle row is made out of deeper "pockets". Each player controls two cue balls; in addition, there are 10 neutral balls, moved by the cue balls. The object is to maneuver five neutral balls into the pockets (once there, they are removed for score).

On your turn, you pick a cue ball and launch it in one of eight possible directions. Your cue ball may travel any distance in a straight line before hitting a neutral (or another cue ball); at that moment, its momentum is transferred and the ball hit moves the same distance. Should you hit a row of balls, only the farthest one moves (as in a Newton's Cradle). All balls bounce off the play area's walls, either straight back when hitting head on, or reflected when hitting at 45 degrees. Note that a move that doesn't hit any balls is illegal.

Includes solitaire problems where the object is to find the least number of moves required.

name: Coodju
description: (Back of the Box) "...teams battle for points by spelling everyday words in a host of bizarre and crazy ways! Coodju's quirky team play will provide you and your friends with plenty of mental mix-ups and lots of laughs. Coodju is easy to learn, quick to play, and irresistible to watch! It's spelling with a twist!"

name: The Golden Horde
description: This two-player game by Excalibre covers the period of Mongol Conquests in Eurasia from 1205 to 1241 A.D. One side represents the Mongol Hordes and the other side represents the 12 main opponents of the Mongols, referred to as the Allies in this game, although these 12 rarely did anything resembling an alliance in history.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Investigators
description:
From the box:

You are a team of private detectives solving such cases as Theft, Smuggling, Blackmail, etc. You move around the Big City looking for clues, trying to avoid Locked Doors, Guard Dogs, Getting Tied Up, Secret Codes, even Mob Tough Guys, using Disguises, a special Tool Kit, Fast Moves, but mostly your Quick Wits to get out of Tight Corners. Can we solve the case to get our client out of trouble? Yes, if we pool our strategies, use some intuition and help each other out of tough spots. A quick moving game with lots of opportunity for sharing, consultation and decision making.

name: Form A Word
description: A Scrabble-type crossword game, but the goal is to get rid of your tiles (they don't have a point value). At the beginning of her turn, the players spins a spinner, and it decides if she has to put her tiles at the end of a word, at the beginning of a word, between two words (thus creating a third, new word), or anywhere. If she cannot do it, she has to draw some new tiles, depending which tasks she failed. The winner gets points equal to the remaining tiles of other players. altogether three rounds are played.
publishers: Paget Services, REMUS Produktions- und Entwicklungs GmbH, Top Games, Westside Fun Games

name: O' PenzedoR!
description:
O'penzedor is the first game of young designer Cedric Joint.
The game is about opening doors and facing the magic spells behind it. If you have the right counter-spell among the cards in your hands you succeed and win arcane points; if you lose, you can continue though lose points and you give advantages to your opponents (new counter-spell cards).
Some cards with special power spice up the regular magic spells.
O'penzedor is a very simple and fun card-game with nice artwork from Pierro (Ghost Stories, En Garde, Linq, Mr. Jack).
[user summary of playtesting]

name: Minotaurus
description:
Players must prove their adeptness at somersaulting bulls. They do that by performing the somersault in five steps.

Left and right horn stones of varying colours and values are used in a type of Memory game to collect matching pairs of horns. These pairs symbolise the height of the somersault. Higher values mean greater skill.

Players can challenge each other by trying to throw a ring over one of the horns of a bull sculpture.

Victory goes to the player who has the highest jumps at the end of the game.

Content of the box:

50 playing stones and 1 horn sculpture made of THETA stone
one leather ring
one rulebook


Source : translated from publisher's website

name: Hold On Scooby-Doo
description:
Scooby and Shaggy sit on top of a wall of bricks. On your turn, use one of the ghost hands to push out a brick...very, very carefully! On someone's turn they will tumble down. Yipes! Don't let it be YOU!
If you knock down the heroes, you lose.

Contents:

Wall frame, 44 bricks,
Scooby-Doo / Shaggy figure,
2 ghost hands
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Atlantis Schnupperspiel
description:
This mini version of Leo Colovini's Atlantis was a free give-away in Essen 2011. It is a 2-player version of the game with fewer and smaller game components.
The game works the same way as the original: the players, by skillful placing of cards and the building of bridges, try to leave the city of Atlantis in order to reach the solid ground with as much treasures as possible.
mechanics: Enclosure, Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: The Package
description:
A fast-paced and hilarious card game of bluff and sabotage.

The goal of the game is to be the player holding onto the Package card when the end game condition is triggered, which is the draw deck running out. Players start with 5 cards. Every turn, a player either draws a card or plays one from his/her card. Playing a card may allow the player to draw additional cards, steal cards from another player or exchange cards with another player. There is a hand limit of 7 cards.

name: Foodie Fight Rematch
description:
It is the same as the original game, Foodie Fight but has more trivia questions.

The object of the game is to fill a game board with tokens collected for correctly answering questions in each of five categories: Foodstuff, Kitchenary, Smarty Cook, To Table, and Leftovers. The first person to fill in their game board wins.

name: Gho...Gho...Ghosty
description: Let's go to the amusement park! Instead of simply gawking at the attractions, however, the players in Gho...Gho...Ghosty get to command their own ghost train, competing against others to travel far and nab the most passengers. Players take turns in the role of Mr. Ghosty, collecting two cards from the ghost train card display. When the ghost train reaches a certain length, the train takes off — and when all 75 wagons are gone, the best ghost train boss will be determined based on the passengers they have.

name: VOID
description:
VOID is a work of art created for the "Is This a Game?" exhibition held in the Akihabara section of Tokyo from May 29 to June 3, 2018.

VOID includes many strange tiles, along with dice and a marker, but it contains no specific rules on how to use these components to play a game. Well, sort of — you use these materials as you wish to create a game scene, then you take a photo or video of that fabricated game scene and upload it to whatever social networking services seem appropriate for you and your fellow players using the hashtag #voidgame. Whoever receives the most "likes" on their post wins.

name: Wishing Well
description:
This is a 2 player game by Matias Paredes where players will roll a die and try to quickly throw down their cards with the same amount of coins that match the die face. Speed matters when you are competing for the coins in the Wishing Well.


Released in the July 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

name: Tataka: A Strategic Card Game of Samurai Showdowns
description:
It's a simple, strategic and fun samurai themed fighting card game for 3-5 players.
The game deck is made up of attack, block, and special cards. Cards that correspond to each character in play are shuffled together and dealt out.
The drafting phase begins. In this phase players will select one card from their hand, lay it face down in front of them and then pass their hand. This continues until each player has collected 10 cards.
Next is the battle phase. Each player simultaneously plays one card from their hand to attack, block or perform another action. By defeating another player, you gain a honor card.
The phases then repeat until one player claims two honor cards to win the game.
mechanics: Deduction, Kill Steal, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Peter Pan Game
description: This children's track game is based on the Disney movie. To begin, puzzle pieces are placed face down in the center of Never Land, cards are placed on the Pirate ship, and players choose a pawn with a picture of a character from the film. On your turn you roll the die and advance your pawn around the Never Land path the number of spaces indicated. If you land on a Peter Pan space, you draw a card from the Pirate ship and follow the directions. If you land on a space with a picture of the character on your pawn, you draw a puzzle piece from the center of the board. If the color outline on the piece matches the color of your pawn, you keep it. When you have collected all 5 of your puzzle pieces you may move onto the boat track and head for HOME. The first player to complete his or her puzzle and reach HOME by exact count wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Pirates, Puzzle
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Rainbowland
description: Players work together collecting colored raindrops in their buckets to build a new rainbow in Rainbowland. Then they flip the gold coin to see if they can keep the gold at the end of their rainbow.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: RisiKo! Junior
description: A special edition of the game, designed for younger players. The game board shows 6 islands thatvare under attack by the evil black armies. Children must cooperate to avoid the invasion.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: Cat's Eye
description:
Think "Hungry Hungry Hippos" with extra stuff.
