4 players' marbles are dumped into a hopper. Each player pushes a button as fast as they can to fill a channel with 5 marbles. They can take the marbles of their own color to put in their tray, which is cat-shaped. Then, dump the other marbles back into the hopper and keep pressing. Fill your tray with your own marbles (plus the "cat's eye") and win.
publishers: Cadaco, Marx Toys, Milton Bradley, Schaper

name: The Zombie Shamble
description:
The zombie apocalypse happened and the zombies won. Now what? There aren't any more people to eat and the rotting eternity is down-right boring. So, the zombies came up with the idea (if that's even possible) that foot-races would be neat. They certainly can be exciting – especially when pieces of the contestants fall off along the way!

Zombie Shamble is a fast-paced card game where players take on the roles of zombies trying to do their best to get across the finish line. It's not all that far away, but remember that you're an animated rotting corpse and all kind of craziness can happen in just a few steps.

First to 25 steps wins. Deal out 6 cards each, then draw a card, play a card. The cards are Steps (move towards finish line), Calamities (eg a leg falls off; fixed by Duct Tape card), Fortune (usually cancels a Calamity), a Trump card (eg Steely Eyed, so cannot be distracted). Oh, and that's exactly 25 steps, not more. Else the Zombie Judges won't be happy. But might be hungry.

name: Hyano
description:
Six stacks of cards are placed in a circle, with the top card of each stack exposed. One player takes the role of the "appraiser", and he both chooses the first card to be placed in the center of the circle and tries to guess the last card that will be played onto the center stack. Other players place cards based on specific rules. If the appriser correctly guesses the last card placed, he gets the cards in the center stack. Whoever gets the most cards wins.

Ages 8 and up.

name: Thomas Making Tracks Game
description:
From the Press Release:

Molly, Percy, James and Thomas need your help to build railway tracks from their sidings to the main line. Connect straight and curved tracks by matching colors on the spinner. Lastly, spin the spinner and chug your engine across the board, over a bridge and finally to the round house where Sir Topham Hatt awaits your arrival. Complete game rules included. For 2-4 players. Ages 4+.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trains

name: Muh & Mäh
description:
Publisher website: "Oh dear! Farmer Berts' animals have all disappeared! But where have they gone? The children help Bert to search for the animals and bring them back to the farm: for the color game version they need some luck, for the tactile memory game a good memory and tactile abilities. A brightly colored tactile game for 2-4 players ages 3-8. Including two game ideas"

Farmer Frank has lost all of his animals and needs your help finding them. Players take turns drawing animals from a bag, and if you draw an animal of your color, you get to place it on your farm. Use those delicate fingers to feel for the animals that you're lacking and fill up your board first. A sort of Lotto game.

name: La Hache & Le Feu
description:
La Hache & le Feu is a cooperative boardgame for 2 players (more with the expansions) which take on the roles of courageous heroes.

During each game, the heroes embark on quests and venture into dark dungeons to battle monsters, earn gold.

With danger lurking in every shadow, combat is a necessity. For such times, La Hache & le Feu uses a dice-based system. Players use dice according to their character's abilities and weapons.

Featuring 16 modular board pieces, 5 dices, many tokens and 55 cards, etc.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Das magische Museum
description:
Das magische Museum is a co-operative game from the "smart play" series. It is played using an App.

After their dog Fluffy ran into the magic museum and destroyed a glass cabinet, players are trappped in there. To get out they have to find the samples Fluffy has hidden behind other exhibits, get Fluffy and find Rexy's bone.

Every round consists of a planning phase followed by an action resolution phase. The planning is done simultaneously with a time limit. Players can choose between different actions such as gathering information about the museum or Fluffy's whereabouts, moving to another room of the museum, or searching for the hidden objects or keys. Most actions can be chosen multiple times, also by the same player, but the overall number of actions is limited depending on the number of players.

In the action resolution phase players then take the planned actions. The App controls all steps and announces whose turn it is and what to do.

But beware not to be too loud - sometimes someone awakes and they have to run using keys they found.

They all win if they manage to fulfill their tasks before the time is up.

name: Maki Staki
description:
A similar game to Rummy, in that players may pick from the discard pile or face down deck to create a set of five cards, always rounding down to five cards at the end of a turn. A number of "take that" action cards are worked into the deck, swapping player hands, discarding most valuable sets, etc.
—user summary

Maki Staki is a stylish sushi themed card game for three to six players. Simply collect sets of sushi cards to make your Maki but be ready to roll with the action cards. Will you fall foul of the Fatal Fugu or Wasabi Burn or will you pass the buck with the help of the Conveyor Belt?
—description from the publisher

name: Kolorowy zawrót głowy
description:
Small family game based on a idea of tic-tac-toe. Players are placing tiles with different shapes and colours trying to make a line of three of the same shape or colour.

The game is based on a pattern building and memory element cause players need to remeber what tiles their opponents took from the supply.

It includes a fun team variant for four players.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Pirates!
description:
(From the box)
"You've got to be on the lookout for pirates as you sail your fleet through enemy waters to capture their treasure"
A battle game, with two players each having six pirate ships. The fleets maneuver through a board crowded with shoals and islands to capture their opponent's treasure and return it to base. Movement and combat resolved by die roll.

A straightforward game, distinguished by great graphics from The Jigsaw Factory, a short-lived but (semi) legendary Australian design, toy and game studio from the early 70's.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Don't Die!
description:
Don't Die! is the fast paced, frantic card game where you try not to die... at least, not as much as everyone else.

In Don't Die!, players take turns pulling Hazard cards from the deck and laying them face up for all to see. Each card depicts a unique hazard and a hazard rating. Players then take turns moving the card around the table using "Side-Effects" on the cards in their hands.

If a player is caught without a useable side-effect, that player has to roll a die and try to beat the hazard rating on the card. Side-effects can also help add to your die roll, or, take away from an opponent's die roll. If the hazard is not avoided by rolling higher than the hazard rating, that player recieves a death. 10 deaths to any one player ends the game and the player with the least amount of deaths wins!

Special Death cards are also included in the deck and pop up at random times to deal out an instant death or two to the active player, a random player, and sometimes, a player of your choosing.

Don't Die! also has multiple ways to play and encourages coming up with new ways to win.

name: Monopoly: Chile
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Official Hasbro Monopoly variant set in Chile
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Barbarians
description: In "Barbarians" one player plays the role of a great Roman Emperor ruling the Roman Empire in the period that goes from its apex to its fall, facing the invasions of Barbarians controlled by the other players. The barbarian players act as Attila, Alarico, or other great Barbarian leaders, looking to spread their population over the rich Roman territories and conquer them with their tribes. Each turn represents 25 years of history, during which each Emperor much pay existing legions, recruit new ones and launch his armies into the conquest of Barbarian provinces. Meanwhile, the Barbarian tribes multiply to produce new warriors to tighten their hold and attempt to enlarge their territories.

name: Auf Trab im Sulkydrom
description: Sulkydrom is Trap racing round a circuit, basically modern 'chariot' racing, popular in continental Europe and the southern US, but unseen in Britain. The eight horses are named from Atletico to Happy Days and you play either Horse or Position cards to allow each to move, with the leading horse going first. The cards show the lengths they may move from 0 to 4 including half lengths, e.g. 0, 0.5, 1, 1.5 etc. Shifting lanes costs 1 length, but the Sulky only moves forward a half length. As with many such games, the inside lane has fewer spaces on the bend than the outside lanes. But if you are blocked in and cannot move, you miss your go completely. Taking the inside line therefore is quicker, but makes it easier for others to block you. Each player also has a Joker and Gallop card to help themselves and hinder others once in the game. The races are meant to be quick and the designer encourages betting on them, but doesn't give a method. A solid, colorful production with a jigsaw board, the game comes packaged in a large wooden box with sliding card lid.

name: The Mage's Triangle
description:
The Triangle awaits. You are a restless apprentice who has worked hard for the last ten years studying and practicing to become a Mage. You are ready to take your last test before you can advance onto the final training to become an actual mage-extraordinary. In this test you must play against another apprentice and win the majority of 3 apparently simple games.
THE WIZARD'S DILEMMA - A checkers variant where each apprentice can cast the inscribed magical symbols on the board.
THE SORCERER'S ABYSS - Normal game board squares have been changed into hexes. In addition to this, the element of fate has been added.
THE SHAMAN'S CIRCLE - Pieces move in straight lines as well as in circles. This game is the trickiest of the three and should be played carefully. Surprise wins are not uncommon.

Do you have what it takes to make it through the Mage's Triangle? You must play the triangle to find out.

name: Triple Traveler
description:
A collection of three abstract strategy games that all play on the same board. The board and pieces are designed to stay put, so that the games can be played while traveling. The three games are:

Tandu - Each player places their opponent's numbered tiles (1 - 14) face-down on the board. They then take turns turning over one tile at a time. If it is the correct tile in sequence (starting with 1), it is placed on the outside edge of the board. The first player to place all 14 of their tiles wins.

Hannibal - Each player tries to capture their opponent's king by placing blocks around it. The first to succeed wins the game.

Nile - Try to be the first player to place four of their pyramids in a row, while blocking the other player from doing so.

name: Net.opoly
description:
The board game that challenges you to become King of the CyberSurfers, with a CyberEmpire of Web Sites and CyberBucks.

Surf the Internet, buying, selling and trading Chat Rooms, News Desks, Computer Stores, Shopping Carts, Game Rooms, Sports Dens and more. Buy Web Sites, then upgrade them with Megabyte Chips and Gigabyte Chips to collect CyberBucks as other players hit those sites.

Increase your revenues by landing on You've Got Mail spots. But watch out for those Virus! spots! They can cost you CyberBucks or a feared scamming penalty or that nasty Connection Interrupted: Go Offline!

Similar to Monopoly but selling websites instead of real estate.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Himalaya Blackjak
description:
Gear-up for blackjack - Himalayan style. Components include 6 reference cards, 15 camp cards, and a deck of 58 playing cards.

The cards are shuffled and stacked. One card is revealed to begin the discard pile. Players alternate taking turns by drawing the top card from the draw pile or drawing the top card from the discard pile. The goal is to get exactly 1000 in Meter cards. Having reached the goal, a player gets a Camp card. Some cards are Shortcuts which award a Camp card for having only 800 meters. There are hazard cards which hinder the unlucky player who draws one.

The winner is the first person to get four Camp cards and collect exactly 1000 meters more.

name: Calva-d-Os
description: A simple "dice rolling" game - but not with normal dice. Skulls & bones are used instead of dice. Very light game. Components are rules, 2 skull dice & 8 bones.

name: Wild Wooly
description:
From the rules:

You've captured a rare and hairy Wild Wooly, a creature few humans have ever laid eyes on! This wild thing doesn't like being in a cage and he wants to be bust out. It's up to you to keep him from escaping by keeping your side of the cage strong enough to hold him in. Sometimes a piece of food will calm him down - but not for long! To win you have to be the one player who has not let Wild Wooly escape!

name: Inventions Trivia
description:
Inventions Trivia is a board trivia game in which teams of players answer questions about inventions and inventors. Game consists of a game board, a single six-sided die, 6 game pieces, and 450 question cards. The cards are divided into 3 subject groups (Household Items, Sports and Recreation, and Miscellaneous). Each card contains a question read by one team member to the other members and contains a clue, answer and a short story about the invention or inventor.
The game box states that the game is for 2 or more players or teams, Ages 13 and up.
The game publisher has a website (www.inventionstrivia.com).
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

description:
The game board in 17! consists of three home spaces for each player and several "regular" and "safe" spaces connected by paths. On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves two of his seven pieces (5 pawns and 2 queens) along the paths from space to space. Each piece moves a distance equal to the result of one of the dice. (Instead of moving two pieces, a player may move one of his two queens a distance equal to the sum of the dice.) A player may capture an opponent's piece which is not in a "home space" or in a "safe space", by landing on it, which earns a point.

The goal is to occupy the opponent's home spaces. Each such occupied space gives a player one point. Occupying all three yields an additional two-point bonus and ends the round. A new round ensues; if a third round is needed, the game ends when a player reaches 17 points.

name: Keep Smiling!
description:
Your smiles against your opponents, your smiles against your grimmies and the neutral. A nice collection, face down and lined up against each other! The aim of the game is to make the breakthrough with your smilies, using psychological tactics, good fortune and a poker face, But your opponent is trying to do the same. It's enough to make you a grimmy yourself!

But who wants to identify with something that will count against you later on, So keep smiling.

name: The Great Escape
description: The zany prisoners have escaped from the jail and have handcuffed all of the players to the game board. To make matters worse, they have taken the one key that will open the handcuffs and mixed it with 5 keys that will not open them, and put them all in the jail house. As players move around the board, they must get 4 key cards, all of the same color. Each time they get 4 matching cards they may pick one key from the jail and try to open their handcuffs.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Moscow! Auction!
description:
From the Playing Guide: "The goal is to reverse the Communist monopoly & transfer properties to private ownership. Play of game continues until the Old Commie Bank goes broke & all properties have been transferred to Private Ownership. The richest capitalist wins the game".

Similar to monopoly, players roll dice to move an auctioneer token (airplane) to a property. The player who is the auctioneer rotates counterclockwise each turn. Depending on the property, it is either taken outright by the auctioneer, sold to the highest bidder in a free auction, or sold to the bidder whose bid is closest to a hidden die roll. Landing on an owned property requires paying the owner a fee based on a die roll. Multiple properties of a given color multiply the fee. The player to the right of the auctioneer is the KGB (red car) and attempts to get to the property that the auctioneer is at (using die roll) to steal any proceeds or fees.

Players can also obtain escape cards to foil the KGB, or black market cards that provide special benefits.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Disney's The Lion King Circle of Life Dominoes
description: Meet the endearing characters from Disney's The Lion King while playing the classic game of dominoes. It's a fun game that builds memory and matching skills. Players take turns flipping over dominoes and trying to match characters like Simba, Mufasa and Sarabi to dominoes already in The Circle of Life. The player who completes the three-foot-wide circle wins.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Find Furby
description: In Find Furby, each furby has a unique silly sound or phrase all its own. Find Furby will ask you to find a silly sound like "doobedoo" or a funny phrase like "party". Can you find the correct furby to match with the furby sound.

name: Time Flies
description: Another card game by Dal Negro. Finish your cards by placing them on top of the other chronologically (by moths and seasons).

name: Hollywood Awards
description: A skill game where players vote for the best actresses, actors, directors, movies and songs. Players draw action cards and decide to use or hold card. There is no hand size limit. Used cards are returned to the bottom the pile. Players then roll a steel ball down the runway twice- first to determine which candidate, the second to determine the cost of the candidate. After two or more players have a candidate in the same category, one of those players may call for a vote when playing a "Contest" action card. Vote cards are drawn until a player decides to stand, but beware drawing the "Loser" card that puts you out of the contest immediately. At this point, all players reveal the vote cards they have just drawn and the high vote getter wins a Hollywood Award. The winner is the first player to get 3 Hollywood Awards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hold Your Horses
description:
From the Box:

"Five games to play with cards featuring favorite Breyer horses: No More Horses, Hold Your Horses, Color Rummy, Classic Rummy, Horse Memory.

Perfect for horse lovers, the imaginative games are simple to learn, quick to play, and are fun for the whole family! The oversized cards are easy for small hands to hold, and the sturdy box is perfect to fit into a suitcase or backpack when on the go."

You get a deck of 48 cards that includes 4 color suits of 10 cards each with 1 wild card and 7 orange fact cards (that are not used in the games). The cards of each suit represent 10 different Breyer horse models. All of the cards are pretty heavily laminated.

The games are basically modifications of various public domain card games using their special deck and aimed at the younger crowd. The box does come with an exclusive Breyer Stablemate horse to encourage purchasing by completist collectors.

Includes 5 different games! Kids can have fun "horsing around" with this neat Horse Play Card Game from Breyer®. From Palominos to Clydesdales, each one of these colorful collector's cards features a favorite horse. Choose between games of "No More Horses!", "Find the Horses", "Color Rummy", "Classic Rummy", and "Horse Memory". The oversize cards are easy for small hands to hold, and the sturdy box is perfect to fit into a suitcase or backpack when on the go. Includes 48 cards, game rules, and a special bonus limited edition Breyer collectible horse.

name: Color Train Game
description:
Discovery Toys edition:
Cubes are placed randomly on the inside track of the game board. The die is placed under the train, and the train is moved along the track. If the die matched the corresponding cube when the train is stopped, the player may take the cube and place it on their board. A black dot is another turn, and a star is wild.

Chateau edition:
Each player is trying to collect one passenger from each of four colors in his train car. One of each color passenger is waiting at each of four colored passenger stations. Each turn a player chooses a station to go to and pushes the train around the track to that station. Inside the engine is a pop-o-matic die that pops as you move the train. At the station, you may pick up a passenger that matches the color of the die if one is available and you do not already have a passenger of that color. A white spot allows you to choose any present passenger you do not already have and a black spot prevents you from taking any passenger.

name: Camelot Battlechess
description:
A four man chess game with the legends of Camelot added for a different adventure to each game played.

Each player represents a suit of cards, the heart player must have hearts in his hand to play a piece. An ace will allow you to move one piece one space, therefore you must have a 3 or above to move a knight.

Add to this magic cards that can allow you to do anything from a regular piece movement to arbitrarily removing an opponents piece from the game. All this and a roaming giant and dragon... Not your normal game of chess anymore.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Duckula
description:
The players try to move the three characters, Count Duckula, Igor and Emma, into one room, for them to meet.
If players succeed, they'll get pieces of broccoli.
The more characters get moved into one room, the more pieces of broccoli players get.
But be careful, the well known vampire slayer Doctor von Gänseklein might get in your way.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monopoly: Essex
description:
From the Game-
Monopoly, the great property trading board game finds its home in the ancient Saxon County of Essex. You can now play the classic game with the landmarks, institutions and sights which geve the County its distinctive character and appeal.
Essex has been influenced by many different cultures and historical events. The Normans left their mark with castles and the Romans made Colchester their capital. Start your journey off in Basildon and Chelmsford before moving on to Audley End and Colchester castle.
With its long coast, Essex boasts a real maritime flavour. The woodlands of Epping and Hatfield Forests also add interest to a beautiful landscape characterised by thatched cottages, timber framed farmhouses, Country Houses and the unmistakable outline of windmills.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Australian Football Game
description: A detailed simulation of Australian Rules football. Players vie to move the football marker over the detailed board and through their goal using action cards.

name: Peter Rabbit's Blackberry Game
description:
"Mrs. Rabbit has sent Peter and his sisters, Flopsy, Mopsy and Cotton-tail out to collect some blackberries for their supper. They may go out into the fields or down the lane, but not into Mr. McGregor's garden. Off they go with a basket each, but beware, the birds are out to nibble your blackberries and Mr. McGregor could appear at any time!"

"The rabbit to get home with the most blackberries must have been a good rabbit, and is the winner. If they have the same number it was the first rabbit to get home who is the winner. Any rabbit with no blackberries must however go to bed with no supper and have chamomile tea as they must have been naughty and been in Mr. McGregor's garden."

This a simple multi-square, roll and move children's game. If a player lands on a blackberry square, he or she gets a blackberry. Land on a bird square, lose a blackberry. Land on a Mr. McGregor square, go back several spaces.

Components include four small wicker baskets, a cloth bag filled with wooden blackberries, a flowerpot, a large wooden die, original water color painted board by Beatrix Potter, and four hand-made, hand-painted rabbit figurines.

name: Gronk
description: A simple black & white deck of cards with wild drawings of odd Clan creatures, I suspect this is a variation on the old Italian game Scopa. Players get points for cards and for certain types, Magician and Diplomat and so on.

name: ANTICS
description:
COMPONENTS:

board and 28 tiles depicting ants with 2 holes each.

AIM OF THE GAME:

To get rid of the tiles, by playing them on the board.
The tiles (ants) can only be played on those places so that the color showing through the 2 holes matches the color of the ant.

name: COPS The Game
description: The humorous and exciting board game which challenges the players to make split-second decisions, involving criminal acts, radio calls, and dangerous situations! Be the first COP to make it through the ranks and you'll win the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: Travel TriBond
description: As with TriBond, players are given a list of three items and must determine the common bond, but Travel TriBond replaces the game board with a small scoring peg board, making the entire game very portable.

name: Derby
description:
Derby is a horse race game played with cards. The full game includes some rules for betting, but these are rather rudimentary (the included gaming money is of best quality though - ASS is a famous playing card manufacturer in Germany).

The deck for the race contains 66 cards plus 6 horse cards. Each player chooses a horse. There are 11 cards in the deck for each colour/horse: 1,1,2,2,3,3,4,5,6,7,8. Each player has 7 cards in his hand and each turn he draws a new card, places a card on the table (if possible) and finally discards a card.

Placing cards on the table is only possible with cards of the own color. The first player, who manages to lay down all 8 cards (from 1-8) in the correct order, wins the race.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Goldrake all'attacco
description:
Children game from Mattel based on the popular giant robot Grendizer (Goldrake in Italy).
Players race against each other trying to defeat the enemy robot and the final spaceship.

The movement is driven by a classic spinner and combat is resolved by cards with Rock-Paper-Scissors mechanic.

Contents:

1 Map board
1 Spinner
4 Plastic counters
6 Enemy robot weapon cards
24 "Goldrake" weapon cards
4 Templates for enemy robot weak points filled with puzzle pieces
(Rules printed on the back of top cover box)

name: Kastellan
description: Every player tries to get the most influence in the different areas. There are 8 areas with different values.

name: Rattle Battle
description: The object of the game is to catch marbles through holes in a vertical maze as the marbles fall from top to bottom.

name: Zauberlehrling
description:
[translated from the publisher’s description]
A magical game of chance

Who will be the lucky guesser and the first to manage to place all their tiles? A cheerful murmur rings through the magic caves: Each year the apprentices meet to compare their clairvoyant abilities. But only the best can win the magic contest.

Each child has their own magic equipment, which they place on the four different magic objects and five tiles. Each round two children play a game with one another. One child secretly divides his magic objects between his two hands. The other chooses one of the hands and looks at what it holds: Are there magic objects whose tiles they hold? If so, they can put them aside.

name: Eierlei
description:
From the box: "The dots on the dice determine how many rabbits jump, one after each other, from the back to the front. If there is an egg in one's supply, of the same color as that of the rabbit that ends up at the front once a jumping round has finished, the egg can be returned to the box.
With a little luck with the dice and some tactical thinking you will soon be able to return all their eggs.
For 2 - 4 players.
Two ideas for dice games, with a little bit of tactical thinking."

From the author of Galloping Pigs, this is a fun "jump-over" game aimed at the younger audience!
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ElementO
description: ElementO was designed as a learning tool for the Periodic Table of Elements. Players acquire elements by landing on them. When another player lands on an element, which is owed, they must pay the owner protons. The last player with protons wins. This game is a scientific variant of Monopoly. If you are into science, teaching or the Periodic Table of Elements this game is for you. The game board depicts the Periodic Table of Elements.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Fun Fair
description:
This is a fairground-themed children’s game where players can buy and own booths at the fair and charge other players a fee when they land on them. In Fun Fair children use observation, counting, memory and money skills to be the player with the most money at the end of the game.

Fun Fair was part of John Waddington Ltd.'s 'Look, Learn and Play' series of boardgames first published in the mid-seventies, designed to introduce children aged 5 onwards to basic concepts like simple addition, memory, following instructions and social interaction.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Ducklings
description:
Little ducks is a child’s first board game.

In this hilarious and colorful game each player helps his/her little duck onto the island to enjoy the sunshine by rolling the dice. The first one to reach the island is the winner. High-quality pieces guarantee that all young ones enjoy playing with these little ducks

name: Tumblewords
description:
From the Invisible City Productions website:

Tumblewords: It's like a cross between Scrabble and Connect Four.

On your turn, Place a tile from your hand in a vacant space at the top of a column. That tile 'falls' down the column until it reaches the bottom or lands on another tile.

Look for words that can be formed that use the tile you just played. Words can read up, down, left. or right, but must be in a straight line. Score one point for every letter in each word you find; palindromes count twice. If your tile set has blank or 'wild' tiles, declare what letter the blank represents when you play it. That tile continues to represent that letter for the rest of the game.

When you feel that you've found all the words you can, draw a tile and end your turn. Play passes to your left.

The game ends when there are no vacant spaces on the board.

Board and rules are available here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/119/tumblewords

Online Play

Super Duper Games
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Grand Speculation
description:
In the words of the designer:

"This is speculation on a grand scale where the future of Australia hinges on a takeover race between the Financial Superpowers of the World."

6 nations are represented - Australia, Japan, USA, UK, France and Germany. Regardless of the number of players, one player (the best player) must be the "Australian Master Player."

Your aim is to take over Australia by buying up its riches and portfolios such as Iron & Steel, Major Banks and Government. Once you have accumulated enough wealth, you can pay the Grand Takeover Price to financially rule Australia.

The game comes with toy money in various million and billion dollar denominations. There are Stake counters (small shares) for each nation, and Supergrabs (giant shares). The board is mounted and represents the various portfolios you are trying to take over.Movement is controlled through the roll of 2 dice. There is also a Speculation deck, much like a Monopoly chance deck. Each player also gets a Kangaroo piece to move around the board.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Oh Wilderness
description:
Players answer questions to collect cards. If the question isn't answered, the person asking the question gets to keep the card. The person with the most cards at the end of the game wins. Questions fit into 4 basic categories; wilderness skills, plants, wildfire and land & sky.

The starting player is the person who has the best snacks, or knows the most constellations, or has never had poison oak.

name: Het Grote Basisschoolspel
description:
Essentially Trivial Pursuit for children. Question sets are made for different classes. The board has two sides: one for groups 3-4 and one for groups 5-8 of the Dutch 'Basisschool'.

It's very much like Trivial Pursuit, with a few added options.

name: Hockey Night in Canada Trivia Game
description:
From the publisher's website:

So you think you know hockey? Test your hockey trivia knowledge with this action-packed, interactive board game for two or more players. Featuring 3150 challenging hockey trivia questions in six exciting categories: History, Playoffs, Names, Records, Numbers, Firsts and a Junior category for hockey fans of all ages. Collect six trivia rings as you circle the arena to become hockey trivia Champion. But be careful that your opponents don’t body check you in an attempt to delay your quest for victory and your claim to Hockey Trivia Supremacy!

name: Spongebob Squarepants Bikini Bottom Book of Games
description:
From the back: "It's time for the Bikini Bottom Games! You can join in the events with five cool games. Four are based on favorite Spongebob Squarepants episodes and one is inspired by the Spongebob Movie. Are you ready to hunt for pirate treasure? Or avoid some fishing hooks? Spongebob, Patrick, Squidward, and Sandy are- they've been training all year and are ready to take on the competition, Let's go!"

This is a board book that contains five kids' games, small plastic figures of Spongebob, Patrick, Squidward, and Sandy, and a die. Best of all, the die is in a pop-a-matic bubble and the pieces store in a plastic case built into the book. The games are:

Road Trip
Hooky
Argh!
Sandy's Rocket
Mrs. Puff's Boating School
categories: Children's Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: UNO: Fantastic Four
description:
Standard Uno using a Fantastic Four theme.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "N-Zone" card. When played the player who plays it selects another player to draw cards from the draw pile until a red card is drawn. When the selected players draws a red card, he/she must place it on the discard pile. The player who played the N-Zone card determines the color to be played in the next round by announcing his/her choice of red, yellow, green or blue, despite that there will be red card on the top of the discard pile. The N-Zone card can be played as a player's last card allowing him/her to go out of the game. If this happens, the player who plays the card still chooses a player to draw cards. The point value of the N-Zone card is 50 points.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Stalag Luft III: The Great Escape
description:
Stalag Luft III - The Great Escape, is Game system based on the true story of the mass breakout of Allied POWs from the German prisoner-of-war camp at Sagan in occupied Poland in 1944.

There are two versions of the game currently in progress.
The first is a table top game using a large fully detailed scale model of the camp - much like a wargame.

The second is simplified Boardgame version which is a strategy style of game.

The same 28mm (1/60th scale) metal miniatures are used for both versions of the game and are available from the Ebob Miniatures website: www.ebobminiatures.com

The rules for the table top game are still in development, however a working version of the boardgame is presented here for you to download and print out
categories: Bluffing, Exploration, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Polly Pottwal
description:
Try to catch as many fish as you can with the help of Paula.
On a Magnificent wooden board the whale is placed right in the middle. You have to use Paula on the edge of the board (wooden Pawn) and a string (connected to the whale) to catch the fish. This is much more difficult as you think, because you have to act under pressure of time.

There is an expert rule: Throw a die and catch only the fish of this certain color.

The author Robert F. Watson is better known on the BGG as robbirob.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Dinosaurs: The Game of Survival
description:
Another great children's game from Ravensburger, this one getting your dinosaur (one of four to choose from) past the volcanos, across the stone bridge, through the swamps to the feeding grounds. Last dino standing wins.
As with all Ravensburger games, this one has outstanding components. The dinosaurs are plastic and nicely detailed. One of the hazards is a nice sized plastic boulder. And, the box bottom is part of the gameboard. As usual, Ravensburger makes a game that should make US Publishers hang their heads in shame.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ohne Worte!
description: Players try to form words by playing a letter-card and using (at least) all the letters already on the table and the one just played. If anybody fails he has to take all the cards played so far and he starts a new word. After all cards have been played the player with the least cards taken wins.

name: Bratz Rock Angelz World Tour
description: This game is based on the Bratz DVD movie. Players portray the Bratz trying to save their magazine by traveling around the world (I.e. the game board) and performing rock concerts. The first player to collect 10k in cash is the winner.

name: Convoy
description:
Players take it in turns to run convoys of ships in partnerships. Two players are chosen by spinning the compass card to create a convoy. They become players 'North' and 'South'. All other players act individually to try and stop them.

A convoy is a running sequence of 4 'Merchantmen' cards and the 'Home' card. The merchantmen are numbered from 1-6 so there are 3 ways of making a convoy. The convoy has to be in North's hands to score, so North and South work together to realign their cards. When they have a convoy North calls 'Convoy' and the round ends.

Any other player (not North) can halt a round by declaring their hand when they have collected certain configurations. Other cards
include 'torpedoes', 'mines', 'cruisers', 'destroyers' and 'submarines'.

After adding up the points the winner is the first to 1000 points.
categories: Card Game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Magi
description:
Another version of UNO with twist and tricky cards.
Brilliant and charming illustrations of a fantasy theme.

There were three magic kingdomes (Yellow, Red and Blue) battling each other. Almost peaole belonged one of the kingdoms. But Magi (Great Magicians) were independent from any country. Thus Magi could make peace or flame up the wars.

Color of cards means suit belongs. And all playing cards have rank number.

There are three categories for Playing cards.

Guild cards: No distinctive feature. They have only color and rank.

Item cards: Defense or Attack cards for battle with another player.

Magi cards: Wild cards. Without color, but they have rank and Special Powers.

Object of each round is to get rid of your hand cards as quickly as possible. At the end of the round, your hand cards produce negative points.

The game continues until the first player accumulates negative 50 points.

name: Rattle Me Bones
description:
A spring-loaded dexterity game where players attempt to carefully remove various objects from a motorized, battery-operated, glow-in-the-dark skeleton without setting off the mechanism that causes the skeleton to shake & vibrate.

A spinner directs gameplay and indicates the appropriate piece which the player must attempt to remove from the skeleton on that turn. If the vibrating mechanism is tripped the player must replace the object that was spun.

When all objects have been removed from the skeleton the game is over. The winner is the player who removed the most objects from the skeleton successfully.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Humor, Pirates
publishers: Ideal, MB Jeux, MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley, Tyco

name: Battle of the Slag Hills
description:
The final battle of the "War of the Ring." This is the march on the gates of Mordor undertaken as a diversion to buy time for Frodo and Sam to achieve the ultimate goal: destruction of the One Ring. The Mordor player wins if he is able to destroy all units of the Gondor player within 9 game turns.

This is a mini game included with the "The Siege of Minas Tirith"

name: Cold Harbor
description:
Panzerschreck Magazine #3

(Fall 1999) Cold Harbor (solitaire tactical American Civil War). Small map, 66 counters, rules. Description: The player (Union) makes a frontal assault against Confederate positions in the hope of achieving a breakthrough.

name: Sixty-two Dice Games
description:
The name of this set of 20 specialty dice and a rule booklet is something of a hyperbole, because there are really 12 distinct games plus 50 state games that together really equal one game, for an actual total of 13 games.

The games are as follows:


Train - Uses 6 special train car dice. Build your train with a locomotive, a caboose, and the highest value freight cars you can while avoiding "train wrecks" and "equipment shortages". Essentially a variant of Ship, Captain and Crew (below).



States Game - Uses 4 special dice numbered 2 through 6 with a USA symbol replacing the number 1. Roll the 4 dice and use the numbers showing to calculate the numbers 1 through 50 (ordinal state numbers), with the USA symbol serving as a joker.



Poker Dice - Uses 5 poker dice (faces showing Ace, King, Queen, Jack, 10, and 9). Roll the dice to get the highest poker hand.



Bar Dice - Uses 5 standard dice. Roll the dice to get the highest poker hand.



Cover the Board - Uses 2 standard dice. A little like multi-player Shutbox.



Buck Dice - Uses 3 standard dice. A little like Old Maid, but with dice.



Sequences - Uses 3 standard dice. Roll the dice and try to get the highest-scoring sequence(s) of numbers.



Accumulation - Uses 2 standard dice. Roll the dice and try not to reach the sum of 41.



Horse - Uses 5 standard dice. Roll the dice and try to get the highest N-of-a-kind.



C-Low - Uses 3 standard dice. Roll the dice and try to earn 5 points by getting the highest value hands.



Craps - Uses 2 standard dice. A highly simplified, turn-based form of standard craps.



Ship, Captain and Crew - Uses 5 standard dice. Roll the dice and get the highest number of "cargo points" after give "voyages".



Kaput - Uses 5 standard dice. Roll the dice and try to get the highest total without rolling 2s or 5s.

name: Extreme Snowboard
description:
From the box: "The Extreme Snowboard game rockets you to the top of the mountain for high-flying tricked-out competition."

The game utilizes a battery-powered ramp to launch plastic snowboarder miniatures onto a 3-foot tall "mountain", and players attempt to land their figures in the highest scoring targets. The mountain's targets can be reconfigured in many ways to make the game easier or harder, and the launch ramp can be aimed however the players prefer.

name: Strategy Golf
description:
From the back of the box:

Love to play cards? Love to play golf?

Now you can do both with STRATEGY GOLF. The first game to combine the fun of cards with the challenge of golf.

With STRATEGY GOLF, your cards are your clubs. Every player is dealt ten cards before each hole. By using the distance charts, players must strategically plan out what cards they are going to use to reach the green and putt into the hole.

But don't count your birdies before they hatch. Because if you match cards with another player, you lose yardage. This could put you at the bottom of a lake or deep in the sand.

Whatever happens, you'll probably have to think quick and come up with a new plan of action.

The best part is, you don't have to be a golfer to win at STRATEGY GOLF. You just have to play your cards right.

Components:
- Deck of cards (standard)
- Score Pad
- Distance Charts (4)
- Mounted board depicting a 9-hole course
- Player markers (4 golf tees)
- Pncil (1)
- Rulebook (3 pages - includes Beginner, Intermediate and Professional rules)
mechanics: Hand Management, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: At the Beach
description:
Content:
27 picture cards, 4 value stones, 1 pawn, 1 dog, board

In this game a young boy walks around the strand and looks to see what he can discover there. When he meets his girlfriend he has to tell what he has seen.
The winner is the player who first reaches the field with the sun with his value stone.

Each turn players get tiles with pictures of common beach objects, and each turn they try to remember, in order, the previous tiles they have seen. Remembering correctly earns you points, and the first to 11 points wins.

name: The Little Wooden Train Game
description:
translated from Dutch cover:
Choo Choo, The train is about to leave!

All aboard? The passengers have lost their luggage at different stations and the players have to help them find their luggage. This is achieved by traveling by train from station to station. Good memory may help you find your luggage. The player who is the first to find his or her three pieces of luggage wins.
mechanics: Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Piatnik, Saenggak Plus Edu, Tactic, Toot Toot Toys

name: Trivagory
description: Two types of categories, alphabet and general, make up the 99 different trivia categories. Players try to reach one of the four finish spaces on the center circle and answers the general category question correctly wins.

name: Kellogg's Professional Basketball
description:
From the rules: "If you don't know or understand basketball, this game will teach you. If you do know basketball, this game will be a challenge to your knowledge and ability."

Simplistic playing card driven game. I believe I got the games from Pop-Tart boxes. I am aware of 8 games in the series.

name: DHV Round 2
description:
Drinking. History. Violence. The wax museum bar brawl league heats up as new challengers enter the fray. Round 2 includes Atomic Emancipator and Helen Killer, and can be combined with DHV Round 1 to support up to 4 players.

As the attacker, play attacks, struggles, or booze, and the defender plays defends, struggles, or boozes.

Alternate cards until one player chooses to pass, wherein all the cards are resolved in reverse order.

Some cards will be blocked, some cards will be enhanced or reduced based on what was played, and many cards will deal damage to the opponent.

Refill your hand, reverse roles, and continue until sober.

Available from RobotMartini.com.

Combines with:

DHV Round 1

name: Inflatable Monopoly
description: Inflatable Monopoly contains original cards, money and metal pieces in a handy carry case. Approx. size when inflated 700mm x 700mm x 300mm.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Head to Head Sudoku Game
description:
From the Manufacturer: Battle against a friend with Cardinal's Head To Head Sudoku Game. Choose from three levels of difficulty and compete against the clock to see who comes out on top.
Game includes:
-100 puzzles & solutions
-2 game boards
-162 number tiles
-Timer
-Head to head divider

name: The Ultimate Dice Game Compendium
description: The Ultimate Dice Game Compendium is a collection of dice games compiled by Reiner Knizia. Although advertised as containing "over 40 games", it actually contains 35 games plus 8 variants. The set contains a rulebook plus dice and accessories. It contains all the classic favourites including Poker Dice, Macro, Drop Dead, Chicago, Tit for Tat, Double Trouble, and Ninety Nine. Original designs by Reiner Knizia are: Double Trouble, Hunter, Katego, Matches, Tit for Tat, and Triple Poker.

name: Giro d'Italia
description:
Giro d'Italia is a bike racing game for 3 to 4 players.

The board depicts a race track that is 40 hexes long and 3-4 hexes wide. Each player has 4 playing pieces, 4 speed cards (numbered 3, 5, 6, and 8), and 3 chips.

The game is played over one round. It simulates a real bike race which includes effects like slipstreaming and blocking. Movement is handled with the 4 speed cards, where all 4 cards must be assigned to one of the 4 playing pieces. The speed can be increased by slipstreaming or by sacrificing chips. In the middle and end of the race, chips are won by the first three arrivals. The winner of the game is the player with the most chips at the end.

Originally published in spielbox 1991 #3 as part of the "Spiel im Heft/Game in the zine" series.

name: Fargerally
description:
'Fargerally' (Color Rally) is a children's game consisting of two phases:

Phase 1: Collect six meeples of different colors and place in your racing car.
Phase 2: Race your car to the finish line.

The dice are used both to collect meeples and to advance the cars to the next square of matching colors.

Contents:

- Game board
- Four wooden racing cars
- 24 meeples in six colors
- Two colored dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Befudiom
description:
From Rachel Mason's 05/27/2007 article in the Gwinnett Daily Post:

"In the game, players try to identify idioms, like 'taking candy from a baby' or 'kick the bucket,' in one of four ways. Depending on the roll of the die, players can act out a saying with charades, sketch it on a piece of paper, spell it out in a hangman-like game, or shout it with spoken clues."

name: Microwars V-1.0
description:
Drakons and Gödenors fight for the conquer of space. Due to a the simultaneous explosion of several stars, the universe collides in only one dimension.

Drakons are oviparous and enormous. They gather in developed communities, with high technology. Their strength and aggressiveness is remarkable.

Gödenors haven't a special natural strength but a high level of intelligence, becoming one of the most dangerous races in the world.

Both races have met, unfortunately, and so have created two forces that will fight to the death for the control of the new world, to conquer a new place to live and improve.

Drakon's force is commanded by Clain, the Manan, and is composed by two Dux-Manan and Atter-Manan, Arnor and Cowtor which have in charge three expert Mereos: Sunno, Cornex and Artak. Gödenors have the same forces in their side: Arco(Manan), Daro(Dux-Manan), Rotx(Atter-Manan) and the Mereos(Sazzer, Preto y Malk).

The goal of the game is to conquer the opposite military base. It's achieved by getting one the characters to the mountainous enemy base.

Each of the characters have different attributes that can be used in combat against enemy creatures.

Each player starts with only the Manan and will get through the different places by throwing a dice. Your forces could be increased by gathering new soldiers and getting additional powers, all of these using cards, supplied in Oracle squares. Other special squares will grant you access to mountains (Climbing) or get you frozen (Dimensional Door).

To stop enemy forces in their advance to your base, you can attack them with your ground forces, by placing them adjacent or by using the heavy artillery placed in mountains. Artillery will give you the opportunity to fire one of the missiles, trying to knock down opposing forces.

There are additional powers attained through extra cards.
categories: Adventure, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Skid-O
description:
One of the scarce editions from the so-called Pepys "Double Feature Games".

As with most of the Pepys games there are cards (50), but added is a game mat of paper (enforced with raw canvas on the back) and 6 cardboard speedway riders on wooden stands.

Aim of the game is to round the course the quickest with your rider, trying to block your opponent, just like in real speedway.

Players use their different cards (a hand of 7) to funnel out the best combinations, as the cards have different movement value which can be combined with other cards to more advantage.

Before game starts, players have to agree the number of track rounds they play (4 is the number in real speedway).
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Wo bist du, heller Mond?
description: A memory game for children Ages 4 and up. Players turn over wooden pieces with either images or golden stars on it. While collecting pairs, turning over stars let the moon rise higher on the board. The player owning the most pairs when the moon reaches the top of the sky wins the game.

name: Zagadki Smoka Obiboka
description:
"Riddles of Lazybones the Dragon" - as the title translates to English - is a children trivia game. The game contains 135 cards with rhymed riddles on one side and pictures showing the answer . For correct answers players get tokens with appropriate drawings on. The owner of most tokens wins.

Sequel:

Nowe Zagadki Smoka Obiboka

name: Wizardology: Spells and Potions
description:
From the back of the game:

"Unleash your Wizardology skills to become Master Wizard in Spells and Potions, the Wizardology Card Game. Use amulets, spells, and potions to find out who is the most powerful wizard of all. Team up with another wizard to collect the most points and win the game - magic!"

Spells and Potions is a partnership trick-taking game played with a deck of cards ranked 1 to 10 in four suits (representing the four elements, of which Fire is trump). There are also 12 Spells and Potions cards which change the rules of the game in various ways.

name: Banana Split
description:
In Banana Split, you want to complete as many ice cream orders as can, especially the valuable banana splits! To set up the game, shuffle the ice cream order deck, then reveal four cards. Shuffle the ingredient deck, and deal each player five cards, which they place behind their screens. On a turn, a player can:


Draw one card from the ingredient deck.
Take one ice cream order and play ingredients on it.
Add one or more ingredient cards to an order already in front of you.


When you play ingredients on an order, you must play exactly as many as are on the card and in the order listed, from top to bottom. When you play the final ingredient on an order, place that card aside as you'll score its point value at the end of the game. Banana split orders can't be built upon turn by turn, but must be claimed all in one go, either by playing all four ingredients at the same time or discarding one wild card ingredient. Special ingredient cards let you steal an ice cream order in progress or take an extra turn.

Once all the ice cream orders have been fulfilled, players tally their scores to see who wins.

name: Harrow
description:
From the Paizo website:
Divine your future! Lose your shirt! All in one box!

In the Pathfinder Chronicles campaign setting, the Harrow deck has long been a sacred tool of Varisian fortunetellers. In skilled hands, the Harrow deck can predict crop results, divine the gender of your unborn child, or give hints about your immediate future. In unskilled hands, the Harrow deck is a sacrilegious gambling game—a cutthroat diversion for ruffians in every port to lose their hard-earned fortunes.

Harrow will be featured throughout the second Pathfinder Adventure Path, Curse of the Crimson Throne. At least once in each installment, players may divine their futures with the Harrow deck, and Pathfinder #7 contains an in-depth article about the history of Harrow and its in-game use.

Harrow is also a standalone card game designed by Jason Bulmahn, Mike Selinker, and Teeuwynn Woodruff for use inside or outside the Pathfinder Chronicles campaign setting. Harrow is lavishly illustrated by Kyle Hunter, the artist behind Downer: Wandering Monster and Downer: Fool's Errand, the Paizo Comics compilations of Kyle's original Downer comics from Dungeon magazine.

This item also has an entry on RPGG: Harrow Deck

name: Der Aktionär
description:
Content:
100 share-cards
8 cash cards

The players try by skillful trading and exchanging to get as many shares of the company as possible.
The more shares you own, the higher is your total value.

name: Vem vet vad?
description: A card game where players shall say things which starts with a particular letter on a card, that the player before has played. The player has succeeded when the answer is correct or another player is laughing.

name: When Pigs Fly
description:
From the Publisher:

Blast-off into “Hog Heaven” and make the impossible; possible in the game When Pigs Fly. Keep the kids squealing for hours when pigs are launched out of a cannon high into the sky, soaring in the clouds. On each turn, players send a pig flying, add a pig to their pen, or give one of their pigs to another player. The first person to get rid of all their pigs is the winner. Includes 12 pigs, motorized spinning game board and instructions.

name: Monopoly: Kiel
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Kiel, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: VR Troopers Game
description:
From the back of the box:

"He's nasty! He's mean! He's Grimlord, the power-hungry master of virtual reality. And he's about to launch a deadly attack on the real world. Only you can stop him!

You and your friends must transform into VR Troopers and enter the mysterious world of virtual reality - just like on the exciting TV show! Toss the battle dice top smash the sinister Skugs. Your powers increase as you defeat them. Then fight the fiendish robot mutant General Ivar! But watch out! He'll stop at nothing to destroy you!

Only the bravest VR Troupers can defeat Grimlord's evil army and win the game. Will it be you?"

Unlike most other games, the three VR warriors in the game are shared by the players. Each turn, the active player throws a die to decide which (red, yellow or green) trooper he controls this time, and then battle a Skug on their way to the penultimate battle, General Ivar.

Battles are done by tossing dice into a battle arena. Someone plays the Skug and tosses one die, hoping for a hit (50% chance), and then the active player tosses a die to get a hit as well. Play continues with 2 more dice on each side , one at a time. The dexterity comes in that you can try to hit your opponent's 'hit' die or your own 'miss' die to switch the result. Ties go to the active player.

There is some skill in tossing the dice to change results, but because you cannot control which VR warrior you will assumer on your turn, the game comes down mainly to luck. Winning battlers earns you a power chip (with a VR glasses wearing dog on it), which will allow you a reroll in the final battle (which is a toss of 4 dice at once, so dexterity plays no role here), while losing a battle loses you the same number of accumulated power chips.

There's no doubt this is a kid's game for fans of the TV show. Still, the components are fairly nice and the battle arena mechanic is well done.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Monopoly: Dominick's Collector's Edition
description: This edition of monopoly was sold in Dominick's Stores in the Chicago Area from 2006-2007. The board consists of spaces related to the grocery store chain and it's subsidiaries.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Bordeaux
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Bordeaux, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Das Kabinett des Königs
description:
A game contained in Spielbox #86 (Feb/Mar 2009)
Players must supply nine markers in each of two colors and a figure to use for the king.
(rough translation from description)
The Cabinet of Kings
A new king has come to power. He must recruit the best members of society for his cabinet. Who will get the most valuable seats in the cabinet.

This game is for two players who either place potential cabinet members on the board or move the king to recruit members. Some spots in the cabinet are worth more points than others, so players attempt to grab the best seats for their candidates, but cannot give up too many of the less valuable ones.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Worker Placement

name: Learning to Listen Pizza Palace Game
description:
From the box:
"Life lessons that last
Pepperoni, eggs, stinky socks - you never know what toppings your customers will order at the Noodleboro Pizza Palace. That's why in this game it's important for kids to listen and pay attention to orders before heading into the kitchen. Orders up!"

name: Apfelhexe
description:
In this HABA game,each player tries to be the first to collect five apples. There is a special die with three different side:

Green spot: Hide an apple under the table.
Red Spot: Hide the Apple Witch.
Magpie: Helps players to steal other players apple.


Choose a player and try to steal him an apple or the witch.
If this player doesn't have anything, you must give him an apple.

name: Pssst!
description:
The animal babies have fallen asleep. The winner is the player who first collects four complete animal families or plays his last card.

Game play: The starting player plays a baby animal, then the other players may either say “psst, baby is asleep” and start a new deck with a baby card, or place a card onto the first deck, the mother on the baby card, the father on the mother card, and the grandmother on the father card. When the grandmother card is placed the player makes the corresponding animal noise and takes the complete family. A player who cannot place a card must draw an additional card.

From the back of the box of Chut! Le Petit Dort

English: (Translated)

The animals are having a party. During the party, families have lost sight of each other, but now: Shhh! the children are sleeping. Every mother is looking for her child, every father for his wife and even grandmother is running around to find everyone else!

The goal: Be the first to have 4 families reunited or play your last card.

French:

Les Animaux font la fête. Dans le tumulte, les familles se sont perdues de vue, mais Chut! les petits étainent fatiguèus et se sont endormis. Maintenant, chaque maman cherche son petit, chaque papa la maman et pour terminer la grand-mére cherche tout le monde.

Le but du jeu: Être le premier à rassembler quatre familles d'animaux, ou bien à poser sa derniére carte.

name: NFL Gamebreaker Trivia
description:
Play an entire football game by answering trivia questions about the NFL. More than 1,500 trivia questions assure you variety. Play offense, defense, and special teams. Test your knowledge of gridiron strategy. Enjoy authentic football game piece and scoreboard.

Product Description:
Excalibur NFL Game Breaker Trivia - Dominate NFL Game Breaker Trivia with your knowledge of football players and history. Choose your play, answer the questions and march down the field! Your opponent won't just watch from the sidelines. Armed with a set of defensive cards, the "D" will be busy trying to predict what the offense will do. The right choices will make the difference! Watch out for the Game Breaker! These cards change the momentum of the game in the blink of an eye. NFL knowledge and strategy will determine the outcome of this game!


NFL GameTime Trivia Game
Play an entire football game by answering trivia questions about the NFL
More Than 1,500 trivia questions assure you variety
Play offense, defense, and special teams
Test your knowledge of gridiron strategy/enjoy authentic football game piece and scoreboard

name: Pallanguli
description: The board has 14 cups and each player is controlling seven. Six seeds are placed in each cup. The game is over when a player is unable to fill any cups with six seeds at the end of a round.

name: Welt der Bücher
description: A Trivia game about literature and books in general. Its a multiple-choice-game with the additional twist that more than one answer can be correct. The players can pick as many answers as they want and if they get all correct get 1 point per answer. One wrong answer however and you end up with zero points.

name: True Soccer Hero
description:
True Soccer Hero is a two-player fantasy soccer board game of clever management of players on the field, tight score difference, and an always fun easy-to-teach game of soccer. Managers (the players) must carefully plan their tactic on getting pass through the defence and eventually score a goal. The game take about 15+ minutes of intense and exciting game of soccer.

True Soccer Hero is a print-and-play game in which managers taking turns roll the dice and based on the given result managers make a clever strategy that can get pass through the opposition goal line.

All you need to play True Soccer Hero is:


1d6 (or 1 die)
The game components (which can be download at the download section below)
The rule book (it is a two-page rule fill with pictured example)
The board which is the field

name: Eine Chance für die Liebe
description:
In this game the players guess on erotic related questions. There are three different types of questions.

1: From Me To You
questions like: "Do I think marriage is a reasonable way of living?" or "Do you think I need jealousy to be really in love?"

2: To Everybody
questions like: "Which one of us would get so jealous to smash a valuable vase against the wall?" or "Which one of us has probably had the longest love night?"

3: Who Knows It
mutiple choice questions like: "Since when does the phrase sex-appeal exist?" or "the longest kiss has been recorded in 1972. How long did it last?"

The players receive points for correct answers. The player with the most points after 15 rounds wins the game.

name: Circulo
description:
Circulo is the world's first 4-in-1 circular strategy game; featuring four challenging games the whole family will enjoy, we're sure Circulo will become a favorite in your home for years to come!

4-in-a-Row: Players try to be the first to make a line of four tiles of their color in any direction to win!

Pipe Connections: The first player to complete a continuous pipe is the winner!

4 Letter Words: The first player to create a four letter word in any direction is the winner!

Sum of the Squares: The first player to line up tiles adding up to a total of seven is the winner!

Contents: 1 Circulo Game Tube with Cap, 1 Set of Pipe Connections Tiles, 1 Set of 4-in-a-Row Tiles, 1 Set of 4 Letter Words Tiles, 1 Set of Sum of the Squares Tiles
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Educational, Number, Puzzle, Word Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Palagonia
description:
Palagonia is an alternative game played with Palago tiles, but it is not at all a variant of Palago. Palago is a two player perfect information abstract, Palagonia is a game of luck, creativity and co-operation for 3 to 5 players.

Players add tiles to a central pattern to form closed shapes which are called "creatures". The roll of the dice may cause tiles to be removed or rotated as well. When a creature is formed, the player and the previous player score points based on the size and complexity of the creature. When the tiles run out, the player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Electronic Toss Across
description:
Jazz up your game play! Add cool lights and sounds with this electronic take on your favorite classics. Play eight great games including the original Toss Across tic-tac-toe, Darts, 4 Corners, "X" Marks the Spot, and more. Plus, mix it up by playing on the floor or on the wall!

* For game nights, rainy days, anytime!
* A slick, ultra-modern design
* Comes with six bean bags
* For one to three players

Re-implements:

Toss Across

name: Alexander the Great: The Battle of Issa
description:
Part of the Age of Battles: Napeonic Wars – Rulebook (3rd Edition) table-top miniatures gaming system using 1/72 scale miniatures, The Battle of Issa replays Alexander's attempt to defeat Darius and his Persian army.

Alexander the Great: The Battle of Issa
This box contains 4 complete kits:
Zvezda – 8019 – Macedonian Phalanx (Complete Box)
Zvezda – 8007 – Macedonian Cavalry (Complete Box)
Zvezda – 8006 – Persian Infantry (Complete Box)
Zvezda – 8008 – Persian Chariot and Cavalry

From the back of the box:
The military-historic game "The Battle of Issa" is based on the events that took place in Syria in October 333 BC in the valley between mountains and the sea. Two armies of Alexander the Great and Darius of Persia met. The Macedonial cavalry and phalanx crossed the river under Persian arrows and made the Persian king and all his army flee.

This game is for 2-6 players. The enemy armies led by the players meet near the bay of Issa, in the valley of the Pinar river. Battle characteristics of the armies are close to the reality.Tactic maneuvering are very important in the game. Under a skillful leader a smaller army can defeat numerous enemies. You can either recreate the historic battle or change the course of the fight. Anyway you should rely not only on the number of your army but also on your leadership and war skills.

Zvezda 8205
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Nederland Speelt; Hollandsche Helden
description:
Memory-, Domino- and quizgame in one, about everything Dutch! 'Kaaskop', 'Klompendans', 'Tulp', 'Trekdrop', 'Hinkelen' and 'Haasje-over'. With 50 authentic photo's and 90 'Orange'-quenstions!

Contents:
25 Photocards with 50 photo's
15 Quizcards with 90 questions

This is a nice party game, where players need to remember parts of the typical Dutch pictures, answer typical dutch questions and try to combine the remembered pictures. The player who combines four pictures to make one wins!
Tiles are, facing down, spread out on the table. Every turn a player turns a card face up, showing parts of 4 different pictures. The player has to answer a typical dutch question. Answer correct; you may have the tile. Wrong answer; the tile has to be turned down again. Then it's the next players turn.

When a player collects the 4 pieces to complete a picture he/she is the winner and gets the title of 'Dutch Expert' ;)

name: Die Pioniere (fan expansion for The Settlers of Catan)
description:
Unofficial expansion of Settlers of Catan.

A set of 32 unique "Pioneers" cards that affect game play from the start of the game.

Each player is given three random "Pioneers" cards before the game begins and chooses one to keep. The effects of the chosen card lasts throughout the entire game for the particular player who chose the card.

The Pioneers card that a player chooses can be a two edged-sword; the card can be anything from "The Sailors" where the player is only able to build ships, but victory is now 2 victory points less than the game's usual number of victory points, to being able to control your opponents for a cost; "The Beggars" gets to extort a resource of their choice from any player who wishes to build a settlement or city. If the builder refuses (or can't) pay the owner of "The Beggars" card, the builder cannot build the settlement or city. In exchange for this power, "The Beggars" victory is now 1 point more than usual.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

Die Pioniere: http://www.poeppelkiste.de/catan/pioniere/pioniere.htm
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Negotiation, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Коммерсантъ.Деньги
description:
From the publisher's website:

In a rich metropolis once gave way to the mayor. But the city lives its life - and not all free sites are allocated for construction. Former market participants dropped out of the game along with his patron, and the young developers have a unique chance to do business in one of the largest cities in the world.

Players try himself in the role of developers - they have to build up the metropolis of office and shopping centers. Cells of the game board is a place under construction. On each of them may appear a skyscraper or a few shopping centers. Skyscrapers are built together, and income from them is shared between the players. And every mall belongs to only one party, however, the management control center - can be intercepted.

In addition to the "developers", the game involved two independent characters: each construction project can visit both Inspector and the Leader of the Nation (Vladimir Putin). And then to predict the progress of construction is absolutely impossible. Business intrigue and unpredictable actions of officials, the exact calculation and the sudden success - in the game "Коммерсантъ. ДЕНЬГИ" (Businessman.MONEY). Actions of the participants are illustrated with photographs from the archives of the newspaper Kommersant.

Reiner Knizia's original name for the game was Money! Money! Money! Some elements of the published game were added by the publisher.
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Non-Trivial Quest
description:
From the game publisher:

Non-Trivial Quest is "the IMPORTANT Game of Life" because it is an educational game that allows us to learn and discuss all the things that will help us to lead successful, happy, and healthy lives. The goal of the game is to make it interesting and fun to think, to remember, and to learn.

The game is played by each player selecting one of the 6 categories of trivia questions based on the dice results of 2 six-sided dice. If the player provides the correct answer, their pawn pieces moves towards the finish line.

A few variations of the game allow for more complex scoring to either increase or decrease the game speed.

name: UNO Reflex
description: UNO Reflex Game: UNO reflex brings fast, fun action to the classic game of UNO. Race to match the colored light one of two ways: in Reflex mode, race to play the color first, in Wild mode use your skills to select the color you want. Includes the electronic UNO Reflex unit, 108 cards and instructions. For 2 to 10 players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Electronic, Party Game

name: Poker Patience
description:
These are the rules to a playing card game that, at the time, was a craze. It was the Magic The Gathering of its day.

The game is played solitaire but can be played by any number "For Progressive Parties", so says the publisher.

The game is played on a 5 x 5 grid. The dealer deals himself 25 playing cards, face-down. If it is being played by more than one, then everyone must have their own pack of cards but they do not deal themselves 25 cards from it. The dealer takes the first card from his stack and announces it to the other players. They then find the declared card in their deck. Now all players simultaneously add it to their own grid. Once one card has been played there are limitations on where the next card can go. The second card must be placed adjacent to the one card already in the grid, vertically, horizentally or diagonall. The third card must be so placed but this will have a little more choice because there is a block of two cards which you can adjoin. And so the game goes on until everyone has a block of 5 x 5 cards, 25 in total.

The scoring is now counted. Remember, everyone had the same cards, but it is very unlikely that more than one player will have the same grid. The object is to score points by building up Poker hands, 10 in total, 5 across and 5 down.
The scores are;
One Pair 1 point
Two Pairs 3 pts.
Flush 5 pts.
Three of a king 6 pts.
Full Hand 10 pts (Nowadays we would call this a Full House)
Straight 12 pts.
Four of a Kind 16 pts.
Straight Flush 30 pts.
publishers: Chas Goodall & Sons Ltd, Dal Negro, De La Rue, Messrs. Edward Mortimer, The International Card Company
