name: Race For The Cup
description:
Subtitled: "An America's Cup Yacht Race Game"

Box Description:

"Race For The Cup" is a fun and exciting game about America's Cup Yacht racing. But you don't have to be a "Yachtie" to play!

Suitable for 2-6 players it's just like real Yacht Racing involving both luck and judgement.

Before the actual race starts each player accumulates assets (cash and insurance) then the race beings. Players sail their yachts around the America's Cup course trying to avoid problems and taking advantage of windfalls. The first yacht across the line is the winner!"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Erudition
description:
Erudition™ jump-starts the road to reading. The game takes players on a fun adventure through literacy land, complete with common land marks and street signs. You will enjoy an ice cream cone, encounter a construction site, ride a train and play on a playground. Recognize a sight word and you earn a bonus roll. Be the first player to reach the library and you are a winner!

The sight word game cards represent about 50% of all English text. Game cards are categorized by reading level so children of all ages can play together. Through interaction with sight words, new readers enhance their reading skills while playing a fun game.

Game cards are categorized to promote differentiated instruction so children of all reading levels can play together! They choose from one of four game cards:

26 blue game cards – upper and lower case letters and their consonant and short vowel sounds
94 green game cards – beginner level sight words
95 yellow game cards – intermediate level sight words
95 red game cards – advanced level sight words
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Alias: Extra Cards 2
description:
Second expansion for popular game Alias.
This expansion adds 200 new cards for the game Alias, but this time the cards are for the new version of the classic Alias, which have both sides, one with 4 words, one with 8 words.

These cards only go for the new version of the Alias.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Point to Point Movement, Race, Team-Based Game

name: Frog Game
description:
The object of Frog game is to be the player to use your Frog to catch as many balls as possible. The player catching the most balls wins the game.

Contents:

1 Plastic game base
4 Plastic frogs with levers
24 Plastic marbles

name: Uno: Super Bowl XL Steelers Special Edition
description:
A Special Edition of Uno the successful commercial version of crazy eights that is dedicated to The Super Bowl XL champion Pittsburgh Steelers.
Includes Exclusive MVP Card (Hines Ward) and rule.
When an MVP card is played the person who played it chooses another player to draw cards from the draw pile until he gets an 8 or a 6 (based on Hines Ward's uniform number of 86) or has reached five cards drawn if no 8 or 6 comes up.
If an 8 or 6 is drawn it is put into the discard pile and the person who played the MVP card chooses the color to continue playing with regardless of last card played to the discard pile.
The MVP card can be used as a player's last card allowing him/her to go out of the game. if this happens a player to draw must still be chosen. The MVP card is worth 50 points.

name: Maldoria
description:
Maldoria is a cooperative adventure game for 2 to 6 players inspired by the Croatian legend of the Black Queen.

The gameplay takes place on a modular board build from 30 tiles that represents an underground maze under Zagreb. Players encounter and fight various monsters and collect the keys that will enable them to escape the evil queen Maldoria.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Think: Namen & Gesichter
description:
Another game of the Ravenburger Think Series. You could train your ability to remember names and hobbies of people you meet at a"party".
Everyone gets a number of people with their faces,names and hobbies. Then you roll and move around all the person from all players. When you hit a person for the first time you read aloud the name and the hobby of the person. being the second on a person´s portrait urges you to tell the name and the hobby.
Game when the 6th champaign bottle (on the die) was rolled

name: Critical Hit! - Volume 6, No. 1
description:
Volume 6, No. 1 of Critical Hit's ASL magazine, featuring articles and scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader.

The following articles are included:
- Arnhem: The Third Bridge (designer's notes for the ASL module of the same name)
- Tumult from the Skies (ASL air support rules explained)
- Tasty SALSA! (an article about the SALSA SASL computer program)
- Shout for PIATS (strategy article for that scenario)
- Carnage at Cassino (an introduction to that ASL module)

The following scenarios are included:
CH101: IN THE RUINS OF A CHURCH; 7 July 1944; Äyrapää, Finland
CH102: THE CAUQUIGNY BRIDGEHEAD; 6 June 1944; Cauquigny, Normandy, France
CH103: A SPLENDID COUNTERATTACK; 25 May 1940; North of Deynze, Belgium
CH104: SHOUT FOR PIATS; 27 June 1944; Le Haut du Bosq, Normandy, France
CH105: WIDE DIAMOND; 28 June 1944; Grainville-sur-Odon, Normandy, Frrance
CH106: THE BREAKTHROUGH; 28 June 1944; South of Grainville-sur-Odon, Normandy, France
CH107: TUMULT FROM THE CLOUDS; 9 April 1940; Sola-Stavenger, Norway
CH108: ASSAULT ON A PARTISAN HOME BASE (generic solitaire mission)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: White Elephant: Mystery Box Promo Cards
description:
This promo includes seven "Mystery Box" cards and was only available through Kickstarter during the project to fund the "White Elephant" card game.

Mystery Box Rules


Deal Gift Cards to each player according to the rules in the standard game, then deal one Mystery Box card to each player. Players keep this card until their turn to be the starting player.
Each player simultaneously places one Gift Card from their hand face-down in the center of the table as in the standard game. The starting player (the player who will select the first gift of this party) places his or her Mystery Box card face up on top of their own Gift Card. This gift is now the "Mystery Box" gift for this round.
The game continues as normal with the exception that when a player selects the Mystery Box gift they do not “open” it by turning it over. The gift may be selected and stolen like any other gift without being revealed.
When the round is over and each player has a gift, the player with the Mystery Box gift may now look at the Gift Card without revealing it to the other players. The player, the only one who knows the color and number of that card, tucks it face-down under his or her Gift List Card. The Mystery Box card used this round may now be discarded.
The next round resumes with the new starting player using his or her Mystery Box card.


Rules Updates (12/09/2011)

When played as written in the current rules, the Mystery Boxes usually didn't hold very good presents. Therefore, the designer (Brian Kelley) suggests that you follow the current rules, except for these changes:


Before looking at their cards players randomly select one of the cards dealt to them to be their Mystery Box gift, keeping it face down.
Players place their Mystery Box card on top of this selected card without looking at it.
The Mystery Boxes are then kept close to each player until it is their turn to select a gift first, and then they are the ones who bring the Mystery Box to the "party."

name: Fodboldspillet Onside
description:
Sportsgame, football (soccer)

Play a season in the Danish Superliga (known as Faxekondi Ligaen, when the game was released).

Goal of the game: To finish as #1 in the league.

Through comparing dice rolls with stats on the fielded football-players, the gameplayers move the players up and down the gameboard (football field) and hopefully score goals (just like a real football match).

In the off-season gameplayers can transfer their players and buy better players for their team.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: Erlangen
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Erlangen, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Bonn
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Bonn, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Alfapet: Razzle
description:
Alfapet Razzle is renewed and modern version of the classic word game Alfapet (also know as Scrabble). Create as many and as long words as you can in just one minute. The box includes a hourglass for keeping time and rules for three different versions of the game. Part of Alga's Qube series of games.

Alfapet Razzle on taas täällä – uudistettuna ja nykyaikaisena. Muodosta mahdollisimman monta ja pitkää sanaa yhden minuutin aikana. Kuutiossa on sisään rakennettu tiimalasi ajan ottamista varten. Pakkaus sisältää peliohjeet kolmeen hauskaan ja haastavaan pelivaihtoehtoon. Alfapet Razzle on Qube-perheen uusin jäsen. 2-6 pelaajalle, yli 10-vuotiaille Peliaika: Noin 30-60 minuuttia

name: Trivial Pursuit: 1998 Edition
description:
This is a Trivial Pursuit edition with questions exclusively from the year 1998.

The game contains 250 trivia cards with 6 questions each from the following categories:

Blue: Schlagzeilen (Headlines)
Pink: Showbusiness
Yellow: Weltgeschehen (World Affairs)
Brown: Klatsch & Tratsch (Gossip & Chit-Chat)
Green: Sport (Sports)
Orange: Rundblick (Panorama)

Every player gets a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes (standard Trivial Pursuit issue). There is no game board. A special six-sided die showing the six colors mentioned above is rolled by the player on turn. The color tells from which category the question comes.

If the player on turn can answer the question, he gets another turn and, if he does not has it already, the corresponding colored pie piece which he puts in his playing piece. If he answers wrong, it's the next player's turn.

The first player to collect all colors wins the game.

The set is fully compatible with every other Trivial Pursuit game.

name: Twiga
description:
Twiga the giraffe and her friends are surprised as all of their brown spots have disappeared and been replaced by spots of various colors and shapes. Is it the mysterious spot disease?

In Twiga, each player has four giraffe cards representing the various parts of his body. By drawing wooden shapes from a bag, players help their giraffe find its real spots; they appear thanks to magic transparent cards. The first player to recover all of his giraffe's spots wins the game!

name: I Am Vlad: Prince Of Wallachia – Bonus Pack
description:
Bonus New Pack!

134 new cards:
- 14 replacements for the Magic Cards for the Vlad heroes
- 36 replacements for the Battle Cards for the Vlad heroes
- 36 replacements for the Battle cards for the Archers
- 36 replacements for the Battle Cards for the Wallachian Knights
- 12 replacements for the Akathist Cards

There is also a small change for the fighting with Battle Cards mechanic. The new Battle Cards have some penalty points included (on the right side), to affect the damage taken or inflicted, according with the distance between the units involved in the fight.

Different cards for a different game experience.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Mees Kees Bordspel
description:
Schoolmaster Kees is still an intern, and he doesn't yet know what a schoolmaster is supposed to do. Luckily, he has a class full of experts! In his class, everything is a little bit different: a dictation becomes telling jokes, geography becomes portraying countries, and during biology, the children watch Spiderman or Kung Fu Panda. He tries very hard, especially when the head of the school comes around to check if everything goes well.

In this game, the players score points by playing several mini-games. When it is a players turn, he rolls two dice and moves his pawn around the school. If he enters a classroom, a mini-game is started:

Language class: The players have to come up with a word that matches a certain description (such as 'a country starting with the letter A'). The description is given by an assignment card combined with a spinner. The first player to shout a matching word wins the mini-game.
Math class: The player picks one opponent. He takes a regular die and a special die (which only rolls sixes). His opponents get two regular dice. Both players start rolling their dice. The first player to roll 7 wins the mini-game.
Geography class: The player is assigned a country that he has to depict. The other players have to guess the country. If someone guess correctly, both the guesser and the player score points, otherwise only the player scores.
Gym class: Each player receives a number of cards with the values 1 to 5. Then, the first player has to play one or two cards with the value '1' (facedown), the second player has to play one or two games with the value '2', etc. After the '5' has been played, the game continues again with the '1'. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins the game.


You are allowed to play non-matching cards, but other players may accuse you of bluffing. If you are accused and were bluffing, the accuser wins the game. If you are accused and were not bluffing, you win the game.

Schoolyard (playing hide-and-seek): The player picks an opponent. Both players receive a set of schoolyard cards. Each card has an picture of a schoolyard scene. Then, a random item is determined. The first player to find that item in the pictures wins the mini-game.


The game is over when each mini-game has been played four times. Now, the scores for each player are added up. The player with the highest score wins the game.

name: Power Rangers Action Card Game
description:
Players customize a deck of 30 cards depicting the heroes, villains, Zords, and Megazords of the Power Rangers universe. Cards are found in special starter sets, booster packs, and also packaged with Power Rangers toys from the 2013 line.

Turn Order:

1. Draw 2 cards.
2. Choose a Ranger or Villain to play, or pass. Discard cards equal to the play cost.
2. Optionally, players can summon Zords or Megazords if a Ranger was played in the previous step.
3. If only one player played a card, that card deals damage equal to its damage value twice.
4. If both players played a card, each player performs a "judgement" by rolling a die (or using an app or Morpher toy) to determine what power level their card fights at. The higher Power value wins. The loser is dealt damage equal to the winning card's damage value.
5. If the winner's card's rock/paper/scissors icon defeats the opponent's, the winner deals damage twice.
6. Damage is represented by moving cards from the draw deck into the discard pile.
7. The winner's card is discarded, the loser's is moved to the reinforcements area, where it can boost the "judgement" value in subsequent battles.
8. Play continues until one player runs out of cards in his or her draw deck. That player loses and the opponent wins!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components

name: Memory Challenge: Marvel Comics Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

You're a comic book lover, but can you remember every comic book cover? Now's the time to put your knowledge to the test because your favorite super heroes are joining forces with your favorite matching game to create the most super matching game the world has ever seen! The Marvel Comics Edition of MEMORY features the iconic comic book covers of your childhood with new super twists. Play power cards that release different strategies or steal a card and change the fate of the game. Match the most cards, and you'll be the one saving the day!

name: O.K. Corral (fan expansion for BANG!)
description:
The O.K. Corral is another unofficial expansion to BANG!, available in English and Italian. It was designed by Steve Elmore in 2008, and functions just like BANG! A Fistful of Cards or BANG! High Noon.

Thus, after the first round, the Sheriff flips over an O.K. Corral event card that stipulates a gameplay change for the round. At the beginning of the next round (the Sheriff's next turn), they flip over an O.K. Corral card that replaces the old one. The old gameplay condition is removed and the new one is in place. For those of you who liked A Fistful of Cards and High Noon, this expansion might work just right for you. For players not a fan of these, there is a gameplay variation that removes the randomness of these event cards (having them flipped out in order at the beginning of the game).
categories: American West, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Angry Nerds Promo Card
description:
May be used once by a player to eliminate any one opponent's bunny that forms a Bunny Triplet including a Triple Specialty Bunny or a Triple Celebrity Bunny. May not be used to eliminate an opponent's last bunny.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation

name: MTR Railway Journey
description:
MTR Railway Journey is a card game which is published by Hong Kong Mass Transit Railway (MTR) company.

All cards are Hong Kong MTR stations. The cards are divided as 8 groups of different railway lines (3 short lines combined as one).

Players get 7 cards in their hands and race to empty their hands.

In turns, players attempt to play cards by matching its color, number, or word to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw a card from the draw pile, and if still unable to play, they pass their turn.

After player play a card, if he gets any card with the same number/action, he can play all of them within the same turn.
e.g. the last played card is a RED card, A can play a RED 2, BLUE 2, ORANGE 2 all together.

Card Types:

Number, all carry the names of a MTR stations. The number ranges from 1-13(the longest line) to 1-4 (the shortest one).
Interchange Station, it belongs to 2 railway lines (colors) and change the game play direction.
Stop, to skip the next plyer. The effect can be accumulated to stop several players.
Notice (+3), make the next player draw 3 cards. Player can play other Notice or Railway Journey card to avoid the effect and accumulate the effect on the next player.
Wild Changing Color, player select a new color for the next player.
Railway Journey (+4), make the next player draw 4 cards. Player can play other Railway Journey card to avoid the effect and accumulate the effect on the next player.

name: Quickly
description:
The aim of the game: find the colour of an object as quickly as possible to collect the card. But beware of QUICKLY the dog who likes to disrupt the game!

Game preparation: place the five "coloured spot" cards colour side up in the centre of the players. Shuffle the other cards and lay them face down in a draw pile.

How to play: Turn over the first card in the draw pile and lay it on the table. Turn over a second card and lay it next to the first. On the second card, look at the object in the white circle. What colour is this object on the first card? The game continues with the second card serving as the first card, and a new card is turned over from the draw pile.

The end of play: the game ends when the draw pile is empty. The player with the most cards wins the game.

name: Monopoly Junior: Planes
description:
A version of Monopoly Junior based on the Disney movie Planes. Collect the most and best characters (properties), and earn the most fuel (money) to win.

The board is 7 x 7, with 4 characters (properties) per side, two per color, plus the standard Go, Free Parking, Go to Jail and Jail corners, and finally 2 "Race Challenges" and 2 "Prize Fund" locations (where the railroads would be, but correspond to the Community Chest or Chance cards in the original game). Race Challenges will often have you contribute money to the Prize Fund, which then goes to the next person who lands on those locations.

When the game begins, each location has a corresponding card placed on it. As each player lands on those locations and "buys" them, they take the card and mark the location on the board with one of their 10 hangars (houses/hotels, sort of, but that simply mark ownership of locations on the board). Then like in classic Monopoly, other players must pay the fuel cost for that location if they land there.

Variants on the basic game allow for monopoly pricing, scoring per the fuel cost on each card (property) instead of simply 1 point per card, and card (property) swaps.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Winning Moves Australia Pty Ltd, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Enigma
description:
Enigma is a micro board game for two, which is played on a small battle map and uses playing cards to code and decode messages. Each player, using his own deck of playing cards, will code a single word using one of two ciphers available to them. Once both players have coded a message they will then exchange the cards and start to decode their opponent’s password. The first to crack the code will have several strategical maneuvers available at his disposal while the person who fails to crack the code will be given only one move. The key objective is to control as much of your enemy’s territory as possible before the game ends after ten rounds of code cracking.

Setup
Place the map between you and your opponent. In addition to the map, each player has a card shield to place upright in front of them. This not only keeps your code making secret but also is used to show the two ciphers available for coding. To begin, each player should have 5 pennies placed on opposite sides of the map (on the edge closest to you). At this point, you should be ready to start creating codes.

Play
Each turn begins with both players creating a code using one of two ciphers available. The secret code must be at least three letters long and not have the same letter repeating more than twice. Once both players have cards selected to spell out their coded word, exchange cards. At this point, the person who can correctly decode their opponent’s message first will be awarded the next move on the map.The player who successfully decoded the message will have a list of maneuvers they can choose from while the other opponent (who failed) is only allowed one single move.

Game end
The game ends when all ten rounds of code cracking have been completed and all final moves have been made. The game play length can be adjusted by increasing or decreasing the amount of rounds to be played.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Disney Edition
description:
A travel variant of the famous Trivial Pursuit game. The object is to answer questions in different color-coded categories, and to win "wedges" with correct answers. The first person to win a wedge of each color wins the game.

The game comes with a plastic container that can be split into two parts forming the player's "cake" and cards container. Played by 2 players or teams.

name: Monopoly: Western Australian Charity Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Western Australia; limited Edition to improve the lives of children and young people throughout Western Australia.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Find...den MÖRDER
description:
Find... consists of 36 tiles, with each tile having one letter on it. Shuffle the tiles face down, then lay them out in a 6x6 pattern. Players take turns revealing one tile and putting it back in place in the grid, then trying to spell out the target word by finding a chain of letters in order to win. Alternatively, a player can claim that the target word can't be found in the grid, and if this proves to be true, then this player wins.

Two games exist that include the target word in their title — Find...den MÖRDER and Find...die LIEBE — and while the target words are German, the game itself has no language specific text.

name: Drunter und drüber
description: The players have to get their 4 meeples from their starting spaces (marked with a "+") to the center of the game board and the spaces of their color, marked 1 to 4. The first to do so, wins the game. Movement is determined a die. The players may chose to use the red symbol-die instead of the black number-die. On the roll of a dot, all meeples on a danger-space ringed with dots or dots and crosses, have to return to the first space on the track. On the roll of a cross, the same goes for meeples on a danger-space ringed with crosses or dots and crosses.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spy Tag
description:
Spy Tag is a high-speed race to spot the spies and tag them before time's up!

To play, deal an even number of agent files to all players (the masterminds), who lay these agent files in front of them, face up, then set the timer. The first mastermind draws a spy card from the pile, scans the other player's agent files for the matching card, then slaps the spy card on top of the appropriate one. The mastermind who just got slapped is next to pull a spy card, and play continues until the timer goes off. The player with a spy card covering one of their agent files when the timer goes off must pull a card from the secret attaché. If the card is empty, the player is safe; if the card shows the stolen gizmo, that player is out and play continues until only one spy remains standing – the winner!

name: Plan B
description:
From the rules:
A new construction zone has been designated. The architects want to develop it and are planning new houses and parks on the building area.

Your task in Plan B is to be the first to build three houses of the same colour next to each other on the building area. Only horizontal and vertical combinations are allowed.

name: Micro Play-Break: Duel
description:
From the publisher:

In this 2-player game, the Attacker controls the field of play via Momentum, selecting one of three attack types aimed at either the upper or lower section of an opponent's character. Defenders can stop the momentum and become the attacker by successfully predicting the incoming attack and accurately selecting the correct block type and placing it where the attacker's hit would land.

How well can you predict your opponent's actions?

The Story: You are an elite TechnoLectric Warrior helping your Evil Warlord in his quest for world domination. During your standard mission of Seek and Destroy, you have come across an equally elite warrior in the employ of your Warlord’s enemy.

Both Warriors, equal in weapons and skill, make decisions during battle that will determine who survives.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting

name: Tank Hunter 2e Cmdr
description:
User summary

A standalone expansion to Tank Hunter (Jäger) 2e.

Tank Hunter is set in a fictional future where players pit their army of model tanks against each other. Each player has a small unit of various tanks from WW2, and deploy them against each other trying to defeat the other player's tanks, infantries and guns.

Commander contains more tanks, more infantry and more guns, and adds Commander cards. It can both be played as a standalone game or integrated with the base set, or Jäger.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Génération X
description: A game of questions from the years 1980 to 1994. Each players have three cards in hands. Turn base, you choose a card, ask the two questions on the card, then draw a new one. Each correct answer gives a black token. Some joker questions require a die to know which question to ask. Some of the questions are about Quebec political and cultural background of theses years.

name: Chapas
description:
From the publisher:

One of the most popular traditional games. Made up of 26 bottle-caps, 2 halves of a ball and cardboard discs on to which the caps must be thrust. Drawing a football pitch on the floor, take it in turns to flick the bottle-caps into your opponent’s goal. Presented in a cloth bag and a vintage style cardboard box.

name: Bumba waar is Bumba?
description:
There are four figures and five cups. Hide the figures under the cups. Your opponent wil draw a card. You will need to point out the cup under whitch the figure on the card is located. If you're right you win the card. If you are wrong the card goes away. First to five cards wins.

Bumba is a popular Belgian children's TV-show.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: It's A Chicken
description: A fun and exciting drawing game for kids! It's a chicken will provide hours of hilarious fun for kids of all ages and also encourages them to interact and to use their imaginations. Can the other players guess what you are drawing? In this 'easy to play' game the sheets are pre-printed with circles to make starting the picture even easier! Each word card contains four options to draw, one with a picture to copy to help younger children play. The 'chicken' timer 'clucks' to let the drawer know they are running out of time and if the word is guessed within the time limit the timer announces the number of points won for both the drawer and the person who guessed correctly. The player with the most points when each player has draw 5 cards wins! This game provides a sheet of printed circle layouts, which can be photocopied to give you more sheets and a lot more hours of fun. This educational game will help children express themselves through a variety of different drawing skills and at the same time the electronic timer adds to the tension and the fun! Whatever age you are, this game is great fun for the whole family. This game is for 3 or more players and suitable for ages 5 years and up.

name: Wer war's?: Happy Meal edition
description:
Players cooperate to catch the thief who stole the King's magic ring. To catch the thief, players need gather information about them. But time is working against them, so they need to have a good memory and a little luck to catch the thief before time runs out.

After the portable dice game and the card game version of the electronic boardgame, this is a version with a spinner, a standing clock and food types already printed on the suspect cards. This game was distributed as part of the McDondald's Happy Meals Menu from 2nd to 12th November 2015 in Austria.

name: Kymppitonni
description:
Boardgame based on a hugely popular game-show on Finnish TV from 1985 to 2005. ("Tenthousand")

The idea is to give a one sentence clue for a single word for other players, higher points are given, if only one other person will get the answer. Think Dixit with words instead of pictures.

The game box features Riitta Väisänen, who hosted the show for its entire 20 year run.

A version aimed at younger audiences was published a little bit later as Junnutonni ("Youngsterthousand")
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game

name: Matka
description:
A travel game set in Scandinavia. Players must play travel cards in order to travel around Scandinavia, trying to collect a post card from each of the five countries. First one to do that and then return to the starting city wins the game.

There's also some trivia involved, but it's just purely optional flavour. The game play is very simple play a card and move a space.

name: Dicey
description:
Dicey is a new demon dice game, with a unique feature. Rascally shaped dice make a mockery of throwing a six in this fast, fun and furiously tricky game of chance!

The result of Dicey's unique shape means the odds of throwing a 6 is now about three times harder (1 in 18) and throwing a 1 that much easier (about 1 in 3). Throwing the other four number has about the same odds as for a normal dice (1 in 6)

There are 4 ways to play depending on the number of players.

The first game named Dicey is a 3-6 player game has the objective of winning all your opponents' counters. You take one dice and 8 counters.

All players roll in real time and when someone throws a 6 they win the pot.

As you roll the following numbers

1 - Add a counter to the pot
2 - If someone spots you roll this, they can take a counter from you
3 - no action
4 - no action
5 - Must stop rolling for 5 seconds
6 - Win the pot

The second option is a two player game named Double Trouble with the objective of winning all counters.

You each take 10 counters and two dice.

You both ante one token the pot and make a single roll in turn

If you roll

A single 1 - place 1 token into the pot
A double 1 - place 2 tokens into the pot
Double 2,3,4,5 - You lose the round and the pot goes to the other player
A single 6 - You win the pot
A double 6 - You win the game automatically.

The third game is for 3-6 players named Last Man Standing, with the objective of not being the player to put the last token into the pot.

You start with an agreed number of counters each, three for a quick game or more for a longer game.

Each player in turn rolls 3 dice

1 - Put a counter into the pot
2 - Give a counter to the person on the left
3 - Give a counter to the person on the right

If you have no tokens you are not out as you may get some back.

When only 1 token not in the pot the dice actions change

2 - move a counter left
3 - move a counter right
6 - place a counter in the pot and lose the game!

The fourth and last way to play is named The solo challenge and is for a single player. This is a challenge mode with the aim of rolling specific faces in the least number of rolls.

name: Shinrei shashin
description:
User summary
心霊写真 (Ghost Picture) (Shinrei shashin) is a physical game that uses a mobile phone app to play. The game box includes a light frame which the player constructs. This holds the player's phone, a clear plastic screen and a small board onto which players' cards are placed.

Before playing, the player must download the free app onto their phone, and then set it so the screen does not go to sleep while playing.

The cards show different parts of the dark forest, and the players try to make their way home without being caught by a ghost. A player takes turns to place a card from their hand onto the board, so the image faces the phone. Each card includes a QR code, which the phone's camera reads. Then a ghost might be projected by the phone screen and appears hovering in the forest.

In fact, the image is on the clear plastic screen in front of the forest card, an illusion similar to the theatrical trick Pepper's Ghost.

If the player sees a ghost, they must take all the cards that have been placed in the stand. If there is no ghost, they leave their card on the stand. In ths way, cards build up for the player who gets caught.

Some cards have extra effects which cause the app to increase the odds of a ghost appearing. Or a player can swap their cards with another player and so on.

The game was produced in 2015 and sold out its initial print run. The app was made for iPhones 5 and 6, and later for Android. After 2016, there appears to be a break in development. Although published in Japanese, gameplay is language free and English rules are online.
publishers: Projection Card (プロジェクションカードバンド)

name: Behold, A Pale Glider
description:
10 May 1940: a handful of German troops landed atop Belgium's strongest fort using gliders (painted light blue underneath to match the sky) and took it out. This two player game simulates this key event in the fall of France. Each turn is 10 minutes and each ground unit is about 10 men.

This is a postcard game that was released from LPS POCKET BATTLE game No. 18
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Stones Break Bones: The Perfect Mix of Strategy & Luck
description:
Stones Break Bones is a card game with just one simple goal - to gain exactly 25 points, no more no less. The gameplay is just as simple, pick up cards from the main pile and add up the points on them, but be sure to avoid stones! Those pesky cards force you to discard your whole hand to the discard pile. Boosters, on the other hand, make for a great surprise to your opponent. Play them at the beginning of your turn to throw off your opponents and get an advantage over the gameplay.

The design of the cards is slick, with hand-drawn icons on each card. Unlike many other popular card games, Stones Break Bones is pocket size (1.75in x 2.5in) - perfect for parties and road trips!

—description from the designer

name: Quick Link
description:
Quick Link is a fast and furious party game for the whole family in which players use squeaky suction cup sticks to snap up words that are logically related. When an opponent makes a debatable link, squeeze your stick to call them out!

Quick Link is a game that develops verbal reasoning and teaches conflict resolution in a fun and exciting way. Can you find the link in a blink?

STEP 1
Flip the top card from the Draw deck.
STEP 2
Quickly pick up related cards from the word grid.
STEP 3
Show your cards to the other players. Squeeze your suction cup when a player makes a wrong link!
Step 4
Players with the most points after eight rounds win!

—description from the publisher

name: Mansplain It!
description:
Welcome to Mansplain It!, a party game for the Mansplain-er in all of us.

As women academics and creators, the Mansplain It! team frequently meets sexism and rampant bullshittery in our fields of study and at work and-- like most women, in the wilds of "being outside and in public". This game is our way of bringing attention to the problem --while keeping a sense of humor.
 
Mansplain It! was created with the ability to play it in two completely separate styles-- competitive OR cooperative. Mansplain It!'s unique blend of teamwork, on-the-spot action and game play make it infinitely reuseable and replayable. Mansplain It! is based on a complicated and nuanced system of points, guessing and drinking as much wine as possible until you get bored and watch more Vine compilations.

Each deck of Mansplain It! comes with 200 concept cards with informative (and actually researched) facts about each subject. Learning CAN be fun, kids! It also includes 100 rebuttal cards to spice up your game play and the instruction manual to get you started.

Game play is designed around trying to earn as many points as possible while firing back WellActually cards that can do everything from end a turn to completely eliminate all earned points within the game.

Using your Topic Card, you will spew forth every fact, figure and every piece of bullshit trivia knowledge you can on the topic. Can you exaggerate? Yes. Can you lie? Absolutely. Can you Mansplain ItI? Time will tell. Your goal is to rack up a total of 35 points, the age at which one can run for President of these United States.
 
Other players will be listening intently. Their WellActually Rebuttal Cards are powerful, for they contain the Secret Words That Must Not Be Said. If you happen to say one, a player may choose to play their card and steal your spotlight for a chance to win points. Players may choose to save their WellActually card for another instance, betting that your mansplaining ass will repeat yourself at least once before the timer runs out, or play it immediately to shut you up. HOWEVER— if they DO steal -- they must keep talking as well. They are now saddled with the responsibility of Mansplaining on your chosen topic. 

 “But Mansplain It! What if my superior male brain avoids all virulent vocab, vanquishing these vocal villains?” Don’t worry—the deck is stocked with over a whole bunch of F***You cards that can impact game play immediately. 

Cards include: 

The Glass Ceiling- Everyone at the table loses 20% of their points. 
#blessed- Everyone at the table must post to Instagram immediately or lose all of their points. 
Triggered™- You’re offended. Player immediately loses their turn. All points are forfeited. 
Money Where Your Mouth Is: Player may only continue if they make a charitable donation to a women’s rights organization. Right there, on their phone, in front of God and everyone. $1 minimum. 
Ruth Bader Ginsberg Dissents- Everyone at the table must vote to let the person continue. If the vote is not unanimous, their turn ends. All points are forfeited. 


The action of Mansplaining/Rebuttal happens as many times as possible in the 30-second window. Again—the victor is the last person talking when the timer runs out. They win the points for that round, and it starts all over again. That’s it! That’s how you play Mansplain it! 
Cooperative mode works a little differently, but at this point we’ve given you enough information to steal our idea completely anyway, so we’ll let there be a little mystery.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Educational, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Political, Trivia, Word Game

name: Redaktion Wadenbeisser: Die Jagd nach der Titelstory
description:
The players are reporters for a school magazine and try to catch the newest „title story“ for it.
So they chase through the city trying to be the first.
The game comes with two game modes.
1. players play clockwise and either collect cards or play them and collect tokens from the board matching the color of the blueprint of their story. When one of the three parts of the story is full, they look at the card for ca. 30 seconds and try to memorize as much as possible.
They are asked a question in the vein of „what is the kid in the background eating?“ and if they guess it right they keep the card.
The first to collect enough tokens and to answer the three cards correctly wins.

2. there are 8 decks of cards available and the players take a deck and search for cards that point in the right direction in their own player color, they program simultaneously their path through the city and try to get to the colored tokens. In player order they check if they collect enough tokens to try to answer a question.
When all three cards are fulfilled the player who has all three cards in front of himself wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Action Queue, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: EXIST
description:
EXIST is the thrilling adult party card game that offers a virtually endless variety of absurd obstacles against which players compete to EXIST.

Each round consists of ludicrous scenarios created by the combinations that result from the drawing of one card each from the OPPONENT, LOCATION and WILD CARD decks. The players must then choose which RESOURCE card to throw from their hand to overcome the obstacle; either more effectively than any of the other players, in a funnier way, or simply supported by a better, more persuasive argument for the SUPREME DECIDER to consider in making the ultimate decision of who wins the round.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game

name: Parlamentary
description:
In Parlamentary every player has to build a political party. The parties will have randomly generated name, politicians with special skills, and popularity. The goal is getting a possible higher popularity, collecting media and company cards, and winning the 3 turned election at the end of the game.

It's a tactical game with lot of fun and big luck factor. Still it's quiet a precise model of the plural democracy. Among others the game includes 80 unique politician cards, and has an entertaining graphic design.
—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: TKKG Gangsterjagd
description:
The tactical chase for clever detectives
A jewel thief is up to mischief and has already robbed several villas! A case for TKKG, who swarm out in two teams at night and try to catch the thief.

- - - - -

Die taktische Verfolgungsjagd für clevere Detektive
Weitere Produktinformationen
Helle Aufregung in der Millionenstadt: Ein Juwelendieb treibt sein Unwesen und hat schon mehrere Villen ausgeraubt!
Ein Fall für TKKG, die nachts in zwei Teams ausschwärmen und versuchen, den Dieb zu schnappen.
Vorausschauendes Denken ist gefragt – sowohl für den Spieler, der die Rolle des Gangsters übernimmt, als auch für die Spieler, die beide TKKG Teams bewegen. Zahlenchips geben dabei vor, wie weit gezogen werden darf.
Ziel von TKKG ist es, genau auf das Feld des Diebes zu gelangen und ihn somit zu schnappen. Der Dieb gewinnt dagegen, wenn es ihm gelingt, an die Beute in allen vier Villen zu kommen.
Die TKKG Gangsterjagd ist ein taktisches Detektivspiel für clevere TKKG Fans ab 8 Jahren.

name: City of Gears: Creator's Compound Promo Tile
description:
Originally available from TWIST Gaming Year 4 Kickstarter campaign.

Promo tile for City of Gears.

City tile, Industrial Community tile.
Link Bonus: 1 Zap token.
Activation cost: 1 Worker, 1 Zap.
Score: 3 Prestiges.
Gain 2 Prestiges for each Industrial Community (grey) tile your workers occupy, including this one.
categories: City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Blobby's Pizza
description:
Win this monster pizza-eating contest by eating your way to the highest bill. Complete pizza to eat pizza, take pizza to make pizza, and always keep your eyes on your pies!

A strategic set-building, take that card game with a 128 deck card game consisting of various pizza fraction cards (plain, pepperoni, veggie and supreme) as well as 7 different pizza eating monster character cards who eat different sizes of pizza fractions. Accumulate cards as you go as you try to build whole pizzas to add to your guest check. Protect cards in your 5 card hand (called the "plate") and store extra cards on your "table," which are subject to being stolen by other players monster cards. Use Switch and Swap waiter cards to switch cards or game play direction. Advanced play options include use of Tax and Tip cards for an added layer of strategic play and more advanced educational content.

Includes a realistic/retro guest check score pad for adding final scores. A fun way to teach fractions, decimals and percentages.

-description from designer

name: Cone of Shame the Game
description:
Play the game for anyone with a neck! "SHAME, SHAME, SHAME, SHAME!" It's the chant heard 'round the table in the game where shame comes in the form of a cone you'll have to wear if you give the lamest answer. Grab up to five friends and have a laugh as you find out how well you know each other. Answer questions, act things out, draw pictures and avoid wearing the Cone of Shame! Once you’re wearing the Cone you’ll have to carry out challenges to escape and win your friends’ respect back. Go on.

—description from the publisher

name: よくばりハンターズ！ (Greedy Hunters!)
description:
よくばりハンターズ！ (Greedy Hunters!) is a traitor game from Japan. The players work together, exploring a dangerous dungeon, and try to recover the treasures within. But when the party tries to leave, then the traitors try to gain the upper hand.

At the start of the game, the players are dealt a secret hidden role; either they are Hunters, or Greedy. As the players explore the dungeon, battling monsters and avoiding traps, a player's special abilities might reveal what their true character.

Players draw action cards and play through similar to a role-playing game. When the dungeon is cleared, as the players climb out, the Greedy traitors try to steal from the others. At the end of the game, the richest Hunter and the richest Greedy both win.
user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Drop Bears: Survival Series, Chapter 1
description:
The Australian Bush is a dangerous place at night. And as if spiders and snakes weren't enough, another horror is on the loose: Drop Bears infest the dark - Hideous koala-like beasts dropping from gum trees, eager to consume human flesh.

This is where the game drops you in, an inexperienced group of tourist campers ventured into the night. Your objective: Survive until dawn.
Drop Bears is a cooperative game where the Campers have to carefully choose actions every turn to stay alive, while the whole Australian Bush is on a hunt for them. The group can choose of several different options such as:
Explore and Run, allowing the Campers to place new map tiles and attempt to keep the lurking hunger beasts at arm's length (at bay, a distance).
Definitely they will need to Rest and Heal, which will give them a chance to patch up and recoup their most essential resources.
Finally Search and Endeavour will hopefully lead them to find much needed survival resources.
All these are tools to ensure as many campers as possible survive until dawn. While doing so, the game drops the hideous creatures right on them, attacking and terrorising the Campers in every turn.

Even the very landscape and environment will batter the poor Campers – They can become severely wounded; this will surely hamper their chance for survival.
Each time a camper is eaten, that player will select another camper from those available, but every death brings the Drop Bears closer to victory, so don't let your humans die in vain. With no weapons, campers must band together, scavenge gear and use their wits if they ever hope to survive until dawn.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Animals, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management, Map Addition, Modular Board

name: UFO Boom
description:
Today our galaxy has been turned upside down. The aliens were in a hurry to leave for an important meeting when… suddenly their spaceship broke down. The aliens jumped out of the spaceship confused, and helpless. What should they do? They have to meet with the other aliens as soon as possible. Please help them!

Game play: When it’s your turn, you must try to bring together the two aliens depicted on the card to the same square on the board. When you complete this task, you can flip the card over face down (the card is yours). Then, you can take a new card from the stack and place it face up in front of yourself. The player who is the last to have seen a starry night sky begins the game. The players take turns clockwise. On his/her turn, a player rolls the dice and makes a move according to the dice symbol.

Goal: The first player to collect 5 alien cards and flip them face down will be the winner. This ends the game. The player can flip the card face down only after he/she completes the task pictured on the card (brings both aliens depicted in the card together on the same square).

-description from publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Contracts, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mimic Taking
description:
Mimic Taking is a trick-taking game for 3-4 players where the winner of a trick is the player who plays a card closest in rank to the lead card.

It is a "must-follow" game, and the winner of a trick takes all of the cards from the trick face-down into a score pile. If the trick was won with a trump card, the winner may discard some of the cards without collecting them.

Points are awarded at the end of a hand based on comparing the number of cards a player took in the suit where they took the most and the suit where they took the least, with a bonus being awarded if the number of cards is the same.

The player with the most points after a number of rounds wins!

name: Géants Stupides
description:
In Géants Stupides ("Stupid Giants"), you land with your rivals on the mythical island of Night Mountain.

In this jubilant "stop or else", you land on the island of the mythical Night Mountain with only one obsession: get as many stars as possible! But your quest will be full of pitfalls!

So climb with your giant and pray to the ancestor to move rocks... Aim for the highest spot possible and jump to catch stars!

But the greedier you are, the more flying nonos and carcass hits will lead to nasty falls!

Borrow the superpower of the Ancestor's Head to transform the mountain by moving cubes... And unleash the Giant that growls inside you!

A colorful wooden game, with drawings by Marion Poinsot, the illustrator of Naheulbeuk comics.

With several levels: from the giant beginner to the stupid expert!

name: Prometheus
description:
A 2-player abstract game played on a chess-style board, where opposing pieces (of three distinct kinds: cubes, pyras and tetras) seek to win by capturing the fourth and leader piece of each army: the sphere.

Each piece moves exactly as many squares as it has corners: tetras move three squares, pyras five and cubes eight. No pieces can be jumped, but pieces are captured when an opposing piece ends its' move on the same square. When a sphere is captured, the game is over.

name: Merry Dissmas
description: A rotating Diss-Master reads a card out loud to the group (for example: Who's the worst gift-giver? The chronic over-sharer? The pickiest eater?). Everyone else writes down their answer on their dry-erase boards, and then it's up to the Diss-Master to pick their favorite answer— after reading all the responses out loud, of course!

name: Carnival Carnage
description:
This is a carnival-themed set collection card game with take-that elements.

—user summary

Be the first to collect a full set of carnival cards - they could be anything from acrobats to animals, rides to sideshows. But keep your wits about you because things can take an unexpected turn at the carnival and the carnage cards are there to wreak weird and wonderful havoc!

—description from the back of the box

name: Escape Game: Die verlassene Schule
description:
In this escape game for kids, you visit your school while it is closed. After a few seconds it gets really scary: the entrance gate suddenly closes and you can't get out!

Just like in a real Escape Room, you are locked in a mysterious place. Now you have to work together to find the exit by solving logic puzzles and mathematical problems and looking very carefully. Use the objects you find during your adventure, pay attention to even the smallest details and don't be in a hurry: if you manage to solve all the puzzles correctly, you can escape and be safe.

name: Nåt ska bort
description:
A challenging trivia game where the players have to figure out which option, out of five, doesn't belong with the others.

If you answer correctly you get to answer tricky follow-up questions. If you answer these correctly you get to place one of your markers on the board.

The first player to place all of their markers on the board wins!

—user summary

name: Age of Will
description:
Age of Will is a minimalist drafting and building card game.

The King has ordered the construction of walls and buildings, and wants them to be beautiful!

Over the course of two rounds of drafting, players draft cards to gather resources, befor contributing those resources to a building, and its decoration. Players get points for contributing resources and decorations, but lose points for wasted resources.

This latest in the "Age of" series from designer N2 was designed with the 2022 Tokyo Game Market design contraints in mind: 32 cards or less, 5 minutes or less rules explanation, 15 minutes or less playtime, and no cooperative games..
publishers: Southern Cross Games (サザンクロスゲームズ)

name: Nusfjord: Expansion Pack #2
description:
Nusfjord: Expansion Collection #2 consists of the Trout and Besøkende expansion decks that are included in the Nusfjord Big Box, but were not previously released on their own.

Guests are a new mechanic introduced in the Besøkende deck: You may attract visitors via main buildings and spend them later for various effects. A few buildings in this deck provide additional ways to use visitors for profit.

This expansion deck comes in a set within a new box size, offering enough space to hold both decks (2 x 44 cards), a new elder card and wooden guest tokens.

ATTENTION: This set is meant to cater to players who already own Nusfjord base game.
Both expansions (Trout deck and Besøkende deck) are included in the new Nusfjord Big Box (2024).

name: Undercover Hunt
description: Scavenger hunt game with cards, timer, and a playing board. Cards give players items to find worth different values. Players advance on game board the number of spaces determined by the value of the items found.

name: Carbon City Zero: A Collaborative Board Game
description:
In this deck-building game, the team picks a mayor to support that starts at 50 on the Carbon Tracker, who must race against the timer playing piece on the Time Tracker. Each player starts with an identical deck of cards, and their turn is made up of three parts: Action, Recycle, Draw.

In each turn, you can buy additional cards from a shared marketplace with the powers to create a more sustainable city. But, amongst the deck of cards you have snag cards, global cards and special power cards, all valued in cost and carbon that could speed or slow your path to victory. Balancing the need to generate income with reducing carbon, you can follow numerous paths to victory, but collaboration is key.

You'll need to bring together governments, industries, and the public. It’s a conversation making game, where you will have to discuss tactics with your teammates.

You win by getting the carbon level to 0 before you reach ’Time’s Up’ and run out of time. And if you can't bring carbon levels to zero before it's too late, everybody loses. The stakes couldn't be higher.

The game can also be played competitively by each player taking a mayor to race down the carbon tracker, or solo by taking two draw decks to play from.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: The Dick Sits
description:
Prepare yourself for an outrageously funny gameplay experience with "Dick Sits"! The rules are simple, but the laughter is anything but. Here's how it goes:

Draw a Dick (if no Dick is visible) and Choose Sit or Sh*t:

When it's your turn, if no Dick is visible, draw a Dick card. After that, you have a choice to make. Will you Sit or Sh*t? The fate of your butt rest in your hands!
If Sitting:

If you choose to Sit, get ready for the glorious moment of pushing the dice into the Glory Hole. Slide the box to the next player, building anticipation for the outcome. But wait, there's more!
Everyone May Now Play Their Drawer Cards: Now it's time for some strategic maneuvers. All players can play their Drawer Cards, adding a twist to the outcome. Will you help yourself or hinder your opponents? The choice is yours!
Once Finished, Reveal the Dice and Calculate Stretch Value: The moment of truth has arrived. Lift the box and reveal the dice result. Add the result to your Stretch Value, taking into account any modifiers caused by the Drawer Cards in play. Will your stretching skills measure up to the challenge?
Sit Success: If your dice result is equal to or higher than the Dickficulty, rejoice! Your Sit is successful, and greatness awaits. Gain 1 Stretch Value, score a point, and bask in the glory of sitting on that victorious dick!
Sit Failure: If the total result is lower than the Dickficulty, your Sit is deemed unsuccessful. Lose 1 Stretch Value, as your stretching skills take a temporary setback. The Dick remains, ready to taunt the next player who dares to sit upon it. It's a reminder that not all stretches end in triumph.

Anal Tear Alert: The Perils of Dice Rolling - Beware the treacherous roll of the Dice! If you happen to roll a 6, an Anal Tear awaits you. This unfortunate event leads to missing your next turn, as the pain and discomfort take their toll. Remember, even in the world of "Dick Sits," stretching has its risks.

If Sh**ing:

Sh**ing Strategies: Clean Breaks: When players decide to Sh*t instead of Sit, it's time for a clean break. Discard any visible Dicks on the table, clearing the way for new challenges and opportunities.
Recharge:

To wrap up the turn, players replenish their Drawer Cards. It's a chance to strategize and plan for the next round of stretching adventures.

The first player to reach the target points wins (4-6 points depending on the number of players).

—description from designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Take That

name: Abenteuer in Aventurien
description:
Welcome to the legendary world of Aventuria, a realm where every dice roll plunges you deeper into an epic adventure filled with magic and mysteries. Adventures in Aventuria is not just a game, but a gateway into a world where you, as a brave leader, assemble a group of heroes to conquer fabulous adventures and gain glory.

Suitable for 2 to 4 players aged 8 and up, this game is a journey through fantastic landscapes and adventures beyond imagination. Each game, lasting about 30 minutes, is a unique experience full of strategy and excitement.

The Saga of the Game:

The Path of Discovery: Each turn begins with a roll of the fate dice, determining how far your heroes can travel through the mysterious regions of Aventuria. Choose your path wisely, as every decision can alter the fate of your heroes.
The Alliance of Heroes: In the recruitment regions of Aventuria, you meet brave companions. Win these heroes for your cause and form an unbeatable team.
The Challenge of Adventures: Face the adventures lurking in the mysterious lands in each round. Skillfully use your heroes to collect victory points and pave the way to triumph.
Rewriting Fate: If you find yourself in a region where neither recruitment nor adventure is possible, seize the opportunity to rewrite fate by wisely exchanging your hero cards.


Dive into Adventures in Aventuria and experience a world where every game writes a new chapter in an unforgettable legend. Gather your heroes, master the adventures, and write your own story in the world of Aventuria!

—description by publisher

Willkommen in der legendären Welt von Aventurien, einem Reich, in dem jeder Würfelwurf dich tiefer in ein episches Abenteuer voller Magie und Mysterien führt. Abenteuer in Aventurien ist nicht nur ein Spiel, sondern ein Tor in eine Welt, in der du als mutiger Anführer eine Gruppe von Helden zusammenstellst, um sagenhafte Abenteuer zu bestehen und Ruhm zu erlangen.

Für 2 bis 4 Spieler ab 8 Jahren ist dieses Spiel eine Reise durch fantastische Landschaften und Abenteuern jenseits der Vorstellungskraft. Jede Partie, die etwa 30 Minuten dauert, ist ein einzigartiges Erlebnis voller Strategie und Spannung.

Die Saga des Spiels:

Der Pfad der Entdeckung: Jeder Zug beginnt mit einem Wurf des Schicksalswürfels, der bestimmt, wie weit deine Helden durch die geheimnisvollen Regionen Aventuriens reisen können. Wähle deinen Pfad weise, denn jede Entscheidung kann das Schicksal deiner Helden ändern.
Das Bündnis der Helden: In den Rekrutierungsregionen Aventuriens triffst du auf mutige Gefährten. Gewinne diese Helden für deine Sache und bilde ein unschlagbares Team.
Die Herausforderung der Abenteuer: Stelle dich in jeder Runde den Abenteuern, die in den geheimnisvollen Ländern lauern. Nutze deine Helden geschickt, um Siegpunkte zu sammeln und den Weg zum Triumph zu ebnen.
Das Schicksal neu schreiben: Solltest du dich in einer Region befinden, in der weder Rekrutierung noch Abenteuer möglich sind, nutze die Gelegenheit, das Schicksal neu zu schreiben, indem du deine Heldenkarten weise austauschst.


Tauche ein in Abenteuer in Aventurien und erlebe eine Welt, in der jedes Spiel ein neues Kapitel in einer unvergesslichen Legende schreibt. Sammle deine Helden, meistere die Abenteuer und schreibe deine eigene Geschichte in der Welt von Aventurien!

—description from the publisher

name: One, Two Hoparoo!
description:
Who can guide the frogs to the pond? In 1, 2, Hüpferei!, two kids try to walk frogs to the pond by rolling a die. The die determines whether the frog moves one or two spaces, and the player whose frog first reaches the pond wins.

Included in 1, 2, Hüpferei! are an extra die and rules for a more advanced game.

name: Eyecatcher
description:
Box blurt:
Eyecatcher is a brain teaser that will challenge your mind and senses, and an intriguing party game you'll want to play.
Think quickly- Where do the Game tiles go? They may look deceptively simple, but are actually designed around unique color sequences that will baffle you as you try to place them on the symmetrical board. It is a race against time.

name: Storm over Olympus
description:
A two-players game derived from Stratego, but asymmetrical and themed in the Greek Mythology universe. Two teams of gods struggle for the dominance of the Olympus - its current occupiers, lead by Zeus, against the Chthonians, entities of the Underworld lead by Hades.

Both players choose a team of 9 out of 12 units. As in Stratego, their pieces identities are hidden from the opponent before they enter combat. Besides their pieces, each side has two important assets, Honor and Energy, which are crucial in their mobility and combat power.

Both sides have different victory conditions: the Chthonians win by moving one of their leaders (Hades or his wife Persephone) into the Olympus top, while the Olympians must simply avoid the Chothonian success by eliminating their leadership from the game. Also, a player loses when ending up with less than 1 Honor point.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Flippin' Out!
description:
From the Manufacturer:

Played like the classic Shut The Box Dice Game but with Letters. Say the category is "Boys Names", You say "Mike" before the 10 second timer runs out, and flip the letter "M" down so it cannot be used again (by either player or team). Your opponent says "Brian" and flips the "B" down. Teams or players race back and forth in 10 second increments as they eliminate the available Letters until someone can't answer. It's high energy, fast-flippin' fun. The all new outrageous party game from endless games. Category name game for whole family. Recommended for ages 10 and up and for 2 or more players. Fast paced board game that anyone can play. Letter flipping elimination game.

name: Dr. Seuss Trivia Game
description:
[from the insert]
A boxful of Fun from Dr. Seuss's Books!

Dr. Seuss forever changed the way children and their parents read together. And now, Dr. Seuss will change the way children and their parents play games together.
In addition to questions in four fun categories, this game features a set of famous Seussian Scenes taken directly from the good doctor's books. Players look at a scene, then answer questions about it from memory. This simple concept adds a visual element that makes this game different from all other trivia games, and perfect for children and parents to play together.
From 1937's And to Think That I Saw It on Mulberry Street to 1986's You're Only Old Once!, every major Dr. Seuss book, character, and quotation is included. It's a Seuss treasury, in a fun format thta makes it easy for children and parents to enjoy classic, favorite Seuss moments, and, maybe, introduce themselves to Dr. Seuss books that they don't yet know.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trivia

name: Sketchy
description:
From the Publisher:

In Sketchy, players’ doodles may lead to victory. In this all-draw, all-the-time game, players sketch things that fit a given category. If partners’ pictures match—they win points. Teams score two points for each match and lose one point for each incorrect match.

name: Tip Top Clap
description:
From the Box: A succession of noises and mimes is created and added to at the game's pace...Laughs guaranteed for this original memory game!

Players draw from 32 cards with icons of noises and mimes and turn the cards over. The active player has to do all the noises and mimes of the already drawn cards in the right order. When a player has got it wrong, he takes a turned over card as a penalty card.
The winner is the player who has the least penalty cards.

name: Arrakhar's Wand
description:
Published in ''The Dragon'' magazine, Issue #69.

From the introduction:

Arrakhar's Wand is a fantasy boardgame of tactics and strategy for two players. One player (the sorcerer player) hides the wand in his realm and defends it with a group of evil sorcerers who can summon the aid of demons, orcs, and ghouls. The other player (the wizard player) invades with a force of good wizards, barbarians, dwarves, and elves, seeking to locate the wand and escape with it.

Before the play of the game begins, both players secretly design their forces. The board portrays the valley of the evil sorcerers, and on it the sorcerer player places the counters representing haunts (temples, ruins, and crypts), secretly recording one of them as the haunt in which the wand is hidden. The counters representing the sorcerers and their minions are then placed on the board, and on the sorcerer player's first turn they can begin summoning other evil units. The wizard player brings in the wizard units and their allies through one or more hexes along the valley border, and the struggle begins.

Each side can attack with spells and by physical combat. The wizard player should usually try to strike quickly, before the sorcerer player can organize an effective resistance. Only the sorcerer player gets a steady stream of reinforcements, in the form of wandering-orc counters, but the wizard player has the advantage of special attacking bonuses. To win, the wizard player must locate the wand and remove it from the sorcerers' valley through an entry/exit hex.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Variable Set-up

name: Risc Commander
description:
"Are you a good strategist? Are you able to command an army? Are you ready to take the risk? Are you capable to conquer the world? Prove it!

Risc Commander is a strategy game which develops the imagination and the capacity to think logically and anticipantly. The game contains a board (the world map divided into 36 territories), 6 different colored armies, 5 dice, 1 pawn and cards containing battle missions, plus a spare army.

Every army is composed of tanks, rocket launchers and planes; there are in total 360 miniatures. Every miniature represents a fighting unit, with different capacities. The armies are distributed depending on the number of the players.

Every player draws a card, on which is stated the mission that he has to fulfill: the first one that manages to fulfill his mission, wins the game" - from the game box.

name: Moskitojagd
description:
Childs dexterity game with a electronic, spinning card dealer and 4 swatters with suction cups on the ends. The stack of 40 cards are loaded into the card dealer, which is placed in the center of the playing area (it is powered by 2 "C" batteries). The cards have different point values, some are negative. After the cards are loaded, the dealer is turned on and it starts spinning in a circle. Cards are shot out of the side if the dealer at random times. Each player is trying to get the cards by shlepping them with the suction cup at the end of their swatter. Any card that sticks to your paddle, you collect (even the negatives!). After the last card is swatted, the dealer is turned off and players add up their positive cards and subtract any negative cards. The highest point total is the winner.
It is a quick game to play and children do seem to love to swat at cards!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic, Humor, Real-time

name: Mouse Trap Card Game
description:
This game was released with the Battleship card game in 2002 and comes in similar packaging. Set up involves multi-directional double-sided 'maze cards' on which the mouse moves on and responds to during the game. The cards are arranged at random in a square and each game will have a differing arrangement which can also change during play. On a player's turn, the mouse is placed on the starting 'maze card', cheese is placed somewhere in the maze, an 'action card' is drawn and responded to - which involves movement of either the mouse or the maze cards - and if desired, a second action card is drawn and responded to.
Just as in the original mouse trap, players must move the mouse to collect an amount of cheese and upon being 'trapped' all cheese acquired in that turn is lost.
mechanics: Area Movement, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Escape Velocity Nova: A Sci-Fi Card-Driven Board Game
description:
Escape Velocity Nova is an expandable card-driven board game based on the popular computer game from Ambrosia Software. In this game, you will take the role of a trader captain in a vast and dangerous galaxy. There are pirates, aliens, and enemies lurking behind every asteroid, waiting to strike when you least expect it. Meanwhile, there are vast riches to acquire, intriguing missions to run, and new technologies to discover.

This game intricately weaves adventure, trade, political conflict, military tactics, and strategy together to give you the best of Ambrosia's classic computer game and DG Associates Card Gaming Systems. There is almost nothing you can do in the computer game that is not represented in this card game, and yet, it is still simple enough for an 8 year old player to understand. Escape Velocity: Nova has fast action, political intrigue, immense variety of options, and an intense struggle for survival.

Components include a 20" x 20" board, 124 cards, 5 colored pawns and 16 hostility markers in the Boxed set. 40 different 15-card expansions are available to add to your experience. There are 600 total cards available to acquire, but the set is non-collectible, in that the expansion packs actually tell you what is in them on the back. You can browse the contents of each expansion pack online as well, if you prefer to make online purchases.

This game is no longer available for sale from the publisher's website but may still be available at many game stores around the US.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Secret Unit Deployment, Trading

name: The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
description:
From the publisher:

In Front Porch Classics’ The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, you will travel down the Yellow Brick Road with Dorothy, the Scarecrow, the Tin Woodsman and the Cowardly Lion in a cooperative effort to outsmart the Wicked Witch of the West. In this unique team game, players work together against the Wicked Witch to get Dorothy to her home in Kansas. During the course of the game, different players will become the leader of the group, making decisions as the Wicked Witch tries to capture and defeat the team. Front Porch Classics’ The Wonderful Wizard of Oz allows young and old alike to actively relive America’s most beloved children’s tale. Game includes both basic and advances rules and features four beautifully designed character playing pieces, over 30 multi-colored gems and 100 unique playing cards.

name: It's Blunderful
description:
It’s Blunderful is a party game where you bet on how others would respond to awkward situations. It’s easy to learn you’ll be having fun in a matter of 30 seconds. With dynamic conversations and inspired storytelling, you’ll be surprised at the things you learn about your friends, family and yourself.

The game has fun, non-offensive content that’s relatable to adults so you can play with all of your adult friends and family. The strategic betting component raises the stakes for competitive players and keeps all players involved in every turn. Each player has their own betting scorecard used to place their bets. Read the Blunderful card and secretly choose how you would react. Other players place their bets on how they believe you would react. Everyone reveals their answers. Players who guessed the correct answer gain the points they wagered, but those who guessed incorrectly lose the number of points they wagered. The first person to reach 100 points wins.

Enjoy the camaraderie, the laughter and the stories that arise about the awkward moments – we’ve all been there.
publishers: Games by Bicycle, The United States Playing Card Company

name: The Valiant Card Game: Ninjak vs. The Valiant Universe
description:
The greatest heroes in the VALIANT UNIVERSE must team up to stop one of their own! NINJAK, MI-6's deadliest operative, has stolen an object of immense power and you must build up your power in order to survive against all the gadgets and threats he will throw at you while working towards your hidden agenda.

It won't be easy... are you up for the challenge?

Throughout the game, you will collect various tactics and artifacts that both make you more powerful so you can fight Ninjak while also earning you points towards your hidden agenda. The game ends after all of Ninjak's threats have been eliminated. You will need to work together with the other players to survive, but only the one who best completes their hidden objective will win the game.

Warning: Contains violent images.

—description from the publisher

name: Chrono Blocks
description:
From the Mindware site:

Tick, Tock—Quick, Find a Place for That Block!

Put your spatial skills to the test!
