A roll and write game of rails across various terrain where players try to connect Cities, buy and sell goods, and complete contracts. Players are responsible for upgrading their trains to be able to develop better abilities and make their travel easier and more profitable. The Conductor and Engineer lend a hand as well as the occasional Station that can be dropped on an empty hex of the map to complete those languishing routes.

Each turn a pair of dice are rolled. All players use the same dice to complete an action: place a track, hire Conductor and Engineer, work toward a train upgrade, buy or sell a Good.

Clever placement is the order of the day in this game, players will find themselves feeling like their trains are in vain on non-connected tracks until it all comes together and Contracts start flying off the board.

Train in Vain plays 1+ players, meaning any number of players could play as long as they have access to the dice.

—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Exploration, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Connections, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Lagniappe Games, Roll and Write Revolution

name: Das Spitzweg-Spiel
description:
The game is based on the paintings of a quite famous german artist, Carl Spitzweg. Therefore 80 big playing-cards with pictures of the artist are the main part of the components.

Publisher of the game is a company named Belser, but looking at the box it's quite obvious that this company seems to be just a branch of Kosmos (and the author Fritz Kruber is a Kosmos editor).

Players try to build exhibitions with the paintings of the master. All players work at the same exhibition by placing cards towards it following special rules. The exhibition is closed (and points are awarded) once a certain amount of pictures have been added - then a new exhibition starts until the deck runs out.

Game feels a bit like Rummy meets Scrabble (without words...) with a few twists.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Marvel Spider-Man & Friends 3-D Memory Match-Up
description:
Test your memory with Spider-Man & Friends! Just turn over the cups to see if you can make a match of Spider-Man or his superhero pals!

A version of 'Memory' notably different in that it contains no cards and players are not matching 'identical' pieces; instead, players match the top half of a painted miniature to the bottom half, all hidden under plastic cups. The game comes with a fold-out showing what the complete miniatures look like (mostly unnecessary once you discover, for instance, that Spider-man has bulbous 'manly' feet, and Spider-girl has petite 'girly' feet).

The 'carrying case', when opened, serves as the game board, impressed with spaces to place the half-miniatures and cups.

The rules also list a 'more challenging game' variation: after a 'full' miniature is found it is still removed, but the now empty cups remain on the board to throw off players: this variation is dependent on the plastic cups and therefore unplayable with other Memory-type games that use only cards.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Memory, Miniatures

name: Face Chase
description:
Description from the publisher:

How good are you at remembering faces? Flex your facial recall muscles in this mad dash to get rid of all your cards first!

In Face Chase, you race to match any features on your cards — such as hair, eyes, nose and mouth — to the quickly changing faces on the board. Find a match and drop it fast! The first to dump all their cards wins!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Escape the Labyrinth
description:
A cooperative riddle labyrinth for children.

The players are trapped in the haunted maze. They have to reach the two sets of keys and then the exit. For this, they need to rotate the cards to change the paths.

The maze consists of 7x7 cards with routes (including a start card, two keys, and an exit). On his turn, a player first moves the (shared) player token along existing paths. Then he can rotate a path card; to do this, he must first take one of the task cards, and correctly solve the task on it. A task has also to be solved when reaching a set of keys, or the exit.

There are 5 different types of tasks; for example, finding a specific illustration in the maze, counting how often a symbol appears in a maze, or recognize the correct shadow image for an item. The back of the task card shows the correct solution.

The players win the game if they get out of the maze with at most two wrong tasks. Three wrong answers, and the game is lost.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Dammi il malloppo
description:
Game for children in which everyone tries to steal their opponents coins.

In a cute combination of roll-and-move and abstract strategy piece movement, players move their three playing pieces around the board according to their d6 roll trying to land in adjacent squares to opponents' pieces to capture one of the coins sitting on top of the piece. Pieces with no coins are eliminated. The last player with remaining pieces wins.
publishers: MB Giochi, MB Jeux, MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Valente: O amor em jogo
description:
Valente - O amor em jogo is a storytelling game based on the stories I have created, Vitor Cafaggi, about this young and graceful dog, Valente.

Through the randomness of the cards and using their own skill, reasoning and experience, the players will assemble strips telling the story and the amorous misfortune of the Valiant. Players have the challenge of guiding our hero to the right choice. And what choice is that?

At this point in his life, Valente finds himself in a difficult time. With a platonic love story for Lady and living a recent passion with Princess, he finds himself in a bind, not knowing which of the two to give his heart. In the game, this is the scenario. You and the other players will help Valente make that decision, but that path will not be easy.

According to the created stories, you will guide Valente's heart as he hears the invaluable advice of his best friend Bu, plays RPG with his friends, takes his little sister to the ballet and devours roast beef sandwiches!

—description from the designer

name: Эадор: Владыки миров
description:
Rightgames LLC and Snowbird studio have released Eador: Masters of the Broken World board game based on "Eador" strategy computer games series. Action takes place in a fantasy world of Eador which is broken into pieces of a past holistic world, surfing across the Astral. Players take roles of the Masters, mighty demigods, trying to subordinate as many Eador shards as possible. They forward armies to conquer new territories, cast spells and perform powerful rituals.

The board game suits for 2-6 players but it’s mostly comfortable to play for at least 4 players. All players get their Master cards at the game start – such cards exist not only for the atmosphere, they also help to settle some controversies. 12-18 shard cards (amount depends on the number of players) are mixed up to a separate pile and the game is over when this pile flows out. There are always two shard cards on the table, the one for the current round and another for the next – it helps players to plan their moves concentrating on the shards which are easier to get. Shard conquering is performed by playing action cards; there are more then 100 of them – armies, spells and rituals. At the game beginning everyone gets 7 action cards to the hand. Usually it’s possible to add only one more card during the turn so using them should be careful. Rituals are the cards with especially strong features letting, for example, to take more action cards, take someone else’s action or shard cards, to gain more winning points. Player can’t fight for the chard during the turn if he performs a ritual but these cards give him further advantage.

At the beginning of the round each player decides if he will fight for the current shard or not. You need to play an army or a spell card to join a battle. The most important feature of the army is its power. Also there are the type of the army on the card (Light, Chaos or neutral), its class (warrior, monster, magician or undead) and nature of the ground (hills, swamps, plains, forests). Armies and some spells stay in the battle to the end of the round, some spells work only for the round they were played at. The result of the battle round is counted when all players interested in the shard have made their moves. The owner of the strongest army gets authority points counters according to his advantage above the second contender. Players can give up from the second turn and leave the battle. In this case they can’t play armies or spells anymore for the current battle but still have a chance to win if nobody acquires more authority points. When all players pass the battle ends and the shard goes to the player who gained maximum authority points.

Each battle has some pieces of subtleties. Firstly, it’s impossible to play Light and Chaos armies without a special card. Secondly, all the shards are different: some of them give advantages to defined type or class of armies or restrict using them, others allow to play two armies in a round. Thirdly, all armies fighting for the shard at the “native” land get extra strength. Attentive player will get a big profit considering all these features. When battle for the last shard is over players count their winning points on their conquered shards and performed rituals. That sum shows the winner.

The game for two or three players differs – they get 3 or 2 Master cards and make more actions during the round – to play a ritual and take part in the battle.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Koulutusleikkaus
description:
Koulutusleikkaus ("Education Cutback") is a game about cutbacks in Finnish education system by the current government - against their promises (Koulutuslupaus - education promise) prior to election. Main characters are Prime Minister Juha Sipilä and Minister of Education Sanni Grahn-Laasonen.

Players start with a certain number of students and teachers (wooden bits) which they assign to different schools (from primary to university). During the game, cutback after cutback (different event cards) force players to fire teachers or do some other unpleasant action which leads to student alienation. Players may struggle against the cutbacks (eg. reassign teachers), but eventually they can't save everybody. In the end, the player who lost the least is the winner - or the best loser.
—user summary

Koulutusleikkaus on peli koulutusleikkauksista ja niiden vaikutuksista.
Kukin pelaaja pelaa koulutuksen järjestäjää, joka yrittää saada oppilaitoksensa aina varhaiskasvatuksesta yliopistoon asti selviämään parhaalla mahdollisella tavalla hallituksen tekemistä leikkauksista.
Tässä pelissä ei ole voittajia, ainoastaan pienempiä ja suurempia häviäjiä.
Koeta tehdä parhaasi koulutuksen pelastamiseksi!

koulutusleikkaus on omistettu koulutukselle ja sen tuomalle taas-arvolle ja kehitykselle, sekä kaikille opettajille, muulle henkilökunnalle ja ennen kaikkea opiskelijoille, jotka ovat kärsineet koulutusleikkauksista.


—description from the back of the box (Finnish)

name: UNO: The Muppet Show
description:
Basic Uno-themed card game.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Mayhem" card, which works like a wild card except that it makes everyone at the table swap hands, the direction of the swap is decided by the person who played the card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: La Casa Stregata
description:
Strange noises come from the house!

Legend has it that on the longest night of the year, in the haunted Whippole Manor, the terrible Ghost Buu and his henchmen wake up and go around the city to scare the inhabitants. Only a brave hero can stop them, finding the only thing inside the house that calms Buu and makes him return to his age-old rest ...

… His ghost teddy bear!

The haunted house is a very simple game, inside the box you will find some tiles that will be used to represent the rooms and corridors of the house.

After placing the tiles to represent a haunted house, place all the characters on the starting tile the last one who was in a haunted house starts playing! Roll the die, make your move and flip the arrival tile, performing the action shown on it.
The objective of the game is to find the tile containing the ghost bear and bring it back to him to win the game.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Memory

name: Task Force
description:
In the late 1950's this game was sold in ads in comic books. You could order a copy for $1.25, complete with 2 boards, rules, and over 80 plastic pieces.

This game is very similar to Battleship, with a few additional rules. Each player has a gameboard (printed on cardstock-paper), later boards from the late 70's were printed on plastic with no backing at all, with 3 islands on it. Players place all of their units on their board (secretly; you can't see your opponent's board) at the beginning of the game. Units consist of Head Quarters, Tanks, Pill Boxes, Battleships, Destroyers, Landing barges, Aircraft Carriers, and Planes.

The objective is to locate which island the enemy HQ is on (when you sink the enemy Battleship, they must tell you if their HQ is on the North or South half of the board), destroy all enemy installations in that island, and send a landing barge to occupy it. You can also win the game by destroying both enemy barges (so they have no way to land on your HQ island anymore) or by destroying all enemy planes and ships (they can no longer attack).

Jean Shepherd (best known for the movie "A Christmas Story") mentioned an ad for Task Force on his June 18, 1963 radio show. It's not clear if he is discussing game 2982, 13059 or another version of this game.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Codebreaker
description: Pair-matching memory game a la "Concentration", with the twist that you can write your own code on the backs of cards you see, and try to figure out others' codes.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Pick-Up Lines
description:
From the manufacturer:

In Pick-Up Lines, players secretly write down their best responses to a pick-up line. Read the one you have out loud and score points if your line is chosen as the best. "Do you know what time it is?" "Time to get to know you better!" Outrageous every time you play - and unique with each gathering of friends. Plastic martini glasses, a shaker and olives add special twists to the fun.

For 3 to 6 adult players or teams.

name: Mission: Grenada
description: Mission: Grenada is a tactical level simulation of the U.S. rescue mission on the small island nation of Grenada. A unique game system of action points allows for great flexibility. Moderate complexity with playing times ranging from 1-4 hours depending on the scenario played.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Zulu: Naka
description:
Zulu battle of Naka is one of the series of games put out in the late seventies by Bearhug Publications...
It is a small map small counter game that can be played in less than an hour.
It has a nicely old style brown coloration style map but is fairly bare in regards to terrain..the counters represent the Army of Shaka Zulu and the opposing tribes that the emerging Zulu army machine fought and defeated on the war to the short lived Zulu empire. The counters are on solid cardstock and show shields as the main figure.

name: Charade
description: A version of the classic game Charade with a game board. Each team has a pawn on the spiral-shaped track. When a term (usually a compound word) is guessed by the team in less than 30 seconds, the team's pawn moves two squares, in under a minute, 1 square. On certain squares there are special tasks, such as presenting a term blindfolded or while holding hands with another player.

name: Heilig of Geilig?
description:
Heilig of Geilig? is a dutch partygame. It can be translated as Holy or Horny?

The players take trivia cards on which a 3 different hints are stated. These are vague and ambiguous and describe an object. The players have to guess the answer to get points. When they get it wrong they show their own 'horny' nature.

All players start at the same starting point on the board, this is in the middle of the board. On the one side are the holy/heilige points, on the other side the horny/geilige pionts. The oldest player begins. He takes a card and chooses one of the three hints from the card and reads it to his neighbour his leftside. When the player guesses the object with this one hint he may move up to 4 places. If a second hint is needed he moves up 3 places. After a third hint he can move up 2 places. But if passes after the 3 hint he has to move back 1 place. When he guessed wrong he has to move back 2 spaces. The game ends when a player gets at the top of the holy points.

The game contains:
- A board
- Pawns
- 300 playing cards

name: The Book of Medieval Wargames
description:
This large format book contains an accessible history of knights, chivalry, heraldry and medieval warfare and includes 4 games. The book includes:
- knight pieces, which are thin cardboard figures that stand up with plastic stands. Each knight in game has a different herald.
- a card for each knight to track abilities and injuries, (Each knight in the game has different ratings.)
- a board with a pop-up section, showing the nobles and masses watching the festivities.

The games are:
Joust: A simple double bluff game where the pairs of jousters pick a target area on their opponent and determine who was unseated.
Tourney: A small battle of knights mounted on horseback.
Melee: A small battle of knights on foot.
Battle: A game that combines both mounted knights and knights on foot.

These games are simple, small-scale wargames. They do include facing of each knight and combat is resolved on a series of flowcharts.

name: Rally Run!
description:
Everyone wants to hold the coveted DaCart Rally trophy — but the race track is tricky and constantly changing, so the drivers must try to remember the best route without getting trapped in a dead end! Who can steer their zooming racer as quickly as possible over the pit stop and across the right finish line?

Rally Run! is a tricky memory matching game.

—description from the back of the box

name: Feuerwehrmann Sam: Einsatz für Sam
description:
From the back of the box:
_Fireman Sam and his comrades have been called to duty. Who will be the first at the fire?
If you pick the correct action-chip you can place the ladder to advance quickly. But be careful if you pick the wet hose you'll slip and fall back again.

At his turn each player picks a face down action chip and executes the action displayed. The action chip remains face up.
Possible actions are:
- 1-4 steps ahead (shoes)
- climb ladder (short or long ladder)
- slip down (hose)
- turn all chips face down again (Fireman Steele)
- turn all chips face down again and shuffle them (Norman Price)

The first player to reach the fire at the end of the meandering track wins the game.

Content:
1* gameboard (6 pieces)
3* firemen figures
1* firewoman figure
4* standees
2* ladders
1* hose
9* duty chips
rulebook
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mega Monster City Smash!
description:
Two titans appear on the horizon. The behemoths quickly engage in battle, seeming to blindly attack each other with no care for the buildings around them. In fact, they seem to delight in the destruction left in their wakes. But there can be only one victor. Will it be you?

Mega Monster City Smash is a remote controlled monster city smashing game. In phase one, players build their city buildings using strategy to pick their build sites. Then, in phase two, they send their giant monsters into the city and smash their opponent's buildings before their own buildings meet the same fate. Fight off the opposing monster and keep your buildings from being reduced to rubble to achieve victory!

name: Floh am Po
description:
Floh am Po is a vacation-themed kids’ roll-and-move game of fleas clinging tightly to the fur of big wooden dogs (thanks to Velcro).

Each player has their own dog that they want to be the very first to reach the destination. The more fleas a dog is carrying the faster it will run. If it's your turn, you roll colored dice hoping that fleas will jump off the other dogs and onto yours.

Advanced rules are also included.

name: RallySport Board Game
description:
From the Designer/Publisher:

Players buy a car, then hit the road in a funny race to the finish line! At Gas Stations along the road, players "work" and make money for the drive. Valuable Draw Cards help you to overcome feisty opponent drivers!

RallySport keeps everyone involved, because outside of cheating, anything goes! Make deals on the side, trade Draw Cards, help somebody out for a future favor, buy an opponent's position on the board... if you can make the deal, DO IT!

name: Space Race
description:
Don't let the flimsy components put you off --this is a good game. It is similar in some ways to Settlers of Catan; here too cities sit at the vertices of hexes, which produce resources. However, the cities move, and the resources aren't renewable.

Each player buys a single box containg his colour components; when multiple players meet, the use their combined components. Most of the tiles make up Earth, but some may be used for the Moon and even Mars. Cities begin at Tech Level 1, Stone Age; as you explore surrounding hexes to recover the resources, you'll eventually be able to advance in technology to Iron, Coal, Oil, Uranium and Deuterium. Gold is money. Advance enough in tech, and your cities can go into orbit and eventually reach the other planets. Tech also gives you an advantage in city-to-city combat.

The game is very dynamic, since it is over by the time the last resources are harvested.

name: Himmel und Hölle
description:
English title: Heaven and Hell

The publisher's annual downloadable game for 2001 depicts the eternal battle between Heaven and Hell, played out on a 10 x 3 square grid. Each player's forces are represented by dice and their movements limited by player action points, the number of points available being dictated by the number of dice the player has in the play area. Dice gain strength by winning conflicts, but may may voluntarily reduce strength in order to move faster. Conflict is resolved by a combination of dice strength and cardplay. The player who manages to get the strongest dice into his opponent's home area wins.

name: Westwärts
description:
On his last long ride through the wide and wild West, the experienced expedition leader McTrucker realizes that he's getting too old for the job – but who will take his place? One of the greenhorns accompanying the current expedition?

To find out which of these greenhorns might be best for the job, McTrucker gives each of them a mission on the final day of the expedition – and to make sure he finds out how they fare against one another, the missions all bring them into competition with one another. Only the one who can enforce his will best over the others and best deal with unexpected situations will merit being appointed expedition leader.

To set up Westwärts, twenty wagon cards – along with settlers, gold mines and even a scout, barber, preacher, teacher, cook and gravedigger – are placed beside a munitions wagon. Five cards each are randomly distributed on four area cards (pastureland, desert, Indian country and mountain country). Thirty job cards can be completed, four of which are laid out face-up with a reward of 1-3 gold nuggets for each when completed.

The progress of the wagon train is controlled by cards, with each player holding three in hand. While game flow is simple, fulfilling demands is not always so. Each player places a movement card face down. The current player reveals his own and that of another. With these two cards, he then resolves the wagon train movements and tries to fulfill jobs. The game ends when a player has earned 15 nuggets or fewer than four incomplete jobs remain. Some jobs are simple with small payoffs while a more difficult one would require, for example, equipping one area with three settlers and two gold diggers or placing the preacher between a settler and a gold digger. In such cases, often the second card is of no help unless players make special arrangements with one another: You scratch my back, I scratch yours. Special cards do things like eliminate or paralyze certain wagons due to fire or broken axles.

name: Uräus
description:
This two to four-player race game uses a Mehen board (a spiral of 64 squares). The designer kept the random aspect (which he's done otherwise only with his Pharao game), but used a standard die instead of the Ancient Egyptian throwing sticks. Each player has three pieces which he tries to bring all the way in to the serpent's head. I don't think you can take opposing pieces (sending them back to the serpent's tail), but it seems you can form blockages and maybe even you can move back and forth as desired.

Check out the beautiful board at Pharao-Brettspiele's home page.

name: Il gioco della Formula Uno
description: Yet another imitation of Formula Dé. Roll the dice, try to get the correct symbols and run!

name: Chutzpah
description:
You could call this a Jewish version of Monopoly, without all the houses and hotels to build. Instead of Community Chest and Chance cards, you have Shlemiel and Shlemazel cards.

If you have a little mazel with the dice, you could end up with 5 weeks in Miami Beach.

Add a little Chutzpah, buy some smaltzy properties, avoid Tsoris and you could end up the Big K'nacker with all the Gelt. If you lose, you get Bubkis.

Unless you're a gonif and try and walk off with the Pushka, we'll all have naches.

The perfect gift for Bubbe and Zayda.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: First Galaxy G1
description:
The object is to fly a Rocket around the board to collect all 4 parts of a Battle Station, which is assembled at the base.
The Rocket must then race back to it's home base and dock with the Battle Station to win.
The game involves attacking other players with lasers, fuel management, a black hole, and an original designed board of a galaxy with 10 arms and round supply cards. If you are swallowed by the black hole you re-enter by rolling two dice, the 1st number selects the arm , the 2nd tells you how many spaces you move.

Contents:

1 Galaxy gameboard
5 Rockets
5 Space stations
56 Supply cards
60 Fuel cell pieces
1 Standard die
1 Deca dice
Rules
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Raid on Bananama: The Bad Boys Game
description:
A two-player game based on the Bad Boys comic series published in Warhawks magazine #2.

After the invasion of Bananama, the forces of the U.S. have taken El Presidente into custody... or have they? You play either the forces of the 'Bad Boys: American Special Forces', or 'The Cartel', the elite drug runners of the Third World. Each side wants El Presidente... the U.S., because he's been helping run drugs; the Cartel, to kill him before he talks.

Finding El Presidente will be difficult because of his duplicates, but if either player can get the real one to his HQ, he wins.

name: Norseman: Viking Kingdoms of the North Sea 900 - 1050
description: Norseman is a game of the latter half of the Viking period. The game is played in a series of turns, each of which is composed of phases, each of which may contain one or more sequenced segments. Raid, trade, incursion, levy, and outright warfare are all covered.

name: Nutty Elephant
description:
"Nutty Elephant loves to talk and spin on his circus stand and he loves to be fed peanuts. Feed Nutty as he goes 'round and 'round. If you feed him all of your peanuts he will reward you with a special trumpet blast"

For ages 3 - 6

name: Pro Jax
description:
ProJax is a collectible jacks variant. Through a combination of card play and traditional jacks action, players attempt to be the first to collect their own five jacks from the playing area. There are three ProJax products so far:

Starter Set - Contains 5 ProJax, ProJax ball, 3 Powerplay cards, 10 ID bands, and instructions

Booster Set - Contains 5 ProJax, 2 Powerplay cards, and 10 ID bands

Battle Arena Set - Contains 10 ProJax, 2 ProJax mines, 6 PowerPlay cards, 20 ID bands, 1 ProJax ball, a fold-out cloth arena, and a travel carrier that hold 5 ProJax and a ball.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Collectible Components

name: Space Race
description:
A simple roll-and-move game, where players move from outside the Solar System inward towards the Sun, visiting various planets along the way. 'Special' spaces include miss a turn, move forward/back (to next planet), and 'follow the trail of a passing comet' (snakes-and-ladders-style move forward/back).

From the rules:

Note to parents and teachers.

Space Race is a stimulating and challenging way for children to increase their interest and understanding of the solar system. It also enables children to practice their counting and reading skills, while providing the important experiences of turn-taking and co-operation. As they play, children are introduced to some technical vocabulary, and as they talk with adults and friends, they will develop their speaking and listening skills.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Space Exploration

name: Lord of the Rings: Battle of Destiny
description: This game is played in two parts. First, you must cast the magical stones to divine your personality, strengths and weaknesses. Will your destiny take you to Mount Doom to destroy the ring so that Good will prevail, or will you guard your precious band and give it to Lord Sauron to rule the world? One stone will give you faith in hard times and can give you the ability to glimpse into the future, while another will give you true power should you listen to your intuition. Fate awaits your roll. After your character is divined, you must battle to either control or destroy the One Ring. Once found, you must take the One Ring to Mount Doom and fulfill your destiny. Along the way, your power may change as Gandalf aids you in your struggle.

name: In the Chips: Silicon Valley
description:
"Welcome to the Silicon Valley! You'll soon be traveling through the Santa Clara Valley on its main highway, earning income, buying a new car, buying a home, and making investment decisions. Naturally, you can succeed or fail; just like reality, some of the decisions are up to you."



Game Play
like The Game of Life, players simulate a career, with the winner ending with the most money
...but focused in the Silicon Valley in the mid-1980s.

in the first few spaces players choose
a "Business" career with a static, higher salary
or a "Academic" salary which is initially lower, but gets boosted $10k every time the player lands on a Advanced Degree space (which does nothing for a Business player)

spaces are color coded
Green spaces are like Monopoly's "GO" space, with passing it getting the salary, and landing directly on it getting an "Opportunity" card
Orange spaces are newspapers, like Monopoly's "Chance" card, with a random bonus or penalty
Red spaces (concentrated in the last third of the board) are large money penalties

there are 3 kinds of investment spaces
yellow spaces are banks - get paid 10% of your current cash, take out a loan, make a payment on your loan
blue spaces (concentrated at the end of the first third of the board) are car dealerships.
you can own only one car
There is a penalty for never buying a car
Your car has a resale value (!) and you can upgrade your car
each dealership has a choice of 3 makes/models of car, and no one else can buy that car
more expensive cars are immune to more hazards that are on later spaces

white spaces are real estate agencies
you are encouraged to buy as many houses as possible. The prices are comparable to the real neighborhoods/cities at the time.
you only ever have to pay 25% of the price of the house, but there are some penalty spaces that will make you pay off another %50%
the resale value is always higher. This is the Silicon Valley in the 1980s!
to buy, roll the die. The number corresponds to the properties available, they start with 4 in each (24 cards). Pick one to buy it. A given house can have only one owner.


Opportunities cards are small businesses you buy now (when landing on a green space) and have a value that is randomly calculated on its table at the end of the game
some of the die roll results pay back less than the Opportunity cost!
you do not have to buy an Opportunity

once everyone gets to the end, players all total their assets
cash
opportunities (rolling for each one)
resale value of the car
sale price of real estate based on if it's paid off 25% or 50%
minus any other outstanding loans





Historical notesMany elements in this game were real businesses at the time

the careers are from companies from the area at the time: Intel, HP, Varian, Memorex, National Semiconductor
the newspaper is the San Jose Mercury News, which at the time was owned by Knight-Ridder
the car dealerships are all real businesses, mostly around Palo Alto and Mountain View
the banks were all real local banks
the real estate spaces were real agencies


"No one was ever charged to be in the game. "
mechanics: Income, Investment, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Trac 4
description: You must match a pattern shown on the tower by filling your tray with 16 cubes. You must complete your tray and switch off the tower before the tower shuts itself off. The tower will shut itself off after going around 12 times.

name: Portaaviones
description: Game that recreates the combat in the pacific, to be more precise the Battle of Midway, during the WWII among Carriers. The game is played with blind mechanics and logistics.

name: Disciples
description:
Disciples is a religious themed card game for 2 players.
As the Disciples are put into play, the players attempt to play cards from their hand attempting to get the required number of cards on a Disciple to close him out. Certain Disciples have special rules associated with them about how cards can be played.

When a Disciple is closed out, he is scored and another takes his place. This continues until only 1 Disciple remains. When this happens, the game is over and the total is taken.

name: Tri-o Tri-x
description:
Tri-o Tri-x is a game of Tic-Tac-Toe on nine different boards.

In the first round, participants place their tokens (either x's or o's) on any one of the game boards. When one has three in a row on a 3x3 square, he/she has won that board and places a large 'x' or 'o' token on it.

In the second round, players may move their tokens around either within a board or from board to board to try and 'win' more boards.

The first to win 3 boards in a row, wins!

One of Ravensburger's Traveller-Serie games.

name: Negamco Pro Hockey Game
description: A stat-driven game for simulating professional hockey matches. The initial release was furnished with 17 players per team for each of the six NHL teams at the time: Boston Bruins, Montreal Canadiens, New York Rangers, Chicago Blackhawks, Toronto Maple Leafs and Detroit Red Wings. Later season sets added teams as the NHL expanded. The game uses a spinner to generate a number, which is compared to the card of the player with the puck. The result is a shot or pass. Goalies are rated on ability to stop shots.

name: Equable
description: A game of tile placement similar to Scrabble using numbers and arithmetic symbols to make equations instead of words.
publishers: (Unknown), Fortuna Games, John N. Hansen Co., Inc., Nathan

name: Mudpluggers
description:
Mudpluggers, 'Hit the Trails and Ride'! The All Action Mountain Biking Game...

The blurb says... Players decide where they want to go, how fast, and what risks to take. Players stamina and general wear and tear challenged. Visually exciting graphic design captures the spirit of the game. Playing cards written with humor and in street language.

In real life, the game is fun to play and for younger children would have some educational benefit. Best of all, its about mountain biking and to some extent real life experiences you may have whilst riding, great fun and recommended...

name: Ara
description: Parrots want to eat crackers, but the black parrot is always in the way. By Dirk Hanneforth & Hajo Buecken. For 2-4 players Ages 5 and up.

name: Carcrash
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #49. Based on their minitel-multi-player game.

Equip your car and fight other players' cars

name: Annie Oakley Game
description:
From the box cover:

a Golden Key game

Key to Fun and Learning, Ages 4 - 12
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Mad Math
description:
In this game, players roll the dice and multiply the two numbers together. They then place one of their pawns on the correctly-numbered space on the board, and the first player to get three pawns in a row wins.

For younger players, the other side of the board offers the same game, using addition instead of multiplication.

name: Slalomspelet
description: Downhill skiing game with the Swedish national team from the 1970's. Be the first down the hill. Endorsed by the Swedish alpine skiing legend Ingemar Stenmark, whose picture covers the box front, the Ski Team Sweden Alpine (Svenska Alpine Landslaget) and the Alpine Ski Pool (Alpin-Skid-Pool Sverige).

name: The Birthday Game
description: This is a party game for 4 or more players. The person whose birthday it is fills out a special bio questionnaire. Teams move around the board performing silly tasks and answering silly questions to advance. The first team to reach the Birthday Cake space gets a chance to answer the bio questions. The team that answers the most questions correctly wins.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Planet Quest
description:
The first animal in space was a dog. True or False? The sun is a star. True or False? Learning about our solar system is much more than memorizing planets! It’s full of fascinating facts. Earn planet cards for correct answers. Put the planets in the right order, and you win!

Blast off into a learning journey through space! Be the first to collect all the planets in the solar system by answering the True/False question cards. Watch out for the black hole, asteroid belt and supernova - you might get lost in space!

* Teaches fascinating facts about our solar system
* Planet Fact Sheet Included
* Includes two challenging levels of game play

Contents:
Planet Quest Board Game - unfolds to 48" across!
4 Astronaut Game Pieces
Spinner
Guide
132 Game Cards
Planet Facts
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Space Exploration, Trivia

name: Counterstrike
description:
From the rules:

COUNTERSTRIKE is a unique and challenging game of superior forces for 2 players aged 8 to adult.

"When you play COUNTERSTRIKE you will attack and attempt to occupy your opponent's defensive position but you must watch carefully because if not they will rapidly come back at you with their own strategy move and COUNTERSTRIKE.

COUNTERSTRIKE is entirely a matter of skill. Luck plays no part at all. There is no dice, there are no question cards and you never lose any of your pieces. It is up to you, right to the very end. An opponent may be just a couple of moves away from an apparent win, but you may still be able to turn the tables and COUNTERSTRIKE.

COUNTERSTRIKE is tremendously addictive. No two games are alike and the more you play it the more you will discover how tactics can be all important.

Almost anyone can play from 8 upwards and will enjoy the challenge it presents.

COUNTERSTRIKE has a wide variety of game patterns which can be played, and learned in just a few minutes. The rules are very simple. Play it once and you will never need to look at the rules again. That's a promise!"

Each player has 24 pieces which are placed in one line of 4 and two lines of 10 on the 10x16 grid that forms the gameboard. The center two spaces of the line of four are coloured and represent the player's defence area.

The object of the game is to move your pieces so as to occupy your opponent's defence area. The game is won by the first player to succeed in occupying and holding both the spaces of his opponent's defence position.

There are three types of move allowed:
- A single piece can move one position in any direction (forwards, sideways, backwards or diagonally).
- A straight line of pieces can be moved one space in any direction.
- A piece may be moved from either end, or from anywhere within a line of pieces to the opposite end of the line. If the position is occupied by an opponent's piece then that piece may be removed and placed at the opposite end of its line, provided that the player's line of pieces is greater in number than his opponent's.

name: Boerenschroom
description:
Boerenschroom is a 19th Century Dutch dice game, played with two special six-sided dice. One die has the letter 'B' and faces showing one, two and three spots; the other two faces are blank. The other die has the letter 'S' and faces showing four, five and six spots; the other two faces are blank. Also needed for play are eight cards, depicting a Lawyer, Clerk, Mayor, Secretary, Forester, Tax Collector (the Boerenschroom or 'Peasant's Fear') and two Peasants.

Two to eight players pay or receive bets according to the roll of the dice and the cards they hold.

name: Star Encounters
description:
STAR ENCOUNTERS - The zodiac game - provocative, fun and revealing.

STAR ENCOUNTERS is not only fun to play - it's a game to be treasured. Illustrated with images from original 14th century Italian manuscripts - Roman gods, ruling planets and mythical creatures exquisitely illuminate the splendor of the star signs.

Your objective is to travel the zodiac and complete your "crystal" star. Crystals are won by answering questions on how different players react in various humorous and real life encounters. Use your own experience and the clues provided to select the right answers, but beware - "choose a player" cards can surprise you, topple your lead or even lose you the game!

As play unfolds and interaction develops, personalities are revealed, passions aroused and secrets discovered - all adding to the fun and excitement of STAR ENCOUNTERS, even for those with no knowledge of star signs!

name: First to Five
description: First to Five is a fun, challenging Go-Moku game of tactical moves and counter moves. The object of the game is to be the first player to place five marbles in a formation like the "five" on a die. Players take turns placing marbles and may make the "5" pattern any size on the playing board as long as all the marbles are equally spaced.

name: Trivial Pursuit Mini Pack: Rock & Pop
description: This Mini or Pocket Pack was made for use with the Trivial Pursuit Pocket Player Set Game but also featured color coded questions for use with the regular Trivial Pursuit games. This set contains 120 questions about Rock & Pop music.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Music, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: Horn Abbot Ltd., Parker Brothers, Parker Spiele, Selchow & Righter

name: Mighty Beanz Trading Card Game
description:
An educational collectible card game designed for younger children based on the popular Mighty Beanz series of collectible toys. Moon Quest, the first wave, contains 131 card to collect.

Card come in 40 card starter decks and 9 card booster packs.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Humor

name: Monopoly: Mustang
description:
From the box:

The world's most famous board game now gives you the chance to lasso your dreams and desires of owning the best of the breed of America's most famous sports car. This very special Mustang Edition gathers together, in a single corral, four generations of the most amazing automotive horsepower to ever gallop out of Detroit. Convertibles, hardtops, fastbacks, prototypes, show cars, muscle cars, Indy 500 pace cars and more. This Monopoly Game is the ultimate Mustang fantasy.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Turtle Recall
description:
Preschoolers will meet their match in this fun memory game.
Objective: Try to match the number under each turtle's shell with the numbered lily pads. The player who matches the most turtles and lily pads wins.
Turtle Recall really puts young minds to the test with memory matching and counting fun!
Two levels of play.
Game Play:
1. Shuffle the lily pad cards
2. Place turtles next to lily pads, shells down
3. Take turns flipping up turtle shells to match lily pad number. The most matches wins!
4. Try adding the "scramble" turtle for a second level of memory-matching fun!

name: Hey, Bartender!
description:
In Hey, Bartender! everyone is trying to take change from a friendly bartender. Each player is dealt a hand of seven cards. The 'bartender' also gets seven cards, played face up on the table. The object of the game is to trade cards with the bartender, making change such that the bartender gives the player more points than the player gives the bartender. Play continues until all players have exhausted their hands, at which time the player with the most points wins.

Hey, Bartender! was designed as another version of Pennywise played with cards, and was published in Game Trade Monthly in 1999.

name: The Mind Game
description:
Create the longest possible line in a growing grid of lines on Hex tiles, each with 3 lines in two colors. This was an antecedant of Tantrix, and was called Tantrix at one time.

Similar to:

Tantrix
Kaliko

name: Mad Roll: the Mad Libs Dice Game
description: Use a Boggle-esque tray to roll dice with words or word types (noun, Adjective, etc.)on them to build and score sentences.

name: PotzKlotz
description:
Potzklotz contains of 5 wooden cubes, a 5 x 5 board with squares and 56 cards. The cubes are set in the middle of the board, shaping one form. The players draw 5 cards each from the stack of 56 cards. On these cards are pictures of other shapes, created by the 5 cubes. If the player on turn thinks, he can rebuild the existing shape into one shape of the cards on his hand by moving only a single cube, he plays a card and tries it without turning the board and in a single trial. If he is not able to rebuild the shape, he has to draw one more card from the stack.

The player who first gets rid of all his card, wins.

There are different rules in the box, so you can vary from lighter gaming to more heavier: Without building over the border of the board, with penalty cards for mirror-shapes etc.

Potzklotz is for children up from 7, but also for grown-ups. It is pretty difficult to think three-dimensional and turning the shapes in your imagination. SO it is good math training and much fun, too.

Home Page: http://www.potzklotz.de

name: Gallop Home
description:
From the box: "Train your horse and win! Have you ever wanted to train your own horse? Now you can with the game Gallop Home! Travel around the board in this exciting, fun filled, educational game that will take your imagination into the horse world."

Each player chooses one of four horses, each having a corresponding game pad and a plastic, molded horse-head movement token. The game pad lists the training goals of each horse type; for example, the Arabian's most important training is pleasure, then, in sequence, halter, endurance, dressage, reining, driving, racing, trick riding, jumping, and barrels. Other horses emphasize different training schedules.
Players roll and move around the board, attempting to participate in the training most important to their horses. They also gather bonuses for proper care of their horses; for example, a stop at the vet scores points. The winner isn't necessarily the one to get to the end of the game board first, but to have accumulated the most points for training and care.
publishers: Gallop Home LLC, Reveal Entertainment, Inc.

name: Fatti di Calcio: Soccer Strategy
description:
FATTI DI CALCIO - SOCCER STRATEGY
translation: hooked by soccer - soccer strategy

A football (soccer) game simulation for 2 players, another new ITALIAN game following the new wave of Italian game designers.

A really interesting play mechanism; you can use your dice-roll results in several different ways (moving the players, passing the ball), white dice for the players, yellow dice for the pass, and every player has a different numbered shirt (like in a real football match). Through a very clever system the value of this number can be used to get a better pass or to move others players.
Also, to score the player has to bring (literally) the ball inside the goal area. Shooting from distance is not an option.

...English version will soon be on the market

name: Freibier
description: Players are playing cards (value of 0-4) and try to avoid a sum of 21. The player who reach the 21 loses one of his three blanking caps or has to drink two gulps of his beer. Different actions cards bring some alternation into the game.

name: Jump!: A Horsin' Around Card Game
description:
Kids who think, talk, and dream about horses all day long will be crazy about this deck of Horsin' Around card games.

The Jump! deck will have English and Western riders alike jumping, racing, and spinning their way through the lineup of six card games. Deal out the cards and get ready to jockey for first place in "Neck and Neck," a contest in which riders try to gallop the farthest on a tabletop track. Vie to become top horse in the field by winning all the cards in the game of "Pecking Order." Then use your ESP (Equine Sensory Perception) to make the right matches in the challenging memory game of "Horse Sense."

The Jump! cards are full-color and depict all things horse related, from types of feeds, grooming tools, tack and riding accessories to a variety of fun facts that will really give horse lovers plenty to talk about! Each deck comes with a bonus gift of four collectible horse breeds cards.

Dedicated horse fans--and even kids who don't know a gait from a gate--will enjoy these fun, fast-paced games.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Monkey in the Middle
description:
From the publisher:

Monkey in the Middle is a fun skill and action game that lets players take chances with the roll of the dice. With a delightfully illustrated game board, players try to roll their monkey dice into the special "Banana Zone" to earn Banana Scoring Chips. But if you roll too hard one of your monkeys may fall into the middle and be gone! A unique way for little ones to practice counting and grouping and to interact with each other.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Number

name: Top Job
description:
This game deals with careers in professional life. First the education and after a while earning money.

This is done on a board with 4 rings at 24 spaces each. Players begin on the out-most ring, where education costs nothing. When moving to the inner rings, players choose a profession and start to earn money. It's possible to choose a profession, where you don't have all required qualifications, but you take the risk of loosing that job during an inspection. Further education, money investments and other things are still possible on the 3 inner rings.

Winner is the richest player after a previously agreed playing time.

name: Myth
description:
"Myth" is an interactive video card game. There are two levels at which the game may be played - for the Beginner level, players, via battles, must be the first to collect a set of 5 different warriors (Human, Elf, Goblin, Dwarf and Troll) of any number ('1', '2', or '3'), whilst in the Standard level players must battle to collect a set of 5 different warriors of the same number.

Battles are resolved by players simultaneously playing numbered Warrior and Weapon cards and consulting a battle grid (player with the top total score wins the battle). Depending on the result, Warriors and/or Weapons are then exchanged between the players or the deck.

The main feature of the game is an accompanying video (played during the game) which features the "Battlemaster" who dictates changes to the gameplay which will 'make certain only the best warriors (players) will prevail'. This includes penalizing the current leader (by removing a Warrior card from their hand), helping the current loser, swapping/taking cards from another players hand, and other such winner-influencing actions.

The game was produced in Western Australia by a now apparently defunct games publisher.

name: Monopoly: Boston Red Sox
description:
From the Publisher:

The MONOPOLY® Brand proudly presents the Boston Red Sox™ Collector’s Edition of America’s favorite board game. We bring Red Sox fans the best of the Red Sox – players, coaches and team icons. Featuring Ted Williams, Jason Varitek and Carlton Fisk, and collectible pewter tokens including a Red Sox hat, batter, pitcher, World Series trophy, Sox and ball in glove. This MONOPOLY Game is a must-have collectible for the die-hard Red Sox fan. This collector’s game captures and brings to life the Red Sox greatest accomplishments including the 1918 and 2004 World Series Championships. Home to some of the most accomplished players in Major League Baseball®, the Red Sox continue to make for exciting play in this classic game of risk taking and deal making
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: L'Autoroute
description:
This game was designed by the same author as Milles Bornes (1954), Edmond Dujardin. It was meant to make people more familiar with the driving code. The game won a prize: the 'Medaille d'argent au concours Lepine Paris 1949'.

The game was an ever-present on the French market under the same name since then, undergoing several editional faceliftings design-wise. The 1949 edition contained 6 small cars in lead, each car for a player. The goal of the game is to take your car to a wedding, to pick up family members and get a present on the way to the wedding. But first U have to get your driving license. This is done by moving on the track on the board and learning/respecting the road code (speed limit, unique direction). Several things can happen on the board: an accident, blown tire,... There also is a garage, a gangster, a dépanneur (troubleshooter) and a gangster that can be met on the board. Vintage game for collectors.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Dujardin, Editions Edmond Dujardin, Educa Sallent SA

name: Pomela
description:
Today Kim and Andy have to get up particularly early because they are going with their granddad to the large meadow outside of the village. There are a lot of fruit trees there, and as the apples have turned a dark-red shiny color over the last few days, they are ripe for picking. Granddad has promised to make sweet jam for the two of them if they pick a lot of apples, but picking them without dropping them can be a challenge!

Contents:
• 1 apple tree (235 x 185 x 3,5 mm)
• 2 fruit pickers
• 10 apples
• 30 winning tokens (jam jars)
• 1 sand glass
• 1 basket
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box

name: Over Pakistan
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple abstract game of modern air combat between India and Pakistan played out on a small area map. The object is to destroy all of the opposing aircraft. Aircraft are rated for attack and defense, and combat is resolved by die roll when opposing aircraft occupy the same area on the mapsheet.

name: Personology
description:
Personology is a boardgame controlled by a video tape.

On your turn you'll have to guess the name of a famous personality. You'll be presented a blurry picture, a quote or something similar.

If you guess correctly within 7 seconds you get to roll the dice and double your movement.
If you guess correctly between 8 and 15 seconds you get to roll the dice and move normally.
If you fail to guess within 15 seconds the other players can try to guess themselves. If another player guesses correctly, he steals your turn.

Each correct guess also gains the player a chance card. These cards break the rules in various ways.

First player to reach the finish wins.

name: World Wise African Edition
description:
(Back of box):PUT THE WORLD IN YOUR HANDS with this great new educational family card game! No matter what your age or education level, no matter how little or how much you know about geography, you can be equally competitive. Parents and children can play and learn together. Prepare for an upcoming vacation or sharpen your knowledge for a business trip. Or just relax and have fun.

There is a card for each country on the African continent and each body of water bounding Africa, as well as wild cards and super wild cards. Each player must play a card whose geographic location shares a boundary with the card that was last played. Bluffing and using wild cards add strategy to the play.

Exciting and educational for 2-8 players, ages 9 years to senior citizens.

name: Agrarisch aan- & verkoopspel
description:
The Agrarisch aan- & verkoopspel (Agrarian sell and buy-game) is a roll and move game produced by the Dutch agrarian cooperation Cebeco and "De Boerenbond" a Dutch agrarian retail cooperation.

Players expand their farm with livestock, greenhouses and tractors on the middle part on the game-board. On the outer track of the gameboard players move their pawn in a roll and move style, landing on some spaces gives the player the chance to buy above additions to their farms. Other spaces on the outer track can make the player sell produce, enter a cooperation, damage others property, change the market price, pay upkeep or draw a chance card.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Geni: Norge gjennom 100 år
description:
A game in the series of Norwegian Geni trivia games, released in the event of Norway's 100th anniversary. The rules are equivalent to the original Geni, but this game only has four categories, namely Norway and the world, Sports and Entertainment, This changed us, and Norwegian history. To win the game, the player must correctly answer a by the players chosen number of questions from one card correctly.

Contents:

Game board
Six playing pieces
24 Geni-pieces
250 cards with 1000 questions

name: Bella Sara
description:
Bella Sara is an imaginative, joyful world of horses, where every girl is special and uniquely beautiful! Horse cards can be collected, traded with friends and used to play fun card games. Each horse has a positive message for you to discover. Every card also has an activation code, which you can enter on bellasara.com to put your horses online in your very own stable.

Once your horse is online, it will be your friend forever! You can care for your horse by feeding it, training it, brushing it and building up its energy. What is Bella Sara’s World? It’s a magical place that you can explore with your favorite horses. There are castles and forests, beaches and racetracks – everything a horse and a girl could wish for.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy

name: Katze
description:
"From far away you can hear the loud meowing of the cats. If you can guess how many cats' eyes will twinkle at you, you can join in the singing of the cats.

But, beware of the big dog ..."

Another game in the HABA Mini-Spiel line. Players roll a die that determines how many cat faces they are hoping to match. Players then toss a handful with as many cats (one blank side, one face side) as they choose into the air. If they are successful, they keep a cat face. Play continues until a player has gathered three cats.

This children's game teaches turn taking, counting up to four, and simple probability.

name: Michael Bully Herbig Spiel: Trilogie
description:
This game offers at least for the fan of the Munich comedian genuine cult potential. In funny small dialog , which originate partially from the feather/spring from Bully Herbig, a search term is replaced in the text by the word “Bully”. While a player reads out the texts, the others must try to guess the term. This guessing takes place into four steps, trying to encircle the term a bit in each round. Amazing what (wrong) associations some first references may lead to.
While this first part of the game is strictly played in sequence, as soon as someone says the correct answer the game changes into chaotic action.
The so-called riddle master must try to catch with a cup the figures of the others, which stand in the center of the game board. They try to pull fast enough the cord and thus theirs figures of the board, otherwise point loss.
This odd mixture of knowledge and dexterity, has even something from the parodic humor of the Bully films.
Two long-proved mechanisms are connected here in new and unusual way to an entertaining game.

name: Search & Rescue
description:
Four areas in the Park are reserved for exploration: a lake with an island, desert conditions, mountainous trails and forest paths.

Stormy weather comes up and a child, a young woman, an older man and a family of five are missing. We are a search & rescue team sent out to find and rescue these missing persons.

We share equipment, develop strategies and contend with mounting storm centers! Tense, real life situations are faced. On each turn, tough choices have to be made. Only working as a team can lead to a happy ending.

Contents:
12x12-inch board showing four park areas
cards depicting motor power
horn hailer
infrared binoculars
trained search dog
GPS tracker
storm passes
rescue equipment: jeep, helicopter, boat & searchers
4 people tokens
28 storm tokens
rules

name: Conversion
description:
This game is similar to the Flash game Proximity (available many places, for example: http://www.mathsisfun.com/games/proximity.html ). Players roll a hand of 5 dice, then each in turn place them on a chess board. If a die is placed adjacent to dice of the same player, those dice are promoted in value. If placed adjacent to dice of another player, those dice are converted to the placing players color and raised one in value. Several winning conditions are given, including most points, most area, and other options based on these.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=23

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: War: Stalingrad
description:
The Wargame system is devoted to battles of WWII (1939-1945).

It models tactical level of combat operations. A corresponding card represents each military formation. They may be infantry, armor, artillery and aircraft units, or even special troops (e.g. Guerrillas). As a rule a card depicts certain military unit, usually company or platoon. Game parameters of unit cards are adjusted to reflect not only their power but also tactical capabilities in terms of the game mechanics. Resource cards reflect the economic powers of each side, which enable them to build and maintain armies and to take military actions.

name: Abyss
description:
This game is played on a 5×5 board. One player drops 6 white stones and 6 black stones on empty cells. The other player then may: (a) choose a color and be the second to move, or (b) choose to move first and the other choose color.

On each turn, each player must orthogonally slide a friendly stone, pushing all stones it that line, until at least one enemy stone is pushed out of the board.

When one player cannot execute a valid move, the game ends. The player with more stones on the board wins.

name: Atoms
description:
Split molecules into smaller atoms & stalemate your opponent in this 2-player abstract game.

Equipment:

* 8x8 square board
* 11 stones per player

On the first turn White drops an atom on any cell; then players alternate placing atoms on any empty cell which is adjacent to exactly one other atom (of either color). After all atoms are placed they form one large molecule, which may split into several smaller molecules during the game.

Each atom has a valence, which is the number of atoms (of either color) adjacent to it (include diagonal). Players must now move one of their atoms to any adjacent empty cell provided that its valence in the new position is exactly the same as its valence in the old position.

Any atom which is not adjacent to an enemy atom is unstable. Immediately after each move, the players remove all unstable atoms from the board. This also occurs after Black makes his last drop.

A player wins by stalemating his opponent, (leaving him with no legal moves). A player also wins by leaving an empty board (after the removal operation); in fact this is a special case of stalemate since his opponent would have no moves at all.

R. Kraus defined two variants: Isotopes, where each atom can move any number of cells (instead of just being able to move to the adjacent cell); and Radioactive Atoms, where a stone may also commit suicide (if able to move to an isolated cell)

name: Quarters
description:
Quarters is a card-game component of the popular drinking game.

Players have two shotglasses or tumblers on opposite ends of the table. When the glass is in front of you, you must bounce a quarter on the table and into the glass. When you do this twice, you pass the glass counter-clockwise to the player next to you. If a player is caught with both glasses passed in front of him, he must then drink a shot of alcohol.

When a player must take a shot, they choose another player to draw a Quarters card. The cards in Quarters give players different challenges or restrictions, from having to name a U. S. State before bouncing their quarter each time, to getting protection from drinking if you can bounce your quarter into the glass more times than required.

Quarters comes with 32 different cards. Quarters not included.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Real-time

name: Little Storm's Lunchbox
description: Help Little Storm make his own packed lunch, even help him put the lid on his lunchbox. This game involves finding fruit, vegetables and other food items. The game is over once the lunchbox lid is in place. The game is very suitable for children at kindergarten age and gets them to talk about packed lunches and the kinds of food they best like to find in their lunchbox.

name: Trodde du ja!
description:
A game there the goal is to get your pawn to the end of the gameboard and the first to do this win.
Each turn one player roles the dice and depending on the result he take a question cards and read it aloud. After this each person tries to guess which answer the reading player are going to choose. Depending if you guess right or not you move your pawn on the gameboard.

The game contains the following.

1 Gameboard
6 Pawns
1 Dice
300 Question cards
30 Player cards
1 card holder
1 Hourglass (30 sec)

name: Monopoly: Oldenburg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Oldenburg, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Code-Cracker
description:
Each player has a rack with a row of six disks on top and a row of six disks on the bottom. Each disk has numbers from 0 to 6. The top row is adjusted by the players to form their 'secret codes' while the bottom is used to deduce the code of the opponent.

The codes are cracked by drawing question cards, which must be truthfully answered by the opponent. The questions are in the form of simple mathematics involving the dials on the secret code, such as "what is the sum of the third and sixth figures" or "multiple the second figure by the fourth".

By collecting the information in this manner, the players try to deduce the secret code of their opponent, and the first to do so wins!
publishers: Blue Zebra, Vanderlee Int. Trading B.V. Heel

name: Patriots & Loyalists:  Rules for the American Revolution
description:
Patriots and Loyalists is a set of miniatures rules for gaming the smaller battles of the American Revolution and French and Indian War. While designed for 25mm figures on an 8'x5' table, the game can be played with 15mm or smaller scales and adjusting movement and firing distances.

Units in the game are infantry battalions, cavalry regiments, and artillery batteries. Typical organizations require 6-9 stands of infantry, which include command stands and stands of grenadiers and/or light infantry. Light infantry and grenadiers can be converged into their own organizations if desired. Units are rated A-F depending on training and morale. This affects movement as well, in that lower grades of troops require multiple actions to carry out formation changes.

The turn sequence is as follows:

1. Active player determines number of actions available (2-4)
2. If Active player has 3-4 actions, he may use these actions to move and/or fire units as desired. If he rolls only 2 actions, the Reactive player is allowed to Preempt or react (e.g., evading).
3. Melee phase.
4. Brigade morale phase.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Spy Gear: Spy Wire
description: Race against the clock to neutralize detonators and deactivate the explosive before it blows! In this fast-moving, suspenseful strategy game, players slide the wire tiles to make connections between their defuser and their opponent’s pegs, close the circuits, and deactivate their fuses. Comes with an electronic countdown timer and explosive sound effects that create sudden-death endings if you make the wrong move. Live to spy another day…there’s not a second to waste!

name: Gold and Glory: The Road to El Dorado
description:
Based on the Dreamworks movie.

Players move movie-character standies along a path according to the roll of a single die. They may move forward or back.

Some spaces require a card draw from the Trivia deck, where the player reads aloud trivia about the movie or the making thereof, and then follows the directions on the card which may move them forward or back, give or take a turn, etc.

Other spaces give one of eight gold coins that correspond to characters or locations in the movie.

Still other spaces allow drawing a card from the Discovery deck; these have questions about Mayan civilization and if answered correctly allow the player to move to any gold coin space and acquire that gold coin.

Collect a full set of eight gold coins and you win!

Game includes six color character standies, one six-sided die, the Trivia and Discover decks, a bunch of cardboard gold coins, and a mounted color board.
categories: Ancient, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Mauseloch
description:
There is a lot of hubbub among the mice as there are only a few minutes left before the annual relay race begins. The mice warm themselves up, as each team wants to win the race. The cheese has to be quickly lifted and placed on the head, the tidbits added and they are off...

As soon as the first mouse of a team stands completely on the opposite mouse hole,the game ens, thereby winning the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Racing

name: Domina 4
description:
Here is Domina 4. Be careful. It may cause a headache!

What you need to play Domina 4:

- 25 square tiles in 5 colours (5 each).
- 5 black pawns.
- 5 white pawns.

Randomly configure a 5x5 board using the 25 coloured tiles so that no 2 tiles of the same colour are orthogonally connected. You can draw a board if you don't have tiles.

Placing phase: White starts. Players in turn place ONE of their pawns in any empty square of the board until all the pawns have been placed.

Moving phase: White starts. Players in turn MUST move ONE of their pawns 1 square up, down, left or right to an empty square.

The game ends when one of the players ‘dominates’ the board by having placed 4 of its pawns in 4 squares of the same color.

name: Monopoly: Corse
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Corse region, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Bartender
description:
Bartender is a card game in which players compete to make the most money by mixing fancy drinks. The fancier the drink, the more money it is worth.
In Bartender, the table represents the bar, the deck of cards represents the store-room full of ingredients, and the cards in the players hands represent the ingredients the players are carrying from the store-room to the bar.
Players must 'stock' the bar with the cards from their hand so that they can mix fancy drinks but unless they are careful, the other players can use those cards to mix their own drinks.
Bartender was designed as a bartender training aid.
After a few plays, players will start to memorize the formulas for the over 50 real drinks depicted in the game.

name: Summoner Trinity
description:
This is a fantasy themed CCG from Thailand.

The game has 3 card types that can be separated by their backside: Seal cards (blue with star), Mystic cards (red with sun) and HP cards (white with moon).

The game has similar rules to Summoner Master but shorter game. The difference between this game and Summoner Master is HP mechanic and upgrade mechanic of each Seal cards (Character cards) and the deck construction size.

This CCG card size is half from Summoner Master.

This game has 3 variants.

Single game - 15 Mystic cards + 15 HP cards
Buddy game - 20 Mystic cards + 40 HP cards
Trinity game - 30 Mystic cards + 60 HP cards


The cards and rules are only available in Thai.

Modified from

Summoner Master
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Blitzmerker
description:
The players read the super-large cards, visible for all players in the middle of the table, and
Then they must answer the truest answer from their response cards on the table.
The later you respond, the less points you get.

Contents:
240 super-large cards with about 2400 questions and
Selection
6 x 4 answers reply cards,
6 Jocker cards scoring pad,
pencil,
game instructions

name: Schweinerennen
description:
This is a race of rubber pigs and their owners (wooden meeples). They move forward by dice rolls, but more importantly by the instructions found on event cards which have to be drawn when a meeple reaches certain squares on the game board.
In order to win, a player has to get his/her pig over the finish line and then the owner in the same turn.

name: Playmobil: Dinoworld
description:
Small children's coop game in which you try to save the dinosaurs from an erupting vulcano.

Dinosaur counters come in four distinct colors. They are mingled with some explorer counters and then put face down in the middle of the table.

The players take turns in rolling the die. When one of the colors turns up, the player throws a cardboard lasso, trying to catch one or more counters. Those are turned faced up and the ones matching the color of the die roll are considered rescued and taken out of the game. Explorer counters are simply taken out of the game. Non matching counters are turned face down again.

When a vulcano is thrown, one of five vulcano pieces is turned over. When all five pieces are turned over the game is lost. If players succeed in rescueing all dinosaurs before that happens, they win the game jointly.

WARNING: the Playmobil theme is a loose one and although the cover art suggests that you might expect to find some real dinosaur playing pieces in the box, this is a plain cardboard game.

name: Die drei ??? und die Masken der Dämonen
description: The players move through a forest, trying to find the demons' masks in different hideouts. On some of the fields there are chips which a player can turn around when he or she reaches that field. Some force the player to draw an event card and follow the instructions on it; others give hints about a certain hideout. If a player has four hints for one hideout, he or she can move there and pick up a mask card which has a point value. The player with the highest valued mask cards at the end of the game is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ugly Duck
description:
Ugly Duck is played on a 5x5 square board.Each player starts with 5 stones(ducks)on the first row.
A duck moves one cell orthogonal or diagonal forward.
Ducks capture diagonal forward.Captures are not mandatory.
A duck reaching last row is promoted to a swan.
A swan moves one cell orthogonal or diagonal backward (toward start row).
Swans capture diagonal backward.Captures are not mandatory.
Wins the player who first moves a swan into his first row.

name: Medina de Rio Seco
description:
Simple board wargame on the July 14, 1808 Peninsular War battle between a French corps commanded by Bessières and the Army of Galicia under the joint command of Blake and La Cuesta.

Published in Casus Belli (Issue 19 - Feb 1984) magazine.

1 map sheet, 17x26 hexes map + charts
60 unmounted counters
rules

Sequence of Play:
- French Movement
- French Combat
- Spanish Movement
- Spanish Combat
- Reorganization

Rules Notes:
- 1 historical and 1 hypothetical scenario
- 8 turns
- Locking Active Zones of Control
- units check for possible disorganization (die roll) after each retreat
- leaders, lines of communication

name: Wyx
description:
Wyx is a 2 to 4 player game where each player control an ant queen on a 8 by 8 squares board.
After each move the queen lay an ant egg, althoug on some square she may lay more than one.
