The moves are done by chosing from 4 columns of dominos, the top of each column being visble. Each dominos have a vertical and horizontal values indicating the move the queen will have to execute.

The aim of the game is to be the first player to lay out its 16 eggs.

name: Sprizza la Parola
description:
From box:
An original game, exciting, full on the Italian language.
3000 questions on 13 different topics: plurals,contrarys, foreign words, literature, mistakes ....
The simple and fast strategy involves and will challenge all players with fun challenges, risks, exciting and thrilling competition.

name: Sigla: Ataque de blindados
description:
This game has 6 tanks trying to be the last one alive on a board consisting of a 10x10 grid.

Each turn you select 3 of your 21 cards that will determine the three actions you are allowed to take that turn.
Move, retreat, turn, turn your turret or fire!
Mountains and land mines post obstacles for your movement and fire, and you will have to try to deduce your opponent's moves, since you have to pick your cards at the same time.

Beware, if your tank is hit, you'll have to discard seven of those cards and wont have that much choices, get hit three times and you're out!


El juego consiste en 6 tanques intentando ser el último en pie en un tablero tipo grilla de 10x10.

Cada turno los jugadores eligen cuales 3 de los 21 movimientos posibles de su tanque van a realizar (avanzar, retroceder, girar, girar el cañon, disparar).
Hay montañas y minas que obstaculizan el desplazamiento, y un lindo juego de deducción al tener que adivinar los movimientos de tu oponente porque las cartas a usar se eligen al principio y se van ejecutando después en el orden del turno

Si golpean a tu tanque, tenés que descartar 7 de las 21 cartas de movimiento. Otro golpe y solo te quedarán 7 cartas, al tercer golpe el tanque es destruido!
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Clue Jr.:  Pirate Treasure Hunt
description:
From the back of the box: In this special edition of Clue Jr. you are on a Pirate Treasure Hunt! One of five historic pirates (Blackbeard, Captain Kidd, Black Bart, Anne Bonny or Calico Jack) has hidden their loot in the Treasure Chest. It is up to you and the Clue Jr. detectives (Captain Green, Sailor Scarlet, Navigator Plum and First Mate Peacock) to solve the case of the Pirate Treasure Hunt. Search the Pirate Ship and the Desert Island for hidden clues. When you figure out which Pirate hid what valuables in the Treasure Chest, you win!

Also include 10 educational pirate trading cards and a map showing historic sunken pirate ships and hidden treasure. Game mechanics are a re-theme of Clue Jr: The Case of the Hidden Toys.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Back to Iraq (Third Edition)
description:
Back To Iraq, 3rd Edition (B2I3e) is a "what if" simulation of the fighting that might occur across the northern littoral of the Persian Gulf if the US-led anti-terrorism Coalition decides on a ground war to finally settle with the Baghdad regime.

B2I3e is a two player wargame of low to intermediate complexity that posits this might-be war lasting about a month. We believe that is about the maximum time before the Coalition Ground force's diminishing supplies, coupled with a loss of the domestic political will necessary to continue the fighting, would bring about a settlement if victory were not achieved in the field.

(Form the introduction).

Major changes with the previous editions are the units, with new Order of Battle and factors. The units also are now mostly "two steppers". The combat table is also different at all, with separate combat tables for coalition and Militant Islamic.

Two scenarios, one against Iraq and Al Qaeda, and the second also against Iran and Iraq. Turkish and Syrian intervention is possible in both scenarios.

The Advanced rules cover Strategic targets, Airstrikes, Special Operations Forces, Command and Control and Additional Forces

Game Scale:
Turn: 2 days
Hex: 17 miles / 27.54 km
Unit: Brigade to Army

Game Inventory:
One 22" X 34" mapsheet
One countersheet (176 5/8" counters)
One 24 page rules booklet

name: Them!
description:
Them! is a solo horror board game where a player will be on the run from a horrible creature, only hoping to survive until sunrise. With 20 minutes left to survive a player will need to plan an efficient escape route through the forest.

Drawing a card representing each minute, a player will follow the instructions and draw his or her path along the board. After all his "time" is up, it will be up to him or her to make sure he or she was not caught by the creature. A separate creature deck will contain the activities of the creature, and if lines are crossed, the creature wins!

This game will use a unique color change action requiring the user to change the color of his or her marker, along with that of the creature (at certain intervals). This will be the indicator that the creature was close enough to find the player, or not.

The game will consist of:

A 24 card player deck
A 24 card creature deck.
A set of template forest terrains.

The player will provide 5 colored crayons or pencils as well as three tokens to complete the game.

name: GOL!
description:
GOL In the Board Game Gol players play in the board by eleven pawn for the player like in the real football.
The Game Gol is like chess because is on the time (players have ninety second for move),.
In this time can moves yours contenders and kick the ball. In this game we don’t use dice, player must in his ninety second calculate how hard to kick and in which direction.
Time of game is ninety minute.
Number of players is two.

GOL is made by Slawomir Kakietek

name: Korrutuskalake
description:
"Korrutuskalake" is a simple math game for very little kids, to teach them multiplying in the range of 100.
In the game you have small river with a table for each number from 1 to 10, making it the multiplications of 1 to 100.
Each player on their turn roll 2 d10 dice and then have to quickly say the multiplication of the two and add their fish to the board, on the right number.

The winner is the player who manages get all their fish into the lake first.

name: Monopoly: Marburg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Marburg, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Buenos Aires: Soy Gardel
description:
Buenos Aires Soy Gardel is a boardgame that involves competition, ramdom and knowledge of Buenos Aires City.

The game combines a playful look at the passion of Buenos Aires, and was conceived to surprise the participants with the thousands of stories that contain in every corner of the city in each of its interesting places, emblematic buildings, characters, historical events, stories and features.

The objetive in the game is to become Gardel, answering a series of questions about the city of Buenos Aires, to thereby conquer neighborhoods, which is indicated by placing obelisks on each of them. The first to win 3 neighborhoods of Buenos Aires is the winner of the game. Very simple and fun.

name: Charad
description:
Despite what the name indicates this Swedish game is a draw-and-guess game. The game consists of a number of cards with words or phrases on them in different categories. The players take turn trying to make a fast sketch illustrating one of the words on a card. All the other participants try to guess and points ar distributed if you guess correct and to the sketching player if someone manages to guess right. You only count the points, there are no pieces on a board.

It is in many ways similar to Pictionary but without a game board and not played in teams. The categories are (translated from Swedish):
Objects
Verbs
Abstract terms
Names oc Titles
Technical terms
Proverbs

name: GettaLife
description:
Money, adventure, & success in thirty minutes or less!

GettaLife is a fun card game illustrating the universal aspects of every day life. Players will draw and play cards to their individual Life Grid while simultaneously blocking their opponents from building theirs. As players build their Life Grid, they accumulate points, and after the deck runs out, the game ends and the player with the most points is crowned the winner and has GottaLife!

During play, however, players will also play Hard Knocks cards on their opponents' Life Grids in order to slow down their own progress, and will even play Damage cards on their opponents. Life Grids consist of four different tracks, or suits: Relationships, Wealth, Knowledge, and Experience. Each player must build the best Life Grid possible by balancing the development of all four suits with the hope of playing the Legend card and multiplying their points. Of course, the crowning achievement for any suit is for the player to achieve knighthood in one of their suits by playing all four cards in one suit without having any Hard Knocks.

name: Illico
description:
Players in Illico compete in two teams that sit facing one another, the deck of "Illico" cards stacked between them (with a Cache card hiding the top card) and each with three "Joker" cards at their disposal. They choose a number from 1 to 12 to determine which line they'll look at on the cards.

At the start of a round, one team flips the sand timer while the other draws the top Illico card and looks at the appropriate line, which will show two things that can be referred to by the same word, such as "A direction and correct?" The team must answer with the word or phrase that describes both halves of the question – in this case "right". (The team holds up the card so that the opposing team can see the answer on the back of the card.) When the team does give the right answer, the other team draws a card and tries to answer the question. The process continues until time runs out, at which point the team not holding the card wins the round. While trying to guess an answer, a team can spend a Joker card to either learn the first letter of the answer or skip the card and draw a new one.

The first team to win three rounds wins the game!

name: Meisterrechner
description:
In this game players use the four basic arithmetic operations. The aim of the game is, with at least three of the dice to calculate the numbers on the previously required results from the drawn cards.

The card is drawn the dice are rolled and the quickest player socres a point.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Math, Number, Real-time

name: Blitzschnell!
description:
Blitzschnell! is a jigsaw game for children, with an important speed element.

Each player gets one of the picture cards. The 36 jigsaw pieces are shuffled and placed in the box bottom. The first player rolls the die. If it shows a cross, the die is passed on to the next player. If it shows a jigsaw piece, he takes the box bottom and starts looking for pieces that belong to his jigsaw. At the same time, the next player rolls the die. As soon as another player has rolled a jigsaw piece, the box bottom is passed to that player.

As soon as a player thinks his jigsaw is finished, he shouts "Stop!". The other players stop and check whether the jigsaw is correct. If it isn't, the player returns all the pieces collected to the box and must start again; if it is, the player earns a racing car, all pieces are returned to the box, players pass their picture cards to the next player, and a new round begins.

When one player has collected two cars, he wins the game!

Variant: All the jigsaw pieces are randomized and put face down in the middle of the table. All players are simultaneously turning over a piece. If it fits your own jigsaw puzzle, you take the piece. If not, put it back face down. The first player to complete his jigsaw wins the round.

name: Munchkin Gazebo Shot Glass
description:
This shot glass has a special rule for all Munchkin games:




During any combat, you may drink one shot from the Munchkin Gazebo Shot Glass to throw the Potion of Gazebo Repro at the monster, making it look just like a Gazebo. The main player must fight alone. If that player already has a helper, the helper is kicked out of the combat with no penalty. You may only do this once per game.





Note that the "shot" can be any liquid and does not have to contain alcohol.Part of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: het Grote Winkler Prins Spel
description:
This is a knowledge-game, much alike many Trivia and quiz games. However, the questions are based on the information in one of the Dutch Encyclopaedias: de 'Grote Winkler Prins'.
The board represents a library, where players move their marker through different rooms, in which they have to answer a question about the theme of the room, History, Language, Sports etc. When the players gets the right answer, they receive a book-shaped counter. 10 counters (for each category 1) wins the game.

name: Elk Fest: Log Jam! Expansion
description:
Part of Mayfair Games Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #4, the Elk Fest: Log Jam! Expansion adds 4 log jam tiles to Elk Fest.

Set Up: Set up Elk Fest normally. Temporarily put one of the riverbank pieces roughly at the half-way point between the two starting riverbanks. Mix up the Log Jam tiles and place them, log side up, by the corners of the riverbank. Return the riverbank piece to its starting position, leaving the tiles in place in the middle of the play area. You are now ready to begin normally.

Rules: When a log is hit by a stone the log remains where it lands (just like when a stone hits another stone). Your moose can use a log to cross over the water just like a stone. However, before moving the moose onto the log you must immediately "roll" the log over and place it roughly where it was positioned. There are three possible results of a rolled log:

Logs (2 tiles): If you move onto a log, you must move your front feet to a stone by the end of your turn otherwise your "elk gets wet". You may not use the stone that you came from for your front hooves. If you start your turn on a log, you must be off the log entirely before the end of your turn, otherwise your "elk gets wet".
Shaky Stones (1 tile): You may treat this like any stone, but as soon as you have left the tile, the stones are washed away and the tile is removed from the game.
Bear (1 tile): You can't enter this tile. This tile remains in play bear side up and may be flicked instead of a stone as a blocker. If it falls off the table the bear goes into hibernation until the next game.

name: The Lone Ranger: Shuffling the Deck Card Game
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In The Lone Ranger: Shuffling the Deck Card Game, the Lone Ranger, Tonto and other characters from the 2013 movie are all trying to grab as much silver as they can while jumping from car to car of a speeding train. Hide your true intentions and try to determine which characters the other players control. If you guess correctly, you can snatch up half their silver!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Heureka Strategy
description:
This is an educational roll and move board game. Game's name comes from Finnish Science Center Heureka.

In the game you will travel through Europe by throwing dice. In certain places in your way, there are cities where you have to solve some rudimentary mathematical problems. When you solve the problem you can go on. Most of the problems have something to do with probability and to solve the problem you will throw some dice, draw some cards or arrange fibonacci numbers in right order. Game includes traditional card deck and 3*6D, 8D, 12D and the two non-normal 20-sided dice. First player who gets back to Heureka Science Center is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Last Case
description:
The Last Case is a pure hand-work PnP game (CONCISE HW Series). Six explorers delve in a old house in order to investigate a strange case. After they entered the house and search for only a few minutes, they know they can't go back - the house is cursed. So, you have to control these characters to collect enough clues and put everything you know under the well and hope one day it will be searched. You have to fight against mystery events like sudden death and fire comes from nowhere. You can make a deal with the evil spirit in the house to make the situation happier. In the end, you have to bury all the things you know about this case under the well (get required objects and arrive The Final) and then you win - but you lose your life. Hold your pencil, the case begins.

You only need to print out 3 gaming sheet and then grab a 6-sided dice, a pencil and an eraser to play this game.

name: Spot the Difference
description:
Two almost identical images are revealed.

How many of the 5, 10, or 15 differences you can find in just one minute? The quickest eyes score the most points and the player with the most points after the pre-determined number of images have been seen is the winner.

name: Mix!
description:
Mix! is a game of secret goals and tactical color theory, in which players compete to influence which of six paint colors will be applied to canvases in order to meet their own goals. This requires thoughtful play, as the control each player has over which colors are painted is indirect.

At the beginning of the game, each player is assigned a goal with two colors -- one color that will grant them points, and another that will cause them to lose points. A player's positive goal is public, while their negative goal is private. Players must work to influence the painting process so as to maximize their positive goal color, and minimize their negative goal color.

Of course, this is easier said than done. Players can only affect the colors that are painted by controlling the location of a shared set of tokens on a color palette. These tokens are moved between sections of the palette by mixing together color cards from a communal pile that all players must play cards into. Players can also play action cards to affect the location of tokens, and the availability of color cards to mix.

Timing is a critical aspect of Mix!, as players can only take one of three possible actions each turn -- either combining color cards to influence the palette, taking on new bonus objectives, or painting. Painting results in all players gaining and losing points based on the state of the palette, and also allows players to complete their bonus objectives. As a result, players must choose carefully when to work to influence the palette versus when to paint, in order to maximize their own gains while minimizing those of their opponents.

At the end of the game, private goals are revealed, and the player with the most points wins!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Button Bashers
description:
Button Bashers is a 2-4 player, fast-paced, tabletop card game modeled after popular arcade style fighting games.

Each of the 6 characters has a personalized list of attacks to help you pummel your opponent or opponent's team into the ground! Be the first to reduce your opponents life-points from 40 to 0 to win the game!

With easy to learn combos, stylized strategic gameplay, and a little luck of the cards, you will send your friends running to the change machine.

Button Bashers is appropriate for ages 12 and up. The average battle typically lasts around thirty minutes.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Crux 25
description:
From the box:
CRUX 25 consists of a game board and twenty-five high quality plastic pieces. Alone or with other players this game will fascinate you right from the beginning as you try to put down the twenty-five pieces on the game board. Caution! You might have to use all your abilities to solve the mystery of CRUX 25. CRUX 25, super training for your concentration and cleverness. The ultimate aim of the game is to put all of the 25 pieces on the game board. Colour and size of the game pieces have no influence on the solution of the game.

name: Blank Jack
description:
A wild card game with a cowboy, a villain and a lucky number.
Use them wisely or place cards that sum up the deck to exactly 11 so you can get rid of your cards and pass them on to your opponent. The more cards the other players take, the closer you get to victory.

name: Play-Doh: Alle auf Kalle
description:
Each player forms 10 little marbles from one of the 3 containers of play-doh that come with the game. Then Kalle, a can that opens and closes its lid and moves its arms while rotating at the center of three catapults, is activated. The players try to shoot their marbles into the can with the catapults. The first player to get in three marbles wins the game.

(The bases of the catapult also contain some molds for sculpting play-doh.)

name: Fish, Fish, Squish!
description:
From the publisher:

The squish or be squished family game. Will you be the last player with the unsquished fish? Start the game with your own school of dough-fish. Flip cards in turn until you complete a three-in-a-row. When you do, you are awarded a "free squish" of any opponent's fish. Stay on your fins! Everyone is trying to squish your fish too! Last "fish" standing wins!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Don't Rock the Croc
description:
A balancing act consisting in placing as many pieces as possible on the crocodile without them falling of. Children will be able to improve motor skills and reasoning when choosing where to place the pieces so they don’t fall of. All pieces are wooden and painted in striking colours.

How to win: not be the one that makes one or more pieces fall of the belly of the crocodile

name: Túl az Óperencián
description:
The title roughly translates "Far, far away".

The board shows a castle with a dragon (and a captured princess) inside and a cicular track around the castle. Players roll the dice and move around on the circular track, collecting swords and items that can help fairy tale characters who will give them keys as a reward. If you have 3 keys you may try to enter the castle and fight the dragon on your way to the tower where the princess is locked...
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: IronheadE: Punimals
description:
IronheadE is a two player card game based around structured play, strategy and timing. Using the cards at their disposal, players build a deck in any way they choose consisting of exactly twenty unique cards. Having built their twenty card decks, players shuffle their cards and draw the top ten cards and now, using those cards, the goal is to have the most points when both players have chosen to not play any further cards.

When you play a card it must be in the correct placement on your grid and all cards after your first must be touching the edge of a card in play, diagonals don't count.

Playing a card scores you the points written on it, both in the top left and anything you would gain through the ability text. Players keep track of this either on paper or with dice, or whatever you have available.

Players have two options on their turn, play and resolve one card from their hand or pass, but if you pass you can no longer play cards for the rest of the round. When the round ends the player with the higher points is the winner.

This is then repeated until one player wins twice.

name: Dinomania
description:
Dinomania is a strategic card game, which gets more and more intense with each card you play!

If playing 2-3 players, start with 7 cards, and if playing 4-6 players you start with 6 cards. The goal is to get rid of all your cards as fast as possible.

When a player has discarded all cards, the remaining players count the points in their hand. When a player reaches the maximum score (recommended max score: 73), the player with the lowest score wins.

Let the youngest start, or choose yourself (perhaps the one who needs the most help?) If you can’t, or don’t want to, play a card, you have to draw a card from the deck, and let the turn pass over to the next player. Beware of the T-rex! When the deck has no more cards, simply shuffle all the played cards and keep on going!

If the draw-deck is completely out of cards, no more cards are drawn! The T-rex card is worth 36 points! That can only happen with event cards, or by sabotaging a rival with for example the card “Give away 2 cards from your hand to another player”, or hope that someone else will draw the T-rex from your hand when they are playing the card “draw a card from another player”, and try to keep a poker face!

When you only have three cards left on your hand you have to scream out ”Dinomania”, your greatest Dino-roar, or just any sound to indicate your amount of cards. If you don’t - you get 10 points even if you win that gameplay.

name: Lucky Dogs Dice Game
description: This dice game pushes your luck and encourages strategic thinking. Players enjoy working together to spell out Lucky Dogs as a team!

name: Dinosaurus
description:
In the fast and luck-free game Dinosaurus, players compete to reign in Pangea with their dinosaurs.

A 4 x 4 grid of terrain cards is placed, then players take turns to place their dinosaurs (herbivores, carnivores, flying, etc.) of different sizes at the sides of the square. Then, by turns, the players move one of their dinosaurs to an adjacent space or eat an adjacent card: herbivores can eat plants, carnivores can eat herbivores or smaller carnivores, etc.

When no more moves are possible, the game ends and whoever has the largest stack of cards eaten by their dinosaurs wins.

name: Shhh...it!
description:
Shhh…it! is a cheerful and foolish card game that will cheer up countless evenings, as it has been doing in Italy for centuries! The game was indeed conceived in the Middle Ages by a group of aspiring artists. In those days, it was customary to throw excrements out the balcony to the square, once the work had ended. One day, an artist was hit by it and his friends slammed their hands on the table and called out “Shit!”. The unlucky artist decided to use it to develop a game that had immediate success since then.

First, two decks of cards are to be prepared. One of the two decks only include characters cards to be dealt to players, the other one includes all the other cards, representing the points, or so called tons of shit!

The second deck has to be positioned at the center of the table so that it is possible for players to easily reach it with their hands.

The game begins with the counter-clockwise cards dealing, 4 cards each player. Players must quickly choose one of the cards in their hand and pass it to the opponent to the right while picking up at the same time the card that the opponent to the left is handing over.

When a player has a four of a kind (poker) hand must immediately pound the hand firmly on the center deck on the table, while shouting: Shit! All the other players must pound their hands on top of the one who pounded the deck first and called Shit!

The last player pounding the deck has to draw a card from it, which value represents the “quantity” (tons) of Shit picked up.

Watch out! The same rules applies if a player accidentally touches the central deck and subsequently has to draw a Shit! card right away. For this reason, it is possible to bluff by shouting Shit! or by pretending to pound the deck, in order to induce opponents to pound the deck too, by mistake, and therefore be forced to drawing the Shit! card. The winner is the Player summing up less “quantity” (tons) of Shit, once the cards central deck is depleted.

name: Tower Collapse
description:
Wobbly tower contains a variety of colorful columns and rings, and one special game dice.

Test your skills and start playing the crazy column game! Roll the dice to see what color column you have to add to the tower.

Taking turns, each player rolls the dice to see what color column they have to add to the wobbly tower.

Every time there’s six columns added you have to add a ring on top of it, but you can add the columns close together to make it more difficult for the next player. But watch out! The player who makes the tower collapse is out of the game. Continue until one player remains and they are the winner.

See also Katacrash: ¡El loco juego de las columnas chifladas!.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Stacking and Balancing

name: Tic Tac Whoa!
description: Tic Tac Whoa! consists of a deck of 17 cards that display an "X" and 17 cards that display an "O". This deck can be used to play five games on a three by three grid. The rules common to all the games are (i) that a player plays both the "X" cards and the "O" cards, (ii) that a player can score by getting three in a row of either symbol, and (iii) that same-symbol cards cannot be played on top of each other.

name: Lethal Party
description:
Drink shots, or get shot? That's a good question!

Welcome to the life-betting party! A bunch of desperadoes have gathered together — not to bet money, but to engage in a more primitive way to reach to the top: a drinking game. In this party, you can either be wasted or get shot. Only the fastest person can leave here alive.

Lethal Party is a speed game for 3-10 players in which you try to be quick and sharp to grab the correct card to fire your bullets at your opponents. Whoever can survive to the end is the sole winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fighting, Mature / Adult, Real-time
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Goldräuber
description:
Goldräuber is a fast, exciting, cooperative game with simple rules for 1-4 players, which are also understood by small treasure hunters from 8 years up. Thanks to the solo player variant a lonely brave miner can play Goldräuber even if there are no other pitmen around.

Goldräuber is a cooperative game in which the players try to find the legendary treasure of the mountain as well as a lost miner and bring it back to light. The mountain consists of 24 cards.

The players decide together from where they want to enter the mine. Alternating is diced and considered whether to turn over a face-down card, to move the pawn to an already-revealed card, or to chop a stone wall that blocks the path.

As if the way into the mountain was not already arduous enough, the guardian of the treasure can break down a gallery from time to time.

Only with courage, with the smart planning and the necessary little bit of luck the gold rushers can succeed in returning to daylight with their loot.

name: Word Rush
description:
Place nine letter cards on the game board, turn a category card and set the timer in motion. You have to come up with words using one of the letters, but the longer you take, the more time the next player will have.

Once a player cannot come up with a word, they lose one point. Everyone starts with three points and continue until there is a winner.

—user summary

name: Petropoli
description: Petropoli is a game oriented to the simulation of the global oil market, with the production of crude oil, whose price fluctuates according to various factors, sales to importing countries and the possibility of diversifying investments by focusing on renewable energy. All of this, obviously, aimed at achieving the greatest possible profit.

name: Mezame No Sora
description:
Urgent recruitment! Now that efficient space development has become possible, Japan has decided to support companies participating in space development. Please contact the ministry office for the company you want.

You are the president of a space development company. Thousands of years after humans began to fly, humans finally made their way into space. Space development has accelerated at a stretch by creating stars in outer space and recovering resources from them, and it is now a major business of the entire industry. Stay on top of this big wave, outsmart your rivals, and win lots of resources!

Mezame No Sora (目覚めの宇宙) is a set collection game. Each turn, you play three out of four cards to move or turn your rocket, and pick up a card from the color of the planet you end up on (if the planet is still unexplored). At the start of your turn you discard down to four cards into your personal score pile. If you push someone out of the universe map, you get to steal cards from their score pile.
At the end of the game, each card is worth 1 point, with 1, 2 or 3 bonus points for the majority in the three available colors.

In this game, you have five cards in your hand, each of which corresponds to a specific movement of the rocket (for example, two squares forward). You are required to select the most suitable action from the limited options and operate your own rocket. At the end of each turn, each player's position becomes a star and acquires resources. The rocket will become more and more difficult to move because it will be an "out zone" where you will be penalized if you enter.

You can even crash your opponent by pushing them out of the field or to a position with a star! By doing so, you can steal resources from the opponent and get points, so it is often advantageous.

Rules Summary:

Use your hand to move the rockets in order. Since the number of cards you can use is small, let's move systematically. On the contrary, it is also possible to advance the game in an advantageous way by predicting the opponent's hand and action.

At the end of the turn, explore the planet and win cards. This will be a means of transporting rockets as a hand. The effect obtained for each color of the reclamation area is fixed. Be aware of the cards you want and collect them.

It is an out zone where you cannot enter the planets and the outside of the cultivated planet. Let alone self-destruction, you need to be careful not to be dropped by the other party. If you drop your opponent, you can steal a lot of cards from your opponent, so let's aim aggressively.

The person with the most cards in the end wins! Bonus points will be given to the player with the highest number of cards for each color, so it may be the secret of victory not to give up until the end.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Set Collection, Take That
publishers: A Gamer's Studio (とあるゲーマー工房)

name: Sei kein Frosch
description: Sei kein Frosch exhorts you not to be a frog if you can help it.
publishers: Pegasus Spiele, Swan Panasia Co., Ltd.

name: Splatto
description:
Splatto is a family game in which players have to be the first to have their "meeple" exit the track.

The game design takes a lot of influence from cross and circle games such as Ludo with a few notable differencies.

First of all, the game starts with every players creating their token in modeling clay. The most creative one get to be the first player.

At their turns, the players draw a card with 2 movement options and move their tokens to the next applicable case. Some special cards allow to splat other players tockens and making the case not usable animore. This speeds up the game considerabely as the reach of tokens increase significantly the least case are valid for moevement.

name: Savage Choices
description:
Savage Choices is an adult party game that literally ruins lives. You create a character using the cards in your hand and try to convince the judge to live their life as your character. It's who would you rather be, and the choices are savage.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Pummeleinhorn: Mampf Mampf
description:
Nothing is better than freshly baked cookies! As soon as the stove opens, Pummeleinhorn and his friends are ready to eat them up. With a heavy heart, though, they put a few cookies in the jar to save them for bad times — but did they really release the cookies from their paws?

Pummeleinhorn: Mampf Mampf plays like Mau Mau in that players try to empty their hand of cards by taking turns playing cards onto a discard pile, matching the top card's color or number when doing so.

The game contains a few special cards that mix up gameplay. Each time someone plays a biscuit tin, a card from the deck is placed in the separate biscuit pile, and whenever a biscuit card is played, all of the cards on the biscuit pile are dealt out among the players. The Pummelfee card allows a player to hand cards to another player, but only if luck smiles on them in the right conditions.

name: Superfight: The Con Deck
description: Superfight: The Con Deck is a convention-themed expansion for Superfight that will be available for purchase solely at conventions starting with Comic-Con International in July 2018.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Party Game

name: Pinguin Club
description: This is a jump & run game with penguins.

name: Madorino Karuta VR
description:
This floor plan-themed party game is in the style of the classic "telephone game."

18 floor plan cards are spread across a table. Using the game's special app, players can explore the rooms of a house.

One player looks around inside the rooms, and uses words and gestures to describe what they look like.
The other players try to find the corresponding floor plan card from among the cards on the table.

—description from the publisher

name: Polly Pudel
description:
In the area of the park where people come to exercise their dogs, the owners are desperately looking for their pets and urgently need help.

In Polly Pudel, the players have to look closely to find out which hind quarters go with which dog, then they need to act quickly. But be careful as some dogs look confusingly similar! The player who finds the most matching dogs wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Gundam the Game
description:
The TV anime "Mobile Suit Gundam" appears as a board game.
In this product, from TV anime Mobile Suit Gundam, Episode 1 "Gundam Stands Up" to Episode 10 "Garma Falls" is organized into six scenarios and recorded.

Each player makes full use of its unique abilities and items, and cooperates to challenge missions on the story panel that appear one after another. Because the story panel is hidden, you can enjoy the feeling of pounding while retrospectively advancing the story of the TV animation. In the six stories that can be spun by your hand, it may be that Ryu, Kai, and Frau will manipulate the Gundam.
In the battlefield, the Zeon army is also Zaku, Char's dedicated Zak, as well as Magera Attack and Gow can stand up with various attacks.

A nostalgic story that can be spun with the Story panel.
All player cooperation type battle realized by "combat event card".
Become an appearance character and experience the Mobile Suit Gundam of the gem.

—user summary
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling

name: Strandjutters
description:
It is storming!
Unexpected technical problems, sandbanks and the rough sea capsize the large cargo ship. The goods are discarded into the ocean and are floating onto the beach.
Curious beach combers gather on the beach.
Which beach comber collects the biggest loot?

Gameplay:
The players are rolling two special dices included in the game. The first one decides in which directions the loot is drifting: first horizontally then vertically. A small triangle marks the horizontal direction.
The second dice decides how many steps a beach comber can move. Until loot landed on one of the sandbanks, the comber can only move horizontally. As soon as loot has stranded somewhere all combers can move directly into the direction of the loot and collect it by just moving onto the sandbank. If there are moves left, the loot can be picked up and the comber is able to move the rest of the moves back to the beach to save the goods.
A beach comber collects all goods on the sandbank which she/he landed on.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Farming, Nautical, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Bllöx
description:
BLLÖX is an action-packed stacking race! Flip over a card and race to build what you see faster than the other players. Super-simple to learn and super-fast to play, BLLÖX is the perfect game for the whole family! There are 36 wacky and creative ways to play included!

The object of the game is for each player to build a stack of blocks that appears on a common card before the other players can. When a player has finished building the stack, they slap the card with their hand to show that they were first to complete.

The winner of the round is the first player to get 3 Stacky Pack cards. The winner of the game is the first player to win 3 rounds.

-description from publisher's website

name: Who am I?
description:
Who am I? is a deduction game where player's goal is to deduce the animal and two pieces of clothing an opponent is holding. On a player turn, they can give an animal card to opponent who then has to answer if any of the pictured items match their hidden cards. After collecting enough evidence that a player can prove any of the hidden cards, they can do so. Finding out all three hidden cards wins the game.

—user summary

name: Dino Safari
description:
On an uncharted island somewhere on Pacific Ocean you came across something that no one expected... Dinosaurs! But you fear nobody is going to believe you. That's why you need to take photos of them.

Explore the island, take many photos but beware, dinosaurs are not used to visitors. Some will flee but other may find you tasty! You will not be able to show your photos when you're eaten. Also remember that it's not the quantity of photos that count but quality. Big and dangerous dinosaurs are worth more points than small, easier to find ones.

Let the Dino Safari begin!

During setup players are required to create the "island" using tiles with hexagonal spaces starting with "camp" tile. Once it's done 12 randomly chosen dinosaur tokens are randomly placed on "nest" spaces facing down. Then each player choose their character and place him/her in the camp. Players take their turns clockwise. During player's turn you have three movement points and one "take a picture" action. You can spend those in any order you want. Characters can move in any direction they want, "plains" space costs 1 movement point while "forest" space costs 2. You cannot enter "crags" or "lake" spaces. To take a photo move to a space adjacent to dinosaur token and uncover it then take the card with species you've uncovered. On each species card you can see how much points it's worth and its skills like movement points and special rules. Players can also take pictures of already uncovered dinos to get their cards but you can score only once for each species. Starting with round two after you're done with your character's actions you can move 1 uncovered dinosaur token (you must be in possession of that species card). You can use that to run away from other players, scare off another uncovered dinosaur to remove its token so nobody can take a picture of it anymore or, if it's a carnivore, attack other players. Attacked player loses one life and is forced to return to camp. If a character is attacked third time (losing last remaining life) he/she is considered "eaten" and eliminated from game (his/her score is 0 no matter how many cards were in his/her possession). From now on during eliminated player's turn he/she can only move dinosaurs. Game ends when all 12 tokens are uncovered. The sum of points on cards in your possession is your score. Highest score wins. There is also a chance that all players are eaten. In that rare case game ends and nobody wins.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Player Elimination

name: Who Did This Poo?
description:
Who Did This Poo? is a matching and memory game featuring animals (and one human) and the types of droppings they make. There are 54 cards with sets of two: a card with the name and illustration of a creature, and then a card with the name + the word poo and an illustration of the type of poo they make. E.g. Rabbit and Rabbit Poo.

The game can be played with any number of people. It can be played as a matching game for those who can't read, and as a memory game for those who can read.

For a matching game, the cards are laid out face up and players take turns to try to match animal cards to the corresponding poo cards. If they find a match, they receive an extra turn. The player with the most cards is the winner.

For a memory game, the cards are laid out face down and players take turns turning over two cards and trying to find a match. If they find a match, they keep the pair and receive an extra turn. If they don't, they flip the cards back over and play passes to the next player. The player with the most cards is the winner.

name: Kraken Ataken!: Sinister Twister
description:
The pirates were sailing away from their latest raid, partying as only pirates can and counting their booty. Little did they know that one of the looted chests belonged to an old pirate sorcerer, who had sealed within it the powerful SINISTER TWISTER. It turned out to be a devastating problem not only for them, but also for the kraken fleet that was about to siege their convoy.

Sinister Twister adds components for a 6th player, a twister die and twister deck as well as curses and explosive bombardments.

The game is won, as in the original, by defeating pirates, and sometimes your competing krakens and stealing their treasure, however in Sinister Twister you have at least 5 more ways in which to mess with your opponents.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Nautical, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Bunnies the Gathering Promo Card
description:
Psi Series Card #10

Text says:
May be used once by a player to pat up to six bunnies in The Bunn Circle (one of each color). The player must un-pat one bunny at the start of each turn unti they are all back. Patted bunnies may not play aggressive cards.

name: Climate Crisis
description:
Can you help solve the Climate Crisis?

With just under 8 billion people on the planet we face a threat of our own making as climate change seeks to wreak havoc across the globe. This is a crisis like no other.

Climate Crisis, the game, is a collaborative board game where you and your friends (maybe even your enemies) can sit down together and try and save not only the planet but humankind.

General game play description:
Players must work collaboratively to save the world from climate change. There is a tricky balance between moving to renewable energy, recycling, population, staying alive and keeping enough energy to keep going.

The goal is to optimise world population, stay alive and achieve environmental sustainability!

The players work together as they search for scientific discoveries that will solve our climate crisis. This needs to be done all the while the population and pollution across the planet grows and the level of Greenhouse Gases rises. Take too long and the planet dies from too much pollution or the Greenhouse Gases get to the point of no return. As the greenhouse gases rise the impacts from climate change increase and become more common!

Balance the needs for energy production from fossil fuels and environmentally sustainable sources. Keep the population with enough Food and Water. Players are faced with numerous challenges – you need energy to function but fossil fuels create pollution and damage the environment. Moving to clean energy costs time and money, and is not as efficient. Feeding the population with Dairy products can be effective but comes at the cost of energy and pollution. All the while the climate crisis clock keeps ticking!

Each player has special skills that they can use to work together to save the planet. A highly collaborative game where players need to coordinate their actions and devise plans and strategies to solve the crisis.

Sustainable Qualities:
This game is all about educating people about the trade offs around sustainability. The complex interaction between population, energy production and consumption, food production, water use, economic advancement. It also shows the impact of pollution and waste and the dramatic effects of climate change … whilst still giving people hope that if we collaborate and work together we can build a solution to escape the mess that we have made!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Negotiation, Variable Set-up

name: PAIRZI
description:
PAIRZI - Gotta Getta Pair! The aim of the game is to be the first player to collect 5 pairz of the Critter Cards!

Each player has two dice they roll until someone gets a pair, whoever rolls a pair has to then find a matching pair of Critter Cards! Once they've collected their pair of Critter Cards they pick their dice back up and keep rolling. Each player must roll a pair on their dice before collecting a pair of Critter Cards. The first player to collect 5 pairs of Critter Cards shouts "PAIRZI" and wins the game!

In keeping with the rest of the Carma Games range there are many game variations including two decks of critter cards for super-fast games or more challenging gameplay idea's.

Packed with dice rolling Critter matching fun, PAIRZI is an intense card playing adventure the whole family will enjoy! This fabulously fun game is great for the whole family, the perfect game for a games night with family or friends and it's compact enough to take with you when travelling.

name: Saturday Night Live: The Game
description:
Play through a series of classic and iconic SNL sketches. Everyone is in the same sketch together except for one player, the Stand-In. The Stand-In’s goal is to figure out the sketch by playing along and improvising. The rest of the players are trying to figure out who the Stand-In is without giving away too much.

After an agreed upon amount of time, all players point to who they think is the stand-in. The player with the majority of votes then reveals their identity by showing their card to the group. If the player is NOT the stand-in, the actual stand-in reveals their identity and collects 2 scoring tokens. Also, any player that did point to that player scores 1 token. If the player is the stand-in, then any player pointing to them scores 1 token. The stand-in still has one chance to score by guessing the sketch everyone was in. If they are correct, they score 1 token. The first player to collect 5 scoring tokens wins!

It takes timing, deduction, bluffing, and acting skills to win! The game features 30 different all-time favorite sketches including More Cowbell, The Roxbury Guys, The Ladies Man, and more!

Game includes 210 Sketch Cards of 30 Sketches, 7 Stand-In Cards, 30 Sketch Envelopes, 1 Stand-In Envelope, 36 Scoring Tokens, 8 SNL Reference Boards, 60 Second Sand Timer, Game Instructions
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Targeted Clues, Voting

name: Top Trumps Quiz: Disney
description: The Top Trumps Disney version of Winning Moves card game is suitable for children aged 6 and over. Who will be the strongest ? Play with family or friends with this Quiz 500 questions and test your knowledge of the Disney universe.

name: Mint Works: Phil / Baseball Stadium promo card
description:
AI Phil ("The Reigning Champion") on one side / Baseball Stadium location on the reverse

Phil - 5 mint capacity

Baseball Stadium: "Gain a mint for every building in your neighbourhood"

This promo was initially available in Tantrum House Season 7 Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Out of Order
description:
The quirky quiz sees you whiz through just five questions per card – and they’re not that hard!

So what’s the catch? Simple: you always have to give the answer from the question before… With hilarious results!

name: Gobble Monster
description:
A hungry Gobble Monster is ready to eat all your toys! Players race to save as many toys as possible before the monster gets angry and swallows them all.

The game is played in real time. Before the game, players randomly distribute 12 toys on the monster's tongue. Toys come in 4 shapes (bear, plane, car, duck) and three colours (red, green, yellow). Then start a randomised timer on the monster.

On their turn, players draw an action card. Then do the action shown on the card (pick a toy of given shape, pick a toy of given colour, grab a toy from other player, move a toy to a different spot on the tongue).

The game ends when the time runs out and the monster attacks. When he strikes, the active player has to hand over the toys they have taken. Player with the most toys wins.

—user summary

name: 果てにたゆたい底にただよう (Hate ni tayutai soko ni tadayou)
description:
In 果てにたゆたい底にただよう (Hate ni tayutai soko ni tadayou) (Flapping at the Beyond and Drifting at the Bottom) is a card game from Japan, in which the players try to score the most points.

On your turn, play one card in front of you (typically face down) and one card to the center of the table (typically face up), then draw 2 cards.

At the end of the game, the player with the most value in each suit will collect the lowest valued card of that suit from the center of the table as points.
user summary

The publisher says:
2枚のカードを得点と得点を取るためのカードに分けていきます。
最終的に得点として分けられたカードをそれぞれが持つカードで取り合います
種類ごとの合計値が高い人から低い点数のカードを取ります。
最終的に特典カードの合計値の高い人が勝利します。

Players take turns to receive 2 cards per turn, then divide them into a card for scoring points (placed in the center of the table face up/down) and a card kept in hand (placed in front of each player face down/up) for taking such cards.

After dividing all the cards, players compete to take the cards for scoring points by the cards in their hands.

For each suit, players take turns to take a card for scoring points in ascending order of rank, in descending turn order of the total rank of the cards of the suit in each player's hand. At the end, the player with the most scoring points wins the game.
publisher's summary

name: Saboteur: Change Order promo card
description:
Before the start of the game, add this promo card to the deck.

The card is played like a normal action card. The direction of play is changed, from clockwise to anti-clockwise or vice versa (in case you added more than one copy).

The card can only be played if:

it is not the turn of the player who is playing this card; and
another player just set a waycard or played an action card

name: Samesies
description: Time to start using that dirty mind for good... or at least for fun! Introducing Samesies, the party game full of double entendres. The rules are easy: Players takes a Safe" Card and a "Risky" Card, and compete to find the funniest phrase that suits both situations. The perfect game for those who just can't help but build a bridge between normal and naughty.
categories: Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Unboxing: Der Fluch des Seeungeheuers
description:
Ahoy, you landlubbers! Dive into a bygone era full of robbery, rum and brawls.
During a dive you discover a strange box on the seabed. You bring it onto your boat and try to open it. It turns out that there are a lot more secrets hidden inside than you first thought. With the help of a magic shell, you'll witness strange happenings on a pirate ship where little is as it seems.
So it's all hands on deck: solve the riddles, listen carefully to the radio play and uncover the mystery, box by box.

-description by the publisher

name: Therapy
description:
A daily dose of Therapy is recommended. Possible side effects; unexpected truths combined with a high risk of bursting into laughter. In this game, players take turns to move their sofa across the playing board in the hunt for mental balance.
Through conversations with the coach, the group therapy and knowledge about yourself and your co-players, you'll get rid of your worries and obsessions.

Dive into your personal reflections. You'll be amazed how people think about - VERY - ordinary things.

The player who answers the questions correctly and can judge him/herself, aswell as his/her co-players, the best wins. The game has been designed by two psychologists and a writer.

name: Uno: Schitt's Creek
description:
It's the UNO matching card game everyone knows but featuring favorite characters from Schitt's Creek. Players still race to get rid of all their cards by matching color, number and symbol, but every card has either a 'Love' or 'Money' icon on it. When someone plays a special 'Where Everyone Fits In' card, they call out either 'love' or 'money.' Players then reveal their hands and may have to draw cards if they don't have enough of the chosen icon. And just like always, when a player is down to one card, they must shout, 'UNO!' Makes a great gift for card game lovers and Schitt's Creek fans ages 7 years and older. Colors and decorations may vary.

The classic UNO card game builds fun on game night with themes inspired by Schitt's Creek.
Each game features a deck decorated with character graphics from beloved show!
As in classic UNO game, players match colors, numbers and symbols to the card on top of the discard pile!
A special 'Where Everyone Fits In' rule may force some player to draw cards.
Makes a great gift for kid, teen, adult and family game nights with 2 to 10 players ages 7 years and older!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Grand Prix
description:
Goal
Find out who is the best Formula 1 driver. Complete the most laps in the agreed time. You can also agree on a fixed number of race laps in advance. The first driver to complete all laps wins the game.

How do you play the game?
To determine who can start from pole position, each player rolls the dice. The one with the highest throw starts from pole position. The second highest roll starts from position 2, etc. The race starts when the player in pole position rolls the dice. You can move forward, diagonally or sideways. However, you cannot jump over another car. If you cannot pass another car, you lose your moves on your turn.

Special symbols on the board:

If you end up on this symbol you can take a card. Read the card out loud and take the action immediately.
Road narrowing; If you come to a narrowing of the road you may not use this space. If another player blocks the passage, you lose your remaining moves on your turn.


Ways to Play
You can play the game in several ways:

You choose in advance a time period in which you race. The player with the most rounds after that time wins the game.
You choose a number of rounds in advance that you will complete. The player who completes all the rounds first wins.


Rounds are recorded on paper.

Optional rule
If you complete a turn and are 5 spaces behind another car (not sideways/diagonally) you will end up in the slipstream. This allows you to move forward another 4 places.

Tips!
There is a 'racing line' - so the inside of the corners are often shorter in spaces, allowing you to gain speed! It is possible to block the shortest route, forcing other drivers to overtake outside! Watch out for the chicane as the track narrows to 1 square wide and cars can get blocked here. If it is blocked, you lose your remaining moves and you can only pass when there the space is free.

Start your engines!

name: Ninja Cat Cucumber Attack!
description:
Get slapping in this exciting, fast-paced card game where Ninja Cats battle and Cucumbers attack. Play against others to control the deck as you flip and slap your way to victory. Win cards by battling weapon wielding Ninja Cats, but be ready to steal the deck as you beat your opponents by slapping card combos first.

Players take turns flipping cards into a pile at the center of the table. If a player flips a number card, game continues to the next player. If a Ninja Cat card is flipped, the battle begins! The following player then has the number of chances indicated on the card to flip over their own Ninja Cat card. If they do, play continues to the next player, and the battle begins again. If they don't, the player who initially flipped the Ninja Cat card wins the pile!

Keep an eye out for card sequences which can be slapped at any time during the game, as the first person to slap them gets to collect the pile. But watch out for that sneaky CUCUMBER, because when it's flipped you must ATTACK! First person to slap the cucumber wins the pile! Special action cards make the game more intense by forcing players to shuffle or swap their whole deck. Collect the whole deck to win the game!

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Flash Point: Legacy of Flame
description:
Step into the heat of the action with Flash Point: Legacy of Flame, an immersive narrative-driven co-operative board game in which every decision counts and time is of the essence!

Legacy of Flame is an interconnected series of games, with players guiding a team of firefighters as they progress from rookies to seasoned veterans, unlocking upgrades and special abilities throughout the campaign. Uncover hidden information with sealed envelopes that are unveiled at pivotal moments and with a rulebook that adapts and transforms with each playthrough. The impact of player decisions in each game resonates across future sessions, creating a unique gameplay experience.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Legacy Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Family Feud: DVD Game
description:
Here's your chance to play America's favorite game show on DVD with the all-new Family Feud DVD game!

Just like the actual game show, you'll now be playing double and triple money rounds, with the chance to steal the money and the round.

With the updated game play and hundreds of new questions, it's hours of fun for the whole family!

The game deals with 2 players at home, trying to match all the Top 5 answers on the survey, with a twist. Both players must try to out score the opponent by scoring the most points on each question round. With a pair of duel question rounds where both must answer the same survey question, and the fast money question round where both are given seperate questions to answer, and match the surveys.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Ninetyseven
description: Each player has a number board, a die cup, a die and 6 chips. The boards have squares numbered 1 - 96 in a regular but non-sequential pattern. There are 6 blank squares at the top and bottom of the boards. Each board is identical. Each player starts with 1 chip on each of the 6 bottom squares of their board. The object is to be the first player to get all your chips to the top 6 squares. On your turn, you roll your die. You can then move one of your chips in one of three ways: 1) Move the chip to the corresponding number on your board or 2) Move the chip orthogonally the number of squares indicated on the die or 3) Add or subtract the number on the die from the number on the square the chip is currently on. Then move the chip to the square with the corresponding total. One one chip can occupy a square.

name: Connect Four Cube
description:
This is Connect4 played on a cube.

The "cube" is about 3 inches on a side and cannot be accurately called a cube since the edges and corners are cut off at 45 degrees. It is made of the same blue plastic as the more common Connect4 game. Each of the 26 sides thus created has a hole in.

The cube is hollow and one side is a door enabling red and yellow pegs to be stored inside the cube. This, and the wrist strap secured to the inside of the cube (stored inside during play), make the game very portable.

The gameplay is similar to Connect4 - place a peg in a hole on your turn. The object is to get four in a row.

name: Der kleine Prinz geht auf die Reise
description:
With a flock of wild birds, the Little Prince travels from planet to planet. The players help the Little Prince to visit all of the planets in the right order.

Aim of the game (from Rule book):
To help the little prince go travelling and discover as many planets as possible. Beware, each planet must be associated with a flock of birds. In Fact, the prince can only travel if a flock of birds comes to collect him.

On his turn a player turns over an objective card and has 3 attempts to slide stars tiles on the board to discover the planet shown on the objective card and a flock of birds.
If he doesn't manage to do it, next player has three goes.
Fist player to find the good planet and a flock of birds wins the tile. Than next player turn a new objective card.
Once the 8 objective cards have been given, player with the most cards win.

Note:
In the same collection from the publisher Petit Jour, there are two other games with the little prince anthem:
the little Prince protects is planet and the little prince tames the fox.


Mit einem Schwarm wilder Vögel reist der kleine Prinz von Planet zu Planet. Die Spieler sind dem kleinen Prinzen behilflich, alle Planeten in der richtigen Reihenfolge zu besuchen.

name: Get the Gummies
description:
Get the Gummies is the simple, yet strategic, trick-taking card game in which you try to score as many points as possible by grabbing all the adorable gummy bears you can get your hands on, while sabotaging the progress of your opponents!

How To Play
Shuffle the deck. Deal each player 10 cards. Set the remaining cards aside. The player to the dealer's left has first turn and begins the hand's first trick.

Each trick consists of every player placing 1 card into the center of the playing surface, in clockwise order. The first card played determines the trick's dominant color. The next cards played must be the same color, unless a player doesn't have one (in which case any card must be used). The player with the largest gummy bear of the dominant color takes the trick. Players score 1 point for every card taken, as well as bonus and penalty points listed on special cards. The trick taker choses the first card to play for the next trick. Special cards may not be played first in a trick. If a player beginning a trick has only a special card left to play, the trick is void and he or she is assessed a -5 point penalty.

When all tricks for the hand have been played, the points scored by each player should be tallied and recorded on paper. Several hands are to be played to allow points to accumulate.

The first player to score 100 points, wins!

name: Straight Shooter
description:
Straight Shooter is a dexterity/shooting game with a wild west theme. Be the first to clear all of the pucks out of your area and win. Very similar to Fastrack, but for four players instead of two.

From the box:

"A rootin' tootin' disc shootin' noggin' bootin' showdown. How quick is yer draw?

This ain't no high-falutin' showdown for the sappy. This here is the real deal, rootin' tootin' disc-shootin' that'll make an armadillo curl up and high-tail it home. 'Round here, yer either the best shot or you'll be buzzard food.

Not only are ya shootin' for braggin' rights, but straight shooter helps with the way yer hands and eyes coordinate. An' don't even git me started on the benefits to yer visual perception, which helps fer when yer rindin' around town on horseback and other such activities.

The game itself is constructed of geen-u-wine wood, much finer than ol' man Jones' wooden leg. If that don't make ya skip foer joy, then maybe ya been in the sun too long".

How to play:
1. Each player chooses a character and a town to represent. Pick up all 5 pieces of yer ammo and place it in yer town.

2. As soon as the rooster crows (or someone yells "DRAW"), y'all start shootin' into each other's towns by pushing down yer ammo and springin' it off yer trusty elastic.

3. First one of y'all to empty yer town of all the ammo (Yers or another player's) is the winner. Then you git ta tell everybody else ta git outta Dodge!

name: Star Wars Death Star Boom Boom Balloon
description:
It's Star Wars Death Star Boom Boom Balloon, the crazy and unpredictable game where at any time the balloon can go BOOM! In this Star Wars Edition, it's a race to destroy the Death Star. Players take turns attacking the Death Star, but no one knows when it will go BOOM! Roll the die, and carefully push in a stick until it clicks. Squeeze and stretch the Death Star - will the next click make it pop? Be the leader with the most X-wing Starfighters in play to win! Bring home the thrill of Boom Boom Balloon - Star Wars Edition!
Star Wars Death Star Boom Boom Balloon is the crazy game where each player tries to keep the balloon from popping!

Basic Idea is the same as Boom Boom Balloon but with a Star Wars Twist

•Roll the die and "click" a Laser stick for each number rolled. Will the Death Star explode? Watch out!

•It's a race to destroy the Death Star! BOOM! Will your Rebel Alliance fleet be the largest when it pops?

•Star Wars Boom Boom Balloon is made for 2-6 players ages 8 and up. No Batteries Required

•Includes: 1 Balloon Frame, 18 X-Wing Starfighters, 12 Death Star Balloons, 1 Die, 9 Laser Sticks, 1 Instruction Sheet, Batteries Not Required

name: Piraten
description:
This is one of HABA's mini-games, which comes in a tin on a key chain. In the tin are 4 big wooden boats, 4 small wooden boats, 3 small dice and a set of instructions. The boats are each painted in four different colors (yellow, blue, green and red).

Players have three rolls of the dice to try to collect as many flags of one color, so they can get a boat or both boats of that color. If the boat already belongs to another player, you take the boat from him. The game ends when all the boats have been captured. The big boat scores 2 points, and the small boat scores 1 point. The player with the most points win.

name: Scene It? Deluxe Disney Channel Edition
description:
From the publisher:

Want to Jump In with Izzy Daniels and rock out with Hannah Montana? With Scene It? Deluxe Disney Channel Edition, you'll get to do all this and more with clips from your favorite Disney Channel TV shows and movies, including That's So Raven, Cory in the House, Wendy Wu, Kim Possible and more! Race friends and family to spot the difference between two on-screen images, or be the first to name the Cheetah Girls theme song from a ringtone! Can you name the hotel where Zach and Cody live? Or the sport Troy played in High School Musical? Scene It? Deluxe Disney Channel Edition also includes hundreds of trivia questions that will quiz you on all things Disney Channel! Age range: Ages 8 and up
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Wolf im Schafspelz
description:
Wolf im Schafspelz is a fast-paced dice game in which you must quickly evaluate the roll of the dice and toss the right card in the right box. The faster you are, the more points you score – assuming you're correct, of course.

In the basic game, each player holds a wool card and the two halves of the box are laid face-up on the table, one showing a sheep in the bottom and the other a wolf. Players roll five or seven animal dice, depending on the number of players, then they try to scan the dice quickly to see which animal group – the sheep or wolves – are in the majority so that they can through their wool card in that box. Players who do so score 0-3 chips, depending on the number of players and how quickly they threw in their card; anyone tossing in the wrong box loses one chip. The first player to collect ten chips wins.

In the advanced game, a spice/wool die is rolled with the animal dice, and players need to throw the appropriate card – spice or wool – into the appropriate box. In the elite game, a blue animal die comes into play. If the blue animal die is part of the sheep/wolf majority, then game play is identical to the advanced game for that round; if not, then players must throw the symbol not showing on the spice/wool die into the right box.

One final variant can be used with all three levels of play: When the sheep are in the majority, those who score in the round receive a sheep chip; when the wolves are ascendant, they receive a wolf chip. The winner is the first player to collect both five sheep chips and five wolf chips.

name: Quinto
description:
Cards are played, Uno-style, to rows to capture point cards. There are three types of playing cards: combination cards contain one to four symbols in one of four shapes and colors; word cards name a particular attribute (number, color, shape); bridge cards allow a player to connect two word cards. One a row contains five cards, a Quinto is formed and the player takes the point card associated with the row.

As the game progresses the point cards become more valuable, both in the number of points available and in that a player making a Quinto from another player's cards scores the point card and may steal a point card from the player.

For 2 to 4 players Ages 12 and up.

name: San Guo Sha: Beginner's Edition
description:
The beginner's edition (初出茅庐) released in 2008.

Targeted to simplify teaching, it contains only 64 cards in deck instead of 108 in a standard one, 4 heroes (Guan Yu, Gan Ning, tweaked Lv Bu and tweaked Zhang Liao) instead of 25.

It has no box, just a big envelope with a page of rule sheet and 4 sheets of uncut cards inside. You need to cut out the cards by yourself.


Legends of the Three Kingdoms (a.k.a. San Guo Sha) is a card game based off the Chinese classical novel, Romance of the Three Kingdoms, which shares many rules with Bang!, the differences are as follows:
1. The Monarch (Sheriff) may get an additional skill related to their kingdom allegiance; players routinely have two powers.
2. Weapons may have their own additional powers.
3. A card to let a player borrow a weapon from another.
4. A card to cancel the effect of other cards.
5. Peach (Beer) may be played by any player when someone loses their last life; there is no exemption of using Peach when there are only 2 players left.
6. The game proceeds counter-clockwise.

name: Matchify Card Game
description:
No Messing Around ... When the fun starts, the last thing you want is anything complicated. Who wants fiddly pieces and a zillion rules? No way! Matchify says ... let's breeze through the rules in a few minutes, get everyone's round the table - and go for it!

Matchify uses two decks of cards (72 cards). Each card contains 9 symbols. Each card from the first deck has one symbol that can be matched with another symbol from any card in the second deck. For example, the 'Carrot' in the first card is matched with the 'Rabbit' in the second card in the Original theme. 'Bread' is matched with 'Wheat' in the MadeOf theme. 'Eiffel Tower' is matched with 'France' in the Travel theme. 'Banana' is matched with 'Fruits' in the TypeOf theme. 'Tractor' is matched with 'Farmer' in the Professions theme.

Fast-paced Card Game Best games are simple and fast - and Matchify is a high speed doozy. Compete to "catch the match" before your opponents. Sounds easy, but when the heat is on and everyone's racing to the top dog, that's when the challenge begins. This baby tests your observation, sharpens your language skills and powers up the fingers on buzzers factor. Addictive, clever and seriously challenging!

All for One & One for All! Perfect for 2 to 8 players. That's family, friends ... everyone in your tribe. Young children will love it! They are so smart they'll see the playing field is leveled for REAL . Great confidence booster! Field day for competitive teenagers, great for grandparents who remember proper games before computers .

4 cool games to kickstart the fun times. Start simple ... then get smarter. Play Valley, Mountains, Golden Frog or River Delta. And play to WIN. Once you've figured the basics you can go crazy! Get creative! These illustrated cards could even inspire stories. Perfect for imaginary friends and cuddlies!

Colorful, Hardwearing Packaging - and Portable! Fun in a tin never looked so good. 72 beautifully illustrated cards spread across 2 decks, plus easy-to-follow instructions. These colorful and engaging cards come safe and snug in a hardwearing tin. You'll want to play this game over and over - which is why it's made to last. Travels anywhere you want to go - tabletop to car seat, airport to beach.

Just add family and friends, sprinkle with enthusiasm - and you're ready to roll.

Instruction set is available in five languages: English, French, Italian, German, and Spanish.

5 Themes available: Original, MadeOf, TypeOf, Professions and Travel.

Matchify - Your New House Favorite
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Kapital!
description:
Kapital! is much more than a board game, it is quite simply the first game of critical sociology. It allows you to understand and even experiment with the sociological mechanisms of domination, with a board game as funny as it is thrilling, brought to life by the designer Etienne Lécroart.

With family or friends, from 9 to 99 years old, a game to put in all hands to see the world as it is ... and want to change it! So it's your turn to try to win ... the class war!

Each player starts on the same line, but one is dominant and the others are dominated, this will determine which fate cards you can draw in each round and your starting capital. At Kapital! you can have 4 different assets: financial, social, symbolic or cultural. On your turn, roll a die and move your pown, then draw a Destiny card.
The end of the game is triggered when a player reaches the last space: financial paradise! The winner will be the one who has raised the most funds in each of the capitals.

name: Race Cards
description:
Each of up to six players is a driver in a NASCAR race. By drawing and playing a hand of cards, the goal is to be the first to complete 200 laps. However, your opponents will try to slow you down by forcing you to pit for tires, fuel, repairs...or even worse. A good RACE CARD driver will play both offensively, by playing as many Lap Cards as possible, and defensively by slowing down his or her opponents. When someone is too far ahead, rival drivers might even have to gang up on the leader in order to close the gap.

Re-implementation of Mille Bornes

name: Tilez!
description:
