From the publisher's website: Tilez! (rhymes with "smiles") is a color-matching and spatial relations puzzle game that comes with 80 all-different "L"-shaped tiles. The object is to select a tile from your rack and place it on the board such that it matches as many existing neighboring colors as possible. As the game progresses the board becomes a mosaic of color with ever-greater challenges and ever greater opportunities to score.

Includes 80 magnetic L-shaped tiles, 4 custom racks, gameboard, scoring markers, and instructions.

Tylz! is the travel version. No racks or box, but otherwise the same rules, components and game play.

name: Matchin' Middles
description:
A simple matching game for kids aged 3-7. There are two ways to play.

For younger players: place the cookie halves with the white "middles" into the cookie jar, and divide the brown halves among the players. The first player takes a cookie half from the cookie jar. If the shape matches one of their brown cookie halves, they can put the pieces together to make a whole Oreo and place them in their stack. If they do not match, the player must return the cream half to the jar and the next player takes their turn. Play continues until the cookie jar is empty and the player with the highest stack of cookies wins.

For more advanced players: Place all of the cookie halves face down on the table. The first player turns two halves over. If they match to form a cookie, that player gets to add that cookie to their stack. If they don't match, both halves are turned back over and the next player goes. The game continues until all cookies have been matched and again, the player with the highest stack of cookies wins.

name: Lucy's Tea Party Game
description: A very large game which has a large picture of Lucy on the cover, and smaller pictures of the gang playing the game. Came with a large vinyl play mat, plastic serving tray, four plastic tea cups, tea pot, and plastic sugar cubes. Players actually filled up their cups with water, and as sugar cubes were awarded through the game, put them in their cups until they overflowed. First player whose cup overflowed was the winner.

name: Miss Popularity
description: Billed as "The True American Teen Game" and "The Game That All Girls Love to Play," this was a game marketed for preteen and teenage girls. The game is a competition between players to achieve the highest level of "popularity." The game had an interesting mechanism for determining whether a girl scored popularity: a small, pink, plastic phone—the Automatic Answer-Phone*

name: Bindle Rails Expansion #1: Imperial Mexican Railway
description:
From the website:

Available Now For Print and Play!

This expansion is now available for Bindle Rails and involves running track between Mexico City and the Atlantic. The object is to hook up these two regions and join as many resources and cities up along the way. If you aren't able to make it across the mountains, you lose - but run enough rail and you will be considered a visionary among your contempories.

In addition to downloading and printing the PDF's, you will need 27 Event Cards from the original Bindle Rails game as well as most of the cubes. If you need to print out cards for the expansion, please refer to the main game page to direct you to the PDF that will allow you to print the cards. The mats, Goal Cards and Manager cards are not used in this variant.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Stock Holding

name: Head Solitaire
description:
A Decktet solitaire game that does not require a playing surface. It involves melding cards through collections of suit cards, collections of cards that share a rank, and collections of consecutive ranks that share a suit. After going through the deck twice you count the number of unmelded cards and that is your score. The lower the score the better.

A "head solitaire" is a kind of solitaire that requires no playing surface. Many were popular during the era of British sailing merchant ships.

Link to wiki article: http://wiki.decktet.com/game:head-solitaire

name: Daring Contest: Family Edition
description:
Like Daring Contest, but don’t want to embarrass yourself in front of your parents (or kids)? This version keeps all the fun of Daring Contest but with a family-friendly set of dares and penalties!

—Description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Follow, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Guacamole!
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Looking for a spicy game to promote critical thinking? This clever new game has players frantically collecting all the ingredients for their own recipe of mild, medium or spicy guacamole! Be the first player to match 5 ingredients cards to the recipe card, and you get to keep that recipe card. Collect one of each type - mild, medium and spicy - and you win! Ole!

Game Overview:

Players are dealt five ingredient cards, which are laid face up in front of them. The top recipe card is turned over and then players draw cards to improve their ingredients to match the recipe. If a card is kept, another card is discarded, so that players only have five cards at a time. Players may draw from the discard pile as well. The first player to match the exact number of ingredients to the recipe shouts "Guacamole!" and then wins that recipe card. The game continues until one player has won one each of the Mild, Medium and Spicy recipe cards. The game can either be played by turns or by "scramble" (where all players draw and discard as fast as they can at the same time).

There are three special cards to spice things up: Limes - all players pass a card to their left; Salsa Bowl - all players pass a card to their right; Sombrero - all players get up and move one chair to the left, taking over another player's hand.

name: Jokes de Papa: version Salée
description: In this Salty version you will find 200 jokes of (very) bad taste for a good slice of laughter between consenting adults!

name: Canadaopoly
description:
From the game site:

Have you ever wanted to own Banff National Park or Meech Lake? Well now you can!

CANADA-OPOLY combines the Canadian enjoyment of board games with the discovery of the coolest country in the world. Canadians can now live out their dreams and buy Canada's most recognized landmarks coast-to-coast, such as the CN Tower, the Calgary Stampede, or Niagara Falls.

Buy your favourite properties, build log cabins to increase the value, and trade them in for ski lodges.

Plus, learn interesting facts about Canada's landmarks:

•The city of Winnipeg is located in the centre of Canada when traveling east to west, but Manitoba is still considered to be one of the western provinces.

•Many bays claim to be the "world's largest," but there is no disputing that Hudson Bay is the largest bay contained in one country.

It's a game of strategy and luck to determine who can possess the hockey-loving, maple syrup-drinking, board game-adoring country that is Canada. So grab your metal token and advance to the Face Off. Now is your chance to own Canada‚s provinces, bodies of water, and famous attractions. Just watch out that you don't slide into a snowstorm, or end up paying GST!

CANADA-OPOLY is a game for all Canadians who know that real money doesn't come in just one colour.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company, Outset Media

name: Rapigrama
description:
The game has 13 letter dice that players roll up to three times, trying to form a crossword with them before a sand timer runs out. When a player is done or time runs out, they score the value of the words minus the value of unused dice. First one to reach an agreed score (usually 200 points) wins the game.

A classic since the late '70s - early '80s, Rapigrama remains one of the most popular boardgames in Argentina, sold in every toy store and supermarket.

name: LOOPZ
description:
" The memory game that gets you moving"

Tune up both your reflexes and memory by waving your hand in loops that can sense your motions. Seven game modes available for 1-4 players, including a mode that allows you to create your own music.

- Repeat the Beat
- Rhythm and Flow
- Versus Mode
- Reflex master
- Musicology
- Freestyle DJ
- Music studio

(Battery included!)

Players compete against each other or the game by repeating sounds or combinations of sounds played by the game. Moving your hand over a sensor in the loops triggers a correct or incorrect response from the game. Sometimes you must use both hands to trigger a correct response. The game demands both memory ability to replay the right sequence of sounds as well as dexterity in moving your hands to the correct location(s). The non-game modes teach music scales and you can create songs with the correct hand placement in the open loops or "LOOPZ".
categories: Action / Dexterity, Electronic, Memory, Music, Party Game

name: Super-Hirn
description:
A memory game for the old and the young...

Players move around the board and have to complete different (brain/memory) tasks, like listening to a short detailed story and then answering questions, remember drawn patterns, memorize things the other players tell them etc.

Quite fun as this is more than a simple memory game for sure...
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Social Sabotage
description:
How to play!

Social Sabotage gameplay is simple. There are two types of cards:

Where cards, which give the destination for your message, picture, or caption.

Post on a family member's Facebook profile...
Post on Facebook...
Send an ex...


and What cards, which provide awkward messages, pictures or captions you’ll need to send.

I love the smell of my own farts!
Grandpa really fills out those khakis.


Players take turns challenging one another with combinations of What and Where cards.

Post on Facebook... I love the smell of my own farts!


The player with the courage to collect the most Where cards and What cards earns the most points. That’s how you win.

—description from the publisher

name: La Conquête du Pétrole
description:
In the fictional country of Araweit, you compete in the exploration and exploitation of petroleum to be the first to amass 500 MF (500 million francs).

The map shows the country, divided into two zones; the A zone is harder to get to and out of, so exploration permits are cheaper --because only big deposits are likely to be money makers. Some of the A zone lots are offshore.

What you can do during your turn is driven by the outer track. Eventually, you'll buy permits, conduct seismic exploration, drill (also a form of exploration), place reservoir markers for oil or gas. Random events intervene, and nationalization occurs now and then.

The game has a definite educational bent to it.

name: Eureka
description: This game is a bit reminiscent of Wheel of Fortune, but this time the players roll the dice to open one or two of the 10 flaps that cover the hidden word.

name: The Game of Life: Rock Star Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

You wanna be a rocker? Set the world on fire? Get on the Rock 'n Roll Highway and start your garage band, perform at the Red Roxy Amphitheater, get your first single on the radio and build fame and fortune. Live a rock star life, build your career, reach superstardom, become a Rock Star legend and retire at the Rocker’s Hall of Fame.

For those who want to rock, we salute you!

Game features one-time assembly and includes: Custom game board, 6 Tour Bus movers, 7 Rock ‘n Roll buildings, Rock Star spinner, 1 bridge, 3 mountain ranges, 52 Life tiles, 52 pegs and much more

Synopsis:

The Game of Life: Rock Star Edition is an interpretation of the popular Milton Bradley board game, with all the characters, places, events, and life decisions that are present in being a Rock Star. As the traditional version of the Game of Life has players finding jobs and starting families as they progress from space to space, the Rock Star edition has them starting a garage band and getting band members, while they follow life's path by performing at classic venues. By the time they make it to the end of the board -- Rocker's Hall of Fame -- the player who has the most fame and fortune wins the game.

name: UNO Dice
description:
UNO Dice uses the same colours, numbers, and directions as the card game.

To start, players take 5 dice to make their hand which is left visible to the other players. One die is rolled in the center.

On each turn, the players examine their dice without rolling them. If a play can be made by matching the center dice in number or color, then the dice are exchanged and the center die is placed back in the bag. If a play can not be made, then the dice in the player's hand are rolled. If a play still can not be made, then a new die is added to the player's hand.

The first player to get rid of all their dice wins. The winning player's score is based on the faces of the dice left in front of their opponent. Be the first player to reach 500 points.

name: MonStars
description:
Raise the curtain for the funny freak show with cute creatures for little monster fans!

In MonStars, 45 colorful "MonStars" are crowding the stage, ready for the big show. Only an absolutely distinctive style will leave a lasting impression with the jury. Who will be among the Top 10? Each jury member holds a colored card set. By overlapping the cards, details can be combined so that different MonStars are created. Everyone plays simultaneously and tries to copy the candidate shown on the current card.

name: Pass the Pen
description: Pass the Pen is the world's fastest drawing game because the pen tip disappears as you play. You'll get 10 seconds to draw while all the other players guess. Is that a hamburger? A snowman? A sumo wrestler? You earn points if someone gets it right; if not, you pass the pen to the next player, and they pick up where you left off. The game is over when 10 cards are done.
publishers: Cheatwell Games, Goliath Games, Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Beyblade TCG
description:
A TCG based on the television show/toy line Beyblade. The game simulates tops battling in an arena. There are two different levels of play, one for young children and a more advanced game for those who want more depth.

Each player starts by taking one Blade card and placing it face up in front of him/her. Each Blade has its own "spin strength". You count that number of cards from the top of your deck and place them face down in a "spin pile" under the Blade card. The spin pile is very important, since the object of the game is to run your opponent out of spin by removing all the cards in his/her spin pile.

Players take turns initiating battles which go back and forth until one player cannot make a play. Then players determine how many cards will be lost from the losing player's spin pile using symbols that match up on the tops of the cards. The advanced version uses card text to take the game to a deeper level.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Familje Geni
description: The player rolls the dice and moves, then he receives a question from a certain category. If the player answers the question correctly, he receives a ring with the colour of the category. When the player has rings of all 6 different colours, he can move towards the middle. When reached the middle and answered the last question correctly, he has won the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Super Tactico (Super Stratego)
description:
A capture-the-flag variant of Stratego, published in Israel in 1988, with the following changes:

- A large sea that may be occupied by naval units (mines, ships, Navy Seal),
- Ships and planes that can transport units, including the flag (by stacking: pieces interlock),
- A life raft that may be loaded onto ships and planes to save passengers in the event the ship sinks in defeat,
- Two specialized special ops minesweeper units (combining the Stratego spies and miners): a Commando and a Navy Seal.
- To win the game, players must find, capture, and return the enemy's flag to their own island home base.
mechanics: Area Movement, Memory, Secret Unit Deployment
publishers: Amcor Games-Amhad Ltd., Orda Industries Ltd.

name: Number Ninjas!
description:
Ninjas prepare to be challenged! The Golden Dragon has been discovered and you must be the first to reach its location. To reach the ancient artifact, each ninja will have to travel through four areas: a bamboo forest, an ancient Japanese village, the cave of elders and a koi pond. To move throughout these locations, ninja players roll one of two sets of dice and solve the number challenge rolled.

The skill level of each player determines which set of dice that ninja will use the basic set of dice includes addition and subtraction; the advanced set of dice includes addition, subtraction and multiplication. In each of the four locations, ninjas will solve a word challenge, once all four challenges have been successfully completed, the ninja player makes his way to the Golden Dragon and the win!

But don’t be fooled, the life of a ninja is never as easy as it looks, while moving throughout the lands other ninjas will try to trap you and block your way to the Golden Dragon, you must defend yourself while using your smarts and turn the traps on them!

The box includes: 3 Ninja Recruit dice, 3 ninja master dice, game board, 4 ninja pawns, 12 quest items, 3 traps, the Golden Dragon, 80 ninja challenge cards, and EASY to follow rules!
publishers: Haywire Group, WOW! (Plasto World of Entertainment AB)

name: Ziege mit Fliege
description:
Ziege mit Fliege is a memory card game for children.

By turn, cards are placed face down on different piles.
This cards show either a colour, an animal, a piece of clothing or an activity.
4 different cards make one pile. Players have to remember this cards and make a sentence out of this cars, "A green beavers is skateboarding in a diving suit" for example.

name: Der versteckte Schlüssel
description: In each round, one player is the ghost who wants to leave valuable items to the new dwellers in the castle. But where? Cards give clues, then the ghost hides the key somewhere in the room, in any place matching the clues. The player who finds it gets a key card. If the ghost makes a mistake, letters are handed out to the "victims" of the round. After 5-8 rounds, the player with most keys and letters is the winner.

name: PUCK!
description:
PUCK! is the ultimate test of your trick shot skills in an all-out puck slamming, cup stacking melee! Race to eliminate your opponents’ cups by landing wooden discs into them, before they land one in yours! Work your way up to the coveted PUCK! For added difficulty, see if you have what it takes to compete at the grandmaster level! This high-stakes game hones your hand-eye coordination and mental agility while testing your focus (and possibly friendships) as you race to win. On your mark, get set, PUCK!
—from the back of the box

PUCK! is a fast and rowdy action/dexterity game where you bounce wooden pucks (discs) off the table and race to land them in small plastic cups also on the table. After you successfully land a puck in a cup, you stack an empty cup on top of it making your next target more difficult to hit as well as bringing the game closer to an end.

PUCK! has several different game modes including head-to-head, free-for-all, and team play and is either turn-based or real-time. Each mode has different cup layouts and end-game conditions, but all utilize the same simple and fun operation of bouncing pucks and stacking cups. PUCK! comes with 40 wooden pucks and 11 plastic cups.
—user summary
publishers: Marbles: The Brain Store, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Disney Princess: Present Party Game
description: It’s a holiday game of gift-giving fun! The Disney Princesses’ presents are all mixed up. Work together to sort the giant jumble before the party ends. Spin the spinner and pull presents from the bag. Then give and swap to get each gift to the matching Disney Princess! Time runs out when the deck is out - players win if they have matched all presents to princesses.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Move Through Deck, Trading

name: Capture the Flag
description:
It’s a head to head race to capture the flag! Both players play at the same time as fast as they can, no taking turns.
Each player starts with four cards defending their flag. Players draw one card at a time that they can use to either defend their own flag or attack their opponent’s defenses in order to get closer to their flag. The first player that can remove all of their opponent’s cards and grab their flag wins!

Capture the Flag is a colorful, fast-paced, family game of strategy and skill that you can play over and over again.

name: Locuras
description:
Locuras (spanish word for Craziness) This a Spanish party game that has different categories:

10 questions (guess the character)
Logic (Jeroglif, Tangram and logic questions)
Trivia
Drawing (based on a specific starring figure)
Words (9 dice with letters)


A very singular thing about this game, is that it doesn’t have a sand clock for the time. Instead, you have to spin a top.

When you finish your road along the board, you have to do a final "Locura" to win the game (example, eating a raw egg, dance with the game box on your head, etc)

Very good party game
categories: Deduction, Math, Party Game, Puzzle, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Line Drawing, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Team-Based Game

name: La Chasse aux fromages
description:
Tic! Clic! Tic! Tic! The sound of your little paw's claws resonates through the sewer pipes in this mad race to find the cheese. Faced with an impasse, call the plumber to give you a good tip. And when your precious cheese is buried under a pile of garbage, flush the toilet to find them. But wait! Do you feel it? Cheese, very close! Where should I go? Left! No, backwards! Right! There it is! Quick, quick! Hiiiiiii! Hiiiiiiiii!

Each player must build a sewer system that will allow his rat to reach his home while earning as much cheese as possible. Do you have enough and bold strategy to get there? Yes, so on your marks, get set, GO!

Tic! Clic! Tic! Tic! Le bruit de vos petites pattes griffées résonne à travers les tuyaux d’égout dans cette course folle pour dénicher des fromages. Devant une impasse, faites appel au plombier pour vous donner un bon tuyau. Et quand vos précieux fromages seront ensevelis sous un amas de déchets, «flusher» donc la toilette pour les retrouver. Mais attendez! Le sentez-vous? Un fromage, tout près! Où faut-il aller? À gauche! Non, reculons! À droite! Il est là! Vite, vite! Hiiiiiii! Hiiiiiiiii!

Chaque joueur doit construire un réseau d’égout qui permettra à son rat de rejoindre sa demeure tout en accumulant le plus de fromages possibles. Avez-vous suffisamment de stratégie et d’audace pour y arriver? Oui, alors, à vos marques, prêts, PARTEZ!

name: Children
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Story

Thornhill Mansion holds many secrets. Just before the turn into the 20th century Irwin Biddle purchased the house and turned it into what he called an orphanage care facility. But his severe governorship of the orphanage made the home for lost children anything but a haven. A fire in 1939 nearly destroyed the Thornhill Mansion. All but 13 children escaped the blaze. It wasn't until 1956 that Arthur Holland, a mining tycoon, purchased the Thornhill and footed the bill for a full renovation. However, it became clear within weeks of moving his family into the Thornhill that the Victorian mansion was far from settled. Holland's personal account of his family's stay in the Thornhill tells of unexplained children's voices, the sounds of little feet running through the night, of moaning heard inside the walls, even of parts of the house shifting. After leaving the Thornhill, Holland declared, "The place is a house of the dead. No sane person can live well within its walls."

13 ghosts live in the Thornhill, victims of the devastating fire that happened so long ago. As a ghost hunter, you welcome the chance to stay in the ghostly orphanage. Will you be the one to finally put the children to rest? Or will the malevolent child spirits drive you insane?

How to Play

In Children the game, you wander around the Thornhill Mansion trying to trap ghosts.

At the beginning of the game, you deal the 13 Ghosts deck face down off to the side on the table. You then deal the 13 Toys cards face up over the 13 Ghosts cards, creating 13 2-card stacks. Each player gets 5 cards (the hand limit at the beginning of the game) from the Children deck.

Players collectively build the Thornhill Mansion during their turns by placing room cards face up on the table in a grid pattern. The mansion is built in 4 levels--basement, 1st floor, 2nd floor, and 3rd floor. Each room card indicates on which floor it must be placed.

You search for toys and helpful devices by moving your pawn from room to room throughout the mansion. Each time you enter a room, you draw a card and add it to your hand. With a 5-card hand limit, players are forced to leave cards in rooms by placing them facedown beneath room cards. Players may also leave traps beneath room cards. You look at left-behind cards when you enter rooms. Left-behind traps spring immediately. You may add other left-behind cards to your hand.

You place ghost cards into the mansion when they appear at the top of the draw pile. Ghost cards are placed face up beneath room cards so players can read ghosts' names and see the toy icons on the tops of the cards.

To trap ghosts you must have Toy cards. Each ghost card is marked with a toy icon. If you are in a room with a ghost and you have its corresponding toy in your hand, you immediately trap the ghost and put it, along with the toy card, in front of you to keep score.

When you trap a ghost, you must see if another ghost in the house becomes enraged. To do this, flip over the 2-card stack you made at the beginning of the game that corresponds with the toy you used to trap the ghost. If the revealed ghost is in the mansion, flip its card over to its enraged (red) side. Every enraged ghost in the house reduces the hand limit by 1 card. If the hand limit reaches 0 cards, no players win. The ghosts take the game.

name: A Lone Banner
description:
A Lone Banner is the 15th game in the Small Box Games' Pure Card Line. It's also the first game to offer additional components in addition to cards: dice.

A Lone Banner pits each player in a dice driven, press your luck game of global conquest, with each player striving to control the greatest portion of the globe.

Each player receives three dice in his color, and at the beginning of each round, rolls those three dice, which he may place on any of the available 30 region cards. The results of these dice determine the player's army strength, but players may reroll to attempt to get special abilities, but run the risk of losing superiority in a region. The many regions also offer invasion points, allowing the player who holds them the ability to steal regions from other players.

A Lone Banner is for 3-4 players, and plays in around 30 minutes.

name: Do or Drink
description:
Do or DRINK is your new favorite party game. This game brings strangers closer together, has the potential to break up year long friendships and has even played a hand in getting a few people pregnant. If you are looking for a game that will make you laugh so hard you cry and show a side of you you didn’t know was there, look no further. Best part is you probably won’t remember what happened the next day.

—description from the publisher

The game play is simple. Separate the white and black cards into two piles and shuffle. The first player draws a white card, reads it aloud, does what it says, then the next player does the same until someone picks up a white "DRAW" card. Once this happens then that player must draw a black from the other pile, read it aloud, and do what it says or drink. If the challenge on the card is completed successfully, the card can be kept by the player and counted as points. Some cards are far more challenging than others and therefore are worth more but also have greater consequences for failing to successfully perform the challenge. In the end, the player with the most points wins.

—description from the back of the box

name: Dragon Ball Z: Majin Buu Saga
description:
From the box:

In Dragonball Z battle boardgame, you and your friends play your favorite heroes and villains battling to control the seven dragon balls! Power up! Search for dragon balls! And fight your oponents with the best punches, kicks, and energy blasts from the "Dragon Ball Z" television show.

name: The Man from U.N.C.L.E.
description:
Each of up to four Agents is given an assignment: 'Find your THRUSH Agent and deliver him to U.N.C.L.E. Headquarters'. If you do this before your opponents, you win the game.

Subtle strategies make this game a little better than your basic 'roll and move' game. Movement is governed by dice roll, but you only get the roll from one of them, unless you roll doubles.

For example: If you Roll a 3 and 5, you choose whether you move 3 or 5 spaces. If you roll a 6 and 6, you MUST move 12.

You may also 'steal' Agents from other players to keep them from winning by landing on them by exact count. Once you've found your assignment you have to try to keep it a secret before you 'make your run for home base' as your opponents will be out to get you.

name: Lickety Split
description:
A sharp eye and some fast sorting fingers are all that you'll need in this fun, frantic card game. Roll the colored die, flip a card and try to be the first player to find a matching object among your cards. Whoever collects the most cards wins.

Ages 6 and up

name: Peter Rabbit's Race Game
description: Each player is one of four characters from the Peter Rabbit (represented in the original edition by individual lead (!) figurines) and rolls a die to move along their own linear track which winds irregularly over the gameboard. They land on varied bonuses and penalties (which may, for example, direct the character along an alternate route, or tell them they may only move forward when they roll 2 and 3) all of which come with a story explanation appropriate to the character, and many with illustrations from the Beatrix Potter series.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Star Empires
description:
This is the second of an intended trilogy of interrelated science-fiction games (the first being Star Probe, the third never was released).

This game adds more economics and research along with rules for fleet battles.

Expands:

Star Probe
categories: Economic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Mark Breslin's Yuk Yuk's Comedy Game
description:
From the box...

Laughter becomes easy as you compete to play 1 of the 5 Closer cards in your hand against the Opener line on the table. Only after putting your card in the red viewfinder will you find out how the Yuk Yuk's panel of judges scored your card. Use enough of the funny Closer lines and proceed around the board and enter Yuk Yuk's comedy hall of fame.

name: Get Sparta
description: Get Sparta simulates the battle between the great power in the late Hoplite period. Generalship cards, special abilities and omens will influence the outcome of a battle.

name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Independent Study
description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist Universitycore game.

From the publisher:

INDEPENDENT STUDY: Ever ______ with _______? Want to take a course on _______? Wish _______ offered an advanced ______ program? Now ______ can _______with the _______ of them, by enrolling in Mad _______ University's independent study program!

Contains 50 blank cards you can use to explore your own ideas.

Expands:

Mad Scientist University
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Quod
description:
Quod is an abstract strategy game played on an 11-by-11 grid of spaces with the four corner spaces removed. Players alternate placing pieces, called quods, into empty spaces. A player wins by placing four quods that form the four corners of a square. The square can be any size and any orientation (in other words, the square can be "tilted").

In addition, each player has a small number of pieces, called quasars, that are used purely for blocking.

Quod was invented by G. Keith Stills in 1979, while he was at college, and was popularized by Scientific American in March 1996.

Many computer implementations exist, such as
http://www.geocities.com/SiliconValley/Heights/2220/quod.htm...
and
http://wizard.ae.krakow.pl/~jb/Quod/

name: Fronteira
description: Game lived in the Middle Ages with collection of pieces in which the player assembles his kingdom, which builds castles, farms, villages and abbeys, Wars facing other kingdoms in wars of expansion, suffers attacks by Vikings, witchcraft and black fever, has factor luck by collecting points as well as parts of the game, strategic factor is reasonable.

name: The Fantastic Forest
description:
Put your heads together to memorise the recipe for the magic potion which will save the old magician then search through the enchanted forest to find all the necessary ingredients. Each character gathers different ingredients.
A co-operative game which teaches teamwork. Includes magical glow-in-the-dark recipes.

name: Faqir
description:
In Faqir players try to make specific patterns with nails (cones) that match with the pattern on a card they have drawn.
The first player to achieve this wins. Each card is partially visible to the other players; use this to spike the fakirs of your opponents!

Taken from the publisher website:

Everyone knows about the faqirs lying on beds of nails, but the ones in this game are not so keen on sharp things – they prefer to squirm between the nails! Who is the first player to place the nails so that their faqir dares to come out from his dressing room to perform? Faqir is a great game for the whole family – all you need is some perceptive skills, light strategic thinking and a pinch of luck!

name: Mikado Reisspel
description:
travel version of Mikado game; involves avoiding (or winning) colored little balls that will fall through after the Mikado stick have been pulled out of the stack. The stack is still kind of random, but is now fixed in a cilinder,that allows for playing on any surface (allthough playing in the back of a car might prove a bit difficult)

user sunmmary:
24 sticks are put through little holes in a cilinder, thereby creating some kind of 'net' blocking the opening of the cilinder. 17 blue balls and 1 yellow ball are poured over and are effectively blocked.
Then players may retreive a stick from the cilinder, 1 by 1, trying to avoid (or in a variant: to maximise) the number of balls falling through. The blue balls count for 1 and the yellow ball counts for 5 points. Balls lying on top of the stack of sticks may be manipulated when in the process of retreiving a stick, thereby forcing of preventing them from falling through.

It's a fun little game played by 2 to 4 players. Children like the colours and the balls falling through.

name: Tabletop Bowling
description: A desktop bowling set. Wooden base and pins, with a wooden ramp for launching the metal bowling ball which can be pivoted to aim shots. The base has a metal backstop. Scoring and pin setup must be done manually for each frame.

name: Enter the Passage
description:
Enter the Passage is a party game based on The Passage trilogy by Justin Cronin. In this game, players are assigned the role of Humans, Virals or Amy, with the Humans trying to destroy the Virals, the Virals conspiring to attack the Humans, and Amy using her unique powers to help the humans determine who among them is a Viral and who is safe. Gameplay is based on the award-winning Ultimate Werewolf series of games by Ted Alspach.

At the start of the game, one person is designated the moderator. That person creates a deck with one card per person in it, with at least one Viral and Amy. The cards are dealt face down, and each player secretly views her role. From that point forward, there are two teams: Virals and humans, with Amy on the Human team. The Virals are trying to attack the humans, and the humans are trying to destroy the Virals. The game continues until one of the two teams has been eliminated.

name: Geonosis Arena
description:
In the Galaxy far, far away… Join Obi-Wan Kenobi, Anakin Skywalker and Padmé Amidala on the planet Geonosis, where they have to fight against ferocious monsters on the arena. Will they survive until remaining jedi knights arrive? Will Count Dooku be victorius this time?

The aim of the game is to defeat your opponents until the droids enter the arena.

Gameplay:
Players decide which side of force thay want to play.
They Choose their pawns and appropriate decks of cards. Both sides have 3 characters that can be freely distributed according to the number of players.
One player can play multiple characters, but they can not fight against each other.
The dark side of the Force begins.
Each player in his turn has the right to perform an action with only one character.
In player’s turn, players can perform two actions: movement and attack. They can also use a special action.
Every turn players draw two cards from the character deck and select one to be used.
The movement and attack points are indicated on the cards along with special actions.
Special actions allow to fortify attack, heal or move away.
Damage is marked on special lenticular indicators.
Whoever elimates the other side of the force wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Confetti
description:
Card game from the "Dubbel en Dwars" series. All cards are printed on both sides. During the game you need both sides!

In Confetti, try to find an object on the basis of assignments as soon as possible. The table is littered with object-cards. One player turns a card on the table, which shows an assignment. Everyone is now searching for a card that meets the assignment: the objects in the green half have to be on the card, while the object in the red half there should not appear. The first player that finds a matching card gets the assignment card.

When the deck runs out, the player who has the most assignment cards wins the game.

name: Tic Tac Toe
description:
The goal is to win tokens in your color (the players decide how many constitute victory). You win tokens by you or your opponent, unsurprisingly, aligning three cards of your color.

What makes this different from traditional tic tac toe is that:
1) Each player has a hand of five red or blue cards. Each turn one card is played and one drawn. Since the cards are shuffled and distributed randomly, you will often end up having to play your opponent's color.
2) The cards are numbered 1 to 9 (2 of each, so 18 cards per color). To place a new card on an existing card, whatever the color, the numbers must match.
3) The cards stay on the table once played and gameplay continues until the decided number of tokens is obtained.
4) Finally, there are a handful of cards that allow you to remove one card position or a whole row of cards.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Bubbles
description:
24 cards, each of them showing four bubbles in four different colours (red, green, blue, yellow), are laid out on the table. Four dice, in the same colours, are rolled. Their faces show values from 1 to 24. All players then simultaneously try to find the card on which the bubbles' sizes match the die roll. E. g. if the green die shows the highest value, the blue one the second highest, the red one the third highest and the yellow one the lowest, players have to find the card on which the green bubble is the biggest, the yellow one is the smallest etc. The player who is first to find the correct card puts it in front of him/herself. If the same combination is rolled again, another player can steal the card.
The first player to collect (and keep!) four cards wins the game.

name: Pentris
description:
Each player get a 10x10 squares grid. Two Tetris-like pentominoes are associated with each numbers 1 to 6.
The game is played in real time: a dice throw determines a combination of two pentominoes, each player must choose one and draw it on his/her sheet connected to the bottom or on top of preexisting full squares in a gravity-affected fashion. The shapes can be rotated at will before being drawn. At the end of the round, player rotate their sheet 90° clockwise. Repeat until every player can't place a piece during a round.
The number of completed columns OR rows gives the score. The player(s) with the highest score win(s).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Puzzle, Video Game Theme

name: Constantinopla: El ocaso de un imperio
description:
It is a game for a player that combines time progress with technological development and a simple military strategy system.

The objective of the game is to deplete the deck of chronological events and reach the year 1463 (last card of the deck) in possession of at least Constantinople. The game is lost if the player is not in possession any moment of Constantinople or if the emperor and all his heirs have died.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Es un juego para un jugador que combina avance temporal con desarrollo tecnológico y un sistema de estrategia militar sencillo.

El objetivo del juego es agotar el mazo de eventos cronológicos y llegar al año 1463 (última carta del mazo) en posesión al menos de Constantinopla. Se pierde el juego si el jugador no está en posesión cualquier momento de Constantinopla o si el emperador y todos sus herederos han muerto.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Turn Order: Role Order, Worker Placement, Zone of Control

name: Brainbox: Sport
description:
Did you know table tennis has 300 million players worldwide? Or that the first Rugby World Cup was won by New Zealand? This BrainBox includes fascinating facts about almost every sport you have heard of and maybe a few you haven’t!

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a dice. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Contents: 71 cards, 2 rules cards, 1 sand timer and 1 dice. Packed in a sturdy cool magnetic cube box.
publishers: Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Mega Mouth
description:
Everyone is a lip-reader in this game of massive mouth magnification.

Draw a category card, hold the mega-magnifier up to your mouth, and silently speak to your teammates. Don't say the words out loud! Players are awarded tokens for every answer they guess correctly.

name: Zombie Chase
description:
Perfect for beginners and pros alike, Zombie Chase is a great choice for the next family game night! Set at Lake Nomby amusement park, everyone was having a wonderful time until the sun began to set and an ominous crash is heard at the center of the park. From within the dark and creepy park maintenance shed, a moaning sound emerges. The owner of that sound quickly becomes clear as the Zombie Janitor appears and begins his search for brains! In a panic, the park guests and security flee the park and lock the gate behind them to keep the zombie trapped inside. The problem is the janitor isn’t the only one left behind! YOU’RE trapped too!

Players roll two Dice. Move your Character the number of spaces shown on the white die, then move the Janitor Zombie the number of spaces shown on the green die. Your goal is to find a flashlight by landing on and flipping the item tiles. Once you have found a Flashlight, go to the maintenance shed, grab a Key, and proceed to any exit to escape the park!

Watch out for Zombies though. If you end up on the same space as a Zombie, flip your pawn over, and now you become a Zombie and your strategy changes. Now your goal is to chase the other Human Characters and turn them into Zombies!

There’s two ways to win Zombie Chase! Find a flashlight, grab a key from the maintenance shed, and be the first to escape through one of the gates or you can win by being the one to infect the final human player as a Zombie. With two ways to win, everyone has a shot at coming out the winner and every playthrough is a new adventure. One thing is for sure: to win at Lake Nomby amusement park, alive or undead, you’ll be needing plenty of brains!

—description from the publisher

name: Lizzy Loves Darcy: A Jane Austen Matchmaking Game
description:
To play the game, choose your character and spin the spinner. Depending on what square you land on, you will climb social ladders, slide down ropes of scandal, spin again or answer Jane Austen Trivia questions. To win the game, land on square 100, where a pair of golden rings announces that you have found your partner.

Contains reversible game board, rule booklet, spinner, 24 counters, and 100 trivia cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: #GuiltyFoodTricks
description:
#GuiltyFoodTricks is a trick-taking game about posting attractive pictures of the food you're eating on social media - but be careful! If you post photos that become too sensational, it will take a toll on your physical and mental health.

In game play, each suit is a different social media platform, and higher ranked cards will be more likely to win a trick, but will be worth negative points. Lower valued cards are more difficult to win tricks with, but will be worth positive points.

In addition, players have a special card which will allow them to not-follow suit and play from a face up cache of the undealt cards.

The player with the most points after 3 rounds wins.
publishers: AaAaAaGames (アーアーアーゲームズ)

name: Hoop Godz
description: Hoop Godz brings 3-on-3 street basketball to life with this two-player head-to-head tabletop game. Pick your three players to put on the court. Spend JUICE to move, pass, and play action cards. Roll dice in real time against your opponent to find out whose actions are successful by matching icons on the action cards. Take rests to recover JUICE when you're running low. Go into the Red Zone on your turn to earn G.O.A.T. cards that give you special abilities. The first player to score 7 points wins.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Flohmarkt
description:
Do you like Fleamarkets? Then this is your game, but don't expect to find as many games as in this auction.

A "family" of 2-6 players is visiting a round-shaped fleamarket. Each player starts with 20 money and 2 items. There's a total of 15 items in 5 different colours in the game, the fleamarket stalls have space for 1-3 items, and a rotating disc under the game board keeps the prices for the various stalls constantly changing; the idea is to be in the right place at the right time to buy cheap and sell dear. Hand limit is 3 items, but a player may buy/sell 2 at a time if they are of the same colour, and if there's space in the stall they happen to be at. A stall may be out of use due to a coffee break (the "coffee cup" symbol) and two special squares force players either to give or take money from an opponent. For movement, players can choose between roll-and-move or fixed movement rules.

Winner is the player who first gets 250 money.

name: Monopoly: Assassin's Creed
description:
Whereas the hat, car, iron, and other token pieces represent players in the normal version of Monopoly, Monopoly: Assassin's Creed lets you choose between the series' different protagonists. You can play as Altair, Ezio, Connor Kenway, his grandfather Edward Kenway, Aveline, or the protagonist of Assassin's Creed Unity, Arno Dorian.

Other game pieces have also be changed to match the Assassin's Creed theme. Money has been replaced with Abstergo credits, and the usual real estate is swapped out for historical locations featured in the Assassin's Creed series, with Abstergo Industries and Abstergo Entertainment replacing the game's original prime properties: Boardwalk and Park Place.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dynamite Shack
description: A rather funny game where you wear oversized thumbs and try to put dynamite sticks into a shack before it blows up. I enjoyed this as a kid... I am most certain it would be frowned upon for its "explosive" theme now-a-days...

name: Batman Forever: Battle at the Big Top
description: Two-Face and the Riddler are creating havoc at the circus, and Batman and Robin need your help! It’s up to you to defeat Two-Face, then make your way up and across the tightrope to stop the Riddler and his brain-sucking machine before he steals the audience’s brains! But hurry: If the Riddler turns over all the crowd cards and captures their brains, he wins the game!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Blockbusters Gold Run Card Game
description:
From the game-
ITV's Blockbusters certainly lives up to its name with its quick-fire questions and cliff-hanging finales, it is perhaps the most popular quiz show for young people. This card game brings you all the excitement of the Gold Run.
You won't win fantastic prizes, but you will have hours of fun testing your general knowledge. The aim of the game is to successfully join four hexagons of the same color, by answering questions correctly.

name: Impact: The Battle for Wolf Ridge
description:
Stand-alone game that may be integrated with Impact.

3 levels of play, basic level (1) is just a children's miniatures game with units that can fire rockets. Setup your men (or dinos) and try to knock over your opponents' by shooting them.

Level '2' introduces movement.

Level '3' introduces capture, special tunnel movement and different troop types.

Integrates with:

Impact
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Fabulantis
description:
Who will be first to find his mysterious mythical creature?

The enchanted paths in the mysterious forest change direction again and again. However, with the right knack, enough courage and perseverance, all players will find the shore of the enchanted lake that shows them the way to their destination: a mysterious mythical creature. But this path also holds many magical surprises that may require a detour.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Prime Suspect: Tajemnice Vileburga
description:
The authors of the game are proposing an alternative approach to detective stories. Passive watching / reading of a detective story turns into a dynamic boardgame, in which the players engage in searching out the evidence and investigating the complexity of the murderer's motives.
Each session is a contest of skill between the detectives and the Master of the Game in the role of the Prime Suspect. Exactly what happened and how? Who is the murderer and what was the motive of the crime? The choice is far from easy. Among the twenty suspects are respected citizens of Vileburg. Step by step the detectives follow the murderer's trail, carefully checking each trace, searching out anyone in any way connected with the case. The witnesses (once identified) are ready to testify. Their statements may help or further complicate the process of investigation. In this game everything depends on the deductive skills of the players: no one else will put together all the pieces of the puzzle into one coherent and logical picture. And even when (and if) the criminal is finally caught (after the exciting chase phase of the game), it’s not over yet: the detectives try to deduct the motive of the crime, reconstruct the entire story from the scraps of data they have managed to collect.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Storytelling

name: Imagination
description:
Imagination is a party game of charades in which players compete vs. each other.

Each round one of the players becomes a game master. He draws two top cards of the deck and checks the number of the next top card (which is random from 1 to 10). Then he looks at the text lines ("tasks") with this number and chooses a task from one of those cards. Next, he chooses an action how to explain the task to other players: to speak, to draw, or to perform. (The method of explanation becomes unavailable for this player till he uses all three methods in his text turns.)

All other players tries to guess the task. The game master and the player who gives the correct answer both score 1 victory point, keeping one of the two task cards drawn by the game master. After that the next player becomes a game master, and so on. The player with the most number of cards is declared the winner at the end of the game.

200 two-sided cards (with easy and difficult tasks on opposite sides) contain 4000 different tasks.

name: BULLSHIP!: A New Spin to Liar's Dice
description:
BULLSHIP! is a brand new spinoff of Liar's Dice born in Canada in which each player steps into the role of a famous notorious pirate and battle for the title of Pirate King and the legendary Black Lagoon.

Player's are given five dice, two gold coins, a random character card and one barrel dice shaker. To stay alive in BULLSHIP!, you must bluff or be bluffed and use your unique character abilities to increase the odds of winning. Player's keep their dice concealed from others and make 'wages' of how many dice there are of a certain numeric value in total amongst all players.
e.g "There are 6 dice with fives in total" In a clockwise rotation, the next player must then increase the number of dice by at least one to continue the wager for the match. If a player believes the other player is bluffing, someone can always call "BULLSHIP!" on that active wager. When that happens, all players reveal their dice and the player who called "BULLSHIP!" either the wins the booty or loses their own booty. Once a player runs out of booty, they are eliminated and the player who defeated them steals their unique ability(s) permanently.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Children's Game, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Christmas Trivia Game
description:
From the box:
"Christmas 'Tis the season! What better time to engage in a game of Christmas Trivia than when the family's gathered together for the holidays? Learn all about Yuletide lore through the centuries, from the Three Kings to King Wenceslas, St. Nicholas to Sinterklaas, Ebenezer Scrooge to Frosty the Snowman. Categories test your knowledge of carols, movies, the North Pole, traditions and stocking stuffers."

In Christmas Trivia Game, each player tries to correctly answer two questions in each of five categories (or one of each, for a quicker game). Each player chooses a category, and the player to the right draws a card and asks the question in that category. Correct answers are recorded on a piece of paper. The card is then replaced at the bottom of the card stack. Play continues until one player has answered the designated number of questions.

name: Hojo Pojo
description:
Hojo Pojo is a deliciously-fun, family-friendly hot pot themed card game that plays up to a party of 6.

The objective of the game is to cook and eat as much food as you can before the dipping sauce runs out. The player with the most number of points wins, BUT if another player reveals the King of the Pot card at the end of the game, a final eat off will be conducted to determine the ultimate winner!

The gameplay simulates the actual eating of hot pot. You will need Tongs or Slotted Ladle to cook ingredients, and Bowls to contain the cooked ingredients. You get to roll the dice for each bowl card played in front of you. If you manage to roll a matching colour with an ingredient in the cooked area, dip it into a sauce before you eat by picking a Sauce Card, and yum!

The game is designed to accommodate players of different levels:

Simple (with young children)
- Bowl cards are separated into another drawing pile.
- King of the Pot is removed from the deck.
- Orange Sauce removed from Sauce deck

Normal (general game)
- Bowl cards are shuffled into the action deck.
- King of the Pot is added to the deck.
- All Sauce cards in use.

Advanced (familiar players of the game)
- Cooked ingredients are only shown to all players once before being placed in the pot.
- Advancement to Frenzy Phase (swapping of ingredients).
- Longer gameplay.

—description from the designer

name: Daring Passages
description:
What's the message in this bottle?
A collection of intriguing quotes from famous people - authors , athletes, world leaders, scientists, entertainers... from Charles Dickens to Babe Ruth, from Cleopatra to Elvis Presley. Play Daring 'Passages', the trivia game that will challenge and surprise you. Listen to the quote, then name the person who said it. Get as many as three clues to help you answer. It's a daring passage against your opponents across the nautical course. The first to reach shore, wins!

name: Angel Wars Board Game
description:
The Angel Wars strategy board game is simple to learn. Yet, it has a depth of strategy that is fascinating to players of all levels. The game features the excellent art and intriguing characters from the amazing animated series, Angel Wars.

The game begins with the game tiles set up in checkerboard design. You control the 6 guardian angels. Your opponent controls the 6 demons (or the 6 messenger angels if your opponent prefers not to play the demons). Players take turns moving, following the rules of movement, until one player has successfully moved all of his/her pieces to the opposite sides of the board.

However, it’s not that simple. You can only move your piece on a tile of matching color. Players flip tiles to match their piece. You must find a way to clear a path for both your blue pieces and your orange pieces while trying to block your opponent’s pieces in the process.

Offering two styles of play, this game is sure to become a favorite among game players of all ages and skill levels.
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Reflexx!
description:
The game consists of 36 cards in four colors which show an item in that color plus a right or a left hand. There are 16 additional color cards in four colors, which are sorted and stacked on the table.
The active player draws a card, looks at it and announces (for example): "Ketchup - left hand". The first player to hit the red stack with his/her left hand gets the red color card (but is not eligible if s/he already has a red card). The first player to collect a color card in each of the colors wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Termination Incorporated
description:
(description from publisher's website) "Under the surface of a peaceful society, legend persists about people called Gangsters and the glamorous lifestyle they lead.
These Gangsters used hits to protect their interests, and it is said that the best contract hitters worked for Termination Incorporated.
To satisfy the people's need for combat, the controlling Council devised a tournament to be held in vast stadiums in front of thousands of ecstatic, yelling fans.
Here combatants use stealth, courage and tactical awareness to out manoeuvre and attack their opponents, scoring points with their Electric Pulse Discharge Guns, then making their escape using the hard laser walls as cover.
Many tried and failed, but eventually the very best of the very best were able to compete for the trophy called Termination Incorporated."

Use movement cards to travel across a maze-like board and shoot your opponents before they shoot you. Dice are used to determine damage depending upon your distance away (with a couple of "auto-result" cards that can be used.) You have limited ammo and need to reload at specific squares. There's a minor card bluffing element (you can shield yourself for a turn but you might be bluffing.) There is a single sheet ruleset which explains what all the bits do but leaves you to infer how the game itself works.
The production values are reasonably high, but all the cards and the board are in monochrome.
Basically, it's like Frag but without the interesting weapons or objects or slight role-playing element.

name: TriBond Jr.
description:
From the box:

It's the cool kids' game that asks... "What do these 3 have in common?"

Answer Threezer riddles and move up, bump others backwards, or get bumped yourself! The board can be full of surprises and so can the cards, but the biggest surprise will be how much fun you can have thinking in threes!

Additional note: Differs from TriBond for Kids because the board is different. The main path appears to be longer, but there are shortcuts available.

name: Shark Bait
description:
Players are sharks trying to eat the best-valued people swimming for the shore.

On a player's turn, the player may move their shark up to two spaces and then attempt to eat a swimmer. A player must roll a d6 greater than the swimmer's value modified by ocean square. Rolling a 1 is always unsuccessful, and a 6 is always successful. If not eaten, the attacked swimmer will reach the shore. After attempting to eat a swimmer, a player moves one of the remaining swimmers closer to the shore.

The game ends when there are no swimmers remaining in the water.

name: Ant Army
description:
This game was designed by Kim St. Jack and was the only product from Rebel Games, an Australian company, is a simple wargame about the struggle between rival ant colonies.

The (rather plain) map shows a number of danger areas (spider webs and the like, although they are all abstracted) and ant trails, with the nests around the edges. Players move worker and soldier ants out of their nests and around the board trying to collect food and avoid the danger areas and the praying mantises, which move randomly across the map eating ants. Soldier ants may attack ants from other colonies.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Quadro
description:
Quadro is a game developed from the old Dutch game called "Butter, Cheese and Eggs" (three-in-a-row, Tic-Tac-Toe) played in a 3x3 grid. Quadro is played in 3D on four 4x4 boards to give a game on a 4x4x4 grid of squares. Players attempt to get four in a row to get points. Four in a row can be score on a single board, but also using different boards (By occupying the first square of a row on one board, and the remaining squares of the corresponding rows on the another board).
Bonus points can be scored by using only a single board for your row, or for using all four boards.

See Also:
Qubic - played on 4x4x4 grid instead of four separate boards in 2d.

name: The Redcoats are Coming
description: The players (Paul Revere and William Dawes) work cooperatively to defeat the British. They win by accumulating more points. They do not have to get to Concord first to win the game. The Patriots lose if the British end the game with more points, capture both John Hancock and Sam Adams or capture all of the military supplies.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Wargame

name: Montezuma
description: Each player places a card in each slot. If your card is higher in one of the slots with your chips, you add another chip. The first player to cap Montezuma's tower wins.

name: Movie Makers
description:
From the box:
"Movie Makers is a card game about the life behind the camera in the movie making business. A game in which you are smoking cigars and playing against friends and family trying to make the best films so you can receive the most precious statuettes. Gain an insight into the world of movies delivered with new anecdotes and old tales."

Danish Red Cross has created "Klub 10" which gives away 50.000 kroner (about 7.000 euro) to ten Danes. They will try to invest this money and the profit goes back to Red Cross. This year (2003) the money has been given to Peter Aalbæk, manager of the film company, Zentropa. He and his team have made Movie Makers, which are made in 10.000 copies.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Space Estate
description:
Sub-title:"the Real Estate Game that's out of this WORLD"
M-onopoly in SPACE, but only in OUR Galaxy! Game components consist of: a colorful mounted mapboard with various "Space" properties; a long single-side printed Rules Sheet; thick cardboard "Properties" cards; a set of Money denominations; translucent "Space Stations" chips; 2 8-sided DICE; a set of "Discovery" cards; 5 Cardboard money holders; 6 LEAD tokens-a Space Shuttle, Soyuz Space Station, Apollo Spacecraft, Lunar Rover, Astro/Cosmo-naut, and Lunar Lander. I HIGHLY recommend painting/coating the tokens to prevent unhealthy LEAD effects for those folks so concerned. Dipping or Spray coating with a "plastic" type product is best and 3 coats should be sufficient.
Play is similar to games of this ilk and the game ends once the FIRST player to lose all their money and be forced into Stellar Bankruptcy is declared. The winner is the remaining player with the most money. It has some special effects such as allowing players to move where they like when landing on a Space Shuttle space and paying the TRANSPORT fee. Other special spots include: Astro Bonus; Black Hole; Fuel Base; Halley's Comet; Meteor Storm; Mission Control; Solar Roller; Space Lotto; & Space Sickness. There are special rules for just 2 players including receiving extra money & 3 "Claim" cards prior to commencement of play. Nice and different approach from all the Terran bound versions of games like this.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Foreplay
description: Share and explore each other’s thoughts. What is your most secret fantasy... what is your lover’s? Do you prefer making love with the lights on or off? These are the kinds of questions explored when you land on a Key Card space on the board. If you land on a Heart Card space, you carry out the instructions such as, "Give your lover a massage while telling them what you like about them." Of course, all cards are designed with mental and physical foreplay in mind. The game ends when one player reaches the final space in the sun. Of course, the fun has only just begun. Includes a deck of 60 Key Cards, 60 Heart Cards, a game board, two tokens, one die, and easy-to-follow instructions.For two players. Note: This game is appropriate for adults only.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Ahonen & Wilson Connexion Oy, Relationship Enrichment Systems, Inc.

name: Stormfulde Højder
description:
From the rules:

The game is like life.
You gain ground by cheating, but aren't guilty until caught. You find love and get married, but you betray your spouse for something better, or steal the spouse from another player.
You compete to gain the most gold, and can steal from other players. You will need a fortune to be let into the great endless party in paradise.

The game is in Danish.

name: Miracula
description: As a wizard the players fill their cauldron with ingredients to make gold.

name: Krabcek
description:
Krabcek - a game of skill and chance.

The board is a labyrinth made from sixteen tiles, which are rearranged for every game (there are over 8 million variations).

Each player has seven round playing pieces: 4 Skinnyboys (the smallest), 2 Middlemen (medium size) and 1 Bigboy (the largest).

Play takes place on pathways, moving pieces from box to box on the throw of a dice. Play doesn’t stop at the edge of the board. Leave at the right side and you come back at the same place on the left side. Leave the path at the top, and you come back on at the same place at the bottom.

Each piece may only move through those paths in the labyrinth that are wide enough for it.

There are three tower combinations (stacking): a little stack is a Skinnyboy on a Middleman, a big stack is a Middleman on a Bigboy, a Krabcek is a Skinnyboy on a Middleman on a Bigboy.

The object of the game is:
•To make a three-piece tower OR
•To block your opponent so that he cannot move
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Atentado no Cassino
description: Secret agents (the players) walk around a casino, trying to protect an important politician. It also happens that one of the agents is a traitor, and is trying to kill him instead. Players may play roulette, black jack or dice to earn money to buy poisoned darts and paralyzing gas to attack other agents, or antidote and anti-gas masks to protect themselves.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Oase
description:
Oase is played with 65 terrain tiles showing straight or curved roads, crossings and bridges; all with 1-4 movement points.

The 4 starting tiles are laid out on the table, and every turn, a player must proceed 1 movement point or draw a new tile and put it on the table.

Object of the game is to reach the starting tile, that laid in the opposite corner as the one, where the player left. The player who achieves that first, is the winner.

name: Snake Eyes
description: Each players is given a set of cards numbered 2 through 6 and 8 through 12. Each card has a distinctive character on them, (ie; #2 is "Snake Eyes" and has a picture of a snake). The object of the game is to be the first player to have all of their cards turned face down and collect the "kitty" in the middle. Players throw 2 dice and turn the corresponding card for the total face down. If that player already has the corresponding card turn face down, he contributes to the pot and passes the dice to the next player. If a 7 is thrown, player must add to the kitty and pass the dice to the next player.
publishers: R. D. Fleck & Company, Selchow & Righter

name: Where's Wally? The Game
description:
Where's Wally? The Game is based on the Where's Wally books by Martin Handford who also designed this game.

The game is played by using a spinner and counters around a fixed board.

Aim: The aim of the game is to be the first player to reach the designated finishing place (in this case a large question mark) To achieve this, players must complete a series of observational questions outlined on the cards using the picture boards included.

name: Couples
description:
from Spielbox:

A new Bremen-based publisher without a website as of yet. They will be releasing a game that apparently has been making the rounds of insiders for the past 10 years. The title: Paaren / Couples. It's a card-playing game. Each player plays cards. In one spot, one man can be matched with a suitable woman. Matches are determined by having at least two matching characteristics with both the location and the partner. These can be different, though. Players always have four characteristics, locations have two to six. There are influence cards which can break up matches as well as destroy them. Thankfully there are also other cards which offer protection against jealousy. The first player to reach a pre-set number of matches wins the game.

The game will be bilingual (German / English) and come with 120 individually illustrated cards. Since most will recognize the characters, it will be great fun to match those who might not seem to be such a good match to start.

name: Arthur and the Minimoys: The Search for Archibald
description:
The smallest heroes can sometimes achieve the greatest exploits.

Arthur, 10 years old, has many concerns. A dreadful property developer wants to seize the house of his grandmother. The only solution to save it is to find the treasure hidden with the country of the Minimoys by his/her father Archibald... who disappeared 4 years ago. Return Arthur to the country of Minimoys. In the role of the one of the 4 heroes of film, you leave to search for Archibald.

Traverse the kingdom of the Seven Grounds until Nécropolis. But do so quickly, because the cruel villain has decided to flood the village. While the water level rises up to dangerous levels, traverse the 5 levels of the game. Fight horrible creatures, answer questions about the universe of Arthur and, ultimately, find Arthur's father before it is too late!

In the search of Archibald is a game of action and adventure which will charm all the fans of the most famous of miniature heroes.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Spy vs. Spy Combat Card Game
description:
Promo Spy vs. Spy game illustrated by Antonio Prohias.

There are 36 glossy, micro-perforated cards: 2 - 6 in 4 suits (although suits don't matter in the game), 4 each of 3 weapons (tanks, bombs and daggers), 2 wild cards and 2 WAR cards.

Basically the card game War with a little Rock-Paper-Scissors thrown in. Shuffle and deal out the deck so each player has their own card stack. Players turn over their top card simultaneously. Highest card takes both cards and winner puts both cards on the bottom of their card stack. Weapons beat numbers. Bomb blows up Tank; Tank runs over Dagger; Dagger cuts a Bombs' fuse. If the cards tie, you go to war: place 3 more cards face down and turn over the 4th card, which decides the winner of the trick. Wild cards beat numbers and weapons. If a WAR card is turned over, players must go to war. Keep playing until one player has won all he cards.

Variant rules for play with more than 2.

name: Pettson och Findus födelsedagsspel
description:
Swedish children´s game featuring the characters Pettson and his cat Findus. Players help them make a birthday cake and celebrate. They roll the die and collect chits featuring parts of the cake. If you get a chit with a muckla (the small ever present creatures from the books) you must give away a birthday present to another player. The first player to have a complete cake with candles, and who has received 2 birthday gifts, is the winner.

Contents:

Gameboard
colored die
42 small chits
48 big chits
Cloth bag
Rules
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Attract
description:
This game is played on an empty NxN square board (say 8x8):


TURNS - At each turn, each player must do the following actions:
First, drop a friendly stone on an empty cell;
Second, all pieces in the same horizontal and vertical rows move one cell nearer to the placed piece, if possible.

GOAL - If at the end of the move, there are any pieces that have an enemy piece at each diagonally adjacent cell, 4 in all, then the player with the most such pieces wins. If these numbers are equal, the game continues.


Online Play


Super Duper Games
mechanics: Area Movement, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement

name: Thought Exchange
description:
The aim of the game is to be the first player/team to successfully complete a given route across the board. Each player receives a Route Planner card which determines start and finish points, which may be on the same track or different ones.

Players roll a d8 for movement and must travel along one of six tracks, each of which represents a different style of puzzle or problem. Where different tracks cross a player may change routes by successfully answering a question from any of the tracks that intersect there. Players have to change tracks at least three times during the game, even if their given route both starts and finishes on the same track.

The six tracks or Lines correspond to different types of puzzles or problems, the idea behind the game being to develop and test different thought processes. The six lines are as follows:

The Sequence Line - the puzzle here is to identify the missing part of a sequence.

The Code line - here one has to break a code or cipher.

The Process line - the aim here is to take in the information at speed and to deduce the correct answer.

The Memory line - here a player is given a look at a card with a variety of information on it, and is then quizzed on a particular aspect of it.

The Perception line - similar to the memory line, problems here relate to observational skill.

The Lateral line - an exercise in lateral thinking regarding the subject detailed on the card. A player has to identify a series of objects that are related to the card's subject.

All these puzzles and problems are subject to a time limit - a sand timer with a 30s limit is included in the box.

The box contains a board, six decks of 40 cards, one for each line, 15 Route Planner cards, 25 Risk It cards (which may be played when landing on a Risk It board space and have both beneficial and unhelpful effects), and six sets of playing pieces and counters to mark when a player has changed lines.

name: Subbuteo Squads
description: Subbuteo Squads is a card game for two players. Each player plays with a deck of 45 cards. A full game lasts for 90 cards, a full deck per half. Players can have any combination of players cards and/or incident cards. Decks can be built with supplemental "booster" packs which have unique incidents, great players, and famous football pitches.

name: Princess & The Pea
description: A children's game for ages 5 and up. From the publisher's catalog: "Just like Hans Christian Anderson's beloved fairy tale The Princess and the Pea the prince is searching for a real princess. In this game, you move your bed along the board, adding mattresses to it as you go. To win, you need to build the highest bed and reach the special "crown" space! Are you the real princess?"

name: Zoom Street: Mastermind Junior
description:
Another Mastermind remake, for kids. The code is now set up under a bridge with small cars of six different colors. The game board is a piece of road with four lines, one for each car in the code.

This is essentially Mastermind with a car/traffic theme, since it still involves four pieces to the code, which can be made up of pieces of six different colors.

There are 3 versions in the rules:
Game 1 (guess only the correct colour of the cars),
Game 2 (guess the correct colour and the correct position of the cars) and
Game 3 (like Game #2 & take a blank field as colour #7).

Contents:
1 Board
1 Bridge (in 3 parts)
42 Point-Cards
72 Plastic-Cars in 6 Colours

name: Piracy
description:
"Piracy was first released in 1985 on the Commodore C64 computer. It travelled the world, and now this enigmatic puzzle of a strategy game is back, testing its players on a new board game format.

Take the challenge and play Piracy. Enjoy!"

After this history lesson from the box, a little about the game itself is in order.

Piracy is a two player abstract game with a pirate theme.

The board is composed of two ships, one Spanish and one pirate, between the two is a rope net consisting of six by five spaces. The rope net also has 4 broken rope spaces which will drop a player's piece to the sea (out of game) if they land on it.
